verses.latin: Rex David senuerat, et grandaevus erat: cumque operiretur vestibus, non calefiebat.
verses.english: King David had grown old, and he was advanced in years. Even when he was covered with clothing, he could not get warm.

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ei servi sui: Quaere mus domino nostro regi adolescentulam virginem, et stet coram rege, et foveat eum, et dormiat in sinu suo, et calefaciat dominum nostrum regem.
verses.english: So his servants said to him: "Let us seek out for our lord, the king, a young virgin maiden. She can stand before the king, keep him warm, and sleep by his side to make our lord the king feel warm."

verses.latin: Quaeseirunt igitur adolescentulam speciosam in omnibus finibus Israel: et invenerunt Abisag Sunamitidem, et adduxerunt eam ad regem.
verses.english: So they searched throughout all the borders of Israel for a beautiful young woman. They found Abishag the Shunammite and brought her to the king.

verses.latin: Erat autem adolescentula grandaeva nimis, et fovebat regem, et ministrabat ei: rex vero non cognovit eam.
verses.english: The young woman was exceptionally beautiful. She cared for the king and ministered to him, but the king did not have sexual relations with her.

verses.latin: Adonias autem filius Aggith elevabatur, dicens: Ego regnabo. Fecitque sibi currus et equites, et quinquaginta viros qui ante eum currerent.
verses.english: Now Adonijah, the son of Haggith, began to boast, saying: "I will be king." He prepared for himself chariots and horsemen, and fifty men who would run before him.

verses.latin: Nec corripuit eum pater suus aliquando, dicens: Quare hoc fecisti? Erat autem et ipse speciosus valde, secundus natu post Absalom.
verses.english: His father had never rebuked him at any time by saying: "Why have you done this?" Adonijah himself was also very handsome, being the next oldest son after Absalom.

verses.latin: Et collocutus est cum Joab filio Sarviae, et cum Abiathar sacerdote. Qui adjuvantes Adoniam sequebantur eum.
verses.english: He conspired with Joab, the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest. They both supported Adonijah and followed him.

verses.latin: Sadoc vero sacerdos, et Banaias filius Jojadae, et Nathan propheta, et Semei, et Rei, et robur exercitus David, non erant cum Adonia.
verses.english: However, Zadok the priest, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and David's mighty warriors were not with Adonijah.

verses.latin: Immolatis ergo Adonias arietibus et vitulis et universis pinguibus, juxta lapidem Zoheleth, qui est vicinus fonti Rogel, vocavit universos filios regis, et omnes viros Juda, servos regis:
verses.english: Adonijah then offered sacrifices of sheep, calves, and all the fatlings by the Stone of Zoheleth, which is near the fountain of Rogel. He invited all the king's sons and all the men of Judah who were the king's servants.

verses.latin: Nathan autem prophetam, et Banaiam, et robustos quosque, et Salomonem fratrem suum, non vocavit.
verses.english: But he did not invite Nathan the prophet, Benaiah, the mighty men, or his brother Solomon.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque Nathan ad Bethsabee matrem Salomonis: Num audisti quod regnaverit Adonias filius Aggith, et dominus noster David hoc nescit?
verses.english: So Nathan spoke to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother, saying: "Have you heard that Adonijah, the son of Haggith, has become king, and our lord David knows nothing about it?"

verses.latin: Nunc ergo veni, et do tibi consilium, ut liberes animam tuam, et animam filii tui Salomonis.
verses.english: "Now therefore, come, I will give you advice so that you may save your own life and the life of your son Solomon."

verses.latin: Vade, et ingredere ad regem David, et dic ei: Nonne tu, domine mi rex, jurasti mihi ancillae tuae, dicens: Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit in solio meo? quare ergo regnat Adonias?
verses.english: "Go, and go in to King David, and say to him: 'My lord king, did you not swear to me, your handmaid, saying: "Your son Solomon shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne?" Why then does Adonijah reign?'"

verses.latin: Et adhuc loquente te ibi cum rege, ego statim ingrediar post te, et complebo sermones tuos.
verses.english: "And while you are still speaking there with the king, I will immediately come in after you and confirm your words."

verses.latin: Ingressa est itaque Bethsabee ad regem in cubiculum: rex autem senuerat nimis, et Abisag Sunamitis ministrabat ei.
verses.english: So Bathsheba went in to the king in his private chamber. The king had grown very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was ministering to him.

verses.latin: Inclinavit se Bethsabee, et adoravit regem. Cui dixit rex: Quid tibi vis?
verses.english: Bathsheba bowed down and paid homage to the king. The king asked her: "What do you want?"

verses.latin: Quae respondens, ait: Domine mi, tu jurasti per Dominum Deum tuum ancillae tuae, Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit in solio meo.
verses.english: She answered, saying: "My lord, you swore by the Lord your God to your handmaid, that your son Solomon would reign after you, and that he himself would sit on your throne."

verses.latin: Et ecce nunc Adonias regnat, et tu domine mi rex nescis.
verses.english: "And behold, now Adonijah reigns, and you, my lord king, do not know about it."

verses.latin: Immolaverat boves et pinguia et arietes plurimos universis filiis regis, et Sadoc sacerdoti, et Banajae filio Jojadae: Salomonem autem servum tuum non vocavit.
verses.english: "He has sacrificed many oxen, fatlings, and sheep to all the king's sons, and to Zadok the priest, and to Benaiah the son of Jehoiada. But he did not invite your servant Solomon."

verses.latin: Verumtamen, domine mi rex, in te oculi respiciunt totius Israel, ut annuncies eis quis sessurus sit in solio tuo post te.
verses.english: "But now, my lord king, the eyes of all Israel are upon you, waiting for you to declare who will sit on your throne after you."

verses.latin: Alioquin, cum dormierit dominus meus rex cum patribus suis, ero ego et filius meus Salomon peccatores.
verses.english: "Otherwise, when my lord the king sleeps with his fathers (meaning, when you die), I and my son Solomon will be considered offenders and will likely be put to death."

verses.latin: Adhuc illa loquente cum rege, et Nathan propheta ingressus est.
verses.english: While she was still speaking with the king, Nathan the prophet entered.

verses.latin: Et nunciaverunt regi, dicentes: Ecce Nathan propheta. Cumque introisset coram rege, et adorasset eum prono in terram vultu,
verses.english: They announced to the king, saying: "Behold, Nathan the prophet!" When he had come in before the king and bowed down before him with his face to the ground,

verses.latin: Dixit Nathan: Domine mi rex, tu dixisti: Adonias regnet post me, et ipse sedeat super solium meum?
verses.english: Nathan said: "My lord king, have you indeed declared: 'Adonijah shall reign after me, and he himself shall sit upon my throne'?"

verses.latin: Quia descendit hodie, et immolavit boves et pinguia et arietes plurimos universis filiis regis, et ducibus exercitus, et Abiathar sacerdoti: illi comedentes et bibentes coram eo, et dicentes: Vivat rex Adonias.
verses.english: "Because today he went down and sacrificed many oxen, fatlings, and sheep to all the king's sons, and to the commanders of the army, and to Abiathar the priest. And they are eating and drinking before him and shouting: 'Long live King Adonijah!'"

verses.latin: Me autem servum tuum, et Sadoc sacerdotem, et Banajam filium Jojadae, et Salomonem servum tuum non vocavit.
verses.english: "But he did not invite me, your servant, nor Zadok the priest, nor Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, nor your servant Solomon."

verses.latin: Si a domino meo rege egressus est sermo iste, nescis quare non indicaveris mihi servo tuo, quis sessurus esset in solio tuo post te?
verses.english: "If this declaration has come from my lord the king, why have you not informed me, your servant, who should sit on your throne after you?"

verses.latin: Et respondit rex David, dicens: Vocate mihi Bethsabee. Quae cum introisset coram rege, et stetisset coram eo,
verses.english: Then King David answered, saying: "Call Bathsheba to me." When she had come in before the king and stood before him,

verses.latin: Juravit rex, et ait: Vivit Dominus, qui eruit animam meam de omni angustia,
verses.english: The king swore an oath and said: "As the Lord lives, who has rescued my life from every trouble and distress,"

verses.latin: Quia sicut juravi tibi per Dominum Deum Israel, dicens: Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit super solium meum pro me, sic faciam hodie.
verses.english: "Just as I swore to you by the Lord, the God of Israel, saying: 'Your son Solomon shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne in my place,' so I will do this very day."

verses.latin: Inclinavitque se Bethsabee vultu in terram, et adorans regem, ait: Vivat dominus meus rex David in aeternum.
verses.english: Then Bathsheba bowed down with her face to the ground, and paying homage to the king, she said: "May my lord King David live forever!"

verses.latin: Dixit quoque rex David: Vocate mihi Sadoc sacerdotem, et Nathan prophetam, et Banajam filium Jojadae. Qui cum ingressi essent coram rege,
verses.english: King David also said: "Call Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada to me." When they had come in before the king,

verses.latin: Dixit ad eos: Tollite vobiscum servos domini vestri, et imponite Salomonem filium meum super mulam meam, et ducite eum in Gihon.
verses.english: He said to them: "Take with you the servants of your lord, and have my son Solomon ride on my own royal mule, and bring him down to Gihon."

verses.latin: Et ungat eum ibi Sadoc sacerdos et Nathan propheta in regem super Israel: et canetis buccina, et dicetis: Vivat rex Salomon.
verses.english: "And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there as king over Israel. Then sound the trumpet and declare: 'Long live King Solomon!'"

verses.latin: Et ascendetis post eum, et veniet, et sedebit super solium meum, et ipse regnabit pro me: ipsum enim praecepi ut esset dux super Israel et super Judam.
verses.english: "Then you shall come up after him, and he shall come and sit on my throne, and he himself shall reign in my place. For I have commanded that he be the leader over Israel and over Judah."

verses.latin: Responditque Banajas filius Jojadae regi, dicens: Amen: sic loquatur Dominus Deus domini mei regis.
verses.english: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, answered the king, saying: "Amen! May the Lord God of my lord the king confirm this as true!"

verses.latin: Quomodo fuit Dominus cum domino meo rege, sic sit cum Salomone, et sublimius faciat solium ejus solio domini mei regis David.
verses.english: "Just as the Lord was with my lord the king, so may He be with Solomon, and may He make his throne even greater than the throne of my lord King David."

verses.latin: Descendit ergo Sadoc sacerdos, et Nathan propheta, et Banajas filius Jojadae, et Cerethi, et Phelethi: et imposuerunt Salomonem super mulam regis David, et adduxerunt eum in Gihon.
verses.english: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the Cherethites, and the Pelethites went down. They put Solomon upon King David's own royal mule and brought him to Gihon.

verses.latin: Sumpsitque Sadoc sacerdos cornu olei de tabernaculo, et unxit Salomonem: et cecinerunt buccina, et dixit omnis populus: Vivat rex Salomon.
verses.english: Then Zadok the priest took a horn of oil from the tabernacle and anointed Solomon. They sounded the trumpet, and all the people shouted: "Long live King Solomon!"

verses.latin: Et ascendit omnis multitudo post eum, et populus canens in tibiis, et laetans gaudio magno: et insonuit terra a multitudine clamoris eorum.
verses.english: And all the multitude went up after him, with the people playing flutes and rejoicing with great joy, so much so that the earth echoed from the sound of their shouting.

verses.latin: Rex autem David senuerat, habebatque aetatis plurimos dies: cumque operiretur vestibus, non calefiebat.
verses.english: King David was now very old and advanced in years. Even when he was covered with blankets, he could not get warm.

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ei servi sui: Quaeramus domino nostro regi adolescentulam virginem, et stet coram rege, et foveat eum, dormiatque in sinu suo, et calefaciat dominum nostrum regem.
verses.english: So his servants said to him, "Let us look for a young, virgin girl for our lord the king. Let her serve the king and care for him, and let her sleep close to him to keep our lord the king warm."

verses.latin: Quaesierunt igitur adolescentulam speciosam in omnibus finibus Israel, et invenerunt Abisag Sunamitidem, et adduxerunt eam ad regem.
verses.english: So they searched throughout all the territory of Israel for a beautiful young woman, and they found Abishag, a Shunammite, and brought her to the king.

verses.latin: Erat autem puella pulchra nimis, et fovebat regem, ministrabatque ei: rex vero non cognovit eam.
verses.english: The girl was indeed exceedingly beautiful, and she cared for the king and attended to his needs. But the king did not have sexual relations with her.

verses.latin: Adonias autem filius Aggith elevabatur, dicens: Ego regnabo. Fecitque sibi currus et equites, et quinquaginta viros qui praecederent eum.
verses.english: Adonijah, the son of Haggith, began to boast, saying, "I will be king!" He prepared for himself chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him as his personal guard.

verses.latin: Nec objurgavit eum pater suus aliquando, dicens: Quare hoc fecisti? Erat autem et ipse pulcher valde, secundus natu post Absalom.
verses.english: His father had never corrected him at any time by asking, "Why are you doing this?" Adonijah himself was also very handsome, and he was the next eldest son after Absalom.

verses.latin: Et collocutus est cum Joab filio Sarviae, et cum Abiathar sacerdote. Qui adjuvantes Adoniam sequebantur eum.
verses.english: Adonijah consulted with Joab, the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest. They both gave their support to Adonijah and followed him.

verses.latin: Sadoc vero sacerdos, et Banaias filius Jojadae, et Nathan propheta, et Semei, et Rei, et fortissimi exercitus David, non erant cum Adonia.
verses.english: However, Zadok the priest, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and David's mightiest warriors did not join Adonijah.

verses.latin: Immolatis ergo Adonias arietibus et vitulis et universis pinguibus, juxta lapidem Zoheleth qui est vicinus fonti Rogel, vocavit universos filios regis, et omnes viros Juda servos regis:
verses.english: Adonijah sacrificed sheep, calves, and all the fatlings near the stone of Zoheleth, which is close to the spring of Rogel. He then invited all the king's sons and all the men of Judah who served the king.

verses.latin: Nathan autem prophetam, et Banaiam, et fortissimos quosque, et Salomonem fratrem suum non vocavit.
verses.english: But he did not invite Nathan the prophet, Benaiah, the mightiest warriors, nor his brother Solomon.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Nathan ad Bethsabee matrem Salomonis: Num audisti quod regnaverit Adonias filius Aggith, et dominus noster David hoc nescit?
verses.english: So Nathan said to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother, "Have you not heard that Adonijah, Haggith's son, has made himself king, and our master David does not even know about it?"

verses.latin: Nunc ergo veni, et do tibi consilium, ut liberes animam tuam, et animam filii tui Salomonis.
verses.english: Now then, come, and I will give you advice so that you can save your own life and the life of your son Solomon.

verses.latin: Vade, et ingredere ad regem David, et dic ei: Nonne tu, domine mi rex, jurasti mihi ancillae tuae, dicens: Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit in solio meo? quomodo ergo regnat Adonias?
verses.english: Go, enter King David's presence, and say to him, "Did you not, my lord the king, swear to me, your handmaid, saying, 'Your son Solomon shall reign after me, and he himself shall sit upon my throne'? How then is Adonijah now reigning as king?"

verses.latin: Et adhuc te loquente ibi cum rege, ego statim ingrediar post te, et complebo sermones tuos.
verses.english: While you are still speaking with the king there, I will immediately come in after you and confirm everything you have said.

verses.latin: Ingressa est itaque Bethsabee ad regem in cubiculum: rex autem senex erat valde, et Abisag Sunamitis ministrabat ei.
verses.english: So Bathsheba went into the king's chamber. The king was now very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was attending to him.

verses.latin: Inclinavit se Bethsabee, et adoravit regem. Cui dixit rex: Quid tibi vis?
verses.english: Bathsheba bowed low and paid homage to the king. The king asked her, "What do you want?"

verses.latin: Quae respondens, ait: Domine mi, tu jurasti per Dominum Deum tuum ancillae tuae, quia Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit in solio meo.
verses.english: She replied, "My lord, you swore by the Lord your God to your handmaid that your son Solomon would reign after you, and that he himself would sit upon your throne."

verses.latin: Et ecce nunc Adonias regnat, et tu, domine mi rex, nescis.
verses.english: And now, Adonijah is reigning as king, and you, my lord the king, do not even know about it.

verses.latin: Immolavit boves, et pecora campestria, et arietes plurimos: et vocavit omnes filios regis, et Abiathar sacerdotem, et Joab principem militiae: Salomonem autem servum tuum non vocavit.
verses.english: He has sacrificed many oxen, fatlings, and sheep. He has invited all the king's sons, Abiathar the priest, and Joab, the commander of the army. But he did not invite your servant Solomon.

verses.latin: Te igitur, domine mi rex, et omnium Israel oculi respiciunt, ut indices eis qui sedeat in solio tuo, domine mi rex, post te.
verses.english: So now, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are looking to you, to declare who will sit on your throne after you.

verses.latin: Alioquin cum dormierit dominus meus rex cum patribus suis, ero ego, et filius meus Salomon, peccatores.
verses.english: Otherwise, when my lord the king passes away and rests with his ancestors, my son Solomon and I will be considered criminals and treated as such.

verses.latin: Adhuc illa loquente cum rege, Nathan propheta venit.
verses.english: While she was still speaking with the king, Nathan the prophet arrived.

verses.latin: Et nunciaverunt regi, dicentes: Adest Nathan propheta. Cumque introisset coram rege, et adorasset eum prono in terram vultu,
verses.english: They announced to the king, saying, "Nathan the prophet is here!" When he entered the king's presence, he bowed down with his face to the ground and paid homage.

verses.latin: Dixit Nathan: Domine mi rex, tu dixisti: Adonias regnet post me, et ipse sedeat super thronum meum?
verses.english: Nathan said, "My lord the king, did you say that Adonijah is to reign after you, and that he is to sit upon my throne?"

verses.latin: Quia descendit hodie, et immolavit boves, et pecora campestria, et arietes plurimos: et vocavit universos filios regis, et principes exercitus, et Abiathar sacerdotem: illique comedentes et bibentes coram eo, dixerunt: Vivat rex Adonias!
verses.english: For today he went down and sacrificed many oxen, fatlings, and sheep. He invited all the king's sons, the commanders of the army, and Abiathar the priest. And they ate and drank before him, and shouted, 'Long live King Adonijah!'

verses.latin: Me autem servum tuum, et Sadoc sacerdotem, et Banaiam filium Jojadae, et Salomonem servum tuum, non vocavit.
verses.english: But me, your servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and your servant Solomon, he did not invite.

verses.latin: Numquid a domino meo rege exivit hoc verbum, et non indicasti mihi servo tuo, quis sessurus esset in solio domini mei regis post eum?
verses.english: Has this decree truly come from my lord the king? And have you not informed your servant who is to sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?

verses.latin: Et respondit rex David, dicens: Vocate ad me Bethsabee. Cumque intravisset in conspectu regis, et stetisset coram eo,
verses.english: King David answered, "Call Bathsheba to me." When she came into the king's presence and stood before him,

verses.latin: Juravit rex, et ait: Vivit Dominus, qui eruit animam meam de omni angustia,
verses.english: The king took an oath and said, "As the Lord lives, who has delivered my soul from every distress—"

verses.latin: quia sicut juravi tibi per Dominum Deum Israel, dicens: Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit super solium meum pro me: sic faciam hodie.
verses.english: —just as I swore to you by the Lord, the God of Israel, saying, 'Your son Solomon shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my place,' this very day I will carry it out!"

verses.latin: Inclinavit se Bethsabee vultu in terram, et adorans regem, ait: Vivat dominus meus rex David in aeternum!
verses.english: Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth, paid homage to the king, and said, "May my lord King David live forever!"

verses.latin: Dixit quoque rex David: Vocate mihi Sadoc sacerdotem, et Nathan prophetam, et Banaiam filium Jojadae. Qui cum ingressi essent coram rege,
verses.english: King David then gave an order: "Call to me Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada." When they had come into the king's presence,

verses.latin: Dixit ad eos rex: Tollite vobiscum servos domini vestri, et imponite Salomonem filium meum super mulam meam, et ducite eum in Gihon.
verses.english: The king said to them, "Take with you my royal servants. Set my son Solomon upon my own mule and bring him down to Gihon."

verses.latin: Et ungat eum ibi Sadoc sacerdos, et Nathan propheta, in regem super Israel: et clangite buccina, atque dicite: Vivat rex Salomon!
verses.english: And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there as king over Israel. Then blow the trumpet and shout, 'Long live King Solomon!'

verses.latin: Et ascendentes post eum, venite et sedebit super thronum meum, et ipse regnabit pro me: ipsum enim constitui ducem super Israel et super Judam.
verses.english: Then return up here, following him. He is to sit upon my throne, and he himself shall reign in my place, for I have appointed him to be ruler over both Israel and Judah.

verses.latin: Et respondens Banaias filius Jojadae regi, ait: Amen: sic loquatur Dominus Deus domini mei regis.
verses.english: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, answered the king, saying, "So be it! May the Lord, the God of my lord the king, confirm it."

verses.latin: Quomodo fuit Dominus cum domino meo rege, sic sit cum Salomone, et sublimius faciat solium ejus solio domini mei regis David.
verses.english: Just as the Lord was with my lord the king, so may He be with Solomon, and may He make his throne even greater than the throne of my lord King David.

verses.latin: Descendit ergo Sadoc sacerdos, et Nathan propheta, et Banaias filius Jojadae, et Cerethi, et Phelethi: et imposuerunt Salomonem super mulam regis David, et adduxerunt eum in Gihon.
verses.english: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and Pelethites went down. They set Solomon upon King David's own mule and brought him to Gihon.

verses.latin: Sumpsitque Sadoc sacerdos cornu olei de tabernaculo, et unxit Salomonem: et cecinerunt buccina, et dixit omnis populus: Vivat rex Salomon!
verses.english: Zadok the priest took a horn of oil from the tabernacle and anointed Solomon. Then they blew the trumpet, and all the people shouted, 'Long live King Solomon!'

verses.latin: Et ascendit omnis multitudo post eum, et populus canens in tibiis, et laetitia magna gaudens: et insonuit terra a clamore eorum.
verses.english: And all the multitude went up after him. The people were playing flutes and rejoicing with great joy, and the earth reverberated with their shouting.

verses.latin: Rex David senuerat, et erat aetate processa; cumque operiretur vestibus, non calefiebat.
verses.english: King David was very old and advanced in years; even when he was covered with many blankets, he could not get warm.

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ei servi sui: Quaeramus domino nostro regi adolescentulam virginem, et stet coram rege, et foveat eum, dormiatque in sinu suo, et calefaciat dominum nostrum regem.
verses.english: So his servants said to him: "Let us find a young virgin for our Lord, the king, to take care of him. She can stand before the king, sleeping close to him, and keep our Lord, the king, warm."

verses.latin: Quaesierunt ergo adolescentulam speciosam in omnibus finibus Israel, et invenerunt Abisag Sunamitidem, et adduxerunt eam ad regem.
verses.english: So they searched throughout all the lands of Israel for a beautiful young woman. They found Abishag the Shunammite and brought her to the king.

verses.latin: Erat autem adolescentula pulchra nimis, et fovebat regem, ministrabatque ei: rex vero non cognovit eam.
verses.english: The young woman was very beautiful. She took care of the king and served him; however, the king did not have sexual relations with her.

verses.latin: Adonias autem filius Aggith, elevabatur dicens: Ego regnabo. Fecitque sibi currus et equites, et quinquaginta viros qui ante eum currerent.
verses.english: Now Adonijah, the son of Haggith, began to exalt himself, saying: "I will be king." He prepared chariots and horsemen for himself, along with fifty men to run before him.

verses.latin: Nec corripuit eum pater suus aliquando, dicens: Quare hoc fecisti? Erat autem et ipse speciosus valde, secundus natu post Absalom.
verses.english: His father, David, had never once rebuked him, asking: "Why have you done this?" Adonijah himself was also very handsome, and he was the next son born after Absalom.

verses.latin: Et collocutus est cum Joab filio Sarviae, et cum Abiathar sacerdote. Qui adjuvantes Adoniam, sequebantur eum.
verses.english: Adonijah spoke with Joab, the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest. They both helped Adonijah and followed him.

verses.latin: Sadoc autem sacerdos, et Banaias filius Jojadae, et Nathan propheta, et Semei, et Rei, et robur exercitus David, non erant cum Adonia.
verses.english: However, Zadok the priest, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and the core of David's army were not with Adonijah.

verses.latin: Immolatis ergo Adonias arietibus et vitulis et universis pinguibus, juxta lapidem Zoheleth, qui erat juxta fontem Rogel, vocavit universos fratres suos filios regis, et omnes viros Juda servos regis:
verses.english: Then Adonijah sacrificed sheep, calves, and all the fatted animals near the Stone of Zoheleth, which was beside the En Rogel spring. He invited all his brothers, the king's sons, and all the men of Judah, the king's servants.

verses.latin: Nathan autem prophetam, et Banaiam, et robustos quosque, et Salomonem fratrem suum, non vocavit.
verses.english: But he did not invite Nathan the prophet, Benaiah, nor any of the mighty men, nor his brother Solomon.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Nathan ad Bethsabee matrem Salomonis: Num audisti quod regnaverit Adonias filius Aggith, et dominus noster David hoc ignorat?
verses.english: Then Nathan said to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother: "Have you not heard that Adonijah, the son of Haggith, has become king, and our Lord David does not know about it?"

verses.latin: Nunc igitur veni, accipe consilium a me, et salva animam tuam, et animam filii tui Salomonis.
verses.english: Now then, come, accept my advice, and save your own life and the life of your son Solomon.

verses.latin: Vade, et ingredere ad regem David: et dic ei: Nonne tu, domine mi rex, jurasti mihi ancillae tuae, dicens: Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit super solium meum? Quomodo ergo regnat Adonias?
verses.english: Go and enter before King David. Say to him: "My Lord, the king, did you not swear to your handmaid, saying: 'Your son Solomon shall reign after me, and he himself shall sit upon my throne'? How then is Adonijah reigning?"

verses.latin: Et adhuc te illic loquente cum rege, ego statim ingrediar post te, et complebo sermones tuos.
verses.english: While you are still speaking there with the king, I will immediately come in after you and confirm your words.

verses.latin: Ingressa est itaque Bethsabee ad regem in cubiculum: rex autem senuerat nimis, et Abisag Sunamitis ministrabat ei.
verses.english: So Bathsheba went in to the king in his private room. The king was now very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was serving him.

verses.latin: Inclinavit se Bethsabee, et adoravit regem. Cui dixit rex: Quid tibi vis?
verses.english: Bathsheba bowed down and paid homage to the king. The king said to her: "What do you want?"

verses.latin: Quae respondens ait: Domine mi, tu jurasti per Dominum Deum tuum ancillae tuae: Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit super solium meum.
verses.english: She answered him: "My Lord, you swore by the Lord your God to your handmaid: 'Your son Solomon shall reign after me, and he himself shall sit upon my throne.'"

verses.latin: Et nunc ecce Adonias regnat, et tu dominus meus rex ignoras.
verses.english: And now, look, Adonijah is reigning, and you, my Lord, the king, do not know it.

verses.latin: Immolavit boves et pinguia et arietes plurimos, et vocavit omnes filios regis, et Abiathar sacerdotem, et Joab principem exercitus: Salomonem autem servum tuum non vocavit, et me ancillam tuam.
verses.english: He has sacrificed many oxen, fatted animals, and sheep, and he has invited all the king's sons, Abiathar the priest, and Joab, the commander of the army. But he did not invite your servant Solomon, nor me, your handmaid.

verses.latin: Tu vero, domine mi rex, oculi totius Israel in te sunt, ut indicas eis qui sedeat in solio tuo, domine mi rex, post te.
verses.english: Now, my Lord, the king, the eyes of all Israel are upon you, for you to declare to them who shall sit on your throne, my Lord, the king, after you.

verses.latin: Alioquin cum dormierit dominus meus rex cum patribus suis, ero ego et filius meus Salomon peccatores.
verses.english: Otherwise, when my Lord, the king, sleeps with his fathers (that is, when he dies), my son Solomon and I will be considered guilty and will suffer the consequences.

verses.latin: Et ecce adhuc illa loquente cum rege, Nathan propheta intravit.
verses.english: And look, while she was still speaking with the king, Nathan the prophet entered.

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt regi, dicentes: Adest Nathan propheta. Cumque introisset coram rege, et adorasset eum prono in terram vultu,
verses.english: They announced to the king, saying: "Nathan the prophet is here." When he had come in before the king and bowed down before him, with his face to the ground,

verses.latin: dixit Nathan: Domine mi rex, tu dixisti: Adonias regnet post me, et ipse sedeat super solium meum?
verses.english: Nathan said: "My Lord, the king, did you say: 'Adonijah shall reign after me, and he himself shall sit upon my throne'?"

verses.latin: Quia descendit hodie, et immolavit boves et pinguia et arietes plurimos, et vocavit omnes filios regis, et principes exercitus, et Abiathar sacerdotem: illisque comedentibus et bibentibus coram eo, et dicentibus: Vivat rex Adonias!
verses.english: For he went down today and sacrificed many oxen, fatted animals, and sheep. He invited all the king's sons, the commanders of the army, and Abiathar the priest. While they are eating and drinking before him, they are shouting: "Long live King Adonijah!"

verses.latin: me autem servum tuum, et Sadoc sacerdotem, et Banaiam filium Jojadae, et Salomonem servum tuum, non vocavit.
verses.english: But he did not invite me, your servant, nor Zadok the priest, nor Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, nor your servant Solomon.

verses.latin: Numquid a domino meo rege verbum istud egressum est, et non indicasti mihi servo tuo, quis sederet super solium tuum post te?
verses.english: Has this word truly come from my Lord, the king, and you have not informed me, your servant, who should sit on your throne after you?

verses.latin: Et respondit rex David, dicens: Vocate mihi Bethsabee. Cumque intrasset coram rege, et stetisset ante eum,
verses.english: King David then answered, saying: "Call Bathsheba for me." When she had come in before the king and stood before him,

verses.latin: juravit rex, et ait: Vivit Dominus, qui eruit animam meam de omni angustia,
verses.english: the king swore an oath and said: "As the Lord lives, who has rescued my life from every distress,"

verses.latin: quia sicut juravi tibi per Dominum Deum Israel, dicens: Salomon filius tuus regnabit post me, et ipse sedebit super solium meum pro me: sic faciam hodie.
verses.english: just as I swore to you by the Lord, the God of Israel, saying: 'Your son Solomon shall reign after me, and he himself shall sit upon my throne in my place,' I will do this very thing today.

verses.latin: Inclinavit se Bethsabee super vultum suum in terram, et adorans regem, ait: Vivat dominus meus rex David in aeternum!
verses.english: Bathsheba bowed down with her face to the ground and paid homage to the king, saying: "May my Lord, King David, live forever!"

verses.latin: Dixit quoque rex David: Vocate mihi Sadoc sacerdotem, et Nathan prophetam, et Banaiam filium Jojadae. Qui cum ingressi essent coram rege,
verses.english: King David then also said: "Call for me Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada." When they had come in before the king,

verses.latin: dixit ad eos: Tollite vobiscum servos domini vestri, et imponite Salomonem filium meum super mulam meam, et ducite eum in Gihon.
verses.english: he said to them: "Take with you the servants of your master. Have my son Solomon ride on my own mule, and lead him down to Gihon."

verses.latin: Et ungat eum ibi Sadoc sacerdos, et Nathan propheta, regem super Israel: et canetis bucina, et dicetis: Vivat rex Salomon!
verses.english: There let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him as king over Israel. Then sound the trumpet and declare: "Long live King Solomon!"

verses.latin: Et ascendetis post eum, et veniet, et sedebit super solium meum, et ipse regnabit pro me: ipsum enim praecepi ut esset dux super Israel et super Judam.
verses.english: Then you shall come up after him. He will come and sit upon my throne, and he himself shall reign in my place, for I have commanded that he be ruler over Israel and over Judah.

verses.latin: Et respondit Banaias filius Jojadae regi, dicens: Amen: sic loquatur Dominus Deus domini mei regis.
verses.english: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, saying: "Amen! May the Lord, the God of my Lord, the king, speak likewise (that is, confirm your word)."

verses.latin: Sicut fuit Dominus cum domino meo rege, sic sit cum Salomone, et sublimius faciat solium ejus super solium domini mei regis David.
verses.english: Just as the Lord was with my Lord, the king, so may He be with Solomon. May He make Solomon's throne even greater than the throne of my Lord, King David.

verses.latin: Descendit ergo Sadoc sacerdos, et Nathan propheta, et Banaias filius Jojadae, et Cerethi, et Phelethi: et imposuerunt Salomonem super mulam regis David, et adduxerunt eum in Gihon.
verses.english: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites went down. They put Solomon on King David's mule and brought him to Gihon.

verses.latin: Sumpsitque Sadoc sacerdos cornu olei de tabernaculo, et unxit Salomonem: et cecinerunt buccina, et dixit omnis populus: Vivat rex Salomon!
verses.english: Then Zadok the priest took a horn of oil from the tabernacle and anointed Solomon. They sounded the trumpet, and all the people shouted: "Long live King Solomon!"

verses.latin: Et ascendit universa multitudo post eum, et populus canens in tubis, et lætans gaudio magno, et insonuit terra a multitudine clamoris eorum.
verses.english: And all the multitude went up after him. The people played flutes and rejoiced with great joy, so much so that the earth resounded from the loudness of their shouting.

verses.latin: Appropinquante igitur die quo moreretur David, praecepit Salomoni filio suo, dicens:
verses.english: As the day drew near for King David to die, he gave these final commands to Solomon, his son and successor:

verses.latin: Ego ingredior viam universae terrae: confortare, et esto vir.
verses.english: “I am about to pass from this world, like all people must. So be strong, and act like a true man.

verses.latin: Et custodi observationes Domini Dei tui, ut ambules in viis ejus, et custodias cærimonias ejus, et præcepta, et judicia, et testimonia, sicut scriptum est in lege Moysi: ut intelligas universa quæ facis, et quocumque te verteris.
verses.english: And faithfully keep the commandments of the Lord your God. Walk in His ways, observe His rituals, His precepts, His judgments, and His testimonies, just as it is written in the Law of Moses. Do this so that you may prosper in everything you undertake, and in every direction you go.

verses.latin: Ut confirmet Dominus sermonem suum quem locutus est de me, dicens: Si custodierint filii tui vias meas, et ambulaverint coram me in veritate, in omni corde suo et in omni anima sua, non auferetur tibi vir de solio Israël.
verses.english: This is so the Lord may fulfill the promise He made to me, when He said: 'If your descendants faithfully keep My ways and walk before Me in truth, with their whole heart and their whole soul, you will never lack a man to sit on the throne of Israel.'

verses.latin: Tu quoque scis quæ fecerit mihi Joab filius Sarviæ, quæ fecerit duobus principibus exercitus Israël, Abner filio Ner, et Amasæ filio Jether: quos interfecit, et effudit sanguinem belli in pace, et posuit cruoris bellici maculas in balteo suo qui erat super renibus ejus, et in calceamento suo quod erat in pedibus ejus.
verses.english: “You also know what Joab, the son of Zeruiah, did to me and what he did to the two commanders of the army of Israel: Abner, the son of Ner, and Amasa, the son of Jether. He murdered them, shedding the blood of war in a time of peace, and stained his belt around his waist and his sandals on his feet with the blood of war.

verses.latin: Feceris ergo juxta sapientiam tuam, et non deduces canitiem ejus pacifice ad inferos.
verses.english: Therefore, act according to your wisdom, and do not let his gray hair go down to the abode of the dead in peace.

verses.latin: Sed et filiis Berzellaï Galaaditis reddes gratiam, eruntque comedentes in mensa tua: quia sic occurrerunt mihi quando fugiebam a facie Absalom fratris tui.
verses.english: But to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, show kindness. Let them be among those who eat at your table, because they showed me hospitality when I fled from your brother Absalom.

verses.latin: Habes quoque apud te Semeï filium Gera, filium Jemini, de Bahurim, qui maledixit mihi maledictione pessima quando ibam ad castra: sed quia descendit mecum ad Jordanem, et juravi ei per Dominum, dicens: Non te interficiam gladio:
verses.english: You also have with you Shimei, the son of Gera, from Bahurim, a Benjaminite, who cursed me with a terrible curse when I was going to the camp. But because he came down with me to the Jordan River, I swore to him by the Lord, saying, 'I will not put you to death with the sword.'

verses.latin: Tu igitur noli eum impunitum dimittere: sed homo sapiens es, et scies quomodo deducas canos ejus cum sanguine ad inferos.
verses.english: Therefore, do not let him go unpunished. You are a wise man, and you will know how to bring his gray head down to the abode of the dead with blood.

verses.latin: Dormivit igitur David cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in civitate David.
verses.english: So David rested with his ancestors, and he was buried in the City of David.

verses.latin: Dies autem quos regnavit David super Israël, quadraginta anni fuerunt: in Hebron septem annis regnavit, et in Jerusalem triginta tribus annis.
verses.english: The length of David's reign over Israel was forty years: he reigned seven years in Hebron, and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Salomon autem sedit super solium David patris sui, et firmatum est regnum ejus nimis.
verses.english: Then Solomon sat on the throne of his father David, and his kingdom was firmly established.

verses.latin: Et venit Adonias filius Aggith ad Bathsabee matrem Salomonis. Quæ dixit ei: Pacificusne est ingressus tuus? Qui respondit: Pacificus.
verses.english: Adonijah, the son of Haggith, came to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother. She asked him, “Are you coming in peace?” He answered, “I am.”

verses.latin: Et addidit: Sermo mihi est ad te. Cui ait: Loquere.
verses.english: Then he added, “I have something to say to you.” She replied, “Speak.”

verses.latin: Qui ait: Tu scis, quia meum regnum erat, et hunc proposuerat omnis Israël sibi in regem: sed translatum est regnum, et factum est fratris mei: a Domino quippe paratum est illi.
verses.english: He said, “You know that the kingdom was mine, and all Israel expected me to be king. But the kingdom has been taken from me and given to my brother; for it was the Lord's will that it be prepared for him.”

verses.latin: Nunc ergo petitionem unam deprecor a te: ne confundas faciem meam. Quæ dixit illi: Loquere.
verses.english: “Now therefore, I ask one favor from you. Do not refuse my request.” She said to him, “Speak.”

verses.latin: Ait ergo: Precor te ut loquaris Salomoni regi (neque enim negare potest tibi) ut det mihi Abisag Sunamitidem uxorem.
verses.english: He said, “Please speak to King Solomon—he cannot refuse you—and ask him to give me Abishag the Shunammite as a wife.”

verses.latin: Et ait Bathsabee: Bene: ego loquar pro te regi.
verses.english: Bathsheba replied, “Very well, I will speak to the king on your behalf.”

verses.latin: Venit ergo Bathsabee ad regem Salomonem, ut loqueretur ei pro Adonia: et surrexit rex in occursum ejus, adoravitque eam, et sedit super solium suum: et posita est sella matri regis, quæ sedit a dextris ejus.
verses.english: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to speak to him concerning Adonijah. The king rose to meet her and bowed down to her. Then he sat on his throne, and a throne was placed for the king's mother, and she sat at his right hand.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eum: Petitionem unam parvulam deprecor a te: ne confundas faciem meam. Dixitque ei rex: Pete mater mea: neque enim fas est ut confundam faciem tuam.
verses.english: She said to him, “I have one small request to make of you. Do not refuse my request.” The king said to her, “Ask, my mother, for it is not right that I should refuse your request.”

verses.latin: Quæ ait: Detur Abisag Sunamitis Adoniæ fratri tuo uxor.
verses.english: Then she said, “Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to your brother Adonijah as a wife.”

verses.latin: Et respondit rex Salomon, et dixit matri suæ: Quare postulas Abisag Sunamitidem Adoniæ? Postula ei et regnum: ipse est enim frater meus major me, et habet Abiathar sacerdotem, et Joab filium Sarviæ.
verses.english: King Solomon answered and said to his mother, “Why do you ask for Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Ask also for the kingdom for him! He is my elder brother, and he has Abiathar the priest and Joab, the son of Zeruiah, supporting him!”

verses.latin: Juravit itaque rex Salomon per Dominum, dicens: Hæc faciat mihi Deus, et hæc addat, si non in hac vita locutus est Adonias sermonem istum contra animam suam.
verses.english: Then King Solomon swore by the Lord, saying, “May God do to me and more also, if Adonijah has not spoken this word against his own life by making this request!”

verses.latin: Et nunc vivit Dominus, qui firmavit me, et collocavit me super solium David patris mei, et qui fecit mihi domum sicut locutus est, quia hodie interficietur Adonias.
verses.english: “Now, as the Lord lives, who has established me and seated me on the throne of my father David, and who has made me a lasting dynasty as He promised, Adonijah will surely be put to death this very day!”

verses.latin: Misit ergo rex Salomon Banaiam filium Jojadæ, qui interfecit eum, et mortuus est.
verses.english: So King Solomon sent Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, who struck him down, and Adonijah died.

verses.latin: Abiathar quoque sacerdoti dixit rex: Vade in Anathoth ad agrum tuum: quidem vir mortis es, sed hodie te non interficiam, quia portasti arcam Domini Dei coram David patre meo, et sustinuisti omnem laborem patris mei.
verses.english: To Abiathar the priest, the king said, “Go to Anathoth, to your own lands. You deserve to die, but today I will not put you to death, because you carried the Ark of the Lord God before my father David and endured all the hardships my father endured.”

verses.latin: Ejecit ergo Salomon Abiathar, ut non esset sacerdos Domini, ut impleretur sermo Domini quem locutus est super domum Heli in Silo.
verses.english: So Solomon expelled Abiathar from being a priest of the Lord, thereby fulfilling the word of the Lord that He had spoken concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.

verses.latin: Et audito nuntio Joab (eo quod Joab declinasset post Adoniam, et post Salomonem non declinasset) fugit Joab in tabernaculum Domini, et apprehendit cornu altaris.
verses.english: When the news reached Joab—because Joab had sided with Adonijah and not with Solomon—Joab fled to the tent of the Lord and grasped the horns of the altar, seeking sanctuary.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est regi Salomoni quod fugisset Joab in tabernaculum Domini, et esset juxta altare: et misit Salomon Banaiam filium Jojadæ, dicens: Vade, interfice eum.
verses.english: It was reported to King Solomon that Joab had fled to the tent of the Lord and was beside the altar. So Solomon sent Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, saying, “Go, strike him down.”

verses.latin: Et venit Banaias ad tabernaculum Domini, et dixit illi: Hæc dicit rex: Egredere. Qui ait: Non egrediar, sed hic moriar. Renuntiavitque Banaias regi, dicens: Hæc locutus est Joab, et hæc mihi respondit.
verses.english: Benaiah came to the tent of the Lord and said to Joab, “Thus says the king: 'Come out!'” But Joab replied, “No, I will not come out; I will die here.” So Benaiah reported to the king, saying, “This is what Joab said, and this is how he answered me.”

verses.latin: Et ait illi rex: Fac sicut locutus est, et interfice eum, et sepeli: et auferes sanguinem innocentem, qui effusus est a Joab, a me, et a domo patris mei.
verses.english: The king then said to Benaiah, “Do as he has said; strike him down and bury him. In doing so, you will remove the guilt of the innocent blood that Joab shed from me and from my father's house.”

verses.latin: Et reddet Dominus sanguinem ejus in caput ejus, qui percussit duos viros justos et meliores se, et interfecit eos gladio, patre meo David ignaro, Abner filium Ner principem exercitus Israël, et Amasam filium Jether principem exercitus Juda.
verses.english: “And the Lord will bring his bloodguilt back upon his own head, because he struck down two men more righteous and better than himself. He murdered them with the sword, though my father David knew nothing of it: Abner, the son of Ner, commander of the army of Israel, and Amasa, the son of Jether, commander of the army of Judah.”

verses.latin: Et revertetur sanguis eorum in caput Joab et in caput seminis ejus in sempiternum: David autem et semini ejus, et domui et solio illius, sit pax a Domino usque in æternum.
verses.english: “So their bloodguilt will fall upon the head of Joab and upon the head of his descendants forever. But upon David and his descendants, upon his house, and upon his throne, may there be lasting peace from the Lord forever.”

verses.latin: Ascendit itaque Banaias filius Jojadæ, et percussit eum, et interfecit: et sepultus est in domo sua in deserto.
verses.english: So Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, went up and struck him down and killed him. He was then buried in his own house in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Et præposuit rex Banaiam filium Jojadæ super exercitum pro Joab, et Sadoc sacerdotem posuit pro Abiathar.
verses.english: The king then appointed Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, over the army in place of Joab, and he appointed Zadok the priest in place of Abiathar.

verses.latin: Misit quoque rex, et vocavit Semeï, et dixit ei: Ædifica tibi domum in Jerusalem, et habita ibi: et non egrediaris inde huc atque illuc.
verses.english: The king then sent for Shimei and said to him, “Build yourself a house in Jerusalem and live there, and do not go out from there to any place else.”

verses.latin: Quacumque enim die egressus fueris, et transieris torrentem Cedron, scito te interficiendum: sanguis tuus erit super caput tuum.
verses.english: “For on whatever day you go out and cross the Kidron Valley, know for certain that you will surely die. Your blood will be on your own head.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Semeï regi: Bonus sermo: sicut locutus est dominus meus rex, sic faciet servus tuus. Habitavit itaque Semeï in Jerusalem diebus multis.
verses.english: Shimei said to the king, “Your word is good. Just as my lord the king has said, so your servant will do.” So Shimei lived in Jerusalem for a long time.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post annos tres ut fugerent servi Semeï in Geth ad Achis filium Maacha regem Geth: et nuntiatum est Semeï, dicentibus: Ecce servi tui in Geth.
verses.english: Now it happened three years later that servants of Shimei ran away to Gath, to Achish, son of Maachah, the king of Gath. And it was reported to Shimei, “Look, your servants are in Gath!”

verses.latin: Et surrexit Semeï, et sellavit asinum suum, et abiit in Geth ad Achis ad quærendos servos suos, et reduxit eos de Geth.
verses.english: So Shimei rose, saddled his donkey, and went to Gath to Achish to search for his servants, and he brought them back from Gath.

verses.latin: Appropinquaverunt autem dies David ut moreretur: præcepitque Salomoni filio suo, dicens:
verses.english: Now the days drew near when David had to die, and he gave a final command to his son Solomon, saying:

verses.latin: Ego ingredior viam universæ terræ: confortare, et esto vir.
verses.english: “I am about to go the way of all the earth, the way of all humanity. So be strong now, and show yourself to be a man.

verses.latin: Et custodi observata Domini Dei tui, ut ambules in viis ejus, et custodias cæremonias ejus, et præcepta, et judicia, et testimonia, sicut scriptum est in lege Moysi: ut intelligas universa quæ facis, et quocumque te verteris:
verses.english: And keep the observances of the Lord your God. Walk in His ways and keep His ceremonies, His precepts, His judgments, and His testimonies—just as it is written in the Law of Moses. Do this so that you may understand everything you do and everywhere you turn, and that you may prosper.

verses.latin: et ut confirmet Dominus sermonem suum quem locutus est de me, dicens: Si custodierint filii tui viam suam, et ambulaverint coram me in veritate, in omni corde suo, et in omni anima sua, non auferetur tibi vir de solio Israël.
verses.english: And also that the Lord may confirm His word which He spoke concerning me, saying: 'If your sons keep their way and walk before Me in truth, with all their heart and with all their soul, a man from your line shall not be cut off from the throne of Israel.'

verses.latin: Tu quoque scis quæ fecerit mihi Joab filius Sarviæ, quæ fecerit duobus principibus exercitus Israël, Abner filio Ner, et Amasæ filio Jether: quos interfecit, et effudit sanguinem belli in pace, et posuit cruorem belli in balteo suo, qui erat circa lumbos ejus, et in calceamento suo, quod erat in pedibus ejus.
verses.english: “You also know what Joab, the son of Zeruiah, did to me—what he did to the two commanders of the army of Israel, Abner the son of Ner and Amasa the son of Jether. He killed them, shedding the blood of war in a time of peace, and he put the blood of war on the belt around his waist and on the sandals on his feet.

verses.latin: Facies ergo juxta sapientiam tuam, et non deduces canitiem ejus pacifice ad inferos.
verses.english: So, act according to your wisdom regarding him. Do not allow his gray hairs to go down to the underworld in peace, that is, do not let him die a natural death.

verses.latin: Sed et filiis Berzellai Galaaditæ reddes gratiam, eruntque comedentes in mensa tua: quia sic occurrerunt mihi quando fugiebam a facie Absalom fratris tui.
verses.english: But to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, you must show kindness. Let them eat at your table, because they were there for me when I fled from your brother Absalom.

verses.latin: Habes quoque apud te Semei filium Gera filii Jemini, de Bahurim: qui maledixit mihi maledictione pessima quando ibam ad Castra. Sed quia descendit mecum ad Jordanem, et juravi ei per Dominum, dicens: Non te interficiam gladio:
verses.english: You also have with you Shimei, the son of Gera, a Benjaminite from Bahurim. He cursed me with a terrible curse when I went to Mahanaim, the place where I gathered my forces. But because he came down with me to the Jordan River, I swore to him by the Lord, saying: 'I will not put you to death with the sword.'

verses.latin: tu ergo noli eum impunitum dimittere. Sed vir sapiens es, et scis quæ facias ei, et deduces canitiem ejus cum sanguine ad inferos.
verses.english: Therefore, do not leave him unpunished. But you are a wise man, and you know what you should do to him. Bring his gray hairs down to the underworld with blood, meaning, ensure he faces justice and dies a violent death.

verses.latin: Dormivit ergo David cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in civitate David.
verses.english: So David rested with his fathers and was buried in the city of David.

verses.latin: Dies autem quos regnavit David super Israël, quadraginta anni fuerunt: in Hebron septem annis regnavit, in Jerusalem triginta tribus.
verses.english: And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: seven years he reigned in Hebron, and thirty-three years he reigned in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Salomon autem sedit super solium David patris sui, et firmatum est regnum ejus nimis.
verses.english: Then Solomon sat on the throne of David his father, and his kingdom was very firmly established.

verses.latin: Venit autem Adonias filius Aggith ad Bathsabee matrem Salomonis. Quæ dixit: Pacificusne est ingressus tuus? Qui respondit: Pacificus.
verses.english: Now Adonijah, the son of Haggith, came to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother. She asked him: 'Is your coming peaceful?' And he answered: 'It is peaceful.'

verses.latin: Et addidit: Sermo mihi est ad te. At illa ait: Loquere.
verses.english: And he added: 'I have something to say to you.' At which point she said: 'Speak.'

verses.latin: Qui ait: Tu scis, quia meum erat regnum, et in me conjecerant omnes Israëlitas vultum suum ut regnarem: sed translatum est regnum, et factum est fratris mei: quoniam a Domino constitutum est ei.
verses.english: He said: 'You know that the kingdom was mine, and all Israel had turned their faces toward me, expecting me to reign. But the kingdom has been transferred, and it has become my brother's, because it was established for him by the Lord.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo petitionem unam deprecor a te: ne confundas faciem meam. Dixitque ad eum Bathsabee: Loquere.
verses.english: Now therefore, I have one request to make of you. Do not refuse my plea.' And Bathsheba said to him: 'Speak.'

verses.latin: Qui ait: Precor ut dicas Salomoni regi (neque enim negare tibi quidquam potest) ut det mihi Abisag Sunamitidem uxorem.
verses.english: He said: 'I beg you to speak to King Solomon (for he cannot refuse you anything), that he may give me Abishag the Shunammite as my wife.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Bathsabee: Bene: ego loquar pro te regi.
verses.english: Bathsheba said: 'Very well. I will speak to the king for you.'

verses.latin: Venit ergo Bathsabee ad regem Salomonem, ut loqueretur ei pro Adonia: et surrexit rex in occursum ejus, adoravitque eam, et sedit super thronum suum: et posita est sella matri regis, quæ sedit a dextris ejus.
verses.english: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to speak to him for Adonijah. And the king rose to meet her, bowed down to her, and then sat on his throne. A chair was placed for the king's mother, and she sat at his right hand.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eum: Petitionem unam parvulam deprecor a te: ne confundas faciem meam. Dixitque ei rex: Pete mater mea: neque enim fas est ut avertam faciem tuam.
verses.english: And she said to him: 'I have one small request to make of you. Do not refuse my plea.' And the king said to her: 'Ask, my mother; for it is not right that I should refuse you.'

verses.latin: Quæ ait: Detur Abisag Sunamitis Adoniæ fratri tuo uxor.
verses.english: She said: 'Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother as a wife.'

verses.latin: Et respondens rex Salomon, dixit matri suæ: Quare postulas Abisag Sunamitidem Adoniæ? Postula ei et regnum: ipse est enim frater meus major me, et habet Abiathar sacerdotem, et Joab filium Sarviæ.
verses.english: And King Solomon answered and said to his mother: 'Why do you ask for Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Ask also for the kingdom for him! For he is my older brother, and he has Abiathar the priest and Joab the son of Zeruiah on his side.'

verses.latin: Juravit itaque rex Salomon per Dominum, dicens: Hæc faciat mihi Deus, et hæc addat, si non in hac voce locutus est Adonias animam suam.
verses.english: So King Solomon swore by the Lord, saying: 'May God do so to me and more also, if Adonijah has not spoken this word against his own life, thereby sealing his own doom.'

verses.latin: Et nunc vivit Dominus, qui firmavit me, et collocavit me super solium David patris mei, et qui fecit mihi domum, sicut locutus est, quia hodie interficietur Adonias.
verses.english: And now, as the Lord lives, who has established me and seated me on the throne of David my father, and who has made for me a house, just as He promised—Adonijah shall surely be put to death today.

verses.latin: Misitque rex Salomon Banaiam filium Jojadæ, qui interfecit eum, et mortuus est.
verses.english: So King Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, who struck him down, and he died.

verses.latin: Et Abiathar sacerdoti dixit rex: Vade in Anathoth ad agrum tuum: quidem vir mortis es: sed hodie te non interficiam, quia portasti arcam Domini Dei coram David patre meo, et sustinuisti laborem in omnibus quæ laboravit pater meus.
verses.english: And to Abiathar the priest, the king said: 'Go to Anathoth, to your own fields. You deserve death, for you are a son of death. But today I will not put you to death, because you carried the Ark of the Lord God before David my father, and you endured hardship in all the difficulties my father endured.'

verses.latin: Ejecit ergo Salomon Abiathar, ut non esset sacerdos Domini, ut impleretur sermo Domini, quem locutus est super domum Heli in Silo.
verses.english: So Solomon cast out Abiathar from being a priest of the Lord. This happened so that the word of the Lord, which He spoke concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh, might be fulfilled.

verses.latin: Et audito nuntio Joab (Joab enim declinavit post Adoniam, et post Salomonem non declinaverat) fugerat ad tabernaculum Domini, et apprehendit cornu altaris.
verses.english: When the news reached Joab (for Joab had sided with Adonijah, and had not sided with Solomon), he fled to the tabernacle of the Lord and took hold of the horns of the altar.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est regi Salomoni quod fugisset Joab ad tabernaculum Domini, et esset juxta altare. Et misit Salomon Banaiam filium Jojadæ, dicens: Vade, et interfice eum.
verses.english: It was reported to King Solomon that Joab had fled to the tabernacle of the Lord and was by the altar. And Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying: 'Go and strike him down.'

verses.latin: Venit ergo Banaias ad tabernaculum Domini, et dixit illi: Hæc dicit rex: Egredere. Qui respondit: Non egrediar, sed hic moriar. Renuntiavit Banaias regi sermonem, dicens: Hæc locutus est Joab, et hæc respondit mihi.
verses.english: So Benaiah came to the tabernacle of the Lord and said to him: 'Thus says the king: 'Come out!'' But Joab answered: 'No, I will not come out; I will die here.' So Benaiah reported the words to the king, saying: 'This is what Joab said, and this is how he answered me.'

verses.latin: Et ait illi rex: Fac sicut locutus est, et interfice eum, et sepeli: et auferas sanguinem innocentem, qui effusus est a Joab, a me, et a domo patris mei.
verses.english: And the king said to him: 'Do as he has spoken. Strike him down and bury him, so that you may remove the innocent blood which Joab shed from me and from the house of my father.

verses.latin: Et reddet Dominus sanguinem ejus in caput ejus, qui percussit duos viros justissimos, et optimos in Israël, absque patre meo David, Abner filium Ner principem exercitus Israël, et Amasam filium Jether principem exercitus Judæ:
verses.english: And the Lord will bring his blood back upon his own head because he struck down two men more righteous and better than himself in Israel, without my father David knowing it: Abner the son of Ner, commander of the army of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, commander of the army of Judah.

verses.latin: et revertetur sanguis eorum in caput Joab, et in caput seminis ejus in sempiternum. David autem et semen ejus, et domus, et thronus illius, erit pacifica, et permanens usque in æternum a Domino.
verses.english: Their blood shall return upon the head of Joab and upon the head of his descendants forever. But upon David and his descendants, and his house, and his throne, there shall be peace and permanence forever from the Lord.'

verses.latin: Ascendit itaque Banaias filius Jojadæ, et percussit eum, et interfecit: et sepultus est in domo sua in deserto.
verses.english: So Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up and struck him down and killed him. And he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Et constituit rex Banaiam filium Jojadæ pro eo super exercitum: et Sadoc sacerdotem posuit pro Abiathar.
verses.english: And the king appointed Benaiah the son of Jehoiada over the army in Joab's place. And Zadok the priest he appointed in the place of Abiathar.

verses.latin: Misit quoque rex, et vocavit Semei, et dixit ei: Ædifica tibi domum in Jerusalem, et habita ibi: et non egrediaris inde huc atque illuc.
verses.english: The king also sent and called for Shimei and said to him: 'Build yourself a house in Jerusalem and live there, and do not go out from there anywhere else.

verses.latin: Quacumque die egressus fueris, et transieris torrentem Cedron, scito te interficiendum: sanguis tuus erit super caput tuum.
verses.english: For on whatever day you go out and cross the Kidron Valley, know for certain that you will surely die. Your blood will be on your own head—meaning, you will be responsible for your own death.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Semei regi: Bonus sermo: sicut locutus est dominus meus rex, sic faciet servus tuus. Habitavit ergo Semei in Jerusalem diebus multis.
verses.english: And Shimei said to the king: 'The word is good. As my lord the king has spoken, so will your servant do.' So Shimei lived in Jerusalem for many days.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post annos tres, ut fugerent duo servi Semei ad Achis filium Maacha regem Geth: et nuntiatum est Semei, dicentibus: Ecce servi tui in Geth.
verses.english: But it came to pass after three years that two servants of Shimei fled to Achish, the son of Maacah, king of Gath. And it was reported to Shimei, with people saying: 'Behold, your servants are in Gath!'

verses.latin: Et surrexit Semei, et stravit asinum suum, et abiit in Geth ad Achis ut quæreret servos suos, et adduxit eos de Geth.
verses.english: So Shimei arose, saddled his donkey, and went to Gath, to Achish, to search for his servants. And he brought them back from Gath.

verses.latin: Et sponsionem iniit Salomon cum Pharaone rege Ægypti, et accepit filiam Pharaonis, et adduxit eam in civitatem David, donec compleret ædificans domum suam, et domum Domini, et murum Jerusalem per circuitum.
verses.english: Then Solomon made a political and marriage alliance with Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. He took Pharaoh's daughter as his wife and brought her to the City of David to live there until he had finished building his own royal palace, the Temple of the Lord, and the city walls surrounding Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Attamen populus immolabat in excelsis: non enim erat ædificata domus nomini Domini usque in diem illum.
verses.english: However, the people were still offering sacrifices in the high places, which were unauthorized altars for worship, because a proper Temple for the Lord had not yet been built in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Dilexit autem Salomon Dominum, ambulans in præceptis David patris sui, excepto quod in excelsis immolabat, et thymiama succendebat.
verses.english: Solomon truly loved the Lord and lived according to the commands of David his father, except for one thing: he also offered sacrifices and burned incense at the high places, rather than exclusively at the tabernacle.

verses.latin: Abiit itaque rex in Gabaon ut immolaret ibi: illud est enim excelsum magnum: mille hostias immolavit Salomon super altare illud.
verses.english: Therefore, the king went to Gibeon to offer sacrifices there, for it was a particularly prominent high place. Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings on that altar.

verses.latin: In Gabaon apparuit Dominus Salomoni per somnium nocte, dicens: Postula quod vis ut dem tibi.
verses.english: While in Gibeon, the Lord appeared to Solomon in a dream during the night, saying: 'Ask me for whatever you wish, and I will give it to you.'

verses.latin: Et ait Salomon: Tu fecisti cum servo tuo David patre meo misericordiam magnam, sicut ambulavit in conspectu tuo in veritate et justitia, et recto corde tecum: et custodisti ei misericordiam tuam grandem, et dedisti ei filium sedentem super thronum ejus, sicut et hodie.
verses.english: Solomon responded: 'You have shown great and enduring mercy to your servant, my father David, just as he lived before You with truth, justice, and an upright heart. And You have continued to show him Your abundant mercy by giving him a son who now sits on his throne, as is evident today.'

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine Deus, tu regnare fecisti servum tuum pro David patre meo: ego autem sum puer parvulus, et ignorans exitum et introitum meum.
verses.english: And now, O Lord God, You have made me, Your servant, king in place of my father David. But I am still very young and inexperienced, and I do not know how to properly govern or lead my people.

verses.latin: Et servus tuus in medio est populi tui quem elegisti, populi immensi, qui numerari et dinumerari non potest præ multitudine.
verses.english: And I, Your servant, am placed among Your chosen people—a vast multitude that cannot be counted or numbered because of their sheer size.

verses.latin: Dabis ergo servo tuo cor docile, ut judicare possit populum tuum, et discernere inter bonum et malum. Quis enim poterit judicare populum istum, populum tuum hunc multum?
verses.english: Therefore, grant to Your servant a listening and discerning heart so that I may be able to govern Your people justly and distinguish between good and evil. For who is truly capable of judging this great and numerous people of Yours?

verses.latin: Placuit ergo sermo in oculis Domini, eo quod Salomon postulasset rem hujuscemodi.
verses.english: The Lord was pleased with Solomon's request because he had asked for such a thing—wisdom to govern.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Salomonem: Quia postulasti verbum hoc, et non petisti tibi dies multos, nec divitias, nec animas inimicorum tuorum, sed postulasti tibi sapientiam ad discernendum judicium:
verses.english: So the Lord said to Solomon: 'Because you have made this specific request, and have not asked for a long life, nor for riches, nor for the death of your enemies, but instead have asked for wisdom for yourself to render proper judgment and discern what is right: '

verses.latin: ecce feci tibi secundum sermones tuos, et dedi tibi cor sapiens et intelligens, in tantum ut nullus ante te fuerit similis tui, nec post te surrecturus sit.
verses.english: 'Behold, I have granted your request. I have given you a wise and understanding heart, so much so that there has been no one like you before, nor will there be anyone like you who arises after you.'

verses.latin: Sed et quæ non postulasti, dedi tibi: divitias scilicet et gloriam, in tantum ut nullus similium tibi fuerit in regibus cunctis retro diebus.
verses.english: 'Furthermore, even what you did not ask for, I have given to you: great riches and abundant glory. In fact, no king among all those who lived before you will be your equal.'

verses.latin: Si autem ambulaveris in viis meis, et custodieris præcepta mea, et mandata mea, sicut ambulavit David pater tuus, longos quoque faciam dies tuos.
verses.english: 'But if you walk in My ways and keep My commands and precepts, just as your father David did, then I will also grant you a long life.'

verses.latin: Igitur evigilans Salomon, intellexit quod esset somnium: et venit Jerusalem, et stetit coram arca fœderis Domini, et obtulit holocausta, et fecit victimas pacificas, et convivium universis servis suis.
verses.english: So Solomon awoke and realized that it had been a dream. He then returned to Jerusalem, stood before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings to God. He also held a great feast for all his servants.

verses.latin: Tunc venerunt duæ mulieres meretrices ad regem, et steterunt coram eo:
verses.english: At that time, two women who were prostitutes came before the king and stood in his presence.

verses.latin: quorum una ait: Obsecro domine mi, ego et mulier hæc habitabamus in domo una, et peperi apud eam in cubiculo.
verses.english: One of them said: 'Please, my lord, this woman and I lived together in the same house. I gave birth to a child while she was with me in the room.'

verses.latin: Et tertia die postquam peperi, peperit et hæc: et eramus simul, nullusque alius nobiscum in domo, exceptis nobis duabus.
verses.english: 'And on the third day after I gave birth, she also gave birth. We were alone together; there was no one else in the house with us except the two of us.'

verses.latin: Mortuus est autem filius mulieris hujus nocte: dormiens quippe oppressit eum.
verses.english: 'But this woman's son died during the night, because she accidentally suffocated him in her sleep.'

verses.latin: Et consurgens intempestæ noctis silentio, tulit filium meum de latere meo ancillæ tuæ dormientis, et collocavit in sinu suo: suum autem filium, qui erat mortuus, posuit in sinu meo.
verses.english: 'So she got up in the quiet of the deep night and took my son from my side while I, your handmaid, was asleep, and laid him in her own bosom. Then she put her dead son in my bosom instead.'

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissem mane ut darem lac filio meo, mortuus apparuit: quem diligenter intuens clara luce, animadverti non esse meum qui pepereram.
verses.english: 'And when I arose in the morning to nurse my son, he appeared dead. But when I looked at him closely in the daylight, I realized that he was not the son I had given birth to.'

verses.latin: Responditque altera mulier: Non est ita ut dicis, sed filius tuus mortuus est, meus autem vivit. E contra illa dicebat: Mentiris: filius quippe meus vivit, et filius tuus mortuus est. Atque contendebant coram rege.
verses.english: The other woman replied: 'No, that's not true! Your son is the one who died; my son is alive!' But the first woman insisted: 'You are lying! My son is alive, and your son is dead!' And so they argued back and forth before the king.

verses.latin: Dixit autem rex: Hæc dicit: Filius meus vivit, et filius tuus mortuus est. Et ista respondet: Non, sed filius tuus mortuus est, et filius meus vivit.
verses.english: Then the king said: 'This woman claims: "My son is alive, and your son is dead." And the other woman replies: "No, your son is dead, and my son is alive."'

verses.latin: Addiditque rex: Afferte mihi gladium. Cumque attulissent gladium coram rege,
verses.english: Then the king added: 'Bring me a sword.' And when a sword was brought before the king,

verses.latin: Divide, inquit, infantem vivum in duas partes, et date unam partem uni, et alteram alteri.
verses.english: he commanded: 'Cut the living child in two, and give half to one woman and half to the other.'

verses.latin: Responditque mulier, cujus filius erat vivus, ad regem (commotæ sunt enim viscera ejus super filio suo): Obsecro, inquit, domine mi, date illi infantem vivum, et nolite interficere eum. Contra illa dicebat: Nec mihi nec tibi sit, sed dividatur.
verses.english: Then the woman whose son was truly alive, for her heart ached for her child, said to the king: 'Please, my lord, give her the living child, and do not kill him!' But the other woman insisted: 'Let the child be neither mine nor yours; divide him!'

verses.latin: Interrogans rex ait: Date huic infantem vivum, et non occidatur: hæc est enim mater ejus.
verses.english: The king then declared: 'Give the living child to this woman, and do not kill him, for she is truly his mother.'

verses.latin: Audivit itaque omnis Israël judicium quod judicasset rex, et timuerunt regem, videntes sapientiam Dei esse in eo ad faciendum judicium.
verses.english: So all of Israel heard of the judgment the king had rendered, and they held the king in awe, for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him to administer justice.

verses.latin: Et rex Salomon erat regnans super omnem Israël:
verses.english: So King Solomon was reigning over all of Israel.

verses.latin: et hi principes quos habebat: Azarias filius Sadoch sacerdotis:
verses.english: And these were the chief officials he had: Azariah, son of Zadok the priest,

verses.latin: Elihoreph et Ahia filii Sisæ scribæ: Josaphat filius Ahilud cancellarius:
verses.english: Elihoreph and Ahiah, sons of Shisha, were the secretaries; Jehoshaphat, son of Ahilud, was the chancellor, responsible for royal records.

verses.latin: Banaias filius Jojadæ super exercitum: Sadoc autem et Abiathar sacerdotes:
verses.english: Benaiah, son of Jehoiada, was in command of the army. Zadok and Abiathar served as high priests.

verses.latin: Azarias filius Nathan super eos qui præfecti erant singulis de tributis: Zabud filius Nathan sacerdos amicus regis:
verses.english: Azariah, son of Nathan, was in charge of the regional governors who oversaw the tribute collection. Zabud, son of Nathan, was a priest and also the king's close friend and advisor.

verses.latin: et Ahisar præpositus domus: et Adoniram filius Abda super tributa.
verses.english: Ahishar was the supervisor of the royal palace, and Adoniram, son of Abda, was in charge of the forced labor and taxation.

verses.latin: Habebat autem Salomon duodecim præfectos super omnem Israël, qui præbebant annonam regi et domui ejus: per singulos menses singuli annonam ministrabant.
verses.english: Solomon also had twelve district governors appointed over all of Israel. They were responsible for providing food supplies for the king and his royal household. Each governor was in charge of providing supplies for one month out of the year.

verses.latin: Et hæc nomina eorum: Benhur in monte Ephraim.
verses.english: Their names were: Ben-Hur, in the hill country of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Bendecar in Macces, et in Saalabim, et in Bethsames, et in Elon, et in Bethanan.
verses.english: Ben-Dekar, in Makaz, Shaalbim, Beth-shemesh, Elon, and Beth-hanan.

verses.latin: Benhesed in Aruboth: ipsius erat Socho, et omnis terra Epher.
verses.english: Ben-Hesed, in Arubboth; his region included Socoh and all the land of Hepher.

verses.latin: Benabinadab, cujus omnis Nephath Dor: ipse habebat Taphath filiam Salomonis uxorem.
verses.english: Ben-Abinadab, whose district covered all the heights of Dor. He also had Taphath, one of Solomon's daughters, as his wife.

verses.latin: Baana filius Ahilud in Thanac et Mageddo, et in universa Bethsan, quæ est juxta Sarthana subter Jezrahel, a Bethsan usque Abelmeula in trans Iecmaan.
verses.english: Baana, son of Ahilud, was in charge of Taanach and Megiddo, and all of Beth-shan, which is near Zarethan, below Jezreel, extending from Beth-shan to Abel-meholah, and even beyond Jokmeam.

verses.latin: Factum est igitur fœdus inter Salomonem et Pharaonem regem Ægypti, et accepit Salamon filiam Pharaonis, et adduxit illam in civitatem David, donec compleret ædificans domum suam, et domum Domini, et murum Jerusalem per circuitum.
verses.english: A covenant was made between Solomon and Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. Solomon took Pharaoh's daughter in marriage and brought her into the city of David, Jerusalem. This was until he finished building his own royal palace, the Temple of the Lord, and the wall around Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Attamen populus immolabat in excelsis: non enim erat ædificata domus nomini Domini usque in diem illum.
verses.english: However, the people were still sacrificing in the local high places. This was because the house dedicated to the Name of the Lord—the Temple—had not yet been built by that day.

verses.latin: Dilexit autem Salomon Dominum, ambulans in præceptis David patris sui, excepto quod in excelsis immolabat, et creabat incensum.
verses.english: Solomon loved the Lord, walking according to the precepts of David, his father. His only exception was that he would offer sacrifices and burn incense in the high places.

verses.latin: Abiit itaque rex in Gabaon ut immolaret ibi: illud est enim excelsum maximum: mille hostias holocaustum obtulit Salomon super altare illud.
verses.english: So the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there, for that was the greatest of the local high places. Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings upon that altar.

verses.latin: Apparuit autem Dominus Salomoni in Gabaon per somnium nocte, dicens: Postula quod vis ut dem tibi.
verses.english: The Lord appeared to Solomon in Gibeon during a night dream, saying: "Ask for whatever you wish that I may give it to you."

verses.latin: Et ait Salomon: Tu fecisti cum servo tuo David patre meo misericordiam magnam, sicut ambulavit in conspectu tuo in veritate et justitia et recto corde tecum: et custodisti illi misericordiam tuam grandem, et dedisti ei filium sedentem super thronum ejus, sicut et hodie.
verses.english: Solomon said: "You have shown great mercy to your servant David, my father, because he walked before You in truth, and justice, and with an upright heart. And You kept for him Your great mercy, giving him a son who sits upon his throne, even today."

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine Deus meus, tu regnare fecisti servum tuum pro David patre meo: ego autem sum puer parvulus et ignorans egressum et introitum meum.
verses.english: And now, O Lord, my God, You have made your servant king in place of David my father. But I am a mere child, lacking the experience to lead effectively.

verses.latin: Et servus tuus in medio est populi tui quem elegisti, populi immensi, qui numerari et supputari non potest præ multitudine.
