verses.english: And your servant is in the midst of Your people whom You have chosen—an immense people, so numerous that they cannot be counted or tallied.

verses.latin: Da ergo servo tuo cor docile, ut judicare possit populum tuum, et discernere inter bonum et malum. Quis enim poterit judicare populum istum, populum tuum tantum?
verses.english: Therefore, give your servant a docile heart, one capable of learning and understanding Your will, so that he may be able to judge Your people and discern between good and evil. For who can truly judge this great people of Yours?

verses.latin: Placuitque sermo in oculis Domini, eo quod Salomon postulasset rem hujuscemodi.
verses.english: And the Lord was pleased with what Solomon said, because he had asked for such a thing.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus Salomoni: Quia postulasti verbum hoc, et non petisti tibi dies multos, nec divitias, nec animas inimicorum tuorum, sed postulasti tibi sapientiam ad discernendum judicium:
verses.english: And the Lord said to Solomon: "Because you have asked for this, and you have not asked for a long life for yourself, nor riches, nor the lives of your enemies, but rather you have asked for wisdom to discern judgment:

verses.latin: ecce feci tibi secundum sermones tuos, et dedi tibi cor sapiens et intelligens, in tantum ut nullus ante te fuerit, nec post te surrecturus sit similis tui.
verses.english: Behold, I have done for you according to your words. I have given you a wise and understanding heart, so much so that there has been no one like you before you, nor shall anyone like you rise after you.

verses.latin: Sed et quæ non postulasti, dedi tibi: divitias scilicet et gloriam, ita ut nullus in regibus similis tui fuerit in cunctis diebus tuis.
verses.english: But also what you did not ask for, I have given to you: namely, riches and glory. This is so that no one among kings shall be like you in all your days.

verses.latin: Si autem ambulaveris in viis meis, et custodieris præcepta mea et mandata mea, sicut ambulavit David pater tuus, longos faciam dies tuos.
verses.english: If, however, you walk in My ways and keep My precepts and My commandments, just as David your father walked, I will make your days long.

verses.latin: Igitur evigilavit Salomon, et intellexit quod esset somnium: et venit Jerusalem, et stetit coram arca fœderis Domini, et obtulit holocausta, et fecit victimas pacificas, et dedit convivium universis servis suis.
verses.english: So Solomon awoke and understood that it had been a dream. He then came to Jerusalem and stood before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord. He offered burnt offerings and made peace offerings, and then gave a feast for all his servants.

verses.latin: Tunc venerunt duæ mulieres meretrices ad regem, steteruntque coram eo,
verses.english: Then two women, who were prostitutes, came to the king and stood before him.

verses.latin: quarum una ait: Obsecro domine mi, ego et mulier hæc habitabamus in domo una, et peperi apud eam in cubili.
verses.english: One of them said: "Please, my lord, this woman and I lived in one house. I gave birth while she was with me in the bedchamber."

verses.latin: Tertia autem die postquam peperi, et hæc peperit: et eramus simul, nullusque alius nobiscum in domo, exceptis nobis duabus.
verses.english: "On the third day after I gave birth, this woman also gave birth. We were together, and there was no one else with us in the house except for us two."

verses.latin: Mortuus est autem filius mulieris hujus nocte: dormiens quippe oppressit eum.
verses.english: "Now the son of this woman died in the night, for she lay upon him while sleeping."

verses.latin: Et consurgens intempestæ noctis silentio, abstulit filium meum de latere meo ancillæ tuæ, me dormiente, et collocavit in sinu suo: suum autem filium, qui erat mortuus, posuit in sinu meo.
verses.english: "And rising in the deep silence of the night, she took my son from my side, your handmaid, while I was sleeping, and placed him in her bosom. But her own son, who was dead, she placed in my bosom."

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissem mane ut darem lac filio meo, mortuus est: quem cum diligentius intuerer, et attenderem, animadverti non esse meum qui pepereram.
verses.english: "When I arose in the morning to give milk to my son, he was dead. But when I looked at him more carefully and paid attention, I realized that he was not my son, the one I had given birth to."

verses.latin: Responditque altera mulier: Non est ita ut dicis, sed filius tuus mortuus est, meus autem vivit. Et e contrario illa: Mentiris, nam filius meus vivit, et filius tuus mortuus est. Atque contendebant coram rege.
verses.english: The other woman answered: "It is not as you say; rather, your son is dead, and mine lives." And the first woman countered: "You lie! My son lives, and your son is dead." And so they argued before the king.

verses.latin: Dixitque rex: Hæc dicit: Filius meus vivit, et filius tuus mortuus est. Et ista respondit: Non, sed filius tuus mortuus est, meus autem vivit.
verses.english: And the king said: "This woman says: 'My son lives, and your son is dead.' And that woman answers: 'No, but your son is dead, and my son lives.'"

verses.latin: Præcepit ergo rex: Afferte mihi gladium. Cumque attulissent gladium coram rege,
verses.english: Therefore, the king commanded: "Bring me a sword!" And when they had brought a sword before the king,

verses.latin: Divi dit: Dividite infantem vivum in duas partes: et date unam partem uni, et alteram alteri.
verses.english: He commanded: "Divide the living infant into two parts, and give one part to one woman, and the other part to the other."

verses.latin: Responditque mulier, cujus filius erat vivus, ad regem (commota sunt quippe viscera ejus super filio suo): Obsecro domine mi, date illi infantem vivum, et nolite interficere eum. Altera autem dicebat: Nec mihi, nec tibi sit, sed dividatur.
verses.english: And the woman whose son was alive responded to the king—for her compassion was deeply stirred for her son: "Please, my lord, give her the living infant, and do not kill him!" But the other woman said: "Let him be neither mine nor yours, but let him be divided!"

verses.latin: Respondit rex, et ait: Date huic infantem vivum, et non interficiatur: hæc est mater ejus.
verses.english: The king answered and said: "Give this woman the living infant, and do not kill him. She is his true mother."

verses.latin: Audivit itaque omnis Israël judicium quod judicasset rex, et timuerunt regem, videntes sapientiam Dei esse in eo, ut judicaret.
verses.english: Therefore, all Israel heard the judgment that the king had rendered. And they feared the king, seeing that the wisdom of God was in him to render such judgment.

verses.latin: Initio autem regni Salomonis roborati, duxit uxorem filiam Pharaonis, regis Ægypti, et adduxit eam in civitatem David, donec compleret ædificans domum suam, et domum Domini, et murum Jerusalem per circuitum.
verses.english: Now, when the reign of King Solomon was established and secure, he married the daughter of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. He brought her to live in the City of David until he could complete building his own royal palace, the Temple of the Lord, and the protective wall around Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Attamen populus immolabat in excelsis: non enim ædificatum erat templum nomini Domini usque in diem illum.
verses.english: However, the people were still offering sacrifices at various high places throughout the land, because a dedicated Temple to the Lord had not yet been built for His name, not even up to that day.

verses.latin: Dilexit autem Salomon Dominum, ambulans in præceptis David patris sui, excepto quod in excelsis immolabat, et accendebat thymiama.
verses.english: Solomon loved the Lord and walked according to the commands of David, his father. However, he himself also sacrificed and burned incense at those high places.

verses.latin: Abiit itaque rex in Gabaon ut immolaret ibi: illud est enim excelsum magnum: mille holocausta immolavit Salomon super altare illud.
verses.english: So the king went to Gibeon to offer sacrifices there, because that particular place was a great high place for worship. Solomon offered a thousand whole burnt offerings upon that altar.

verses.latin: In Gabaon apparuit Dominus Salomoni per somnium nocte, dicens: Postula quod vis ut dem tibi.
verses.english: While he was at Gibeon, the Lord appeared to Solomon in a dream during the night, saying, 'Ask what you desire, and I will give it to you.'

verses.latin: Et ait Salomon: Tu fecisti cum servo tuo David patre meo misericordiam magnam, sicut ambulavit in conspectu tuo in veritate, et justitia, et recto corde tecum: et custodisti ei misericordiam tuam grandem, et dedisti ei filium sedentem super thronum ejus, sicut et hodie est.
verses.english: Solomon answered, 'You have shown great mercy to Your servant David, my father, because he walked before You in truth, in justice, and with a sincere heart. You have also kept Your great mercy for him by giving him a son to sit on his throne, which is as it is this very day.'

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine Deus, tu regnare fecisti servum tuum pro David patre meo: ego autem sum puer parvulus, et ignorans exitum meum et introitum.
verses.english: And now, O Lord God, You have made Your servant king in place of David, my father. But I am merely a young man, inexperienced in leadership, and do not know how to carry out my royal duties.

verses.latin: Et servus tuus in medio est populi tui quem elegisti, populi immensi, qui numerari et dinumerari non potest præ multitudine.
verses.english: And Your servant is in the midst of Your chosen people—an immense population that cannot be numbered or counted because of their great multitude.

verses.latin: Dabis ergo servo tuo cor docile, ut judicare possit populum tuum, et discernere inter bonum et malum: quis enim poterit judicare populum istum, populum tuum hunc multum?
verses.english: Therefore, give to Your servant an understanding and discerning heart, so that I may be able to judge Your people properly and distinguish between good and evil. For who is truly able to judge this immense people of Yours?

verses.latin: Placuit ergo sermo in conspectu Domini, eo quod Salomon postulasset rem hujuscemodi.
verses.english: The Lord was pleased with this request, because Solomon had asked for such a thing.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus Salomoni: Quia postulasti sermonem hunc, et non petisti tibi dies multos, nec divitias, nec animas inimicorum tuorum, sed postulasti tibi sapientiam ad discernendum judicium:
verses.english: The Lord said to Solomon, 'Because you have made this request, and have not asked for yourself a long life, nor riches, nor the deaths of your enemies, but instead have asked for wisdom to discern and administer justice—'

verses.latin: ecce feci tibi secundum sermones tuos, et dedi tibi cor sapiens et intelligens, in tantum ut nullus ante te fuerit similis tui, nec post te surrecturus sit.
verses.english: —behold, I have granted your request. I have given you such a wise and understanding heart that there has been no one like you before, nor will there be anyone like you afterward.'

verses.latin: Sed et hæc quæ non postulasti, dedi tibi: divitias scilicet et gloriam, in tantum ut nullus similium tuorum fuerit rex in cunctis diebus tuis.
verses.english: 'Moreover, I have also given you what you did not ask for—namely, riches and glory—to such an extent that no other king will be your equal throughout your entire life.'

verses.latin: Si autem ambulaveris in viis meis, et custodieris præcepta mea, et mandata mea, sicut ambulavit David pater tuus, longos faciam dies tuos.
verses.english: 'Furthermore, if you walk in My ways and keep My precepts and My commandments, just as your father David walked, then I will grant you a long life.'

verses.latin: Igitur evigilans Salomon, intellexit quod esset somnium: et venit Jerusalem, et stetit coram arca fœderis Domini, et obtulit holocausta, et immolavit victimas pacificas, et fecit convivium universis servis suis.
verses.english: Then Solomon awoke and understood that it had been a dream. He came to Jerusalem and stood before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord. He offered whole burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings, and then he held a feast for all his servants.

verses.latin: Tunc venerunt duæ mulieres meretrices ad regem, et steterunt coram eo,
verses.english: After these events, two prostitutes came before the king and stood there in his presence.

verses.latin: quarum una ait: Obsecro domine mi, ego et mulier hæc habitabamus in urbe una, et peperi apud eam in domo.
verses.english: One of them said, 'Please, my lord, this woman and I lived in the same house. While we were there, I gave birth to a child with her in the house.'

verses.latin: Tertia autem die postquam peperi, et haec peperit: et eramus simul, nullusque alius nobiscum in domo, exceptis nobis duabus.
verses.english: Then, on the third day after I gave birth, this woman also gave birth. We were alone together in the house; there was no one else with us, only the two of us.

verses.latin: Mortuus est autem filius mulieris hujus nocte, dormiens oppressit eum.
verses.english: But this woman's son died during the night, because she accidentally overlaid him while she was sleeping.

verses.latin: Et surrexit media nocte, et tulit filium meum de latere meo ancillæ tuæ, me dormiente, et collocavit in sinu suo: suum autem filium, qui erat mortuus, collocavit in sinu meo.
verses.english: Then she rose in the middle of the night, while I, Your handmaid, was sleeping. She took my son from my side and laid him in her own bosom. And her own son, who was already dead, she laid in my bosom instead.

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissem mane ut lactarem filium meum, apparuit mortuus: et diligenter intuens, deprehendi non esse meum qui genueram.
verses.english: When I arose in the morning to nurse my son, I found him dead. But when I looked at him closely and carefully, I realized that he was not the son I had given birth to.

verses.latin: Responditque altera mulier: Non est ita, sed filius meus est iste qui vivit, et filius tuus mortuus est. E contra illa dicebat: Mentiris, filius quidem meus vivit, et filius tuus mortuus est. Atque altercabat coram rege.
verses.english: The other woman replied, 'No, that is not true! This living child is my son, and your son is the one who is dead.' But the first woman insisted, 'You are lying! My son is alive, and your son is dead.' And so, they argued back and forth before the king.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque rex: Hæc dicit, Filius meus vivit, et filius tuus mortuus est: et ista respondet, Non, sed filius tuus mortuus est, et filius meus vivit.
verses.english: The king then said, 'This woman claims, "My son is alive, and your son is dead." And that woman replies, "No, your son is dead, and my son is alive."'

verses.latin: Adjecitque rex: Afferte mihi gladium. Cumque attulissent gladium coram rege,
verses.english: The king then added, 'Bring me a sword!' So, they brought a sword into the king’s presence.

verses.latin: Dividite, inquit, infantem vivum in duas partes, et date unam partem uni, et alteram alteri.
verses.english: He commanded, 'Cut the living infant in two, and give one half to one woman and the other half to the other.'

verses.latin: Responditque mulier, cujus filius erat vivus, ad regem (commota sunt quippe viscera ejus super filio suo): Obsecro, inquit, domine mi, date illi infantem vivum, et nolite interficere eum. Altera autem dicebat: Nec mihi nec tibi sit, sed dividatur.
verses.english: Then the woman whose son was truly alive—for her heart was deeply moved with compassion for her son—spoke to the king, saying, 'Please, my lord, give the living infant to her! Do not kill him!' But the other woman declared, 'Let him be neither mine nor yours. Divide him!'

verses.latin: Præcepit ergo rex, et ait: Date huic infantem vivum, et non occidatur: hæc est enim mater ejus.
verses.english: Then the king gave the command, saying, 'Give the living infant to this woman, and do not kill him, for she is truly his mother.'

verses.latin: Audivit itaque omnis Israël judicium quod judicasset rex, et timuerunt regem, videntes sapientiam Dei esse in eo, ad faciendum judicium.
verses.english: So all Israel heard the judgment that the king had pronounced, and they stood in awe of the king, for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him to administer justice.

verses.latin: Itaque rex Salomon regnabat super omnem Israël.
verses.english: Therefore, King Solomon was the ruler over all of Israel.

verses.latin: Hi sunt principes quos habebat: Azarias filius Sadoc sacerdos,
verses.english: These were his chief officials: Azariah, the son of Zadok, was the priest.

verses.latin: Elioreph et Ahia filii Sisa scribae: Josaphat filius Ahilud a commentariis:
verses.english: Elioreph and Ahiah, the sons of Shisha, were scribes. Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, was the royal recorder.

verses.latin: Banaias filius Jojadae super exercitum: Sadoc autem et Abiathar sacerdotes:
verses.english: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was in charge of the army. Zadok and Abiathar were priests.

verses.latin: Azarias filius Nathan super eos qui praepositi erant singulis officiis: Zabud filius Nathan sacerdos amicus regis:
verses.english: Azariah, the son of Nathan, was in charge of those appointed over individual administrative duties. Zabud, the son of Nathan, was a priest and a friend of the king.

verses.latin: Ahisar praefectus domus: Adoniram filius Abda super tributa.
verses.english: Ahisar was the chief steward of the palace. Adoniram, the son of Abda, was responsible for the forced labor levy.

verses.latin: Habebat autem Salomon duodecim praefectos super omnem Israël, qui praebebant annonam regi et domui ejus: per singulos menses anni singuli praebebant cibaria.
verses.english: Solomon also had twelve district governors over all Israel. They supplied provisions for the king and his household. Each one supplied food for one month of the year.

verses.latin: Et haec sunt nomina eorum: Benhur in monte Ephraim.
verses.english: And these are their names: Ben-Hur, in the hill country of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Bendecar in Macces et Salebim et Bethsames et Elon et Bethanan.
verses.english: Ben-Dekar, in Makaz, Shaalbim, Beth-Shemesh, Elon, and Beth-Hanan.

verses.latin: Benhesed in Aruboth: ipsius erat Socho et omnis terra Epher.
verses.english: Ben-Hesed, in Arubboth. To him belonged Socoh and all the land of Hepher.

verses.latin: Benabinadab, cujus omnis Nephath Dor: ipse habebat Taphath filiam Salomonis uxorem.
verses.english: Ben-Abinadab, whose district was all of Naphath-Dor. He had Taphath, Solomon’s daughter, as his wife.

verses.latin: Baana filius Ahilud in Thanac et Mageddo et in omni Bethsan quae est juxta Sarthana subter Jezrahel, a Bethsan usque Abelmehula e regione Jecmaan.
verses.english: Baana, the son of Ahilud, was in Taanach and Megiddo and in all of Beth-Shan which is next to Zarethan, below Jezreel; from Beth-Shan up to Abel-Meholah, opposite Jokmeam.

verses.latin: Bengaber in Ramoth Galaad: ipsius erant vici Jair filii Manasse in Galaad: ipsius etiam regio Argob quae est in Basan sexaginta civitates magnas atque muratas et aneas habebat.
verses.english: Ben-Geber, in Ramoth-Gilead. To him belonged the villages of Jair, the son of Manasseh, in Gilead. Also, the region of Argob which is in Bashan belonged to him; it had sixty large, fortified cities with bronze gates.

verses.latin: Ahinadab filius Addo dux Mahanaim.
verses.english: Ahinadab, the son of Iddo, was the governor of Mahanaim.

verses.latin: Achimaas in Nephtali: sed et ipse habebat Basemath filiam Salomonis uxorem.
verses.english: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali. He also had Basemath, Solomon’s daughter, as his wife.

verses.latin: Baana filius Husi in Aser et Baloth.
verses.english: Baana, the son of Hushai, in Asher and Aloth.

verses.latin: Josaphat filius Pharue in Issachar.
verses.english: Jehoshaphat, the son of Paruah, in Issachar.

verses.latin: Semei filius Ela in Benjamin.
verses.english: Shimei, the son of Elah, in Benjamin.

verses.latin: Geber filius Uri in terra Galaad, in terra Sehon regis Amorrhaei et Og regis Basan, unus praepositus in ea regione.
verses.english: Geber, the son of Uri, was in the land of Gilead, in the land of Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, king of Bashan. He was the sole governor in that region.

verses.latin: Juda et Israël innumerabiles, sicut arena maris in multitudine: comedentes et bibentes et laetantes.
verses.english: Judah and Israel were countless, like the sand of the sea in multitude. They were eating and drinking and rejoicing.

verses.latin: Salomon autem erat in dicione sua super universa regna, a flumine terrae Philisthiim usque ad terminum Ægypti: offerentium sibi munera, et servientium ei cunctis diebus vitae ejus.
verses.english: Now Solomon held sway over all the kingdoms, from the River Euphrates to the land of the Philistines, as far as the border of Egypt. They presented gifts to him and served him all the days of his life.

verses.latin: Erat autem cibus Salomonis per dies singulos triginta chori similae, et sexaginta chori farinae,
verses.english: Solomon’s provisions for each day were thirty cori of fine flour and sixty cori of meal,

verses.latin: decem boves saginatae, et viginti boves de pascuis, et centum arietes, excepta cervorum, caprearum, atque bubalorum et alitum pinguium multitudine.
verses.english: along with ten fattened oxen, twenty pasture-fed oxen, and one hundred sheep. This was in addition to a multitude of deer, gazelles, wild game, and fattened fowl.

verses.latin: Ipse enim obtinebat omnem regionem trans flumen, a Thapsa et usque Gazam, et cunctos reges regionum illarum: et habebat pacem ex omni parte in circuitu.
verses.english: For he ruled over all the region beyond the River Euphrates, from Tiphsah even to Gaza, and over all the kings of those regions. And he had peace on every side, all around.

verses.latin: Habitabatque Juda et Israël securi, unusquisque sub vite sua et sub ficu sua, a Dan usque Bersabee, cunctis diebus Salomonis.
verses.english: Judah and Israel lived securely, each one under his own vine and under his own fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.

verses.latin: Et habebat Salomon quadraginta millia praesepia equorum currilium, et duodecim millia equestrium.
verses.english: And Solomon had forty thousand stalls for chariot horses and twelve thousand cavalry horses.

verses.latin: Præbebantque ei praefecti illi cibaria, unicuique per mensem, juxta quod ei erat statutum, ut nihil deesset ex his quae regi debebantur.
verses.english: Those district governors supplied him with provisions, each one for his month, according to what was appointed for him, so that nothing would be lacking from what was due to the king.

verses.latin: Hordeum quoque et paleas equorum et jumentorum deferebant in locum ubi erat rex, juxta constitutum sibi.
verses.english: They also brought barley and straw for the horses and other beasts of burden to the place where the king was, according to what was appointed for them.

verses.latin: Dedit quoque Deus sapientiam Salomoni, et prudentiam multam nimis, et latitudinem cordis quasi arenam quae est in littore maris.
verses.english: God also gave Solomon wisdom and exceedingly great understanding, and a breadth of mind like the sand which is on the seashore.

verses.latin: Et praecedebat sapientia Salomonis sapientiam omnium Orientalium et Ægyptiorum.
verses.english: And Solomon’s wisdom surpassed the wisdom of all the people of the East and all the Egyptians.

verses.latin: Et erat sapientior cunctis hominibus: sapientior Ethan Ezrahita et Heman et Chalcol et Darda filiis Mahol: et erat nominatus in universis gentibus in circuitu.
verses.english: And he was wiser than all people; wiser than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol. And he was renowned among all the surrounding nations.

verses.latin: Locutus est quoque tria millia parabolas: et carmina ejus mille et quinque.
verses.english: He also spoke three thousand proverbs, and his songs were one thousand and five.

verses.latin: Et disputavit de lignis a cedro quae est in Libano usque ad hyssopum quae egressa est de pariete: et de armentis et volucribus et reptilibus et piscibus.
verses.english: He spoke about trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon to the hyssop that grows out of the wall. He also spoke about animals, birds, creeping things, and fish.

verses.latin: Veniebantque de cunctis populis audire sapientiam Salomonis, et ab universis regibus terrae qui audiebant sapientiam ejus.
verses.english: And people came from all nations to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and from all the kings of the earth who had heard of his wisdom.

verses.latin: Rex ergo Salomon erat rex super omnem Israël.
verses.english: Therefore, King Solomon was the king over all the nation of Israel.

verses.latin: Et hi principes quos habebat: Azarias filius Sadoc sacerdos,
verses.english: These were the chief officials Solomon had serving him: Azariah, the son of Zadok, was the priest.

verses.latin: Elihoreph et Ahia filii Sisa scribæ: Josaphat filius Ahilud præfectus curæ rerum.
verses.english: Elihoreph and Ahia, the sons of Shisha, were the royal secretaries. Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, was in charge of chronicling the kingdom's history.

verses.latin: Banaias filius Jojadæ super exercitum: Sadoc autem et Abiathar sacerdotes.
verses.english: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, commanded the army. Zadok and Abiathar were the priests.

verses.latin: Azarias filius Nathan super eos qui præerant singulis tribubus: Zabud filius Nathan sacerdos amicus regis.
verses.english: Azariah, the son of Nathan, was the chief officer over those who governed the twelve tribes. Zabud, the son of Nathan, was a priest and the king's trusted personal advisor.

verses.latin: Et Ahisar præpositus domus: et Adoniram filius Abda super tributa.
verses.english: Ahisar was in charge of the royal household, overseeing the palace. And Adoniram, the son of Abda, managed the forced labor and taxes.

verses.latin: Habebat autem Salomon duodecim præfectos super omnem Israël, qui præbebant annonam regi et domui ejus: per singulos menses anni singuli et suæ præbebant annonæ vices.
verses.english: Now Solomon had twelve district governors appointed over all of Israel. Their duty was to provide food supplies for the king and his royal household. Each of these officials, in turn, was responsible for the provisions during one month of the year.

verses.latin: Et hæc nomina eorum: Benhur in monte Ephraim.
verses.english: And these were their names: Ben-Hur was the governor in the hill country of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Bendecar in Macces, et Salebim, et Bethsames, et Elon, et Bethanan.
verses.english: Ben-Dekar was the governor in Makaz, Shaalbim, Beth Shemesh, Elon, and Beth-hanan.

verses.latin: Benhesed in Aruboth: ipsius erat Socho, et omnis terra Epher.
verses.english: Ben-Hesed was the governor in Arubboth. He was in charge of Socoh and all the land of Hepher.

verses.latin: Benabinadab, cujus omnis Nephath Dor: uxorem habebat Basemath filiam Salomonis.
verses.english: Ben-Abinadab was the governor of all Naphath-Dor. He had as his wife Basemath, Solomon's daughter.

verses.latin: Bana filius Ahilud in Thanac et Mageddo, et omni Bethsan, quæ est juxta Sarthana subter Jezrahel, a Bethsan usque Abelmeula in trans Jordanen.
verses.english: Baana, the son of Ahilud, was the governor in Taanach and Megiddo, and all of Beth-shean, which is near Zarethan, below Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, and across the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Bengaber in Ramoth Galaad: ipsius erant Avoth Jair filii Manasse in Galaad: ipsius etiam regio Argob quæ est in Basan sexaginta civitates magnæ muratæque et aereæ seræ habentes.
verses.english: Ben-Geber was the governor in Ramoth-Gilead. He was responsible for the tent villages of Jair, the son of Manasseh, in Gilead. He was also in charge of the region of Argob in Bashan, which contained sixty large, fortified cities with gates secured by bronze bars.

verses.latin: Ahinadab filius Addo præfectus fuit in Manaim.
verses.english: Ahinadab, the son of Iddo, was the governor in Mahanaim.

verses.latin: Achimaas in Nephtali: sed et ipse accepit Basemath filiam Salomonis in conjugium.
verses.english: Ahimaaz was the governor in Naphtali. He also married Basemath, Solomon's daughter.

verses.latin: Bana filius Husai in Aser et Baloth.
verses.english: Baana, the son of Hushai, was the governor in Asher and Aloth.

verses.latin: Josaphat filius Pharue in Issachar.
verses.english: Jehoshaphat, the son of Paruah, was the governor in Issachar.

verses.latin: Semei filius Ela in Benjamin.
verses.english: Shimei, the son of Elah, was the governor in Benjamin.

verses.latin: Geber filius Uri in terra Galaad, in terra Sehon regis Amorræi, et Og regis Basan, præfectus ipse erat in ea una.
verses.english: Geber, the son of Uri, was the governor in the land of Gilead, in the territory of Sihon king of the Amorites, and of Og king of Bashan. He alone was the governor over that consolidated region.

verses.latin: Juda et Israël innumerabiles, sicut arena maris in multitudine: comedentes et bibentes, et lætantes.
verses.english: The people of Judah and Israel were countless, as numerous as the sand on the seashore. They were prosperous, eating and drinking, and rejoicing in their safety.

verses.latin: Salomon autem erat in dicione sua super omnia regna, a flumine terræ Philisthinorum usque ad terminum Ægypti: offerentium munera, et servientium ei cunctis diebus vitæ ejus.
verses.english: King Solomon held dominion over all the kingdoms from the great Euphrates River down to the land of the Philistines and as far as the border of Egypt. These nations presented him with gifts and served him throughout his entire life.

verses.latin: Erat autem cibus Salomonis per dies singulos triginta chori similæ, et sexaginta chori farinæ,
verses.english: For each day, the food provisions for Solomon's court were thirty measures of fine flour and sixty measures of coarser meal.

verses.latin: decem boves saginati, et viginti boves pascuales, et centum arietes, excepta cervorum, caprearum, atque bubalorum, et avium altilium multitudine.
verses.english: This included ten fattened oxen, twenty oxen from the pastures, and one hundred sheep, not including the vast numbers of deer, gazelles, roebucks, and specially fattened birds that were also consumed.

verses.latin: Ipse enim obtinebat omnem regionem trans flumen, a Thapsa et usque ad Gazam, et cunctos reges regionum illarum: et habebat pacem ex omni parte in circuitu.
verses.english: Indeed, he held sway over the entire region west of the great Euphrates River, from Tiphsah all the way to Gaza, and over all the kings of those surrounding lands. Thus, he maintained peace on all sides of his dominion.

verses.latin: Habitabatque Juda et Israël securi, unusquisque sub vite sua, et sub ficu sua, a Dan usque Bersabee cunctis diebus Salomonis.
verses.english: Therefore, the people of Judah and Israel lived in great security, each person dwelling peacefully under his own vine and fig tree—a sign of prosperity—from the northern city of Dan all the way to Beersheba in the south, for all of Solomon's days.

verses.latin: Fuerunt quoque quadraginta millia præsepium equorum in curribus Salomonis, et duodecim millia equestrium.
verses.english: Solomon also had forty thousand stalls for the horses used for his chariots, and he maintained twelve thousand horsemen in his cavalry.

verses.latin: Præbebantque ei supradicti præfecti annonam regi Salomoni, et omnibus qui vescebantur cum eo, singuli mense suo, nihil deesse patiebantur.
verses.english: The aforementioned district governors provided the provisions for King Solomon and for all who ate at his table, each in his own month, ensuring that nothing was lacking.

verses.latin: Hordeum quoque et paleas equorum, et jumentorum, deferebant in locum ubi erat rex, unicuique secundum constitutum suum.
verses.english: They also brought barley and straw for the horses and for the other draft animals to the location where the king was staying, each governor according to his specific assignment.

verses.latin: Dedit quoque Deus sapientiam Salomoni et prudentiam multam nimis, et latitudinem cordis quasi arenam quæ est in littore maris.
verses.english: Moreover, God granted Solomon immense wisdom and very great understanding, along with an expansive breadth of mind, as vast as the sand on the seashore.

verses.latin: Et superabat sapientia Salomonis sapientiam omnium Orientalium et Ægyptiorum.
verses.english: Solomon's wisdom surpassed the wisdom of all the people of the East and all the wisdom of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et erat sapientior cunctis hominibus: sapientior Ethan Ezrahita, et Heman, et Chalchol, et Darda filiis Mahol: et erat nominatus in universis gentibus in circuitu.
verses.english: He was wiser than all other people, even wiser than Ethan the Ezrahite, Heman, Chalkol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol. His fame for wisdom spread throughout all the surrounding nations.

verses.latin: Locutus est quoque tria millia parabolas: et fuerunt carmina ejus quinque millia.
verses.english: He also uttered three thousand proverbs and composed five thousand songs.

verses.latin: Et disputavit de lignis a cedro quæ est in Libano, usque ad hyssopum quæ egreditur de pariete: et de armentis et volatilibus, et reptilibus et piscibus.
verses.english: He spoke extensively about all forms of plant life, from the magnificent cedar of Lebanon to the humble hyssop that grows from a wall. He also discoursed on animals of the land, birds of the air, creeping creatures, and fish of the sea.

verses.latin: Veniebantque de cunctis populis audire sapientiam Salomonis, et ab universis regibus terræ qui audiebant sapientiam ejus.
verses.english: People came from all nations to listen to Solomon's wisdom, and kings from all over the earth sent envoys who had heard of his profound understanding.

verses.latin: Rex itaque Salomon erat regnans super omnem Israel.
verses.english: So King Solomon was reigning over all of Israel.

verses.latin: Et hi principes quos habebat: Azarias filius Sadoch sacerdos.
verses.english: These were the chief officers he had: Azarias, the son of Sadoc, was the priest.

verses.latin: Elihoreph et Ahia filii Sisa scribae: Josaphat filius Ahilud cancellarius.
verses.english: Elihoreph and Ahia, the sons of Sisa, were the scribes, responsible for royal records; and Josaphat, the son of Ahilud, was the chancellor, managing state affairs.

verses.latin: Banaias filius Jojadae super exercitum: Sadoc autem et Abiathar sacerdotes.
verses.english: Banaias, the son of Jojada, was in command of the army; and Sadoc and Abiathar were the chief priests.

verses.latin: Azarias filius Nathan super eos qui praepositi erant singulis officiis: Zabud filius Nathan sacerdos amicus regis.
verses.english: Azarias, the son of Nathan, was in charge of all the officers appointed over various duties; and Zabud, the son of Nathan, was a priest and a trusted friend of the king.

verses.latin: Et Ahisar praefectus domus: et Adoniram filius Abda super tributa.
verses.english: Ahisar was the prefect of the royal palace, managing the household; and Adoniram, the son of Abda, was in charge of collecting all the taxes and tribute.

verses.latin: Habebat autem Salomon duodecim praefectos super omnem Israel, qui praebant annonam regi et domui ejus: per singulos menses anni singuli providebant necessaria.
verses.english: Solomon also had twelve officers appointed over all of Israel, whose duty was to provide food supplies for the king and his royal household. Each of these officers would provide the necessary provisions for one month of the year.

verses.latin: Et haec nomina eorum: Benhur in monte Ephraim.
verses.english: And these were their names and their assigned districts: Benhur was in the mountainous region of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Bendecar in Macces, et in Saalabim, et Bethsames, et Elon Bethanan.
verses.english: Bendecar was in Macces, and in Saalabim, and Bethsames, and Elon Bethanan.

verses.latin: Benhesed in Aruboth, ipsius erat Socho, et omnis terra Epher.
verses.english: Benhesed was in Aruboth; his district included Socho and all the land of Epher.

verses.latin: Benabinadab, cujus universa Nephath Dor: ipse habebat Taphath filiam Salomonis uxorem.
verses.english: Benabinadab had responsibility for all of Nephath Dor. He also had Taphath, Solomon’s daughter, as his wife.

verses.latin: Bana filius Ahilud, in Thanac et Mageddo, et omni Bethsan quae est juxta Sarthana subter Jezrahel, a Bethsan usque Abelmehula e regione Jecmaan.
verses.english: Bana, the son of Ahilud, was responsible for Thanac and Mageddo, and all of Bethsan, which is near Sarthana, below Jezrahel, stretching from Bethsan all the way to Abelmehula, opposite Jecmaan.

verses.latin: Bengaber in Ramoth Galaad, ipsius erant Avoth Jair filii Manasse in Galaad: ipsius regio Argob, quae est in Basan sexaginta civitates magnas atque muratas, et habentes seras aereas.
verses.english: Bengaber was in Ramoth Galaad; he also controlled the Avoth Jair, the villages belonging to the sons of Manasse in Galaad. His region was Argob, which is in Basan, consisting of sixty large, walled cities, each with bronze gate-bolts.

verses.latin: Ahinadab filius Addo praefectus Maanaim.
verses.english: Ahinadab, the son of Addo, was the officer for Maanaim.

verses.latin: Achimaas in Nephthali: sed et ipse acceperat Basemath filiam Salomonis in uxorem.
verses.english: Achimaas was in Nephthali; he, too, had taken Basemath, Solomon’s daughter, as his wife.

verses.latin: Baana filius Husai in Aser et Baloth.
verses.english: Baana, the son of Husai, was in Aser and Baloth.

verses.latin: Josaphat filius Pharue in Issachar.
verses.english: Josaphat, the son of Pharue, was in Issachar.

verses.latin: Semei filius Ela in Benjamin.
verses.english: Semei, the son of Ela, was in Benjamin.

verses.latin: Geber filius Uri in terra Galaad, in terra Sehon regis Amorrhaei, et Og regis Basan, unus praepositus in ea terra.
verses.english: Geber, the son of Uri, was in the land of Galaad, which was the territory of Sehon, king of the Amorrhaei, and Og, king of Basan; he was the only officer appointed over that land.

verses.latin: Juda et Israel innumerabiles sicut arena maris in multitudine: comedentes et bibentes, et laetantes.
verses.english: The people of Juda and Israel were as numerous as the sand on the seashore; they were eating and drinking and living in joy.

verses.latin: Salomon vero erat in omni regno, habens dominium a flumine terrae Philisthinorum usque ad terminum Ægypti: offerentium sibi munera, et servientium ei cunctis diebus vitae ejus.
verses.english: Solomon was reigning over all the kingdoms, holding dominion from the great River (the Euphrates), through the land of the Philistines, and all the way to the border of Egypt. These kingdoms offered him tribute and served him all the days of his life.

verses.latin: Erat autem cibus Salomonis per dies singulos triginta chori similae, et sexaginta chori farinae.
verses.english: Solomon’s daily provisions were an immense amount: thirty *chori* of fine flour and sixty *chori* of regular flour. (A *chorus* was a large measure, approximately 60 gallons).

verses.latin: Decem boves saginati, et viginti boves de pascuis, et centum arietes, excepta cervorum, caprearum, atque bubalorum et volucrum pinguium multitudine.
verses.english: Also, ten fattened oxen, twenty oxen from the pastures, and one hundred rams were provided, in addition to many deer, gazelles, wild oxen, and fattened birds.

verses.latin: Ipse enim obtinebat omnem regionem trans flumen a Thaphsa et usque Gazam, et omnes reges regionum illarum: et habebat pacem ex omni parte in circuitu.
verses.english: For he ruled over all the region beyond the great River, from Thaphsa all the way to Gaza, and over all the kings of those surrounding regions. He enjoyed peace on every side.

verses.latin: Habitabatque Juda et Israel absque timore ullo, unusquisque sub vite sua, et sub ficu sua, a Dan usque Bersabee cunctis diebus Salomonis.
verses.english: Throughout all the days of Solomon’s reign, the people of Juda and Israel lived in safety and peace, each person secure under his own vine and fig tree, from the northernmost city of Dan to the southernmost city of Bersabee.

verses.latin: Habebat quoque Salomon quadraginta millia praesepia equorum currilium, et duodecim millia equestrium.
verses.english: Solomon also had forty thousand stalls for his chariot horses and twelve thousand horses for his cavalry.

verses.latin: Praebebantque supradicti praefecti cibaria regi Salomoni, et omnibus qui accedebant ad mensam ejus, singuli per menses suos, ita ut nihil deesset.
verses.english: The aforementioned officers would each, in their assigned month, provide the food supplies for King Solomon and for all who came to his table, ensuring that nothing was ever lacking.

verses.latin: Hordeum quoque et paleas equorum, et jumentorum, deferebant in locum ubi erat rex, juxta constitutum sibi.
verses.english: They also brought barley and straw for the horses and other draft animals to the place where the king resided, according to their assigned duty.

verses.latin: Dedit quoque Deus sapientiam Salomoni et prudentiam multam nimis, et latitudinem cordis quasi arenam quae est in littore maris.
verses.english: God also gave Solomon wisdom and exceedingly great understanding, and a breadth of mind as vast as the sand on the seashore.

verses.latin: Et praecedebat sapientia Salomonis sapientiam omnium Orientalium et Ægyptiorum.
verses.english: Solomon’s wisdom surpassed the wisdom of all the people of the East and all the wisdom of the Egyptians.

verses.latin: Et erat sapientior cunctis hominibus: sapientior Ethan Ezrahita, et Heman, et Chalchol, et Darda filiis Mahol: et erat nominatus in universis gentibus per circuitum.
verses.english: Indeed, he was wiser than all other men; he was wiser than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, Chalchol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol. His fame for wisdom spread throughout all the surrounding nations.

verses.latin: Locutus est quoque tria millia parabolas: et carmina ejus fuerunt quinque millia.
verses.english: He spoke three thousand proverbs, and his songs numbered five thousand.

verses.latin: Et disseruit de lignis a cedro quæ est in Libano, usque ad hyssopum quæ egreditur de pariete: et de armentis et de avibus, et reptilibus et piscibus.
verses.english: He discoursed about all kinds of plant life, from the magnificent cedar that grows in Libanus down to the humble hyssop that sprouts from a wall. He also spoke extensively about animals, birds, reptiles, and fish.

verses.latin: Veniebant ergo de cunctis populis audire sapientiam Salomonis, et ab universis regibus terrae, qui audiebant sapientiam ejus.
verses.english: So people came from all nations to hear Solomon’s wisdom, and from all the kings of the earth who had heard of his wisdom.

verses.latin: Misit quoque Hiram rex Tyri servos suos ad Salomonem audiens quod ipsum unxissent regem pro patre suo : quia amicus fuerat Hiram David omni tempore.
verses.english: Hiram, King of Tyre, sent his servants to King Solomon after hearing that Solomon had been anointed king in place of his father, King David. This was because Hiram had always been a loyal friend to David.

verses.latin: Misit autem et Salomon ad Hiram dicens :
verses.english: Solomon then sent a message to Hiram, saying:

verses.latin: Tu scis voluntatem patris mei David, et quia non potuerit ædificare domum nomini Domini Dei sui propter bella imminentia per circuitum, donec daret Dominus eum sub pedibus ejus.
verses.english: You know that my father David wanted to build a Temple for the Lord his God, but he could not because of the wars that surrounded him. God prevented him until the Lord made all his enemies subject to him.

verses.latin: Nunc autem requiem dedit Dominus Deus meus mihi per circuitum : et non est Satan, neque malus occursus.
verses.english: But now the Lord my God has given me peace on all sides; there is no adversary, and no evil threatens my kingdom.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem cogito ædificare templum nomini Domini Dei mei, sicut locutus est Dominus ad David patrem meum, dicens : Filius tuus, quem ponam pro te super solium tuum, ipse ædificabit domum nomini meo.
verses.english: Therefore, I intend to build a Temple for the Lord my God, just as the Lord spoke to my father David, saying: ‘Your son, whom I will place on your throne in your stead, he shall build a house for my Name.’

verses.latin: Tu ergo præcipe ut excidant mihi cedros de Libano, et servi mei sint cum servis tuis : mercedem autem servorum tuorum dabo tibi quamcumque statueris : scis enim quoniam non est in populo meo vir qui noverit ligna cædere sicut Sidonii.
verses.english: Therefore, command your workers to cut down cedar trees from Lebanon for me. My workers will join your workers, and I will pay you whatever wages you determine for your workers. For you know that there is no one among my people who can cut timber as skillfully as the Sidonians and Tyrians.

verses.latin: Cum ergo audisset Hiram verba Salomonis, lætatus est nimis, et ait : Benedictus Dominus hodie, qui dedit David filium sapientissimum super populum hunc plurimum.
verses.english: When Hiram heard Solomon’s message, he rejoiced greatly and said: 'Blessed be the Lord today, who has given David a most wise son to rule over this great people!'

verses.latin: Et misit Hiram ad Salomonem dicens : Audivi quæ mandasti mihi : ego faciam omnem voluntatem tuam in lignis cedrinis et abiegnis.
verses.english: Hiram then sent this message back to Solomon: 'I have heard what you commanded me. I will fulfill all your wishes concerning cedar timber and fir timber.'

verses.latin: Servi mei deponent ea de Libano ad mare : et ego componam ea in ratiis in mari, et ducam usque ad locum quem significaveris mihi : et ibi deponam ea, et tu tolles : eruntque jussioni meæ, ut des alimenta domui meæ.
verses.english: My workers will bring the timber down from Lebanon to the sea. I will then bind them into rafts on the sea and transport them to whatever location you specify. There I will unload them, and you may take them. My only condition is that you provide provisions for my household in return.

verses.latin: Igitur Hiram dabat Salomoni ligna cedrina et ligna abiegna, juxta omne quod voluerat.
verses.english: Therefore, Hiram provided King Solomon with cedar timber and fir timber, supplying everything Solomon desired.

verses.latin: Dedítque Salomon Hiram viginti millia chororum tritici in cibum domui ejus, et viginti millia chororum olei purissimi : hæc singulis annis dabat Salomon Hiram.
verses.english: In return, Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat to feed his household, and twenty thousand measures of pure olive oil. Solomon supplied these to Hiram every single year.

verses.latin: Dedit quoque Dominus sapientiam Salomoni, sicut locutus est ei : et erat pax inter Hiram et Salomonem, et inierunt fœdus ambo.
verses.english: The Lord also gave wisdom to Solomon, just as He had promised him. There was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and the two kings made a formal treaty together.

verses.latin: Elegitque rex Salomon de omni Israël operarios, et fuit tributum triginta millia virorum.
verses.english: King Solomon drafted workers from all of Israel; this forced labor amounted to thirty thousand men.

verses.latin: Misitque eos in Libanum, decem millia per menses singulos vicissim, ita ut duobus mensibus essent hi domi, et uno in Libano : et Adoniram erat super tributa.
verses.english: He sent them to Lebanon in shifts of ten thousand men each month. This meant they would work one month in Lebanon and then be at home for two months. Adoniram was in charge of this forced labor.

verses.latin: Fueruntque Salomoni septuaginta millia eorum qui onera portabant, et octoginta millia cæsorum in montibus :
verses.english: Solomon also had seventy thousand men who carried burdens and eighty thousand stonecutters working in the mountains.

verses.latin: absque his quos præfecerat Salomon operibus, ducum trium millium et trecentorum, qui imperabant populo et his qui parabant opera.
verses.english: This was in addition to the three thousand three hundred overseers whom Solomon had appointed over the work. These overseers were in charge of the workers and supervised the preparations for the construction.

verses.latin: Et præcepit rex ut afferrent lapides grandes, lapides electos in fundamentum templi, et quadrarent eos.
verses.english: The king also commanded them to bring large, carefully selected stones for the Temple’s foundation and to prepare them by squaring them.

verses.latin: Cæderentque fabri Salomonis et fabri Hiram, et Giblii : et præparaverunt ligna et lapides ad ædificandam domum.
verses.english: The stonecutters of Solomon and Hiram, along with the Giblites, quarried and shaped these stones. They prepared both the timber and the stones for the construction of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et Hiram rex Tyri misit servos suos ad Salomonem: audivit enim quod ipsum unxissent regem pro patre suo: quia amicus fuerat David omni tempore.
verses.english: And Hiram, king of Tyre, sent his servants to King Solomon, because Hiram had heard that they had anointed Solomon as king in his father's place. Hiram had been King David's friend throughout his life.

verses.latin: Misit quoque et Salomon ad Hiram, dicens:
verses.english: Solomon, in turn, sent a message to Hiram, saying:

verses.latin: Tu scis voluntatem David patris mei, et quia non potuerit ædificare domum nomini Domini Dei sui propter bella in circuitu quibus circumdatus est, donec daret Dominus eum sub planta pedum ejus.
verses.english: You know the desire of my father, David, and how he was unable to build a temple dedicated to the Name of the Lord his God. This was because of the wars that surrounded him, until the Lord completely subdued his enemies.

verses.latin: Nunc autem requiem dedit Dominus Deus meus mihi per circuitum: et non est satan, neque malus occursus.
verses.english: But now the Lord my God has given me peace on every side. There is no adversary, and there are no threats of harm.

verses.latin: Itaque cogito ædificare templum nomini Domini Dei mei, sicut locutus est Dominus ad David patrem meum, dicens: Filius tuus, quem dabo pro te super solium tuum, ipse ædificabit domum nomini meo.
verses.english: Therefore, I intend to build a temple dedicated to the Name of the Lord my God, just as the Lord spoke to my father, David, saying: 'Your son, whom I will establish on your throne in your place, will himself build a temple dedicated to My Name.'

verses.latin: Præcipe igitur ut excidant mihi de Libano cedros: et servi mei erunt cum servis tuis: mercedem autem servorum tuorum dabo tibi, quamcumque jusseris: scis enim quoniam non est in populo meo vir qui noverit ligna cædere, sicut Sidonii.
verses.english: So then, command your people to cut down cedar trees from Lebanon for me. My servants will work alongside your servants, and I will pay your servants whatever wages you determine. For you know that there is no one among my people who is skilled at cutting timber as well as the Sidonians are.

verses.latin: Cum ergo audisset Hiram verba Salomonis, lætatus est nimis: et ait: Benedictus Dominus hodie, qui dedit David filium sapientissimum super populum hunc maximum.
verses.english: When Hiram heard Solomon's words, he was overjoyed and exclaimed, 'Blessed be the Lord today, who has given David such a wise son to rule over this great people!'

verses.latin: Et misit Hiram ad Salomonem, dicens: Audivi quæ mandasti mihi: ego faciam omnem voluntatem tuam in lignis cedrinis et abiegnis.
verses.english: Then Hiram sent word back to Solomon, saying: 'I have heard what you requested of me. I will fulfill all your desires regarding the cedar and fir timbers.'

verses.latin: Servi mei deponent ea de Libano ad mare: et ego componam ea in ratiis in mari, et ducam usque ad locum quem significaveris mihi: et ibi diripiam ea, et tu tolles: et præbebis cibaria domui meæ.
verses.english: My servants will bring the timbers down from Lebanon to the sea. Then I will bind them into rafts on the sea and tow them to the location you specify for me. There, I will have them disassembled, and you can take them. In return, you will provide food supplies for my royal household.

verses.latin: Itaque dedit Hiram Salomoni ligna cedrina et ligna abiegna juxta omne desiderium ejus.
verses.english: So Hiram supplied Solomon with cedar timbers and fir timbers, just as he had desired.

verses.latin: Salomon autem dedit Hiram viginti millia chororum tritici in cibum domui ejus, et viginti millia chororum olei purissimi: hæc singulis annis dabat Salomon Hiram.
verses.english: Solomon, in turn, gave Hiram twenty thousand *cori* (an ancient unit of measure) of wheat as provisions for his royal household, and twenty thousand *cori* of the purest olive oil. Solomon gave these provisions to Hiram each and every year.

verses.latin: Dedit quoque Dominus sapientiam Salomoni, sicut locutus est ei: et erat pax inter Hiram et Salomonem, et percusserunt ambo fœdus.
verses.english: The Lord also granted Solomon wisdom, just as He had promised him. And there was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and the two kings made a formal treaty together.

verses.latin: Levevitque rex Salomon tributum de universo Israël: et erat tributum triginta millia virorum.
verses.english: Then King Solomon raised a forced labor levy from all of Israel, and this levy consisted of thirty thousand men.

verses.latin: Et mittebat eos in Libanum, decem millia per menses singulos vicissim, ita ut duobus mensibus essent in domo sua, et mense tertio in Libano: et Adoniram erat super tributa.
verses.english: He sent these men to Lebanon, ten thousand each month in rotation. This arrangement meant that for two months they were in their own homes, and then for the third month, they were in Lebanon. Adoniram was the overseer of this forced labor levy.

verses.latin: Fuitque Salomoni septuaginta millia eorum, qui onera portabant: et octoginta millia lapicidarum in monte.
verses.english: Solomon also had seventy thousand men who carried heavy loads and eighty thousand stonecutters working in the hill country.

verses.latin: Absque præpositis qui præerant singulis operibus Salomonis, et numero ducentorum quinquaginta, qui urgebant populum et festinabant opus.
verses.english: This was in addition to the two hundred and fifty chief overseers who were in charge of each of Solomon's work crews. These overseers pressed the people and ensured the work progressed quickly.

verses.latin: Præcepitque rex ut tollerent lapides grandes, lapides electos in fundamentum templi, et quadratos.
verses.english: The king commanded them to quarry large, choice stones, and to prepare them as squared stones, for the foundation of the temple.

verses.latin: Et cæderent fabri Salomonis, et fabri Hiram, et Giblii: et præpararent ligna et lapides ad ædificandum templum.
verses.english: And so, Solomon's skilled workers, along with Hiram's skilled workers and the Giblites, hewed and prepared the timbers and stones, all in readiness for the building of the temple.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in quadringentesimo et octogesimo anno egressionis filiorum Israel de terra Aegypti, in anno quarto regni Salomonis super Israel, mense Ziph, ipse est mensis secundus, coepit aedificare domum Domino.
verses.english: Now it happened in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel departed from the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel, in the month of Ziph—which is the second month of the year—that he began to build the House for the Lord.

verses.latin: Domus autem, quam aedificabat rex Salomon Domino, habebat longitudinem sexaginta cubitos, et latitudinem viginti cubitos, et altitudinem triginta cubitos.
verses.english: The House that King Solomon was building for the Lord had a length of sixty cubits, a width of twenty cubits, and a height of thirty cubits.

verses.latin: Et porticus erat ante templum, longitudinis viginti cubitorum, juxta mensuram latitudinis domus: et latitudinis decem cubitorum, ante faciem domus.
verses.english: And there was a portico in front of the Temple, twenty cubits long—matching the width of the House—and ten cubits wide, extending out from the front of the House.

verses.latin: Et fecit in templo fenestras obliquas.
verses.english: And he made narrow, recessed windows in the Temple.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit super parietes domus per circuitum thecam, sive tabulata per circuitum: et fecit latera in circuitu.
verses.english: And he built side chambers—or stories—around the outer walls of the House, making ledges all around.

verses.latin: Tabulatum, quod subter erat, latitudinis quinque cubitorum: et medium, latitudinis sex cubitorum: et tertium, latitudinis septem cubitorum: Ecca enim in circuitu exterius domus per circuitum minuitur, ut non haereant trabes in parietibus domus.
verses.english: The lowest story was five cubits wide, the middle one six cubits wide, and the third story seven cubits wide; for indeed, the outer wall of the House was recessed all around, so that the supporting beams would not have to be fastened into the walls of the House itself.

verses.latin: Et domus cum aedificaretur, de lapidibus dolatis atque perfectis fabricata est: et malleus, et securis, et omne ferramentum non sunt audita in domo cum aedificaretur.
verses.english: And when the House was being built, it was constructed from carefully cut and perfectly finished stones; so that no sound of hammer, axe, or any iron tool was heard in the House while it was being built.

verses.latin: Ostium lateris medii, in parte domus dextera, et per cochleam ascensus erat in medium tabulatum, et a medio in tertium.
verses.english: The entrance to the lowest side chamber was on the right side of the House, and a winding staircase led up to the middle story, and from the middle story up to the third.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit domum, et consummavit eam: texitque domus laquearibus, et tabulis cedrinis.
verses.english: And he built the House, and he finished it; and he covered the House with ceilings—constructed of cedar planks.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit tabulatum per omnem domum, altitudine quinque cubitorum: et junxit domum tabulatis cedrinis.
verses.english: And he built the stories around the entire House, each five cubits high; and he joined the House with cedar planks for these stories.

verses.latin: Factum est autem verbum Domini ad Salomonem, dicens:
verses.english: Now the word of the Lord came to Solomon, saying:

verses.latin: Domus haec, quam aedificas, si ambulaveris in praeceptis meis, et judicia mea feceris, et custodieris omnia mandata mea, et ambulaveris per illos, firmabo sermonem meum ad te, quem locutus sum ad David patrem tuum.
verses.english: Concerning this House that you are building: if you walk in my precepts, and carry out my judgments, and keep all my commandments and walk in them, then I will confirm my word to you, which I spoke to David your father.

verses.latin: Et habitabo in medio filiorum Israel: et non derelinquam populum meum Israel.
verses.english: And I will dwell in the midst of the children of Israel, and I will not forsake my people Israel.

verses.latin: Igitur aedificavit Salomon domum, et perfecit eam.
verses.english: Therefore, Solomon built the House, and he finished it.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit parietes domus intrinsecus tabulis cedrinis, a pavimento domus usque ad laquearia, tabulavit lignis intrinsecus: et stravit pavimento domus tabulas abiegneas.
verses.english: And he built the inner walls of the House with cedar planks, from the floor of the House up to the ceilings, paneling the interior with wood; and he laid the floor of the House with planks of fir wood.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit a tergo domus, viginti cubitis a pavimento usque ad laquearia, tabulis cedrinis: et fecit ad se intrinsecus oraculum, hoc est, Sancta sanctorum.
verses.english: And at the rear of the House, he built a partition of cedar planks twenty cubits high from the floor to the ceiling; and he made within it the Inner Sanctuary, that is, the Holy of Holies.

verses.latin: Quinquaginta autem cubitorum erat ipsa domus: hoc est, templum ante oraculum.
verses.english: The main part of the House—that is, the Temple proper before the Inner Sanctuary—was fifty cubits long.

verses.latin: Et cedrinis tabulis intrinsecus omnia, tota domus, vestiebatur, sculpturis et caelaturis, et torturis, et scissuris variis, eminentibus et planis.
verses.english: And all the interior of the entire House was covered with cedar planks, decorated with carvings and engravings, with twisted designs and various patterns, both raised and flat.

verses.latin: Et oraculum in medio domus in interioribus praeparavit, ut poneret ibi arcam foederis Domini.
verses.english: And he prepared the Inner Sanctuary in the middle of the House’s interior, to place there the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord.

verses.latin: Porro oraculi longitudo viginti cubitorum erat, et latitudo viginti cubitorum, et altitudo viginti cubitorum: et operuit illud auro purissimo: et altare posuit ante oraculum, et operuit illud auro.
verses.english: Furthermore, the Inner Sanctuary was twenty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and twenty cubits high; and he covered it with pure gold; and he placed an altar before the Inner Sanctuary and covered it with gold.

verses.latin: Et Salomon operuit domum intrinsecus auro purissimo: et posuit catenas aureas ante oraculum, et operuit illud auro.
verses.english: And Solomon covered the interior of the House with pure gold, and he placed gold chains before the Inner Sanctuary, and he covered it—the Inner Sanctuary—with gold.

verses.latin: Et nihil erat in omni domo quod auro non tegeretur: sed et totum altare oraculi texit auro.
verses.english: And there was nothing in the entire House that was not covered with gold; even the whole altar of the Inner Sanctuary he covered with gold.

verses.latin: Et fecit in oraculo duos cherubim de lignis olivarum, decem cubitorum altitudinis.
verses.english: And in the Inner Sanctuary, he made two cherubim—angelic figures—of olive wood, each ten cubits high.

verses.latin: Altera ala cherub unius habebat quinque cubitos, et altera ala cherub quinque cubitos: id est, decem cubitos ab extrema parte alae ejus usque ad extremam partem alae alterius.
verses.english: One wing of the first cherub was five cubits long, and the other wing of the cherub was five cubits long; that is, it was ten cubits from the tip of one wing to the tip of the other wing.

verses.latin: Similiter et cherub alter decem habebat cubitos: aequa mensura erat, et aequum opus in utroque cherub.
verses.english: Likewise, the second cherub also had ten cubits in wing span; the measurement was equal, and the craftsmanship was equal for both cherubim.

verses.latin: Altitudinem habebat cherub unus decem cubitorum, et similiter cherub alter.
verses.english: One cherub had a height of ten cubits, and likewise the other cherub.

verses.latin: Et posuit duos cherubim in medio templi interioris: extendebant autem alas suas cherubim, et ala una tangebat parietem, et ala cherub alterius tangebat parietem alterum: reliquae autem alae in medio templi se invicem tangebant.
verses.english: And he placed the two cherubim in the middle of the inner Temple; and the cherubim spread out their wings, so that one wing touched one wall, and the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall; and their remaining wings touched each other in the middle of the Temple.

verses.latin: Per cuncta quoque auro operuit cherubim.
verses.english: He also covered the cherubim completely with gold.

verses.latin: Et omnes parietes domus per circuitum sculpsit variis caelaturis et torno, tam intrinsecus quam extrinsecus: et fecit cherubim, et palmas, et varietates sculpturarum, quasi eminentes, et extra parietes.
verses.english: And he carved all the walls of the House all around with various engravings and lathe work, both inside and outside; and he made cherubim, and palm trees, and various sculptured designs, appearing as if raised from the walls.

verses.latin: Sed et pavimentum domus texit auro intrinsecus et extrinsecus.
verses.english: And he also covered the floor of the House with gold, both inside and outside.

verses.latin: Et in introitu oraculi fecit ostiola de lignis olivarum: postesque, et latera quinque angulorum.
verses.english: And for the entrance of the Inner Sanctuary, he made doors of olive wood; and the doorposts and side panels formed five-sided frames.

verses.latin: Et duo ostiola de lignis olivarum: et caelavit in eis sculpsitque cherubim, et palmas, et picturas valde eminentes: et vestivit omnia auro, et tam cherubim quam palmas.
verses.english: And there were two doors of olive wood; and he engraved and carved on them cherubim, and palm trees, and very prominent decorative figures; and he covered everything with gold, both the cherubim and the palm trees.

verses.latin: Et in introitu templi fecit postes de lignis olivarum, quatuor angulorum.
verses.english: And for the entrance of the main Temple area, he made doorposts of olive wood, having four distinct angles.

verses.latin: Et duo ostia de lignis abiegnis, sculpta et caelata, et aperta, et duo cardinum latera replicabantur.
verses.english: And there were two doors made of fir wood, carved and engraved, which opened—and the two sides of their hinges folded back.

verses.latin: Et caelavit in eis cherubim, et palmas, et caelaturas valde eminentes: et texit omnia laminis aureis.
verses.english: And he engraved on them cherubim, and palm trees, and very prominent engravings; and he covered everything with gold sheets.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit atrium interius tribus ordinibus lapidum politorum, et ordinibus lignorum cedrinorum.
verses.english: And he built the inner court with three courses of polished stones and one course of cedar beams.

verses.latin: Anno quarto, mense Ziph, fundata est domus Domini.
verses.english: In the fourth year, in the month of Ziph, the House of the Lord was founded.

verses.latin: Et in anno undecimo, mense Bul, ipse est mensis octavus, perfecta est domus in omni opere suo, et in universis quae ad eam pertinebant: aedificavitque eam annis septem.
verses.english: And in the eleventh year, in the month of Bul—which is the eighth month—the House was finished in all its work, and in all that pertained to it; and he built it in seven years.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo, anno quadringentesimo octogesimo egressionis filiorum Israel de terra Aegypti, mense secundo, ipso est mense Ziph, anno quarto regni Salomonis super Israel, aedificare coepit domum Domini.
verses.english: It happened then, four hundred and eighty years after the children of Israel left the land of Egypt—specifically in the second month, which is called Ziph—and in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel: Solomon began to build the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Domus autem quam aedificabat rex Salomon Domino, habebat longitudinis sexaginta cubitos, latitudinis viginti cubitos, altitudinis triginta cubitos.
verses.english: The Temple that King Solomon built for the Lord had a length of sixty cubits, a width of twenty cubits, and a height of thirty cubits.

verses.latin: Et porticus ante templum viginti cubitorum longitudinis, juxta mensuram latitudinis templi: et habebat latitudinis decem cubitos ante faciem templi.
verses.english: The entrance porch in front of the main Temple structure was twenty cubits long, matching the width of the Temple itself. This porch extended ten cubits out from the Temple’s main front wall.

verses.latin: Et fecit in templo fenestras obliquas.
verses.english: And for the Temple, he made windows with recessed frames.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit super parietem templi tabulata per circuitum, in parietibus domus per circuitum, in templo et in oraculo: et fecit latera in gyro.
verses.english: He also built side chambers against the walls of the Temple, all around the structure. These side chambers extended around the outer walls of both the main sanctuary and the inner Holy of Holies. He structured these rooms in a circular arrangement.

verses.latin: Tabulatum inferius quinque cubitorum latitudinis, et medium sex cubitorum latitudinis, et tertium septem cubitorum latitudinis. Scalas enim posuit in domo per circuitum extrinsecus, ut non infigerentur trabes in parietibus templi.
verses.english: The lowest story of these side chambers was five cubits wide. The middle story was six cubits wide, and the third story was seven cubits wide. This widening allowed for a set of stairs to be placed along the outside of the Temple structure. This design ensured that the supporting beams for the side chambers did not need to be inserted into the walls of the main Temple itself.

verses.latin: Et domus cum aedificaretur, de lapidibus dolatis atque perfectis aedificata est: et malleus, et securis, et omne ferramentum non sunt audita in domo cum fabricaretur.
verses.english: When the Temple was being built, it was constructed from stones that had been completely cut and prepared at the quarry. No hammer, ax, or any other iron tool was heard on the site while the Temple was under construction.

verses.latin: Ostium lateris medii in parte erat domus dextra: et per cochleam ascendebant in medium, et de medio in tertium tabulatum.
verses.english: The entrance to the middle side chamber was on the right side of the Temple. People would ascend by a winding staircase to the middle story, and from the middle story to the third story.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit domum, et consummavit eam: texitque domum laquearibus de cedrinis tabulis.
verses.english: So Solomon built the Temple and completed its construction. He covered the Temple with ceiling panels made from cedar planks.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit tabulatum super omnem domum, quinque cubitis altitudinis, et operuit domum lignis cedrinis.
verses.english: He also built the side chambers all around the Temple structure, each five cubits high, and he covered the Temple’s exterior with cedar wood.

verses.latin: Factus est autem sermo Domini ad Salomonem, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Solomon, saying:

verses.latin: Domus haec quam aedificas, si ambulaveris in praeceptis meis, et judicia mea feceris, et custodieris omnia mandata mea, gradiens per ea, ego firmabo sermonem meum tecum, quem locutus sum ad David patrem tuum.
verses.english: “Concerning this Temple that you are building: if you walk in My commandments, and execute My judgments, and keep all My precepts by walking in them, then I will fulfill My promise to you, which I spoke to David your father.

verses.latin: Et habitabo in medio filiorum Israel, et non derelinquam populum meum Israel.
verses.english: I will dwell among the children of Israel, and I will not forsake My people Israel.”

verses.latin: Igitur aedificavit Salomon domum, et perfecit eam.
verses.english: So Solomon continued to build the Temple, and he completed it.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit parietes domus intrinsecus tabulis cedrinis, a pavimento domus usque ad laquearia, et operuit lignis intrinsecus: et stravit pavimento domus tabulas abiegneas.
verses.english: Inside the Temple, he built the walls with cedar planks, from the floor of the Temple up to the ceiling. He covered the interior with wood and laid the floor of the Temple with cypress planks.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit ad viginti cubitos a posteriore parte templi tabulis cedrinis, a pavimento usque ad superiora, et fecit ex adytis Domini Oraculum, id est, Sancta sanctorum.
verses.english: And for twenty cubits at the back part of the Temple, he built a partition with cedar planks, from the floor all the way up. This created the inner sanctuary, which is the Holy of Holies, as an inner space within the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et quadraginta cubitorum erat ipse templi ante oraculum.
verses.english: The main sanctuary in front of the Holy of Holies measured forty cubits in length.

verses.latin: Et cedrus in domo intrinsecus tota sculptilis, et variis celaturis, et eminentibus propomidiis. Nihil omnino lapidum cerni poterat, sed cuncta lignea.
verses.english: The entire interior of the Temple was cedar, carved with intricate designs and ornamental flower buds. No stone was visible at all; everything was covered with wood.

verses.latin: Et oraculum in medio domus in interioribus praeparavit, ut poneret ibi arcam foederis Domini.
verses.english: And he prepared the Holy of Holies in the innermost part of the Temple, so that the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord could be placed there.

verses.latin: Porro oraculi longitudo viginti cubitorum, et latitudo viginti cubitorum, et altitudo viginti cubitorum erat: et operuit illud laminis aureis, et altare posuit ante adytum.
verses.english: The Holy of Holies itself was twenty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and twenty cubits high. He covered it with pure gold plates, and he placed an altar in front of this inner sanctuary.

verses.latin: Et operuit Salomon domum intrinsecus auro purissimo: et appendit ex catenis aureis ante oraculum, et operuit illud auro.
verses.english: Solomon covered the entire interior of the Temple with the purest gold. He hung gold chains across the front of the Holy of Holies and also covered it with gold.

verses.latin: Et nihil erat in templo quod auro non tegeretur: sed et totum altare oraculi texit auro.
verses.english: There was nothing in the Temple that was not covered with gold; even the entire altar belonging to the Holy of Holies he covered with gold.

verses.latin: Et fecit in oraculo duos cherubim de lignis olivarum, decem cubitorum altitudinis.
verses.english: And in the Holy of Holies, he made two cherubim from olive wood, each ten cubits high.

verses.latin: Quinque cubitorum ala cherub una, et quinque cubitorum ala cherub altera: id est, decem cubitos habentes per circuitum, a summo alae unius usque ad summum alae alterius.
verses.english: One wing of a cherub was five cubits long, and the other wing of the cherub was also five cubits long. This means that from the tip of one wing to the tip of the other wing, each cherub measured ten cubits across.

verses.latin: Altitudinis quoque decem cubitorum erat cherub alter: et mensura eadem, et opera una, erat in utroque cherub.
verses.english: The other cherub also was ten cubits high; its measurements were the same, and the craftsmanship for both cherubim was identical.

verses.latin: id est, altitudinis decem cubitorum.
verses.english: That is to say, each cherub measured ten cubits in height.

verses.latin: Et posuit duos cherubim in medio templi interioris: extendebantque alas suas cherubim, et ala una pertinebat ad parietem, et ala cherub alterius contingebat parietem alteram: et aliae alae in medio templi sibi invicem jungebantur.
verses.english: And he placed the two cherubim in the middle of the inner Temple, which is the Holy of Holies. The cherubim spread out their wings, so that one wing of the first cherub touched one wall, and a wing of the other cherub touched the opposite wall. Their other two wings met in the middle of the Holy of Holies, joining one another.

verses.latin: Operuit quoque cherubim auro.
verses.english: He also covered the cherubim with gold.

verses.latin: Et omnes parietes templi per circuitum aperuit sculpsitque variis celaturis, et sculpturis: et fecit in eis cherubim, et palmas, et quasi quosdam ornatos, per circuitum.
verses.english: And all the walls of the Temple around its perimeter, both within and without, he decorated. He carved various designs and sculptures upon them, including cherubim, palm trees, and ornate open flower carvings, all around.

verses.latin: Sed et pavimentum domus texit auro intrinsecus, et extrinsecus.
verses.english: He also covered the floor of the Temple with gold, both inside the inner sanctuary and in the outer sanctuary.

verses.latin: Et in introitu oraculi fecit ostiola de lignis olivarum, postes, et latera quinque angulorum.
verses.english: And for the entrance to the Holy of Holies, he made doors from olive wood, with doorposts and doorframes forming five distinct angles.

verses.latin: Et duo ostiola de lignis olivarum: et sculpsit in eis celaturas cherubim, et palmarum, et caelatos quasi apertos flores: et texit omnia auro: tam cherubim, quam palmas, et cetera.
verses.english: These two olive wood doors were carved with cherubim, palm trees, and carved open flower designs. He covered all of them with gold—both the cherubim and the palm trees and the other carvings.

verses.latin: Et in introitu templi fecit postes de lignis olivarum, quadrifariam.
verses.english: And for the entrance to the main Temple sanctuary, he made doorposts of olive wood, shaped into a four-angled frame.

verses.latin: Et duas janas de lignis abiegnis, et utraque ostiola plicata, et reversa sunt.
verses.english: And there were two doors of cypress wood, each consisting of two folding panels that could swing open or fold back.

verses.latin: Et sculpsit in eis cherubim, et palmas, et caelatos flores: et texit omnia laminis aureis.
verses.english: And he carved cherubim, palm trees, and intricate flower designs on these doors. He covered all of them entirely with gold plates.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit atrium interius tribus ordinibus lapidum politorum, et ordine lignorum cedrinorum.
verses.english: He also built the inner courtyard with three courses of finely cut stones and one course of cedar beams.

verses.latin: Anno quarto, mense Ziph, fundata est domus Domini.
verses.english: In the fourth year, in the month of Ziph, the foundation of the Temple of the Lord was laid.

verses.latin: Et anno undecimo, mense Bul, ipse est mensis octavus, perfecta est domus in omni opere suo, et in universo apparatu suo: aedificavitque eam annis septem.
verses.english: And in the eleventh year, in the month of Bul—which is the eighth month—the Temple was completely finished in all its work and in all its preparation. Solomon built it in seven years.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in quadringentesimo octogesimo anno egressionis filiorum Israel de terra Ægypti, in anno quarto regni Salomonis super Israel, mense Ziph, ipse est mensis secundus, cœpit ædificare domum Domino.
verses.english: Now it was in the four hundred and eightieth year after the sons of Israel had departed from the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel, in the month of Ziph (which is the second month of the year), that King Solomon began to build the sacred dwelling for the Lord.

verses.latin: Domus autem quam ædificabat rex Salomon Domino, habebat sexaginta cubitos in longitudine, et viginti cubitos in latitudine, et triginta cubitos in altitudine.
verses.english: The sacred dwelling that King Solomon was building for the Lord was sixty cubits (approximately 18 inches or 45 centimeters per cubit) in length, twenty cubits in width, and thirty cubits in height.

verses.latin: Et porticum ante templum viginti cubitorum habebat in longitudine, juxta mensuram latitudinis templi, et decem cubitos in latitudine ante faciem templi.
