verses.english: And the porch in front of the Temple building was twenty cubits long, matching the width of the Temple building itself, and it extended ten cubits in width in front of the main façade of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et fecit in templo fenestras obliquas.
verses.english: And King Solomon made windows with latticework within the Temple building.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit juxta parietem templi tabulata per circuitum, in parietibus domus per circuitum, tam sanctuarii quam oraculi, et fecit latera in circuitu.
verses.english: And he built side chambers surrounding the wall of the Temple, against the walls of the sacred dwelling all around, both for the main sanctuary and for the inner oracle, creating additional structures along the perimeter.

verses.latin: Tabulatum inferius quinque cubitorum latitudinis erat, et medium sex cubitorum latitudinis, et tertium septem cubitorum latitudinis. Guttas enim dedit in pariete domus per circuitum forinsecus, ut non infigerentur tigna in parietibus templi.
verses.english: The lowest side chamber was five cubits wide, the middle one six cubits wide, and the third seven cubits wide. This was because he had made ledges on the outside wall of the sacred dwelling all around, so that the supporting beams would not have to be fastened into the Temple walls themselves.

verses.latin: Et domus cum ædificaretur, de lapidibus dolatis atque perfectis adferebatur : et malleus, et securis, et omne ferramentum non sunt audita in domo cum ædificaretur.
verses.english: And when the sacred dwelling was being built, the stones were brought to the site already hewn and perfectly shaped. No hammer, no axe, and no iron tool of any kind was heard at the building site while the Temple was being constructed.

verses.latin: Ostium lateris medii in parte erat domus dexteræ, et per cochleam ascensus erat in medium tabulatum, et a medio in tertium.
verses.english: The entrance to the middle side chamber was on the right side of the sacred dwelling, and a winding staircase led up to the middle chamber, and from the middle chamber up to the third.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit domum, et consummavit eam : texitque domum laquearibus de cedrinis tabulis.
verses.english: So King Solomon built the sacred dwelling and brought it to completion. He then covered the roof of the sacred dwelling with ceiling beams and boards made of cedar wood.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit tabulatum super omnem domum, quinque cubitis altitudinis, et junxit domum tabulis cedrinis.
verses.english: And he built the entire upper story, which was five cubits in height, connecting it to the main structure with cedar planks.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad Salomonem, dicens :
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Solomon, saying:

verses.latin: Domus hæc, quam ædificas, si ambulaveris in præceptis meis, et judicia mea feceris, et custodieris omnia mandata mea, gradiens per eos, ego firmabo sermonem meum tibi, quem locutus sum ad David patrem tuum :
verses.english: “Regarding this sacred dwelling that you are building: if you walk in My precepts, and you execute My judgments, and you keep all My commandments by walking in them, then I will establish My promise with you, which I spoke to David your father.

verses.latin: Et habitabo in medio filiorum Israel, et non derelinquam populum meum Israel.
verses.english: And I will dwell in the midst of the sons of Israel, and I will not forsake My people, Israel.”

verses.latin: Igitur Salomon ædificavit domum, et perfecit eam.
verses.english: Therefore, Solomon continued to build the sacred dwelling, and he brought it to completion.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit parietes domus intrinsecus tabulis cedrinis, a pavimento domus usque ad superiora tectorum, et operuit intrinsecus lignis, et stravit pavimentum domus tabulis abiegnis.
verses.english: And he built the inner walls of the sacred dwelling with cedar planks, from the floor of the dwelling up to the upper parts of the roof; he covered the interior with wood and laid the floor of the sacred dwelling with planks of fir wood.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit ad viginti cubitos a posteriore parte templi tabulis cedrinis, a pavimento usque ad superiora, et fecit intrinsecus oraculum, id est, Sancta sanctorum.
verses.english: And he built twenty cubits from the back part of the Temple building with cedar planks, from the floor up to the top, and he made an inner sanctuary there, which is to say, the Holy of Holies.

verses.latin: Et quadraginta cubitis erat templum ante oraculum.
verses.english: And the main hall of the Temple, in front of the inner oracle, was forty cubits long.

verses.latin: Et cedrinis tabulis tota intrinsecus domus tecta erat, habens tornaturas, et sculpturas diversas eminentes : et nihil erat omnino, nisi cedrus.
verses.english: And the entire interior of the sacred dwelling was covered with cedar planks, having carved mouldings and various projecting sculptures; there was absolutely nothing inside but cedar wood.

verses.latin: Et oraculum in medio domus in interiori parte præparavit, ut poneret ibi arcam fœderis Domini.
verses.english: And he prepared the inner oracle in the middle of the sacred dwelling, in its interior part, so that he might place there the ark of the covenant of the Lord.

verses.latin: Porro oraculum habebat viginti cubitos longitudinis, et viginti cubitos latitudinis, et viginti cubitos altitudinis : et operuit illud auro purissimo, et composuit altare de cedrinis tabulis.
verses.english: Furthermore, the inner oracle was twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in width, and twenty cubits in height. He covered it with pure gold, and he fashioned an altar from cedar planks.

verses.latin: Et obduxit Salomon domum intrinsecus auro purissimo : et posuit tabulas aureas in circuitu sanctuarii, et paravit velum aureum.
verses.english: And Solomon overlaid the sacred dwelling's interior with pure gold. He placed golden panels all around the sanctuary and prepared a golden veil.

verses.latin: Et omne altare oraculi operuit auro purissimo : et totam domum texit auro, usque ad consummationem omnium. Sed et altare oraculi texit auro.
verses.english: And he covered the entire altar of the inner oracle with pure gold; and he overlaid the whole sacred dwelling with gold until all was completed. Indeed, he also covered the altar of the oracle with gold.

verses.latin: Et fecit in oraculo duos cherubim de lignis olivæ, decem cubitorum altitudinis.
verses.english: And in the inner oracle, he made two cherubim from olive wood, each ten cubits in height.

verses.latin: Quinquque cubitorum erat ala cherub una, et quinque cubitorum ala cherub altera : id est, decem cubitis a summo alæ unius, usque ad summum alæ alterius.
verses.english: One wing of a cherub was five cubits long, and the other wing of the cherub was five cubits long; that is, it was ten cubits from the tip of one wing to the tip of the other wing.

verses.latin: Decem quoque cubitorum erat cherub secundus : una mensura et una opera erant ambo cherubim.
verses.english: The second cherub was also ten cubits long. Both cherubim had the same measurement and the same workmanship.

verses.latin: Altitudo cherub unius decem cubitorum erat, similiter et cherub alterius.
verses.english: The height of one cherub was ten cubits, and similarly, the other cherub also had a height of ten cubits.

verses.latin: Et posuit duos cherubim in medio templi interioris : extendebantque alas suas cherubim, et ala una tangebat parietem, et ala cherub alterius tangebat parietem alterum : et aliæ duæ alæ in medio templi se invicem tangebant.
verses.english: And he placed the two cherubim in the middle of the inner Temple sanctuary. The cherubim spread out their wings, and one wing of a cherub touched one wall, and the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall; and their other two wings met each other in the middle of the Temple.

verses.latin: Operuit quoque cherubim auro.
verses.english: And he also overlaid the cherubim with gold.

verses.latin: Et omnes parietes domus per circuitum sculpsit variis cælaturis et tornaturis : et fecit in eis cherubim, et palmas, et sculpsit picturas varias, quasi prominentes, et extra parietem.
verses.english: And all the walls of the sacred dwelling, all around, he carved with various engravings and carvings, making cherubim, and palm trees, and he carved various pictures, as if projecting from the wall and extending beyond it.

verses.latin: Sed et pavimentum domus texit auro intrinsecus et extrinsecus.
verses.english: Moreover, he covered the floor of the sacred dwelling with gold, both inside and outside.

verses.latin: Et in introitu oraculi fecit ostiola de lignis olivæ, postesque et latera quinque angulorum.
verses.english: And for the entrance to the inner oracle, he made doors of olive wood, with doorposts and doorframes forming five angles.

verses.latin: Et duo ostiola de lignis olivæ : et sculpsit in eis cælaturas cherubim, et palmarum, et picturas valde eminentes : et operuit omnia auro, et tam cherubim quam palmas operuit auro.
verses.english: And the two doors were made of olive wood. On them he carved cherubim and palm trees and greatly projecting images. He covered all of these with gold, overlaying both the cherubim and the palm trees with gold.

verses.latin: Et fecit in introitu templi postes de lignis olivæ, quadratos.
verses.english: And for the entrance to the main Temple hall, he made doorposts of olive wood, shaped squarely.

verses.latin: Et duo ostia de lignis abiegnis, et utrumque ostium duplex erat, et se invicem complicabant.
verses.english: And there were two doors of fir wood; each door was double, and they folded back upon each other.

verses.latin: Et sculpsit in eis cherubim, et palmas, et cælaturas plurimas quasi eminentes, et operuit omnia auro.
verses.english: And he carved on them cherubim, and palm trees, and many carvings that seemed to project outward. And he covered all of these with gold.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit atrium interius tribus ordinibus lapidum politorum, et ordine lignorum cedrinorum.
verses.english: And he built the inner court with three courses of hewn stones and one course of cedar timbers.

verses.latin: Anno quarto fundata est domus Domini, mense Ziph.
verses.english: In the fourth year, the foundation of the sacred dwelling for the Lord was laid, in the month of Ziph.

verses.latin: Et anno undecimo, mense Bul (ipse est mensis octavus), perfecta est domus in omni opere suo, et in universis ædificiis suis : et ædificavit eam annis septem.
verses.english: And in the eleventh year, in the month of Bul (which is the eighth month of the year), the sacred dwelling was finished in all its work and in all its construction. So Solomon built it in seven years.

verses.latin: Non inclusi tabulatis lateribus totius domus.
verses.english: I did not enclose the entire sacred dwelling with the side structures' paneling.

verses.latin: Et domus exterior, et interior, et laquearia, et omnia ligna cedrina.
verses.english: And the exterior of the sacred dwelling, and its interior, and the ceilings, and all the woodwork, were made of cedar wood.

verses.latin: Domus autem sua aedificavit Salomon tredecim annis, et implevit omnes domos suas.
verses.english: Now, Solomon built his own royal palace for thirteen years, until he completed all the buildings in his complex.

verses.latin: Aedificavit quoque domum saltus Libani, centum cubitorum longitudinis, et quinquaginta cubitorum latitudinis, et triginta cubitorum altitudinis: et quatuor porticus de columnis cedrinis, et laquearia cedrina super columnas.
verses.english: He also built a palace known as 'the House of the Forest of Lebanon.' It was one hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high. This structure had four rows of cedar columns, supporting cedar beams for the ceiling above the columns.

verses.latin: Et porticus de columnis cedrinis, desuper triginta, quae aptatae erant columnis, et capite columnarum per gyrum.
verses.english: The colonnade was made of cedar columns, supporting thirty cedar beams above them. These beams were precisely fitted to the columns, and the capitals of the columns were adorned with carvings all around.

verses.latin: Et fenestrae triclinares in tribus ordinibus per gyrum, et super fenestram, fenestrae in triplici ordine.
verses.english: There were dining hall windows arranged in three rows all around. Above these, there were additional sets of windows, also in three layers.

verses.latin: Et omnia ostia, et fenestrae, et universa postis quadrata erant, et alterum contra alterum in tribus ordinibus.
verses.english: All the doorways, windows, and doorframes were designed with square frames, each matching the other, arranged in three consistent rows.

verses.latin: Et porticum columnarum fecit quinquaginta cubitorum longitudinis, et triginta cubitorum latitudinis: et alteram porticum in facie majoris porticus, et columnas, et epistylia super columnas.
verses.english: He also built a colonnade, fifty cubits long and thirty cubits wide, formed by columns. There was a second portico in front of this larger one, complete with its own columns and supporting architraves placed upon them.

verses.latin: Et porticum solii, ubi sedebat ad judicandum, porticum judicii fecit: et totum per gyrum tabulis cedrinis vestivit a solo usque ad summum.
verses.english: He made a throne room for judgment, where he would sit to pass decrees, known as 'the Portico of Judgment.' This entire room, from the floor to the ceiling, was covered all around with cedar paneling.

verses.latin: Et domus ejus, in qua habitabat, alterius operis erat, extra porticum hanc: quasi domus saltus Libani. Fecit quoque domum filiae Pharaonis (quam uxorem duxerat) tali opere, sicut et porticum istam.
verses.english: Solomon's own dwelling, where he lived, was constructed with a different design, set outside this judgment portico. It was similar in style to the House of the Forest of Lebanon. He also built a palace of the same craftsmanship for Pharaoh's daughter, whom he had married.

verses.latin: Omnia ex lapidibus pretiosis, qui ad normam deacuti erant, serrati serra, ex interiore parte et exteriore, a fundamento usque ad summa tecta: et extrinsecus usque ad atrium majus.
verses.english: All these structures were built using expensive, precisely cut stones, sawn with a saw, both on their interior and exterior faces. These stones extended from the foundation up to the roof-level, and on the outside, they reached all the way to the great courtyard.

verses.latin: Et fundamenta erant de lapidibus pretiosis, lapidibus magnis, decem et octo cubitorum, et duodecim cubitorum.
verses.english: The foundations themselves were laid with costly, large stones: some were eighteen cubits, and others were twelve cubits in size.

verses.latin: Et desuper lapides pretiosi, ad mensuram deacuti, et cedrina.
verses.english: Above these large foundation stones, there were more costly stones, precisely cut to measure, along with cedar timbers.

verses.latin: Et atrium majus per gyrum, tribus ordinibus de lapidibus sectis, et uno ordine ligno cedrino: similiter in atrio domus Domini interiori, et in porticu domus.
verses.english: The great courtyard all around was constructed with three rows of cut stones and one row of cedar wood. The inner courtyard of the Lord's Temple and the portico of the Temple were built similarly.

verses.latin: Misit ergo rex Salomon, et accepit Hiram de Tyro,
verses.english: So King Solomon sent for and brought Hiram from Tyre.

verses.latin: filium mulieris viduae de tribu Nephthali, patre Tyrio, artificem aerarium, et cuius plenissima scientia ad faciendum omne opus aeris. Qui cum venisset ad regem Salomonem, fecit omne opus ejus.
verses.english: Hiram was the son of a widowed woman from the tribe of Naphtali, but his father was a man from Tyre, a skilled bronze-worker. Hiram possessed exceptional knowledge for executing every kind of bronze work. When he arrived before King Solomon, he carried out all the work entrusted to him.

verses.latin: Et fudit duas columnas aereas, decem et octo cubitorum altitudinis columnam unam: et per gyrum quatuor cubitorum ambiebat columna secunda.
verses.english: He cast two columns out of bronze. Each column was eighteen cubits in height, and the circumference of each column was twelve cubits, measured around it.

verses.latin: Et duo capitella fecit de aere fuso, ut imponerentur super capita columnarum: quinque cubitorum altitudinis erat capitellum unum, et quinque cubitorum altitudinis capitellum alterum.
verses.english: He also made two bronze capitals, cast in a mold, to be placed on the tops of the columns. Each capital was five cubits high.

verses.latin: Et quasi in rete, et catenis sibi invicem implicatis, in capitellibus quae super capita columnarum erant: septem ordines in capitello uno, et septem ordines in capitello altero.
verses.english: On the capitals, which were on top of the columns, he crafted decorations resembling netting and intertwined chains. There were seven such ornate layers on one capital and seven layers on the other capital.

verses.latin: Et perfecit columnas, et duos ordines per gyrum in capitello uno: et celavit retiaculis, quae super capita erant columnarum: et malogranata centum erant disposita duobus ordinibus per gyrum in capitello altero.
verses.english: He finished the columns, designing two rows of pomegranates all around on one capital, concealing them within the netting that was above the column tops. Similarly, one hundred pomegranates were arranged in two rows all around the other capital.

verses.latin: Capitella autem quae erant super capita columnarum, quasi lilia opere polita, in porticu quatuor cubitorum.
verses.english: The capitals on top of the columns, in the portico, were shaped like polished lilies, extending for four cubits.

verses.latin: Et rursum alia capitella super duas columnas, desuper per gyrum juxta retiacula: et malogranata ducenta in ordinibus per gyrum, secundo capitello.
verses.english: Again, there were other capitals on the two columns, extending around above the netting. Two hundred pomegranates were arranged in rows all around the second capital.

verses.latin: Et statuit columnas in porticu templi: et erexit columnam dexteram, et vocavit nomen ejus Jachin: similiter erexit columnam sinistram, et vocavit nomen ejus Booz.
verses.english: He set up these columns in the portico of the Temple. He erected the right-hand column and named it 'Jachin.' In the same way, he erected the left-hand column and named it 'Boaz.'

verses.latin: Et super capita columnarum, opus quasi lilii: et perfectum est opus columnarum.
verses.english: On top of the columns, there was a decorative design resembling lilies. This completed the work on the columns.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque mare fusile decem cubitorum a labio usque ad labium, rotundum per circuitum: quinque cubitos altitudinis habebat, et funiculus triginta cubitorum circuibat gyrum ejus.
verses.english: He also made the great bronze basin, referred to as 'the Sea.' It measured ten cubits from rim to rim, perfectly round in its circumference. It was five cubits high, and a measuring line of thirty cubits could encircle its entire perimeter.

verses.latin: Et celaturae sub labio ejus, per circuitum decem: ut quasi duae caelaturae ex una conflatae viderentur.
verses.english: Under its rim, there were sculpted decorations encircling it, ten sections per cubit, appearing as if two rows of carvings had been cast as one piece.

verses.latin: Et stabat super duodecim boves, quorum tres respiciebant ad Aquilonem, et tres ad Occidentem, et tres ad Meridiem, et tres ad Orientem: et mare super eos desuper, posteriores partes eorum intrinsecus.
verses.english: The basin stood upon twelve bronze oxen. Three of them faced north, three faced west, three faced south, and three faced east. The great basin rested upon them from above, with the rear parts of the oxen facing inward.

verses.latin: Grossitudo autem ipsius quatuor digitorum erat: et labium ejus quasi labium calicis, et folium repandi lilii, mille cubitos capiebat.
verses.english: The thickness of the bronze basin was four fingers. Its rim was shaped like the rim of a cup, or like a spreading lily petal. It had a capacity of two thousand baths.

verses.latin: Et fecit decem bases aereas, quatuor cubitorum longitudinis, et quatuor cubitorum latitudinis, et trium cubitorum altitudinis.
verses.english: He also made ten bronze stands. Each stand was four cubits long, four cubits wide, and three cubits high.

verses.latin: Et inter plagas erant veluti sculpturae leonum, et boum, et cherubim: et interjacentia, similiter deorsum et sursum.
verses.english: Between the panels on the stands, there were sculpted figures of lions, oxen, and cherubim. Similar decorations were also placed on the sections above and below these figures.

verses.latin: Et rotulae sub pedibus uniuscujusque basis: quatuor rotulae, et axes aerei: et per quatuor partes, quasi humeruli subter labellum, fusiles, contra se invicem positi.
verses.english: Beneath the feet of each stand were four wheels, and their axles were made of bronze. On all four sides, there were shoulder-like supports, cast in bronze, positioned opposite each other beneath the rim.

verses.latin: Et quatuor latera uniuscujusque basis, quasi undae, et sculpturae quasi manus, in circuitu.
verses.english: The four sides of each stand were adorned with wave-like carvings and hand-like sculptures all around.

verses.latin: Et os ejus in medio, et superius, unius cubiti erat: et undique celatura junctura: et quadrata, non rotunda, opera, et unius cubiti et dimidii latitudinis.
verses.english: The opening for the basin in the middle, at the top, was one cubit. All around the opening, there were engraved connections. The work was square, not round, measuring one and a half cubits in width.

verses.latin: Et quatuor rotulae per partes singulas subter juncturas: et altitudo rotulae unius, cubitus et semis.
verses.english: And there were four wheels on each side, positioned beneath the connecting structures. The height of each wheel was one and a half cubits.

verses.latin: Et rotulae similes erant rotis currus: et axes earum, et radii, et tori, et modioli, omnia fusilia.
verses.english: The wheels were similar to chariot wheels; their axles, spokes, felloes, and hubs, were all cast in bronze.

verses.latin: Et quatuor humeruli per singulas bases, deorsum: fusiles erant, contra se invicem positi.
verses.english: There were four shoulder-like supports on each stand, extending downwards. They were cast in bronze and positioned opposite each other.

verses.latin: Et in summitate basis, quasi rotunditas per circuitum, unius cubiti et semis, celaturae quoque in singulis columnulis, et in quadris ejusdem.
verses.english: At the very top of each stand, there was a round feature, one and a half cubits in circumference, with carvings on each small column and on its square panels.

verses.latin: Et celavit in tabulis, et in quadris, leones, et boves, et cherubim: et in cardinibus, quasi additamenta quaedam scalpta.
verses.english: He carved lions, oxen, and cherubim onto the panels and square surfaces. On the hinges, there were also sculpted decorative additions.

verses.latin: Hac proportione fecit decem bases: fusura una, et mensura una, et scalptura una omnibus.
verses.english: In this manner, he made ten stands. All of them had the same casting, the same measurements, and the same carvings.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque decem labra aerea: quadraginta bathos capiebat labrum unum, et quatuor cubitorum erat labrum unum: et super singulas bases, labrum unum.
verses.english: He also made ten bronze basins. Each basin had a capacity of forty baths, and each basin measured four cubits. One basin was placed upon each of the stands.

verses.latin: Et posuit decem bases, quinque ad dexteram partem templi, et quinque ad sinistram: mare autem posuit ad dexteram partem templi, contra orientem, ad meridiem.
verses.english: He placed the ten stands, five on the right side of the Temple and five on the left. The great bronze basin, the Sea, he placed on the right side of the Temple, towards the southeast.

verses.latin: Fecit autem Hiram lebetas, et scutras, et batillos: et perfecit omne opus regis Salomonis in domo Domini:
verses.english: Furthermore, Hiram made the pots, shovels, and bowls. He completed all the work for King Solomon in the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Aedificavit autem Salomon domum suam tredecim annis, et implevit eam.
verses.english: But Solomon built his own royal palace, a large complex, over the course of thirteen years, and he finally finished all the construction of it.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit domum saltus Libani, centum cubitis in longitudine, et quinquaginta cubitis in latitudine, et triginta cubitis in altitudine: et quatuor porticus inter columnas ligneas: ligna quippe cedrina erant.
verses.english: He also built a palace structure known as 'the House of the Forest of Lebanon'—a massive building one hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high. It was supported by four rows of wooden columns, for all the timber was cedar.

verses.latin: Et tectum de cedro desuper, quod in porticibus eminebat, ad triginta et quinque columnas: et singulae columnae per ordinem se habebant.
verses.english: A cedar roof was built above this structure, extending over the porticos, supported by thirty-five columns. Each of these columns was perfectly aligned in its proper order.

verses.latin: Et porticus inter columnas triginta: et super columnas asseres cedrinos.
verses.english: There was also a specific portico with thirty columns, and upon these columns rested heavy cedar beams.

verses.latin: Et cunctae fores et fenestrae et universa postis, quadrata erant in schemate: et aequali spatio se habebant singula per singula.
verses.english: All the doors and windows, and every single doorpost, were perfectly square in their design, and each was spaced evenly and symmetrically.

verses.latin: Et porticum columnarum fecit, quinquaginta cubitorum in longitudine, et triginta cubitorum in latitudine: et aliam porticum in facie ejus, lignis et columnis, atque in vestibulo suo.
verses.english: He then constructed a portico of columns fifty cubits long and thirty cubits wide. Directly in front of it, he built another portico, also with timber and columns, and a vestibule leading to it.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque porticum solii, ubi judicaret ipse, porticum judicii: et totum per singula, cedro tabulatum erat a pavimento usque ad summa tectorum.
verses.english: He also built the 'Portico of the Throne,' where he would sit to pronounce judgments, naming it the 'Portico of Judgment.' This entire space was paneled throughout with cedar wood, from the floor all the way up to the roof rafters.

verses.latin: Et domum suam in qua habitabat, alterius structurae erat, extra porticum hanc: quasi domus saltus Libani. Fecit quoque domum filiae Pharaonis (quam uxorem duxerat) tali opere, sicut et hanc porticum.
verses.english: His personal residence, where he lived, was of a different architectural style, located beyond this portico, similar in construction to the House of the Forest of Lebanon. He also built a similar palace, with the same craftsmanship, for Pharaoh's daughter, whom he had married.

verses.latin: Omnia lignis pretiosis, quae serrata erant, de intrinsecus et extrinsecus, a fundamento usque ad summa tectorum: et forinsecus usque ad atrium majus.
verses.english: All these structures were built with expensive, sawed stone blocks, both inside and out, from the foundations all the way up to the roof; this extended outward to the great courtyard.

verses.latin: Et fundamenta erant lapidibus pretiosis, lapidibus magnis, decem cubitorum et octo cubitorum.
verses.english: The very foundations were made of precious, large stone blocks—some ten cubits long, and others eight cubits long.

verses.latin: Et desuper lapides pretiosi, in mensura secti, et de cedro.
verses.english: Above these foundation stones were more precious stones, precisely cut to measure, interspersed with cedar wood.

verses.latin: Et atrium majus in circuitu, tribus ordinibus de lapidibus sectis, et uno ordine de cedrinis asseribus: sic et in atrio domus Domini interiori, et in porticu domus.
verses.english: The great courtyard surrounding these buildings had three courses of hewn stones, topped by one course of cedar beams. The inner courtyard of the Lord's Temple and the temple porch also followed this same construction pattern.

verses.latin: Misit ergo rex Salomon, et accepit Hiram de Tyro,
verses.english: So King Solomon sent for Hiram from Tyre.

verses.latin: filium mulieris viduae de tribu Nephthali, patre Tyrio, artificem aerarium et cujus plenum erat sapientia, et intelligentia, et doctrina, ad faciendum omne opus ex aere. Qui cum venisset ad regem Salomonem, fecit omne opus ejus.
verses.english: Hiram was the son of a widow from the tribe of Naphtali, but his father was a Tyrian, a skilled bronze worker. Hiram was filled with wisdom, understanding, and knowledge for all kinds of bronze work. When he arrived before King Solomon, he undertook and completed all the work assigned to him.

verses.latin: Et fudit duas columnas aereas, decem et octo cubitorum altitudinis singulam: et ambitus duodecim cubitorum utramque circumdabat.
verses.english: He cast two columns out of bronze, each one eighteen cubits high. A circumference of twelve cubits encircled each of them.

verses.latin: Duos quoque capitellos fudit ex aere, quos poneret super capita columnarum: quinque cubitos altitudinis capitellum unum, et quinque cubitos altitudinis capitellum alterum.
verses.english: He also cast two capitals out of bronze, to be placed on top of the columns; each capital was five cubits high.

verses.latin: Et quasi in rete, et catenis sibi invicem miro opere junctis, utrumque capitellum columnarum: quasi lilia, et retiacula caelata fabrefacta.
verses.english: Each capital for the columns was intricately adorned with bronze lattice-work, and chain-work wonderfully connected, and sculpted lily designs.

verses.latin: Et duos ordines malogranatorum per circuitum unius retiaculi, ut cooperirent capitella, quae erant super summitatem columnarum: eodem modo fecit et in capitello secundo.
verses.english: He crafted two rows of pomegranates encircling each lattice-work, designed to cover the capitals that were on the top of the columns. He did the same for the second capital.

verses.latin: Capitella autem quae erant super capita columnarum, quasi lilia opere fabrefacto, in porticu, quatuor cubitorum.
verses.english: The capitals that were placed on the tops of the columns were shaped like lilies, a work of art, measuring four cubits high in the portico area.

verses.latin: Et rursum alia capitella super utramque columnam per circuitum, juxta reticulum: et malogranata ducenta, duobus ordinibus per circuitum: eodem modo et in capitello secundo.
verses.english: There were additional capitals above each column, around the lattice-work, with two hundred pomegranates arranged in two rows all around. He made the second capital in the very same manner.

verses.latin: Et statuit columnas in porticu templi: et cum erexisset columnam dexteram, vocavit nomen ejus Jachin: similiter erexit columnam sinistram, et vocavit nomen ejus Booz.
verses.english: Then he erected the columns in the portico of the Temple. When he had set up the right-hand column, he named it Jachin. Likewise, when he set up the left-hand column, he named it Boaz.

verses.latin: Et super capitella columnarum, opus quasi liliorum: perfectumque est opus columnarum.
verses.english: The tops of the columns were adorned with capitals shaped like lilies. With this, the work of the columns was completed.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque mare fusile decem cubitis a labio usque ad labium, rotundum per circuitum: quinque cubitis altitudinis, et funiculus triginta cubitorum circumdabat gyrum ejus in circuitu.
verses.english: He also cast a large bronze basin, which was called 'the Sea.' It measured ten cubits from rim to rim, perfectly round in its circumference, and five cubits in height. A measuring cord of thirty cubits could encompass its entire circumference.

verses.latin: Et celatura sub labio ejus, per circuitum, aselli quasi, et sculpturae variae, celatae erant, denis cubitis ambiebant mare, bini ordines celaturarum fusilium.
verses.english: Below its rim, all around the circumference, there were decorations resembling gourds, and other various sculptures, carved in bronze. There were two rows of these cast decorations, extending ten cubits around the entire basin.

verses.latin: Et stabat super duodecim boves, e quibus tres respiciebant ad Aquilonem, et tres ad Occidentem, et tres ad Meridiem, et tres ad Orientem: et mare super eos desuper: posteriores partes eorum erant intrinsecus, sub mari.
verses.english: This great basin stood upon twelve bronze oxen. Three of these oxen faced north, three faced west, three faced south, and three faced east. The basin itself rested on top of them, and their hindquarters were turned inward, hidden beneath the basin.

verses.latin: Grossitudo autem ipsius maris, trium digitorum erat: et labium illius, quasi labium calicis, vel folii repandi lilii: capiebat duo millia batos.
verses.english: The thickness of the basin's bronze wall was three fingers wide. Its rim was shaped like the rim of a cup or a blossoming lily petal. It was capable of holding two thousand baths of water.

verses.latin: Et fecit bases decem aereas, longitudinis quatuor cubitorum, et latitudinis quatuor cubitorum, et altitudinis trium cubitorum.
verses.english: He then constructed ten bronze stands for the washing basins, each four cubits long, four cubits wide, and three cubits high.

verses.latin: Et ipsum opus basium, interrasile erat: et inter juncturas, scutellae.
verses.english: The structure of these stands was intricately paneled with engraved designs, and between the joints were panels depicting various figures.

verses.latin: Et inter coronulas et parvas coronas, leones et boves et cherubim: et in juncturis quoque desuper, quasi basis prope: et subtus leones et boves, in modum loricae, et aereas effigies appendebant.
verses.english: On the panels, between the upper and lower borders, were sculpted lions, oxen, and cherubim. Above and below these joints, near the base, and beneath the lions and oxen, were more cast bronze figures, hanging like decorative armor plates.

verses.latin: Et quatuor rotae per unam basem aereae, et axes aerei: et quasi manus subter quatuor angulos unius basis: subter lavacrum, fusiles erant hae manus, singulae contra singulas.
verses.english: Each stand had four bronze wheels with bronze axles. There were also extensions like arms cast beneath the four corners of each stand, designed to support the washing basin. These extensions were cast as a single piece with the stands, facing each other in pairs.

verses.latin: Et os lavacri intrinsecus, in summitate, per unum cubitum: et rursum unum cubitum celatum erat, inter quas et scalpturae: et quadrata, non rotunda, erant universa, per circuitum.
verses.english: The opening for the washing basin, on the top, extended one cubit inward. Around this opening, another cubit was decorated with carvings and figures. All these parts were square, not round, around their circumference.

verses.latin: Quatuor quoque rotae in inferioribus basibus: et axes earum, de ipsis basibus: et altitudo rotae unius, cubitus et dimidius.
verses.english: Furthermore, there were four wheels at the lower part of the stands, and their axles were part of the stands themselves. The height of each wheel was one and a half cubits.

verses.latin: Et rotarum juncturae, quasi in curru: et per singula, fusilia erant omnia.
verses.english: The wheel assembly was like that of a chariot, and all parts, individually, were made of cast bronze.

verses.latin: Et quatuor humeruli per unum angulum basis unius: de ipsa basi, fusiles.
verses.english: And at each of the four corners of every stand, there were four shoulder-like projections, cast as part of the base itself.

verses.latin: Et in summitate basis, quasi rotunditas per circuitum, sex cubitorum: et quasi nexum operis et sculpturae, de ipsa basi.
verses.english: At the very top of each stand, there was a round platform, six cubits in circumference, with interwoven designs and sculptures, all cast as part of the stand.

verses.latin: Et scalpsit in tabulatis basium, et in juncturis suis, cherubim et leones et palmas, quasi expressa, et in oram, quasi additamenta per circuitum.
verses.english: On the panels of the stands and on their joints, he carved cherubim, lions, and palm trees, depicting them in high relief. Around the edges, he added decorative borders.

verses.latin: Hoc modo fecit decem bases: fusura una, et mensura una, et scalptura una, erant omnium.
verses.english: In this manner, he made all ten stands; they were all of the same casting, the same measurements, and the same sculpted designs.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque conchas aereas decem: singulas capientes quadraginta batos, unam concham, altitudinis quatuor cubitorum, super singulas bases, id est, super decem bases.
verses.english: He also made ten bronze washing basins, each holding forty baths of water. Each basin was four cubits high and was designed to sit on one of the ten stands.

verses.latin: Et posuit bases quinque a dextris templi, et quinque a sinistris: mare autem posuit a dextris templi, contra orientem, ad meridiem.
verses.english: He placed five of the stands on the right side of the Temple and five on the left side. The great bronze basin, 'the Sea,' he placed on the right side of the Temple, facing eastward, towards the south.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Hiram lebetes, et scyphos, et calathos: et perfecit omne opus regis Salomonis in domo Domini.
verses.english: So Hiram made the pots, the shovels, and the basins. He thus completed all the work for King Solomon concerning the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Tunc congregavit Salomon omnes majores natu Israel, et cunctos principes tribuum, et capita familiarum filiorum Israel ad regem Salomonem in Jerusalem, ut afferrent arcam foederis Domini de civitate David, quae est Sion.
verses.english: Then Solomon gathered all the chief men of Israel, and all the leaders of the tribes, and the heads of the family lines of the sons of Israel to King Solomon in Jerusalem, to bring the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord from the City of David—also known as Zion.

verses.latin: Conveveruntque ad regem Salomonem universi viri Israel in mense Ethanim, in solemnitate: ipse est mensis septimus.
verses.english: All the men of Israel gathered together to King Solomon in the month of Ethanim, for the Feast—which is the seventh month.

verses.latin: Veneruntque cuncti senes Israel, et portaverunt sacerdotes arcam,
verses.english: All the elders of Israel came, and the priests carried the Ark.

verses.latin: et tabernaculum testimonii, et omnia vasa Sanctuarii, quae erant in tabernaculo: et portaverunt ea sacerdotes et Levitae.
verses.english: and the Tent of Meeting—and all the sacred vessels that were kept in the Tent. The priests and Levites carried these items.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon, et omnis multitudo Israel, quae congregrata fuerat ad eum, in conspectu arcae immolabant oves et boves absque numero, et aestimatione.
verses.english: King Solomon and all the multitude of Israel who had gathered to him, in the presence of the Ark, sacrificed sheep and oxen without number or estimation, because there were so many.

verses.latin: Et intulerunt sacerdotes arcam foederis Domini in locum suum, in oraculum templi, in Sanctum sanctorum subter alas cherubim.
verses.english: Then the priests brought the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord to its proper place, into the innermost sanctuary of the Temple, into the Holy of Holies, beneath the wings of the cherubim.

verses.latin: Siquidem cherubim expandebant alas super loca arcae, et protegebant arcam, et vectes ejus desuper.
verses.english: Indeed, the cherubim spread their wings over the place of the Ark, protecting the Ark and its carrying poles from above.

verses.latin: Cumque extendissent vectium ut apparerent summitates eorum extra oraculum ante adytum, et non viderentur extra, fueruntque ibi usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: When the carrying poles were extended, their ends were visible outside the innermost sanctuary, in front of the entrance to the Holy of Holies, but they were not visible from outside the sanctuary itself. They have remained there until the present day.

verses.latin: In arca autem non erat aliud nisi duae tabulae lapideae, quas posuerat Moyses in Horeb, quando legem dedit Dominus filiis Israel, cum egrederentur de terra Aegypti.
verses.english: There was nothing in the Ark except for the two stone tablets that Moses had placed there at Horeb, when the Lord gave the law to the sons of Israel after they had come out of the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum exissent sacerdotes de Sanctuario, nebula implevit domum Domini,
verses.english: Now it happened that when the priests came out of the Sanctuary, a cloud filled the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: et non poterant sacerdotes stare et ministrare propter nebulam: impleverat enim gloria Domini domum Domini.
verses.english: The priests could not stand there and minister because of the cloud, for the glory of the Lord had filled the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Tunc ait Salomon: Dominus dixit ut habitaret in nebula.
verses.english: Then Solomon said: “The Lord said He would dwell in the cloud.

verses.latin: Aedificans aedificavi domum in habitaculum tuum, firmissimum solium tuum in sempiternum.
verses.english: Building, I have built a house as Your dwelling place—a very firm throne for You forever.”

verses.latin: Convertitque rex faciem suam, et benedixit omni Ecclesiae Israel: omnis enim Ecclesia Israel stabat.
verses.english: The king then turned his face and blessed the entire assembly of Israel, for the whole assembly of Israel was standing.

verses.latin: Et ait: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israel, qui locutus est ore suo ad David patrem meum, et in manibus ejus perfecit dicens:
verses.english: And he said: “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who spoke with His own mouth to my father David, and has fulfilled with His own hands what He said, saying:

verses.latin: Ex die qua eduxi populum meum Israel de Aegypto, non elegi civitatem de cunctis tribubus Israel, ut aedificaretur domus nomini meo ibi: sed elegi David ut esset super populum meum Israel.
verses.english: ‘From the day I brought My people Israel out of Egypt, I did not choose a city from all the tribes of Israel where a house might be built for My name to be there. But I chose David to be over My people Israel.’

verses.latin: Voluitque David pater meus aedificare domum nomini Domini Dei Israel:
verses.english: My father David desired to build a house for the name of the Lord God of Israel.

verses.latin: et ait Dominus ad David patrem meum: Quia hoc voluisti animo tuo aedificare domum nomini meo, bene fecisti hoc ipsum mente tractans:
verses.english: But the Lord said to my father David: ‘Because you desired in your heart to build a house for My name, you did well in having this very thought in your mind.

verses.latin: verumtamen tu non aedificabis domum, sed filius tuus, qui egredietur de lumbis tuis, ipse aedificabit domum nomini meo.
verses.english: Nevertheless, you shall not build the house, but your son who will come forth from your body—he shall build the house for My name.’

verses.latin: Perfecit Dominus sermonem suum, quem locutus est: surrexi enim pro David patre meo, et sedi super thronum Israel, sicut locutus est Dominus: et aedificavi domum nomini Domini Dei Israel.
verses.english: The Lord has fulfilled His word which He spoke. For I have risen in place of my father David and sit on the throne of Israel, just as the Lord promised. And I have built a house for the name of the Lord God of Israel.

verses.latin: Et constitui ibi locum arcae, in qua est foedus Domini, quod pepigit cum patribus nostris, quando egressi sunt de terra Aegypti.
verses.english: And I have prepared a place there for the Ark, which contains the Covenant of the Lord that He made with our fathers when they came out of the land of Egypt.”

verses.latin: Stetit ergo Salomon coram altari Domini, contra universam Ecclesiam Israel, et expandit manus suas in caelum:
verses.english: So Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord, in the presence of the entire assembly of Israel, and he spread out his hands toward the created universe.

verses.latin: et ait: Domine Deus Israel, non est similis tui Deus in caelo desuper, et in terra deorsum: qui custodis pactum et misericordiam cum servis tuis, qui ambulant coram te in toto corde suo:
verses.english: And he said: “O Lord, God of Israel, there is no God like You, in the created universe above or on the earth below. You keep Your covenant and show mercy to Your servants who walk before You with their whole heart.

verses.latin: qui praestitisti servo tuo David patri meo quae locutus es ei, et locutus es ore tuo, et in manibus tuis perfecisti, sicut et praesens dies probat.
verses.english: You have kept what You promised to Your servant, my father David. You spoke with Your mouth, and You have fulfilled with Your hands, as this present day proves.

verses.latin: Nunc igitur Domine Deus Israel, custodi servo tuo David patri meo quae locutus es dicens: Non auferetur tibi vir de conspectu meo, qui sedeat super thronum Israel: ita tamen si custodierint filii tui viam suam, ut ambulent coram me sicut tu ambulasti.
verses.english: Now therefore, O Lord, God of Israel, keep for Your servant my father David what You promised him, saying: ‘There shall not fail you a man from My sight to sit upon the throne of Israel, provided that your sons keep their way, to walk before Me as you have walked.’

verses.latin: Et nunc, Deus Israel, firmentur verba tua, quae locutus es servo tuo David patri meo.
verses.english: And now, O God of Israel, may Your words which You spoke to Your servant, my father David, be confirmed.

verses.latin: Ergone putandum est quod vere Deus habitet super terram? si caelum et caeli caelorum non te capiunt, quanto magis domus haec quam aedificavi?
verses.english: Can it be truly believed that God would actually dwell on earth? If the created universe and even the highest created heavens cannot contain You, how much less can this temple I have built?

verses.latin: Sed respice ad orationem servi tui, et ad preces ejus, Domine Deus meus: audi hymnum et orationem, quam servus tuus orat coram te hodie:
verses.english: Yet, look upon the prayer of Your servant and his supplications, O Lord my God. Hear the hymn and the prayer that Your servant prays before You today.

verses.latin: ut sint oculi tui aperti super domum hanc nocte et die: super domum, de qua dixisti: Nomen meum erit ibi: ut exaudias orationem, qua orat te servus tuus in loco isto.
verses.english: May Your eyes be open toward this house night and day—this house of which You said, ‘My Name shall be there’—so that You may hear the prayer which Your servant prays to You in this place.

verses.latin: Et exaudi deprecationem servi tui, et populi tui Israel, quicumque oraverit in loco isto in caelo in habitaculo tuo audi: et cum audieris, propitius esto.
verses.english: Hear the supplication of Your servant and of Your people Israel, whoever prays in this place. Hear in the created universe, in Your dwelling place. And when You hear, be merciful.

verses.latin: Si peccaverit homo in proximum suum, et quum se obligatum prosit jurejurando, et venerit juxta altare tuum in domum istam:
verses.english: If a man sins against his neighbor, and he is bound by an oath to testify, and he comes to Your altar in this house to swear the oath,

verses.latin: tu exaudi de caelo, et fac, et judica servos tuos, condemnans impium, et reddens viam suam super caput ejus, et justificans justum, et retribuens ei secundum justitiam suam.
verses.english: then hear from the created universe, and act, and judge Your servants. Condemn the wicked, repaying his actions upon his own head, and justify the righteous, returning to him according to his righteousness.

verses.latin: Si fugerit populus tuus Israel inimicos suos, quia peccaverunt tibi, et agentes paenitentiam, et confitentes nomini tuo, venerint, et oraverint, et deprecati te fuerint in domo hac:
verses.english: If Your people Israel are defeated by their enemies because they have sinned against You, yet they return to You in repentance, confess Your name, and come and pray and make supplication to You in this house,

verses.latin: exaudi de caelo, et ignosce peccatum populi tui Israel, et reduces eos in terram, quam dedisti patribus eorum.
verses.english: then hear from the created universe, and forgive the sin of Your people Israel, and bring them back to the land which You gave to their fathers.

verses.latin: Si clusum fuerit caelum, et non pluerit propter peccata eorum, et agentes poenitentiam oraverint in loco isto, et confessi nomini tuo, et conversi fuerint a peccatis suis, quia afflixeris eos:
verses.english: If the created universe is shut up and there is no rain because of their sins, yet they pray in repentance in this place, and confess Your name, and turn from their sins because You have afflicted them,

verses.latin: exaudi in caelo, et dimitte peccata servorum tuorum, et populi tui Israel, et ostende eis viam bonam, per quam ambulent, et da pluviam super terram tuam, quam dedisti populo tuo in possessionem.
verses.english: then hear in the created universe, and forgive the sins of Your servants and of Your people Israel, and show them the good way in which they should walk. Then send rain upon Your land, which You have given to Your people as an inheritance.

verses.latin: Fames si oborta fuerit in terra, aut pestis, aut rubigo, aut aurugo, aut locusta, vel bruchus, et obsederit eum inimicus in terra portae ejus, omnis plaga, universa infirmitas:
verses.english: If there is famine in the land, or plague, or blight, or mildew, or locusts, or caterpillars; if their enemy besieges them in the land of their cities, or any other affliction, any sickness,

verses.latin: omnis deprecatio, omnis oratio, quae facta fuerit ab omni homine de populo tuo Israel, agnoscens unusquisque plagam cordis sui, et expanderit manus suas in domo hac,
verses.english: then any supplication or prayer that is made by any person among Your people Israel, each recognizing the affliction of his own heart, and spreading out his hands toward this house,

verses.latin: tu exaudi in caelo in firmissimo solio tuo, et propitius esto, et fac, ut reddas unicuique secundum omnes vias suas, sicut scieris cor ejus tu enim solus nosti cor omnium filiorum hominum:
verses.english: then hear in the created universe, from Your most firm throne, and be merciful. Act to render to each person according to all his ways, as You know his heart—for You alone know the heart of all the sons of men.

verses.latin: ut timeant te cunctis diebus, quibus vivunt super faciem terrae, quam dedisti patribus nostris.
verses.english: May they fear You all the days they live upon the face of the earth, which You gave to our fathers.

verses.latin: Tunc congregavit Salomon omnes majores natu Israel, et cunctos principes tribuum, et capita familiarum filiorum Israel ad regem Salomonem in Jerusalem: ut afferrent arcam foederis Domini de civitate David, quæ est Sion.
verses.english: Then King Solomon gathered all the elders of Israel. He also gathered all the tribal leaders and the heads of the families of the sons of Israel. They all came to King Solomon in Jerusalem. This assembly was to bring the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord from the City of David, which is Zion.

verses.latin: Et convenerunt ad regem Salomonem universi viri Israel in mense Ethanim, feria septima, ipse est mensis septimus.
verses.english: And all the men of Israel gathered to King Solomon in the month of Ethanim, which is the seventh month of the year.

verses.latin: Veneruntque universi senes Israel, et portaverunt sacerdotes arcam.
verses.english: All the elders of Israel came, and the priests carried the Ark.

verses.latin: Et intulerunt arcam Domini, et tabernaculum testimonii, et omnia vasa Sanctuarii, quæ erant in tabernaculo: et portaverunt ea sacerdotes et Levitæ.
verses.english: And they brought up the Ark of the Lord, and the Tent of Meeting (also known as the Tabernacle of Testimony), and all the vessels of the Sanctuary that were in the Tabernacle. The priests and the Levites carried them.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon, et omnis multitudo Israel, quæ convenerat ad eum, in conspectu arcæ immolabant oves et boves absque ullo numero: tantaque erat multitudo victimarum.
verses.english: King Solomon, and all the multitude of Israel who had gathered to him, sacrificed sheep and oxen before the Ark. There were so many sacrificial animals that they could not be numbered, so vast was the multitude of these offerings.

verses.latin: Et intulerunt sacerdotes arcam fœderis Domini in locum suum, in oraculum domus, in Sancta sanctorum, subter alas cherubim.
verses.english: And the priests brought the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord to its proper place. This was into the inner sanctuary of the house, the Holy of Holies, beneath the wings of the cherubim.

verses.latin: Siquidem cherubim expandebant alas super loca arcæ, et protegebant arcam, et perticas ejus desuper.
verses.english: Indeed, the cherubim spread out their wings over the place of the Ark. They covered the Ark and its carrying poles from above.

verses.latin: Præque erant perticæ, et extendebantur in longum, ita ut capitella earum apparerent foris de sanctuario ante oraculum, et intrinsecus minime apparerent. Fueruntque ibi usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: The poles were so long that their ends could be seen from the Holy Place in front of the inner sanctuary, but they were not visible from outside. They remained there even until the present day.

verses.latin: In arca autem non erat aliud, nisi duæ tabulæ lapideæ, quas posuerat Moyses in Horeb, quando fœdus pepigit Dominus cum filiis Israel, cum egrederentur de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: There was nothing in the Ark except the two stone tablets that Moses had placed there at Horeb. This was when the Lord made a covenant with the sons of Israel after they had come out of the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum exissent sacerdotes de Sanctuario, nebula implevit domum Domini.
verses.english: Now it happened, when the priests came out of the Sanctuary, a cloud filled the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et non poterant sacerdotes stare et ministrare propter nebulam: gloria enim Domini impleverat domum Domini.
verses.english: And the priests could not stand to minister because of the cloud. This was because the glory of the Lord, the visible manifestation of God's presence and power, had filled the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Tunc ait Salomon: Dominus dixit ut habitaret in nebula.
verses.english: Then Solomon said, 'The Lord said that He would dwell in a cloud.'

verses.latin: Ædificans ædificavi domum in habitaculum tuum: firmissimum solium tuum in sempiternum.
verses.english: I have indeed built a house as a dwelling place for You, a most firm and eternal place for Your glorious presence.

verses.latin: Et convertit rex faciem suam, et benedixit omni ecclesiæ Israel: omnis enim ecclesia Israel stabat.
verses.english: And the king turned his face, and blessed all the assembly of Israel. For all the assembly of Israel was standing.

verses.latin: Et ait: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israel, qui locutus est ore suo ad David patrem meum, et in operibus suis perfecit, dicens:
verses.english: And he said, 'Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel. He spoke with His own mouth to David my father, and by His works, He has brought it to pass, saying:'

verses.latin: Ex die qua eduxi populum meum Israel de Ægypto, non elegi civitatem de universis tribubus Israel, ut ædificaretur domus nomini meo ibi: sed elegi David ut esset super populum meum Israel.
verses.english: 'From the day that I brought My people Israel out of Egypt, I did not choose a city from all the tribes of Israel for a house to be built in My name there. But I chose David to be over My people Israel.'

verses.latin: Et cum fuisset voluntatis David patris mei, ut ædificaret domum nomini Domini Dei Israel:
verses.english: 'And it was the intention of David my father to build a house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.'

verses.latin: Dixit Dominus ad David patrem meum: Quia hoc fuisti in animo, ut ædificares domum nomini meo, bene fecisti hoc ipsum mente pertractans:
verses.english: 'The Lord said to David my father: Because it was in your heart to build a house for My name, you did well in conceiving this very thing in your mind.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen tu non ædificabis domum, sed filius tuus, qui egredietur de lumbis tuis, ipse ædificabit domum nomini meo.
verses.english: 'Nevertheless, you shall not build the house. But your son, who will come out from your loins, he shall build the house for My name.'

verses.latin: Firmavit Dominus sermonem suum, quem locutus est: surrexi enim pro David patre meo, et sedi super thronum Israel, sicut locutus est Dominus: et ædificavi domum nomini Domini Dei Israel.
verses.english: 'The Lord has established His word which He spoke. For I have risen up in place of David my father, and I sit on the throne of Israel, just as the Lord promised. And I have built the house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.'

verses.latin: Et constitui ibi locum arcæ, in qua est fœdus Domini, quod pepigit cum patribus nostris, quando egressi sunt de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: 'And there I have established a place for the Ark, in which is the Covenant of the Lord. This is the Covenant He made with our fathers when they came out of the land of Egypt.'

verses.latin: Stetit itaque Salomon coram altari Domini in conspectu universæ ecclesiæ Israel, et expandit manus suas in cælum:
verses.english: Therefore, Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord, in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and he spread out his hands towards heaven, the dwelling place of God.

verses.latin: Et ait: Domine Deus Israel, non est similis tui Deus sursum in cælo, et deorsum super terram: qui custodis pactum et misericordiam cum servis tuis, qui ambulant coram te in toto corde suo.
verses.english: And he said, 'O Lord, God of Israel, there is no God like You, above in heaven or below on earth. You keep covenant and show mercy to Your servants who walk before You with all their heart.'

verses.latin: Qui custodisti servo tuo David patri meo quæ locutus es ei: et verba tua compleisti, sicut et hodie probatur.
verses.english: 'You have kept what You promised to Your servant David my father. And You have fulfilled Your words, as is proven this very day.'

verses.latin: Nunc igitur Domine Deus Israel, custodi servo tuo David patri meo quæ locutus es, dicens: Non auferetur tibi vir de conspectu meo, qui sedeat super thronum Israel: ita tamen si custodierint filii tui viam suam, et ambulaverint coram me sicut tu ambulasti.
verses.english: 'Now therefore, O Lord, God of Israel, keep for Your servant David my father what You spoke, saying: There shall not fail you a man in My sight to sit on the throne of Israel. Nevertheless, this is true if your sons will keep their way, and walk before Me as you have walked.'

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine Deus Israel, firmentur verba tua, quæ locutus es David patri meo servo tuo.
verses.english: 'And now, O Lord, God of Israel, let Your words be confirmed, these words You spoke to David my father, Your servant.'

verses.latin: Numquid igitur verè habitabit Deus super terram? si enim cælum, et cæli cælorum te capere non possunt, quanto magis domus hæc, quam ædificavi?
verses.english: 'But will God indeed dwell on the earth? For if the universe, and even the heaven of heavens, cannot contain You, how much less this house which I have built?'

verses.latin: Sed respice ad orationem servi tui, et obsecrationem ejus, Domine Deus meus: audi hymnum et orationem, quam servus tuus orat coram te hodie:
verses.english: 'Yet, look upon the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O Lord my God. Hear the hymn and the prayer which Your servant prays before You today.'

verses.latin: Ut sint oculi tui aperti super domum hanc nocte et die: super domum, de qua dixisti: Nomen meum erit ibi:
verses.english: 'That Your eyes may be open toward this house night and day. Toward the house of which You said, My Name shall be there, meaning My presence and authority will reside there.'

verses.latin: Ut exaudias orationem servi tui, et populi tui Israel, quicumque oraverit in loco isto: et exaudies in loco habitaculi tui in cælo: et cum exaudieris, propitius eris.
verses.english: 'That You may hear the prayer of Your servant and of Your people Israel, whenever anyone prays in this place. And You shall hear them in the place of Your dwelling, in heaven. And when You hear, You will be merciful.'

verses.latin: Si peccaverit homo in proximum suum, et propterea juramento illigatus fuerit, et venerit qui juret coram altari tuo in domo hac:
verses.english: 'If a man sins against his neighbor, and an oath is laid upon him because of it, and he comes to swear before Your altar in this house:'

verses.latin: Tu in cælo exaudies, et facies, et judicabis servos tuos, condemnans impium, et reddens viam ejus super caput ejus, justificansque justum, et retribuens ei secundum justitiam suam.
verses.english: 'Then You, in heaven, will hear and act and judge Your servants. You will condemn the wicked and bring his way upon his own head, and You will justify the righteous, rendering to him according to his righteousness.'

verses.latin: Si fugerit populus tuus Israel inimicos suos (quia peccabunt tibi), et conversi egerint pænitentiam, et deprecati te fuerint in domo hac, et confessi nomini tuo:
verses.english: 'If Your people Israel are defeated by their enemies (because they have sinned against You), and they turn back, perform penance, supplicate You in this house, and confess Your name, acknowledging Your power and authority:'

verses.latin: Tu exaudies in cælo, et propitius eris peccatis populi tui Israel, et reduces eos in terram, quam dedisti patribus eorum.
verses.english: 'Then You will hear in heaven, and will be merciful to the sins of Your people Israel, and You will bring them back to the land which You gave to their fathers.'

verses.latin: Si clauso cælo pluvia non fluxerit propter peccata eorum, et orantes in loco isto, pænitentiam egerint nomini tuo, et a peccatis suis conversi fuerint propter afflictiones suas:
verses.english: 'If the sky is shut up and there is no rain because of their sins, and they pray in this place, and perform penance to Your name, and they turn from their sins because of their afflictions:'

verses.latin: Audi tu in cælo, et propitius esto peccatis servorum tuorum, et populi tui Israel: et doce eos viam bonam, per quam ambulare debeant: et da pluviam super terram tuam, quam dedisti populo tuo in possessionem.
verses.english: 'Then hear You in heaven, and be merciful to the sins of Your servants and of Your people Israel. And teach them the good way in which they should walk. And give rain upon Your land, which You have given to Your people as an inheritance.'

verses.latin: Fames si orta fuerit in terra, aut pestis, aut rubigo, aut tussis, aut locusta, vel bruchus, et si obsederit eum inimicus ejus portas civitatis, omnis plaga, omne vulnus:
verses.english: 'If there is famine in the land, or pestilence, or mildew, or blight, or locusts, or caterpillars, and if their enemy besieges them in the gates of their cities, whatever plague, whatever wound they suffer:'

verses.latin: Omnis deprecatio, omnis obsecratio fuerit hominis et universi populi tui Israel, uniuscujusque cognoscentis plagam cordis sui, et expandentis manus suas in domo hac:
verses.english: 'Whatever prayer, whatever supplication is made by any man, or by all Your people Israel, each one knowing the affliction of his own heart, and spreading out his hands toward this house:'

verses.latin: Tu exaudies in cælo, in loco habitationis tuæ, et propitius eris, et facies, et reddes unicuique secundum omnes vias suas, sicut videris cor ejus: quia tu nosti solus cor omnium filiorum hominum:
verses.english: 'Then You will hear in heaven, in the place of Your dwelling, and will be merciful, and will act. And You will render to each one according to all his ways, as You see his heart. For You alone know the heart of all the sons of men.'

verses.latin: Ut timeant te cunctis diebus, quibus vivunt super faciem terræ, quam dedisti patribus nostris.
verses.english: 'So that they may fear You all the days that they live upon the surface of the earth, which You gave to our fathers.'

verses.latin: Tunc congregavit rex Salomon omnes majores natu Israel, et cunctos principes tribuum, et capita familiarum filiorum Israel, ad regem Salomonem in Jerusalem, ut afferrent arcam foederis Domini de civitate David, quae est Sion.
verses.english: Then King Solomon gathered together all the elders of Israel, and all the chiefs of the tribes, and all the heads of the households of the sons of Israel, to King Solomon in Jerusalem, so that they might bring the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord from the City of David, which is Zion, the fortress part of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Convenitque ad regem Salomonem universus Israel in mense Ethanim, feria septima: ipse est mensis septimus.
verses.english: And all of Israel gathered to King Solomon in the month of Ethanim, on the seventh festival period. This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar.

verses.latin: Veneruntque omnes seniores Israel, et portaverunt sacerdotes arcam.
verses.english: And all the elders of Israel came, and the priests carried the Ark.

verses.latin: Et duxerunt sacerdotes, et Levitae arcam Domini, et tabernaculum foederis, et omnia vasa sanctuarii, quae erant in tabernaculo.
verses.english: And the priests and the Levites brought the Ark of the Lord, and the tent of the Covenant, and all the sacred vessels that were in the tent.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon, et omnis multitudo Israel, quae congregrata fuerat ad eum, in conspectu arcae immolabant oves et boves absque ullo numero.
verses.english: King Solomon and all the multitude of Israel who had gathered to him, in the presence of the Ark, sacrificed so many sheep and oxen that they could not be counted.

verses.latin: Et intulerunt sacerdotes arcam foederis Domini in locum suum, in oraculum domus, in Sancta sanctorum, subter alas cherubim.
verses.english: And the priests brought the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord to its place, into the inner sanctuary of the house, into the Holy of Holies, beneath the wings of the cherubim.

verses.latin: Siquidem cherubim expandebant alas super loca arcae, et protegebant arcam, et vectes ejus desuper.
verses.english: For the cherubim spread out their wings over the place of the Ark, and protected the Ark and its carrying poles from above.

verses.latin: Mansitque ibi arca usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: And the Ark remained there until this present day.

verses.latin: Non erat aliud in arca nisi duae tabulae lapideae, quas posuerat Moyses in Horeb, quando legem dedit Dominus filiis Israel, cum egrederentur de terra Aegypti.
verses.english: There was nothing else in the Ark except the two stone tablets which Moses had placed there in Horeb, when the Lord gave the law to the sons of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum exissent sacerdotes de sanctuario, nubes implevit domum Domini.
verses.english: And it came to pass that when the priests came out of the sanctuary, a cloud filled the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et non poterant sacerdotes stare et ministrare propter nubem: gloriæ enim Domini repleverat domum Domini.
verses.english: And the priests were not able to stand and minister because of the cloud, for the glory of the Lord had filled the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Tunc ait Salomon: Dominus dixit ut habitaret in caligine.
verses.english: Then Solomon said: 'The Lord said that He would dwell in deep darkness, which He manifests in a cloud.'

verses.latin: Aedificans aedificavi domum in habitaculum tuum: firmissimum solium tuum in sempiternum.
verses.english: Building, I have built a house as a dwelling place for You, and Your firm throne for all eternity.

verses.latin: Convertitque rex faciem suam, et benedixit omni ecclesiæ Israel: omnis enim ecclesia Israel stabat.
verses.english: And the king turned his face and blessed all the assembly of Israel, for all the assembly of Israel was standing.

verses.latin: Et ait: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israel, qui locutus est ore suo ad David patrem meum, et in manibus ejus perfecit dicens:
verses.english: And he said: 'Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who spoke with His own mouth to David my father, and with His own hands, He has fulfilled what He promised, saying: '

verses.latin: Ex die qua eduxi populum meum Israel de Aegypto, non elegi civitatem de universis tribubus Israel, ut ædificaretur domus nomini meo ibi: sed elegi David ut esset super populum meum Israel.
verses.english: 'From the day when I led My people Israel out of Egypt, I did not choose a city out of all the tribes of Israel, so that a house might be built there for My Name; but I chose David to be over My people Israel.'

verses.latin: Voluitque David pater meus ædificare domum nomini Domini Dei Israel:
verses.english: 'And David my father desired to build a house for the Name of the Lord God of Israel;'

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus ad David patrem meum: Quod voluisti ædificare domum nomini meo, bene fecisti hoc ipsum:
verses.english: 'But the Lord said to David my father: "Because you desired to build a house for My Name, you have done well in this very thing;"'

verses.latin: Verumtamen tu non ædificabis domum, sed filius tuus, qui egredietur de femore tuo, ipse ædificabit domum nomini meo.
verses.english: 'Nevertheless, you will not build the house, but your son, who will come forth from your body, he himself will build the house for My Name."'

verses.latin: Dominus perfecit sermonem suum quem locutus est: surrexi enim pro David patre meo, et sedi super thronum Israel, sicut locutus est Dominus: et ædificavi domum nomini Domini Dei Israel.
verses.english: The Lord has fulfilled His word which He spoke, for I have risen in place of David my father, and I sit upon the throne of Israel, just as the Lord spoke. And I have built the house for the Name of the Lord God of Israel.

verses.latin: Et constitui ibi locum arcæ, in qua est pactum Domini, quod pepigit cum patribus nostris, quando egressi sunt de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: And I have prepared a place there for the Ark, in which is the covenant of the Lord which He made with our fathers, when they came out of the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Stetit ergo Salomon coram altari Domini in conspectu universæ ecclesiæ Israel, et expandit manus suas in cælum:
verses.english: Therefore, Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and he spread out his hands towards the sky.

verses.latin: Et ait: Domine Deus Israel, non est similis tui Deus in cælo sursum, et in terra deorsum: qui custodis pactum et misericordiam cum servis tuis, qui ambulant coram te in toto corde suo.
verses.english: And he said: 'Lord God of Israel, there is no God like You, neither in the sky above, nor on the earth below. You keep covenant and show mercy to Your servants who walk before You with their whole heart.'

verses.latin: Qui præstitisti servo tuo David patri meo quæ locutus es ei: et locutus es ore tuo, et in manibus tuis perfecisti ut hæc est dies.
verses.english: 'You who have kept for Your servant David my father what You spoke to him; You spoke with Your mouth, and with Your own hands You have fulfilled it, just as it is this very day.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo Domine Deus Israel, conserva servo tuo David patri meo quæ locutus es ei, dicens: Non auferetur tibi vir de solio Israel: ita tamen si custodierint filii tui viam suam, et ambulaverint coram me sicut et tu ambulasti.
verses.english: 'Now therefore, Lord God of Israel, keep for Your servant David my father what You spoke to him, saying: "There shall not fail you a man from the throne of Israel." Only if your sons will guard their way and walk before Me as you yourself have walked.'

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine Deus Israel, firmetur sermo tuus quem locutus es servo tuo David patri meo.
verses.english: 'And now, Lord God of Israel, let Your word be confirmed, which You spoke to Your servant David my father.'

verses.latin: Profecto si habitare Deus super terram potest: cælum et cæli cælorum te capere non possunt: quanto magis domus hæc, quam ædificavi?
verses.english: 'But truly, if God can dwell on the earth— the sky and the highest heavens cannot contain You, much less this house which I have built!'

verses.latin: Sed respice ad orationem servi tui, et ad preces ejus, Domine Deus meus: audi clamorem et orationem, qua orat servus tuus coram te hodie:
verses.english: 'Yet, look upon the prayer of Your servant and upon his supplications, O Lord my God! Hear the cry and the prayer with which Your servant prays before You today;'

verses.latin: Ut sint oculi tui aperti super domum hanc nocte et die: super domum, de qua dixisti: Nomen meum erit ibi: ut exaudias deprecationem quam orat ad te servus tuus in loco isto.
verses.english: 'So that Your eyes may be open toward this house, night and day— toward the house of which You said: "My Name shall be there"— so that You may hear the supplication which Your servant prays to You in this place.'

verses.latin: Ut exaudias deprecationem servi tui, et populi tui Israel, quæcumque oraverint in loco isto: et exaudies in loco habitaculi tui in cælo: et cum exaudieris, propitius eris.
verses.english: 'So that You may hear the supplication of Your servant and of Your people Israel, whatever they pray in this place. And You will hear in the place of Your dwelling in the universe— the uncreated realm beyond the created sky— and when You have heard, You will be merciful.'

verses.latin: Si peccaverit homo in proximum suum, et sustinuerit juramentum ut juret, et venerit unus coram altari tuo in domo hac, et confiteatur tibi:
verses.english: 'If a man has sinned against his neighbor, and he has taken an oath to swear, and one comes before Your altar in this house and confesses to You;'

verses.latin: Tu exaudies in cælo: et facies, et judicabis servos tuos, condemnans impium, et reddens viam suam super caput ejus, et justificans justum, et retribuens ei secundum justitiam suam.
verses.english: 'You will hear in the universe beyond created things, and You will act and judge Your servants, condemning the wicked, and returning his way upon his own head, and justifying the righteous, and repaying him according to his righteousness.'

verses.latin: Si fugerit populus tuus Israel inimicos suos (quia peccabunt tibi), et conversi egerint pœnitentiam, et deprecati te fuerint in domo hac, et confitentes nomini tuo:
verses.english: 'If Your people Israel flee before their enemies (because they will have sinned against You), and they turn and do penance, and they pray to You in this house, confessing Your Name;'

verses.latin: Exaudies in cælo, et propitius eris peccatis populi tui Israel, et reduces eos in terram quam dedisti patribus eorum.
verses.english: 'You will hear in the uncreated universe, and You will be merciful to the sins of Your people Israel, and You will bring them back to the land which You gave to their fathers.'

verses.latin: Si clausum fuerit cælum, et non pluerit propter peccata eorum, et orantes in loco isto pœnitentiam egerint nomini tuo, et a peccatis suis conversi fuerint propter afflictionem suam:
verses.english: 'If the sky is shut up and there is no rain because of their sins, and they pray in this place and do penance to Your Name, and they turn from their sins because of their affliction;'

verses.latin: Tu exaudies in cælo, et propitius eris peccatis servorum tuorum, et populi tui Israel: et ostendes eis viam bonam, per quam ambulent, et dabis pluviam super terram tuam, quam dedisti populo tuo ad possidendum.
verses.english: 'You will hear in the uncreated universe, and You will be merciful to the sins of Your servants and of Your people Israel, and You will show them the good way in which they should walk, and You will give rain upon Your land, which You gave to Your people as a possession.'

verses.latin: Si facta fuerit fames in terra, aut pestis, aut ærugo, aut aurugo, aut locusta, vel rubigo, et si obsederit eum inimicus ejus portas civitatis, omnis plaga, universa infirmitas:
verses.english: 'If there is famine in the land, or plague, or blight, or mildew, or locusts, or rust, and if an enemy besieges them in their cities' gates— any plague, any sickness;'

verses.latin: Omnis deprecator, et omnis oratio, quæ facta fuerit a quocumque homine, vel a toto populo tuo Israel, agnoscens unusquisque plagam cordis sui, et expanderit manus suas in domo hac:
verses.english: 'Whatever supplication, whatever prayer is made by any man, or by all of Your people Israel, when each one acknowledges the wound of his own heart, and spreads out his hands in this house;'

verses.latin: Tu exaudies in cælo, in firmissimo solio tuo, et propitius eris, et facies: et reddes unicuique secundum omnes vias suas, sicut videris cor ejus tu solus, qui novisti corda omnium filiorum hominum:
verses.english: 'You will hear in the uncreated universe, from Your firm throne, and You will be merciful and You will act. And You will repay each one according to all his ways, just as You alone see his heart, You who know the hearts of all the sons of men;'

verses.latin: Ut timeant te cunctis diebus, quibus vivunt super faciem terræ, quam dedisti patribus nostris.
verses.english: 'So that they may fear You all the days that they live upon the face of the earth which You gave to our fathers.'

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum consummasset Salomon ædificans domum Domini, et domum regiam, et omne quod optaverat et voluerat facere,
verses.english: It came to pass after Solomon had finished building the Lord's Temple and his own royal palace. He had completed everything he desired and had wanted to do.

verses.latin: apparuit Dominus Salomoni secundo, sicut apparuerat ei in Gabaon.
verses.english: The Lord appeared to Solomon a second time, just as He had appeared to him in Gibeon before.

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Dominus: Exaudivi orationem tuam et deprecationem tuam, quam deprecatus es coram me: sanctificavi domum hanc quam ædificasti, ut ponerem nomen meum ibi in sempiternum: et erunt oculi mei et cor meum ibi cunctis diebus.
verses.english: And the Lord said to him: "I have heard your prayer and your petition, which you presented before Me. I have consecrated this Temple that you have built so that I may establish My presence there for all time. My divine attention and My love will be there always.
