verses.latin: Tu quoque si ambulaveris coram me sicut ambulavit David pater tuus, in simplicitate cordis et in æquitate, et feceris omnia quæ præcepi tibi, et legitima mea et judicia mea custodieris:
verses.english: As for you, if you will walk before Me with sincerity of heart and in uprightness, just as your father David walked, and if you will do everything that I have commanded you, and keep My statutes and My judgments,

verses.latin: ponam thronum regni tui super Israël in sempiternum, sicut locutus sum David patri tuo, dicens: Non auferetur vir de stirpe tua de solio Israël.
verses.english: then I will establish the throne of your kingdom over Israel forever, just as I promised your father David when I said: 'A man from your lineage shall not be cut off from the throne of Israel.'

verses.latin: Si autem aversione aversi fueritis vos et filii vestri a me, non custodientes mandata mea et cæremonias meas quas proposui vobis, sed abieritis et colueritis deos alienos, et adoraveritis eos:
verses.english: But if you and your sons turn away from Me, not keeping My commandments and My ceremonies which I have set before you, but instead go and serve foreign gods and worship them,

verses.latin: projiciam Israël de facie terræ quam dedi eis, et templum hoc quod sanctificavi nomini meo, ejiciam de conspectu meo: eritque Israël in proverbium, et in fabulam omnibus populis.
verses.english: then I will cast Israel from the face of the land which I have given them. And this Temple, which I have consecrated for My name, I will cast out of My sight. Then Israel will become a proverb and a byword among all peoples.

verses.latin: Et domus hæc erit in exemplum: omnis qui transierit per eam, obstupescet, et sibilabit, et dicet: Quare fecit Dominus sic terræ huic, et domui huic?
verses.english: And this house will become an example of desolation. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished and will hiss in dismay, saying: 'Why has the Lord done such things to this land and to this Temple?'

verses.latin: Et respondebunt: Quia dereliquerunt Dominum Deum suum, qui eduxit patres eorum de terra Ægypti, et secuti sunt deos alienos, et adoraverunt eos, et coluerunt: idcirco induxit Dominus super eos omne malum hoc.
verses.english: And they will respond: 'Because they abandoned the Lord their God, who led their fathers out of the land of Egypt. And they followed foreign gods, and worshipped them, and served them. Therefore, the Lord has brought all this evil upon them.'

verses.latin: Erat autem post viginti annos, ex quo ædificaverat Salomon duas domos, id est, domum Domini, et domum regiam.
verses.english: Now it came to pass after twenty years, during which Solomon had built the two houses: that is, the Lord's Temple and the royal palace.

verses.latin: Chiram ergo rex Tyri præbuerat Salomoni ligna cedrina et abiegna, et aurum pro omni voluntate sua:
verses.english: So King Hiram of Tyre had supplied Solomon with cedar wood, fir wood, and gold, according to all his desire.

verses.latin: tunc dedit Salomon Chiram viginti urbes in terra Galilææ.
verses.english: In return, Solomon then gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.

verses.latin: Chiramque egressus de Tyro, ut videret civitates quas dederat ei Salomon, displicuerunt ei:
verses.english: When Hiram went out from Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him, they did not please him at all.

verses.latin: et ait: Quæ sunt civitates istæ, quas dedisti mihi frater? Et appellavit eas terram Cabul usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: And he said: "What kind of cities are these which you have given me, my brother?" And he called them the land of Cabul—meaning 'worthless land'—a name it kept until this very day.

verses.latin: Hæc est summa tributi, quod imposuit rex Salomon ad ædificandam domum Domini, et domum suam, et Mello, et murum Jerusalem, et Heser, et Mageddo, et Gazer.
verses.english: This is the summary of the tribute which King Solomon imposed for building the Lord's Temple, and his own royal palace, and Millo, and the wall of Jerusalem, and Hazor, and Megiddo, and Gezer.

verses.latin: Pharao rex Ægypti ascendit, et cepit Gazer, et succendit eam igni, et Chananæum, qui habitabat in civitate, interfecit: deditque eam in dotem filiæ suæ uxori Salomonis.
verses.english: Pharaoh, king of Egypt, had gone up and taken Gezer, and burned it with fire. He killed the Canaanites who lived in the city. Then he gave it as a dowry to his daughter, who became Solomon's wife.

verses.latin: Ædificavit ergo Salomon Gazer, et Bethoron inferiorem,
verses.english: So Solomon rebuilt Gezer and Lower Beth Horon.

verses.latin: et Baalath, et Palmyra in terra solitudinis.
verses.english: He also rebuilt Baalath and Tamar, which was in the desert wilderness.

verses.latin: Et universas urbes frumentarias, quæ fuerant Salomonis, et urbes curruum, et urbes equitum, et omne quod ei placuit ut ædificaret in Jerusalem, et in Libano, et in omni terra potestatis suæ.
verses.english: And he built all the store-cities that belonged to Solomon, along with the cities for his chariots and the cities for his horsemen. He also built everything else that pleased him to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land under his dominion.

verses.latin: Omnem populum qui relictus fuerat de Amorrhæo, et Hethæo, et Pherezæo, et Hevæo, et Jebusæo, qui non erant de filiis Israël:
verses.english: All the people who were left of the Amorites, and Hittites, and Perizzites, and Hivites, and Jebusites—these were the peoples who were not of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: horum filios, qui relicti fuerant in terra, quos scilicet non potuerant filii Israël exterminare, fecit Salomon tributarios usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: Their children, who were left in the land and whom the children of Israel had not been able to utterly destroy, Solomon forced their descendants to be his bondservants and laborers, a practice that continued until this day.

verses.latin: De filiis autem Israël non constituit Salomon servientes, sed erant viri bellatores, et ministri ejus, et principes, et duces, et præfecti curruum et equitum.
verses.english: However, Solomon did not make any of the children of Israel to be bondservants. Instead, they served as warriors, his personal attendants, his princes, his captains, and the commanders of his chariots and horsemen.

verses.latin: Hi erant principes præfectorum super opera Salomonis, quingenti quinquaginta, qui præerant populo, et his qui faciebant opera.
verses.english: These were the chief officers over Solomon's work: five hundred and fifty men who presided over the people and those who performed the labor.

verses.latin: Filia vero Pharaonis ascendit de civitate David in domum suam quam ædificaverat ei: tunc ædificavit Mello.
verses.english: But Pharaoh's daughter went up from the City of David to her house which Solomon had built for her. It was then that he built Millo.

verses.latin: Offerebat quoque Salomon tribus vicibus per annos singulos holocausta et pacifica super altare quod ædificaverat Domino, et adolebat incensum super aliud altare quod erexerat Domino: consummavitque templum.
verses.english: Solomon also offered burnt offerings and peace offerings three times each year upon the altar which he had built for the Lord. And he also burned incense upon the incense altar which he had dedicated to the Lord. Thus, the construction of the Temple was completed.

verses.latin: Classem quoque fecit rex Salomon in Asiongaber, quæ est juxta Ailath in littore maris Rubri in terra Idumæa.
verses.english: King Solomon also built a fleet of ships in Ezion-geber, which is near Elath, on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.

verses.latin: Misitque Chiram rex Tyri in classe naves suas, et servos suos naucleros, et nautas, qui noverant mare cum servis Salomonis.
verses.english: And King Hiram of Tyre sent his ships with the fleet, and his servants who were experienced sailors and mariners who knew the sea, along with Solomon's servants.

verses.latin: Qui cum venissent in Ophir, sumptum inde aurum, quadringentorum viginti talentorum, detulerunt ad regem Salomonem.
verses.english: When they had come to Ophir, they obtained from there four hundred and twenty talents of gold, and brought it back to King Solomon.

verses.latin: Regina autem Saba, audito nomine Salomonis in virtute Domini, venit tentare eum in ænigmatibus.
verses.english: Now the Queen of Sheba, having heard of the fame of Solomon and his relationship with the Lord, came to test him with difficult riddles.

verses.latin: Et ingressa Jerusalem multo comitatu et camelis portantibus aromata, et aurum infinitum, et gemmas pretiosas, venit ad Salomonem, et locuta est ei universa quæ habebat in corde suo.
verses.english: And she entered Jerusalem with a great company and with camels bearing spices, and a very large amount of gold, and precious stones. She came to Solomon and spoke to him all that was in her heart.

verses.latin: Et docuit eam Salomon omnia verba quæ proposuerat: non fuit sermo absconditus regi, quem non responderet ei.
verses.english: And Solomon answered all the questions she proposed. There was no word hidden from the king that he could not answer for her.

verses.latin: Videns autem regina Saba omnem sapientiam Salomonis, et domum quam ædificaverat,
verses.english: But when the Queen of Sheba saw all the wisdom of Solomon, and the house which he had built,

verses.latin: et cibos mensæ ejus, et habitacula servorum, et ordines ministrorum, et vestimenta eorum, et pincernas, et holocausta quæ offerebat in domo Domini, non habebat ultra spiritum.
verses.english: and the food on his table, and the dwellings of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers and their apparel, and his cupbearers, and the burnt offerings which he offered in the house of the Lord, she was utterly overwhelmed and breathless.

verses.latin: Et ait ad regem: Verus est sermo, quem audivi in terra mea super sermonibus tuis et super sapientia tua.
verses.english: And she said to the king: "The report which I heard in my own land about your deeds and about your wisdom is true.

verses.latin: Et non credebam narrantibus mihi, donec ipsa veni, et vidi oculis meis, et probavi quod media pars mihi nuntiata non fuerat: major est sapientia et opera tua quam sermo quem audivi.
verses.english: And I did not believe those who told me until I myself came and saw with my own eyes. Now I have proved that not even half had been told to me. Your wisdom and your works are far greater than the report I heard."

verses.latin: Beati viri tui, et beati servi tui, qui stant coram te semper, et audiunt sapientiam tuam.
verses.english: "Blessed are your men, and blessed are these servants of yours, who stand before you always and hear your wisdom.

verses.latin: Sit Dominus Deus tuus benedictus, cui placuisti, et posuit te super solium Israël, quia dilexit Dominus Israël, et voluit ut esset rex, et faceres judicium et justitiam.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord your God, with whom you were pleased, and who set you upon the throne of Israel. This is because the Lord loved Israel and desired that there be a king, and that you should render judgment and justice."

verses.latin: Dedit ergo regi centum viginti talenta auri, et aromata multa nimis, et gemmas pretiosas: non sunt allata ultra aromata tam multa, quam dedit regina Saba regi Salomoni.
verses.english: So she gave the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold, and a very large amount of spices, and precious stones. Never again were so many spices brought as those which the Queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.

verses.latin: Sed et classes Hiram, quæ portabant aurum de Ophir, attulerunt de Ophir ligna thyina multa nimis, et gemmas pretiosas.
verses.english: Moreover, Hiram's fleet of ships, which brought gold from Ophir, also brought from Ophir an enormous amount of almug wood—also known as algum or thyine wood—along with many precious stones.

verses.latin: Fecitque rex de lignis thyinis fulcra domus Domini et domus regiæ, et citharas, et psalteria cantoribus: non sunt allata hujuscemodi ligna thyina usque in præsentem diem, neque visa sunt.
verses.english: And from the almug wood, the king made supports for the house of the Lord and for the royal house, and lyres and harps for the singers. No such almug wood has been brought or seen until this present day.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum perfecisset Salomon aedificium domus Domini, et aedificium regis, et omne quod optaverat et voluerat,
verses.english: Now it came to pass when Solomon had completed the construction of the Lord's Temple and the king's palace, and everything else he had desired and wished for,

verses.latin: apparuit ei Dominus secundo, sicut apparuerat ei in Gabaon.
verses.english: the Lord appeared to him a second time, just as He had appeared to him previously in Gabaon.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad eum: Exaudivi orationem tuam et deprecationem tuam, quam deprecatus es coram me: sanctificavi domum hanc, quam aedificasti, ut ponerem nomen meum ibi in sempiternum: et erunt oculi mei et cor meum ibi cunctis diebus.
verses.english: And the Lord said to him: "I have heard your prayer and your petition, which you prayed before Me. I have sanctified this Temple which you have built, so that My Name may be placed there forever. My eyes and My heart will be there for all time."

verses.latin: Tu quoque si ambulaveris coram me, sicut ambulavit pater tuus David in simplicitate cordis, et in æquitate: et feceris omnia quæ præcepi tibi, et legitima mea et judicia mea servaveris:
verses.english: "You, too, if you walk before Me, just as your father David walked with integrity of heart and in righteousness, and if you do everything I have commanded you, and keep My statutes and My ordinances,

verses.latin: ponam solium regni tui super Israël in sempiternum, sicut locutus sum David patri tuo, dicens: Non auferetur vir de stirpe tua de solio Israël.
verses.english: I will establish the throne of your kingdom over Israel forever, just as I promised your father David, saying: 'There shall not fail a man of your line to sit on the throne of Israel.'"

verses.latin: Si autem aversione aversi fueritis vos et filii vestri a me, non custodientes mandata mea, et cæremonias meas quas proposui vobis, sed abieritis et colueritis deos alienos, et adoraveritis eos:
verses.english: "But if you, or your children, turn away from Me, and do not keep My commandments and My ceremonies, which I have set before you, but instead go and serve foreign gods and worship them,

verses.latin: auferam Israël de superficie terræ quam dedi eis: et templum quod sanctificavi nomini meo, projiciam a facie mea: et erit Israël in proverbium, et in fabulam omnibus populis.
verses.english: then I will cut off Israel from the face of the earth which I have given to them. And this Temple, which I have sanctified for My Name, I will cast away from My presence. Israel will then become a proverb and a byword among all peoples.

verses.latin: Et domus hæc erit in exemplum: omnis qui transierit per eam, obstupescet, et sibilabit, et dicet: Quare fecit Dominus sic terræ huic, et domui huic?
verses.english: This Temple, even in its ruin, will serve as a warning. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished and will hiss in dismay, saying: 'Why has the Lord done this to this land and to this Temple?'

verses.latin: Et respondebunt: Quia dereliquerunt Dominum Deum suum, qui eduxit patres eorum de terra Ægypti, et secuti sunt deos alienos, et adoraverunt eos, et coluerunt eos: idcirco induxit Dominus super eos omne malum hoc.
verses.english: And they will answer: 'Because they abandoned the Lord their God, who led their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and they followed foreign gods, and worshipped them, and served them. Therefore, the Lord has brought all this evil upon them.'"

verses.latin: Expletis autem annis viginti, postquam ædificaverat Salomon duas domos, id est, domum Domini, et domum regis,
verses.english: Now, at the end of twenty years, after Solomon had built the two structures — that is, the Lord's Temple and the king's palace —

verses.latin: (Hiram igitur rex Tyri præbuerat Salomoni ligna cedrina et abiegna, et aurum juxta omne quod opus habuerat,) tunc dedit Salomon Hiram viginti civitates in terra Galilææ.
verses.english: (Hiram, king of Tyre, had supplied Solomon with cedar, pine wood, and gold, according to all that he needed.) Then Solomon gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.

verses.latin: Ingressusque Hiram de Tyro, ut videret civitates quas dederat ei Salomon, displicuerunt ei.
verses.english: But when Hiram came from Tyre to inspect the cities which Solomon had given him, they displeased him.

verses.latin: Et ait: Quæ sunt civitates istæ, quas dedisti mihi, frater? Et appellavit eas terram Cabul usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: So he said: "What kind of cities are these that you have given me, my brother?" And he called that land 'Cabul' — which means 'good for nothing' — even to this present day.

verses.latin: Miserat quoque Hiram Salomoni centum viginti talenta auri.
verses.english: Moreover, Hiram had sent Solomon one hundred and twenty talents of gold.

verses.latin: Hæc est summa expensæ quam obtulit rex Salomon ad ædificandum domum Domini, et domum suam, et Mello, et murum Jerusalem, et Heser, et Mageddo, et Gazer.
verses.english: This is an account of the levy King Solomon raised to build the Lord's Temple, his own palace, the Millo, the wall of Jerusalem, Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.

verses.latin: Pharao rex Ægypti ascendit et cepit Gazer, et succendit eam igni, et Chananæum, qui habitabat in civitate, interfecit: et dedit eam in dotem filiæ suæ uxori Salomonis.
verses.english: Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, had gone up and captured Gezer, and burned it with fire. He had killed the Canaanites who lived in the city, and then he gave it as a dowry to his daughter, Solomon's wife.

verses.latin: Ædificavit ergo Salomon Gazer, et Bethoron inferiorem,
verses.english: So Solomon rebuilt Gezer, and Lower Beth Horon,

verses.latin: et Baalath, et Palmyram in terra solitudinis.
verses.english: and Baalath, and Tamar (Palmyra) in the desert land.

verses.latin: Et omnes vicos qui erant per circuitum urbium harum, et civitates curruum, et civitates equitum, et omne quod placuit Salomoni ut ædificaret in Jerusalem, et in Libano, et in omni terra regni sui.
verses.english: He also built all the storage cities that were around these cities, as well as the chariot cities, and the cavalry cities. He built everything that Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and throughout all the land of his kingdom.

verses.latin: Omnem populum qui residuus fuerat de Amorrhæis, et Hethæis, et Pherezæis, et Hevæis, et Jebusæis, qui non erant de filiis Israël:
verses.english: All the people who remained of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites — who were not of the children of Israel —

verses.latin: filiorum eorum, qui post eos hæsissent in terra, quos scilicet non quiverant filii Israël exterminare, fecit Salomon tributarios usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: their descendants who remained in the land after them, whom the children of Israel could not completely destroy — these Solomon made subject to forced labor, a tribute, even to this present day.

verses.latin: De filiis autem Israël non constituit Salomon servientes: sed erant viri bellatores, et ministri ejus, et principes, et duces, et præfecti curruum, et equitum.
verses.english: But Solomon did not make any of the children of Israel his forced laborers. Instead, they were his warriors, his servants, his officials, his commanders, and the officers over his chariots and his cavalry.

verses.latin: Hi sunt principes præfectorum super opera Salomonis, quingenti quinquaginta, qui præerant populo, et his qui faciebant opera.
verses.english: These were the chief officers overseeing Solomon's work, five hundred and fifty in number, who ruled over the people and over those who performed the work.

verses.latin: Filia vero Pharaonis ascendit de civitate David in domum suam, quam ædificaverat ei: tunc ædificavit Mello.
verses.english: But Pharaoh's daughter went up from the City of David to her own palace, which Solomon had built for her. It was after this that Solomon built the Millo.

verses.latin: Offerebat quoque Salomon tribus vicibus per annos singulos holocautomata et pacificas hostias super altare quod ædificaverat Domino, et succendebat super illud thymiama coram Domino: perfectumque est templum.
verses.english: Also, three times each year, Solomon offered burnt offerings and peace offerings upon the altar that he had built for the Lord. He burned incense there before the Lord. And so, the Temple was completed with its regular sacrifices.

verses.latin: Classem quoque navium fecit rex Salomon in Asiongaber, quæ est juxta Ailath in littore maris Rubri, in terra Idumæa.
verses.english: King Solomon also built a fleet of ships in Ezion-geber, which is near Elath, on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.

verses.latin: Misitque Hiram nautas suos in classe, viros gnaros maris, cum servis Salomonis.
verses.english: And Hiram sent his own experienced sailors, men skilled in the sea, to be on the fleet with Solomon's servants.

verses.latin: Qui cum venissent in Ophir, sumptum inde aurum, quadringentorum viginti talentorum, detulerunt ad regem Salomonem.
verses.english: When they arrived in Ophir, they brought back gold from there, four hundred and twenty talents of gold, and presented it to King Solomon.

verses.latin: Tempore illo audivit regina Saba famam Salomonis in nomine Domini, et venit tentare eum in ænigmatibus.
verses.english: At that time, the Queen of Sheba heard of Solomon's fame, specifically regarding his wisdom from the Lord, and she came to test him with difficult questions and riddles.

verses.latin: Et ingressa Jerusalem multo comitatu, et divitiis, et camelis portantibus aromata, et aurum infinitum, et gemmas pretiosas, venit ad regem Salomonem, et locuta est cum eo omne quod habebat in corde suo.
verses.english: She arrived in Jerusalem with a very large entourage, with riches, and with camels carrying spices, an immense amount of gold, and precious gems. When she came to King Solomon, she spoke with him about everything that was on her mind and in her heart.

verses.latin: Et docuit eam Salomon omnia verba quæ proposuerat: non fuit sermo absconditus regi, quem non responderet ei.
verses.english: And Solomon answered all the questions she put to him. There was no matter hidden from the king that he could not explain to her.

verses.latin: Videns autem regina Saba omnem sapientiam Salomonis, et domum quam ædificaverat,
verses.english: When the Queen of Sheba saw all of Solomon's wisdom, and the palace that he had built,

verses.latin: et cibos mensæ ejus, et habitacula servorum, et ordines ministrantium, et vestimenta eorum, et pincernas, et holocautomata quæ offerebat in domo Domini: non habebat ultra spiritum.
verses.english: and the food on his table, and the residences of his servants, and the organization of his attendants, and their uniforms, and his cupbearers, and the burnt offerings which he offered in the Lord's Temple, she was completely overwhelmed; she was left breathless.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad regem: Verus est sermo, quem audivi in terra mea de sermonibus tuis, et de sapientia tua.
verses.english: And she said to the king: "The report that I heard in my own land concerning your words and your wisdom is truly accurate.

verses.latin: Et non credebam narrantibus mihi, donec ipsa veni, et vidi oculis meis, et probavi quod media pars mihi nuntiata non fuerat: major est sapientia tua et opera quam rumor, quem audivi.
verses.english: I did not believe those who told me, until I myself came and saw with my own eyes. And I have confirmed that even half of it had not been reported to me. Your wisdom and your achievements are greater than the rumor I heard.

verses.latin: Beati viri tui, et beati servi tui, qui stant coram te semper, et audiunt sapientiam tuam.
verses.english: Blessed are your men, and blessed are your servants, who always stand before you and hear your wisdom.

verses.latin: Sit Dominus Deus tuus benedictus, cui placuisti, et posuit te super thronum Israël, eo quod dilexerit Dominus Israël, et voluerit salvare in sempiternum: et idcirco posuit te regem super eos ut faceres judicium et justitiam.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord your God, in whom you found favor, who has placed you upon the throne of Israel. This is because the Lord loved Israel and desired to save them forever. And for that reason, He has made you king over them, so that you may execute justice and righteousness.

verses.latin: Dedit ergo regi ducenta viginti talenta auri, et aromata multa nimis, et gemmas pretiosas: non sunt allata ultra aromata tanta per omnem multitudinem quæ dedit regina Saba regi Salomoni.
verses.english: Then she gave the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold, and an extremely large quantity of spices, and precious gems. Never again was such a vast quantity of spices brought in as the Queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon dedit reginæ Saba omnia quæ voluit et petivit ab eo: exceptis his quæ ultro obtulerat ei.
verses.english: King Solomon, for his part, gave the Queen of Sheba everything she desired and asked of him, in addition to what he had already given her freely.

verses.latin: Reversa est igitur, et abiit in terram suam cum servis suis.
verses.english: Then she returned and went back to her own land, along with her servants.

verses.latin: Regina autem Saba audito nomine Salomonis in operibus Domini venit tentare eum in ænigmatibus.
verses.english: The Queen of Sheba, having heard of Solomon's great fame and the wisdom he displayed in all his works for the Lord, came to Jerusalem to test him with intricate riddles.

verses.latin: Et venit Jerusalem cum multo comitatu et camelis portantibus aromata et aurum inmensum nimis et gemmas pretiosas. Et cum venisset ad Salomonem, locuta est ad eum universa quæ habebat in corde suo.
verses.english: She arrived in Jerusalem with a large company of attendants and camels, laden with fragrant spices, a truly immense quantity of gold, and many precious jewels. When she met King Solomon, she spoke to him everything that was in her mind and heart.

verses.latin: Et exposuit ei Salomon universa verba quæ proposuerat: non fuit sermo absconditus regi, quem non solvere.t
verses.english: King Solomon then answered all the difficult questions she had proposed to him; there was no word or concept hidden from the King that he could not explain.

verses.latin: Vidit ergo regina Saba omnem sapientiam Salomonis, et domum quam ædificaverat,
verses.english: So the Queen of Sheba saw for herself all of Solomon's wisdom, and she beheld the splendid royal palace he had built,

verses.latin: et cibos mensæ ejus, et habitacula servorum, et ordines ministrorum ejus, et vestes eorum, et pincernas, et holocausta quæ offerebat in domo Domini : non habebat ultra spiritum.
verses.english: and the lavish food upon his table, and the well-ordered arrangement of his servants' dwellings, and the orderly service of his ministers, and their fine apparel, and his cupbearers, and the burnt offerings which he regularly presented in the house of the Lord. She was utterly overwhelmed and left breathless by it all.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad regem : Verus est sermo, quem audivi in terra mea de sermonibus tuis, et de sapientia tua.
verses.english: She then said to the King: “The report I heard in my own land concerning your great sayings and your profound wisdom is true.

verses.latin: Et non credebam narrantibus mihi, donec ipsa veni, et vidi oculis meis, et probavi quod media pars mihi nuntiata non fuerit. Major est sapientia et opera tua, quam rumor quem audivi.
verses.english: I did not believe those who told me, until I myself came here and saw it with my own eyes. I can now confirm that not even half was told to me. Your wisdom and your accomplishments are far greater than the grand report I heard.”

verses.latin: Beati viri tui, et beati servi tui hi, qui stant coram te semper, et audiunt sapientiam tuam.
verses.english: “Blessed are your own men, and truly blessed are these servants of yours, who constantly stand before you and hear your profound wisdom.

verses.latin: Sit Dominus Deus tuus benedictus, cui placuisti, et posuit te super thronum Israël, eo quod dilexerit Dominus Israël in sempiternum, et constituit te regem ut faceres judicium et justitiam.
verses.english: May the Lord your God be blessed, in whom you have found favor and who has placed you upon the throne of Israel. This is because the Lord has loved Israel eternally, and He has established you as king, so that you might execute true judgment and administer perfect justice.”

verses.latin: Dedit ergo regi centum viginti talenta auri, et aromata multa nimis, et gemmas pretiosas : non sunt allata ultra aromata tam multa, quam dedit regina Saba regi Salomoni.
verses.english: Then she presented the King with one hundred twenty talents of gold, an exceedingly great quantity of aromatic spices, and many precious gems. There were never again brought such an abundance of spices as the Queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.

verses.latin: Sed et classis Hiram, quæ portabat aurum de Ophir, attulit ex Ophir ligna thyina multa nimis, et gemmas pretiosas.
verses.english: Furthermore, Hiram's fleet of ships, which regularly brought gold from Ophir, also brought from Ophir an exceedingly large quantity of very rare almug wood, and many precious gems.

verses.latin: Fecitque rex de lignis thyinis fulcra domus Domini et domus regiæ, et citharas, et psalteria cantoribus : non sunt allata hujuscemodi ligna thyina, neque visa sunt usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: From this almug wood, the King fashioned supports for the Temple of the Lord and for the royal palace. He also had lyres and harps made for the singers. No such almug wood has ever been brought or seen in Israel until this present day.

verses.latin: Igitur rex Salomon dedit reginæ Saba omnia quæ voluit et petivit ab eo, exceptis his quæ ultro obtulerat ei munera regali. Quæ reversa est, et abiit in terram suam cum servis suis.
verses.english: Thus, King Solomon gave the Queen of Sheba everything she desired and requested from him, in addition to the royal gifts which he had generously offered her. After this, she returned and journeyed back to her own land with her servants.

verses.latin: Erat autem pondus auri, quod afferebatur Salomoni per annos singulos, sexcentorum sexaginta sex talentorum auri,
verses.english: Now the weight of the gold that was brought to King Solomon each year amounted to six hundred sixty-six talents of pure gold,

verses.latin: absque eo quod afferebatur ei a viris qui super vectigalia erant, et institoribus, et universis negotiatoribus, et omnibus regibus Arabiæ, universisque ducibus terræ.
verses.english: this was besides what was regularly brought to him by the tax-collectors, and by the traders, and by all the merchants, and from all the kings of Arabia, and from all the governors of the lands.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque rex Salomon ducenta scuta de auro puro : sexcentæ igitur auri statere percutiebantur in singulis scutis.
verses.english: King Solomon also made two hundred large shields of refined pure gold; six hundred shekels of gold were used for the plating of each individual shield.

verses.latin: Et trecentas clypeos ex auro probato : trecentæ minæ auri implebant singulos clypeos : posuitque rex eos in domo silvæ Libani.
verses.english: And he made three hundred smaller shields of beaten, refined gold; three minas of gold covered each individual shield. The King placed these shields in the House of the Forest of Lebanon, a royal armory.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque rex thronum de ebore grandem, et vestivit eum auro fulvo nimis.
verses.english: The King also constructed a great royal throne made of ivory, which he overlaid with an exceedingly brilliant, gleaming gold.

verses.latin: Sex gradus erant in solio, et caput solii rotundum in posteriori parte : et duæ manus hinc atque inde fulciebant sedentem : et duo leones stabant juxta manus.
verses.english: There were six steps leading up to the throne, and the back of the throne was rounded at the top. On either side, two arms supported the seat, and two carved lions stood beside these arms.

verses.latin: Et duodecim leunculi stantes super sex gradus utraque ex parte : non fuit tale opus in universis regnis.
verses.english: And twelve smaller carved lions stood upon the six steps, six on each side. No such masterful work had ever been made in all the kingdoms of the earth.

verses.latin: Omnia quoque vasa potatoria regis Salomonis erant aurea : et universa supellex domus saltus Libani de auro purissimo. Non erat argentum, nec aliquid pro nihilo putabatur in diebus Salomonis.
verses.english: Furthermore, all of King Solomon's drinking vessels were made of solid gold, and all the furnishings of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were of the purest gold. Silver was not considered valuable at all, nor was it esteemed as anything of worth in the days of Solomon.

verses.latin: Classis enim regis per mare una cum classe Hiram semel in tribus annis ibat in Tharsis, deferens inde aurum, et argentum, et dentes elephantorum, et simias, et pavos.
verses.english: For the King's fleet of ships, sailing the sea together with Hiram's fleet, went to Tarshish once every three years. From there, they brought back gold, and silver, and ivory tusks, and apes, and peacocks.

verses.latin: Magnificatus est ergo rex Salomon super omnes reges terræ divitiis et sapientia.
verses.english: Thus, King Solomon became greater than all the kings of the earth in both his immense wealth and his profound wisdom.

verses.latin: Et universa terra desiderabat vultum Salomonis, ut audiret sapientiam ejus, quam dederat Deus in corde ejus.
verses.english: And the entire world desired to behold Solomon, so that they might hear the extraordinary wisdom which God had placed in his heart.

verses.latin: Et singuli deferebant ei munera, vasa argentea et aurea, vestes, et arma, et aromata, equos et mulos, per singulos annos.
verses.english: And each person brought him gifts, vessels of silver and of gold, fine garments, and weapons, and aromatic spices, horses, and mules, year after year without fail.

verses.latin: Congregavitque Salomon currus et equites, et facti sunt ei mille quadringenti currus, et duodecim millia equitum : et statuit eos per civitates curruum, et cum rege in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Solomon also amassed chariots and cavalry; he acquired fourteen hundred chariots and twelve thousand horsemen. He stationed them in garrison cities designated for chariots and also kept some with the King in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque rex ut tanta esset abundantia argenti in Jerusalem, quasi lapidum : et cedrorum præbuit multitudinem quasi sycomoros quæ sunt in campestribus.
verses.english: The King caused silver to be as plentiful in Jerusalem as ordinary stones. And he made cedar wood as abundant as the sycamore trees that grow in the lowlands.

verses.latin: Et exeuntes equi Salomoni de Ægypto, et Coa, mercatores regis emebant de Coa, et statuto pretio ducebant.
verses.english: The horses for Solomon were brought out of Egypt and from Coa. The King's merchants bought them from Coa at a fixed price, and then transported them.

verses.latin: Quatuor rotarum currus, sexcentis argenteis æstimabatur, et equus centum quinquaginta : et hoc eodem pacto cunctis regibus Hethæorum et Syriæ vendebantur per manus eorum.
verses.english: A four-wheeled chariot was valued at six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse at one hundred fifty shekels. By this same arrangement, horses and chariots were sold to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Syria through Solomon's intermediaries.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon adamavit mulieres alienigenas multas, et filiam Pharaonis, et Moabitas, et Ammonitas, Idumæas, et Sidonias, et Hethæas,
verses.english: King Solomon, however, began to fall deeply in love with many foreign women—women who did not worship the true God. These included the daughter of Pharaoh, and women from Moab, Ammon, Edom, Sidon, and the Hittite lands.

verses.latin: de gentibus super quibus dixit Dominus filiis Israël: Non ingrediemini ad eas, neque de illis ingredientur ad vos: certissime enim aversuræ sunt corda vestra ut sequamini deos earum. His itaque copulatus est Salomon ardore amoris.
verses.english: These were women from the nations about whom the Lord had strictly commanded the children of Israel: 'You must not go among them, and they must not come among you, for they will most certainly turn your hearts away to follow their false gods.' Despite this divine warning, Solomon became joined to these women because of his intense love for them.

verses.latin: Fueruntque ei uxores septingentæ reginæ, et concubinæ trecentæ: et averterunt mulieres cor ejus.
verses.english: Solomon had seven hundred royal wives and three hundred concubines, for a total of one thousand women. These women then turned his heart away from his true devotion to God.

verses.latin: Cumque jam esset senex, depravatum est cor ejus per mulieres, ut sequeretur deos alienos: nec erat cor ejus perfectum cum Domino Deo suo, sicut cor David patris sui.
verses.english: Indeed, when he was already an old man, his heart was corrupted by these women, so that he began to follow their foreign gods. His devotion to the Lord his God was not complete, as was the devotion of David his father.

verses.latin: Sed colebat Salomon Astharthen deam Sidoniorum, et Moloch idolum Ammonitarum.
verses.english: Instead, Solomon worshipped Ashtart, the false goddess of the Sidonians, and Moloch, the detestable idol of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Fecitque Salomon quod malum erat coram Domino, et non adimplevit ut sequeretur Dominum, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: Solomon thus did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, and he did not fully commit to following the Lord, as David his father had done.

verses.latin: Tunc ædificavit Salomon templum Chamos idolo Moabitarum in monte qui est contra Jerusalem, et Moloch idolo filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: It was then that Solomon built a high place, a temple, for Chemosh, the detestable idol of the Moabites, on the hill that faces Jerusalem. He also built one for Moloch, the detestable idol of the children of Ammon.

verses.latin: Atque in hunc modum fecit cunctis uxoribus suis alienigenis, quæ adolebant thura, et immolabant diis suis.
verses.english: He built these places of idolatry for all his foreign wives, who burned incense and offered sacrifices to their false gods.

verses.latin: Igitur iratus est Dominus super Salomonem, quod aversa esset mens ejus a Domino Deo Israël, qui apparuerat ei bis,
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord's wrath was kindled against Solomon, because his devotion had turned away from the Lord, the God of Israel. This was the same God who had appeared to him twice before—

verses.latin: et præceperat de hoc verbo ne sequeretur deos alienos: et non custodivit quæ præceperat illi Dominus.
verses.english: —and had specifically commanded him regarding this very thing: not to follow foreign gods. But Solomon did not keep what the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque Dominus Salomoni: Quia habuisti hoc, et non custodisti pactum meum, et præcepta mea quæ mandavi tibi, disrumpens scindam regnum tuum, et dabo illud servo tuo.
verses.english: So the Lord said to Solomon: 'Because you have done this, and have not kept My covenant and My commandments which I entrusted to you, I will surely tear your kingdom apart and give it to one of your servants.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen in diebus tuis non faciam propter David patrem tuum: de manu filii tui scindam illud.
verses.english: 'However, I will not do this during your lifetime, out of respect for David your father. Instead, I will tear it out of the hand of your son.'

verses.latin: Nec totum quidem regnum auferam, sed tribum unam dabo filio tuo propter David servum meum, et Jerusalem civitatem quam elegi.
verses.english: 'Yet, I will not take away the entire kingdom. I will leave one tribe for your son, for the sake of David My servant, and for Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen.'

verses.latin: Suscitavit ergo Dominus adversarium Salomoni, Adad Idumæum de stirpe regia Edom.
verses.english: So the Lord raised up an adversary against Solomon: Hadad the Edomite, a descendant of the royal lineage of Edom.

verses.latin: Cum enim esset David in Idumæa, et ascendisset Joab princeps militiæ ad sepeliendos occisos, et percussisset omnem masculum in Idumæa
verses.english: This occurred when David was in Edom, and Joab, the commander of the army, had gone up to bury those slain in battle, and had struck down every male in Edom.

verses.latin: (sex enim mensibus moratus est Joab in Idumæa, donec interficeret omne masculinum in Edom):
verses.english: Joab had remained in Edom for six months until he had completely eliminated every male there.

verses.latin: fugit Adad ipse et viri Idumæi de servis patris ejus cum eo, ut ingrederetur Ægyptum: erat autem Adad puer parvulus.
verses.english: Hadad himself, along with some Edomite men who had been servants of his father, fled with him to enter Egypt. At that time, Hadad was still a very young boy.

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissent de Madian, venerunt in Pharan, tuleruntque secum viros de Pharan, et introierunt Ægyptum ad Pharaonem regem Ægypti: qui dedit ei domum, et cibos constituit, et terram assignavit.
verses.english: When they set out from Midian, they came to Paran, and took men from Paran with them. They then entered Egypt, going to Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. Pharaoh gave Hadad a house, provided him with food, and assigned him land.

verses.latin: Invenitque Adad gratiam coram Pharaone vehementer, in tantum ut daret ei uxorem sororem uxoris suæ Thecem reginæ.
verses.english: Hadad found such great favor in the eyes of Pharaoh, that Pharaoh even gave him his own sister-in-law, the sister of Queen Tahpenes, as a wife.

verses.latin: Genuitque ei soror Thecem Genubath filium: quem nutrivit Thecem in domo Pharaonis, et erat Genubath in domo Pharaonis cum filiis Pharaonis.
verses.english: The sister of Queen Tahpenes bore Hadad a son named Genubath. Tahpenes raised Genubath in Pharaoh's own palace, and Genubath grew up there among Pharaoh's own sons.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset Adad in Ægypto dormisse David cum patribus suis, et Joab principem militiæ mortuum, dixit Adad ad Pharaonem: Dimitte me, ut vadam in terram meam.
verses.english: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David had died and was resting with his ancestors, and that Joab, the commander of the army, was also dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh: 'Allow me to leave, so that I may return to my own land.'

verses.latin: Dixitque illi Pharao: Qua re indigetis apud me, ut quæras ire in terram tuam? At ille respondit: Nihil: sed tantum dimitte me.
verses.english: Pharaoh asked him, 'What do you lack here with me, that you seek to return to your own land?' Hadad replied, 'Nothing at all, but only let me go.'

verses.latin: Suscitavit quoque ei Deus adversarium Razon filium Eliada, qui fugerat Adarezer regem Soba dominum suum:
verses.english: God also raised up another adversary against Solomon: Rezon, the son of Eliada, who had fled from his master, Hadadezer, the king of Zobah.

verses.latin: et congregavit contra eum viros, et factus est princeps latronum, cum interficeret David illos qui de Soba erant: et abierunt Damascum, et habitaverunt ibi, et imperaverunt in Damasco.
verses.english: Rezon had gathered men around himself and became the leader of a raiding band. This occurred when David was defeating those from Zobah. Rezon and his men went to Damascus, settled there, and began to rule in Damascus.

verses.latin: Fuitque adversarius Israël cunctis diebus Salomonis: et hoc est malum Adad, et odium ejus contra Israël: et regnavit in Syria.
verses.english: Rezon became an adversary to Israel throughout all the days of Solomon's reign. This was in addition to the harm caused by Hadad, and Rezon's intense hatred against Israel. He reigned over Syria.

verses.latin: Hieroboam quoque filius Nabat Ephrathæus de Sareda, servus Salomonis, cujus mater erat nomine Sarva vidua, levavit manum contra regem.
verses.english: Jeroboam also, the son of Nebat, an Ephrathite from Zeredah, who was a servant of Solomon (and whose mother was a widow named Zeruah), raised his hand against the king.

verses.latin: Et hæc est causa rebellionis ejus, quia Salomon ædificavit Mello, et obstruxit civitatem David patris sui.
verses.english: This was the reason for his rebellion: Solomon had built the Millo fortress and had closed up the breach in the City of David, his father.

verses.latin: Erat autem Hieroboam vir fortis et potens: vidensque Salomon adolescentem industria præparatum, præposuit eum universis tributis domus Joseph.
verses.english: Jeroboam was a strong and capable man. When Solomon saw that the young man was diligently prepared for work, he put him in charge of all the forced labor from the house of Joseph.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo in tempore illo, ut Hieroboam exiret de Jerusalem: et invenit eum Ahias Silonites prophetam in via, opertus pallio novo: erant autem duo tantum in agro.
verses.english: It happened at that time that Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, and the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite met him on the way. Ahijah was wearing a new cloak. It happened that there were only the two of them in the field.

verses.latin: Apprehenditque Ahias pallium suum novum quo erat opertus, et scidit illud in duodecim scissuras.
verses.english: Ahijah then took hold of his new cloak that he was wearing and tore it into twelve pieces.

verses.latin: Et ait ad Hieroboam: Tolle tibi decem scissuras: hæc enim dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Ecce ego scindam regnum de manu Salomonis, et dabo tibi decem tribus.
verses.english: And he said to Jeroboam: 'Take ten pieces for yourself, for thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: 'Behold, I will tear the kingdom away from the hand of Solomon, and I will give you ten tribes.'

verses.latin: Una autem tribus erit ei propter servum meum David, et propter Jerusalem civitatem quam elegi ex omnibus tribubus Israël:
verses.english: 'However, one tribe will remain for Solomon's son, for the sake of David My servant, and for Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel.'

verses.latin: eo quod dereliquerit me, et adoraverit Astharthen deam Sidoniorum, et Chamos deum Moabitarum, et Moloch deum filiorum Ammon: et non ambulaverit in viis meis, ut faceret justitiam coram me, et præcepta mea, et judicia, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: 'I will do this because Solomon has forsaken Me and has worshipped Ashtart, the false goddess of the Sidonians; Chemosh, the false god of the Moabites; and Moloch, the false god of the children of Ammon. He has not walked in My ways, to do what is right in My sight, nor kept My commandments and My judgments, as David his father did.'

verses.latin: Non auferam universum regnum de manu ejus, sed ducem faciam eum cunctis diebus vitæ suæ, propter David servum meum quem elegi, qui custodivit mandata mea et præcepta mea:
verses.english: 'Nevertheless, I will not take the entire kingdom from his hand. Instead, I will let him remain ruler all the days of his life, for the sake of David My servant, whom I chose, and who kept My commandments and My precepts.'

verses.latin: sed auferam regnum de manu filii ejus, et dabo tibi decem tribus.
verses.english: 'But I will take the kingdom from the hand of his son, and I will give ten tribes to you.'

verses.latin: Filio autem ejus dabo tribum unam, ut remaneat lucerna David servo meo cunctis diebus coram me in Jerusalem civitate quam elegi, ut sit nomen meum ibi.
verses.english: 'To his son, however, I will give one tribe, so that a lamp for David My servant may remain before Me always in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen, so that My name may be there.'

verses.latin: Te ergo assumam, et regnabis super omnia quæ desiderat anima tua, erisque rex super Israël.
verses.english: 'Therefore I will take you, and you shall reign over all that your soul desires, and you shall be king over Israel.'

verses.latin: Si ergo audieris omnia quæ ego præcepero tibi, et ambulaveris in viis meis, et feceris quod rectum est coram me, custodiens mandata mea et præcepta mea, sicut fecit David servus meus: ero tecum, et ædificabo tibi domum fidelem, sicut ædificavi David, et dabo tibi Israël:
verses.english: 'If, therefore, you listen to all that I command you, and walk in My ways, and do what is right in My sight, keeping My commandments and My precepts, just as My servant David did, then I will be with you. I will build you a lasting dynasty, a faithful house, just as I built for David, and I will give Israel to you.'

verses.latin: et affligam semen David super hoc, verumtamen non cunctis diebus.
verses.english: 'And I will afflict the descendants of David because of this, but not for all time.'

verses.latin: Voluit ergo Salomon interficere Hieroboam, qui surrexit et fugit in Ægyptum ad Sesac regem Ægypti, et fuit in Ægypto usque ad mortem Salomonis.
verses.english: Therefore, Solomon sought to kill Jeroboam. But Jeroboam arose and fled to Egypt, to Shishak, the king of Egypt, and he remained in Egypt until Solomon's death.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon adamavit mulieres alienigenas multas, et filiam Pharaonis, et Moabitidas, et Ammonitidas, Idumæas, et Sidonias, et Hethæas,
verses.english: King Solomon passionately loved many foreign women. This included Pharaoh’s daughter, along with women from Moab, Ammon, Edom, Sidon, and the Hittite people.

verses.latin: de gentibus super quibus dixit Dominus filiis Israël: Non ingrediamini ad illas, neque de illis ingrediantur ad vos: certissime enim aversum facient cor vestrum, ut sequamini deos earum. His itaque copulatus est Salomon amore.
verses.english: These were women from nations about whom the Lord had strictly warned the children of Israel: 'You shall not marry them, nor shall they marry you. For they will most certainly turn your hearts away from Me, causing you to follow their false gods.' But King Solomon, in his deep affection, became joined to these women.

verses.latin: Fueruntque ei uxores septingentæ reginæ, et concubinæ trecentæ: et averserunt mulieres cor ejus.
verses.english: He had seven hundred wives who were princesses, and three hundred concubines. And these women turned his heart away from God.

verses.latin: Cumque jam senex esset, depravatum est cor ejus per mulieres, ut sequeretur deos alienos: nec erat cor ejus perfectum cum Domino Deo suo, sicut cor David patris ejus:
verses.english: When he became old, his heart was corrupted by these women, so that he followed other gods. His heart was not perfectly devoted to the Lord his God, unlike the heart of his father David.

verses.latin: sed colebat Salomon Astaroth deam Sidoniorum, et Moloch idolum Ammonitarum.
verses.english: Instead, Solomon began to worship Astaroth, the goddess of the Sidonians, and Moloch, the idol of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Fecitque Salomon quod malum erat coram Domino: et non implevit Dominus, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: Solomon did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not fully obey the Lord, as his father David had done.

verses.latin: Tunc ædificavit Salomon excelsum Chamos idolo Moab, in monte qui est contra Jerusalem: et Moloch idolo filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: Then Solomon built a high place for Chemosh, the idol of Moab, on the hill facing Jerusalem. He also built a high place for Moloch, the idol of the Ammonite people.

verses.latin: Atque in hunc modum fecit cunctis uxoribus suis alienigenis, quæ adolebant thura, et immolabant diis suis.
verses.english: In this manner, he did the same for all his foreign wives, who burned incense and offered sacrifices to their own gods.

verses.latin: Igitur iratus est Dominus Salomoni, quod aversa esset mens ejus a Domino Deo Israël, qui apparuerat ei bis:
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord was angry with Solomon, because his mind had turned away from the Lord, the God of Israel. This was especially grievous because the Lord had appeared to Solomon twice before.

verses.latin: et præceperat ei super hoc ne sequeretur deos alienos: et non custodivit quæ præceperat ei Dominus.
verses.english: And the Lord had specifically commanded him not to follow other gods. But Solomon did not keep the commands that the Lord had given him.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque Dominus Salomoni: Quia habuisti hoc, et non custodisti pactum meum, et præcepta mea quæ mandavi tibi, disrumpens scindam regnum tuum, et dabo illud servo tuo.
verses.english: So the Lord said to Solomon: 'Because you have done this, and have not kept My covenant and My commands which I entrusted to you, I will surely tear your kingdom apart and give it to your servant.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen in diebus tuis non faciam propter David patrem tuum: de manu filii tui scindam illud.
verses.english: 'However, for the sake of your father David, I will not do this during your lifetime. I will tear it out of the hand of your son.'

verses.latin: Sed nec universum regnum auferam: tribum unam dabo filio tuo propter David servum meum, et Jerusalem quam elegi.
verses.english: 'Nevertheless, I will not take away the entire kingdom. I will leave one tribe for your son, for the sake of My servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, which I have chosen.'

verses.latin: Suscitavit ergo Dominus adversarium Salomoni, Adad Edomitam de stirpe regia, qui erat in Edom.
verses.english: So the Lord raised up an adversary against Solomon: Hadad the Edomite, who was of the royal line in Edom.

verses.latin: Cum enim esset David in Edom, et ascendisset Joab princeps militiæ ad sepeliendos occisos, et percussisset omnem masculum in Edom,
verses.english: For when David was in Edom, and Joab, the commander of the army, had gone up to bury the slain, and had struck down every male in Edom—

verses.latin: sex mensibus commoratus est ibi Joab, et omnis Israël, donec interficeret omne masculinum de Edom.
verses.english: Joab and all Israel remained there for six months, until they had completely wiped out every male in Edom.

verses.latin: Fugit ergo Adad ipse, et viri Edomæi de servis patris ejus cum eo, ut ingrederentur Ægyptum: erat autem Adad puer parvulus.
verses.english: So Hadad himself fled, along with some Edomite men who were servants of his father, in order to enter Egypt. At that time, Hadad was just a small boy.

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissent de Madian, venerunt in Pharan, tuleruntque secum viros de Pharan, et introierunt Ægyptum ad Pharaonem regem Ægypti: qui dedit ei domum, et cibos constituit, et terram assignavit.
verses.english: When they set out from Midian, they came to Paran. They took men with them from Paran and then entered Egypt, presenting themselves to Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. Pharaoh gave Hadad a house, provided him with provisions, and even assigned him land.

verses.latin: Et invenit Adad gratiam coram Pharaone vehementer, in tantum ut daret ei uxorem sororem uxoris suæ Thecminæ reginæ.
verses.english: Hadad found such great favor with Pharaoh that Pharaoh gave him as wife the sister of his own queen, Queen Tahpenes.

verses.latin: Genuitque ei soror Thecminæ Genubath filium: quem nutrivit Thecmina in domo Pharaonis, et erat Genubath in domo Pharaonis cum filiis Pharaonis.
verses.english: The sister of Tahpenes bore him a son named Genubath. Tahpenes raised Genubath in Pharaoh’s house, and Genubath remained in Pharaoh’s household with Pharaoh’s own sons.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset Adad in Ægypto dormisse David cum patribus suis, et mortuum esse Joab principem militiæ, dixit Pharaoni: Dimitte me, ut vadam in terram meam.
verses.english: When Hadad heard in Egypt that King David had died and was resting with his ancestors, and that Joab, the commander of the army, was also dead, he said to Pharaoh: 'Allow me to leave, so I can return to my own land.'

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Pharao: Qua igitur re apud me indigetis, ut quæras ire ad terram tuam? At ille respondit: Nihil: sed obsecro te, ut dimittas me.
verses.english: Pharaoh asked him: 'What, then, do you lack with me, that you seek to return to your own land?' But Hadad replied: 'Nothing at all. I only beg you to let me go.'

verses.latin: Suscitavit quoque ei Deus adversarium Raazan filium Eliada, qui fugerat Adarezer regem Soba dominum suum:
verses.english: God also raised up another adversary for Solomon: Rezon, the son of Eliada, who had fled from his lord, Hadadezer, the king of Zobah.

verses.latin: et congregavit contra eum viros, et factus est princeps latronum, quando interfecit David Adarezer: et abierunt Damascum, et habitaverunt ibi, et imperaverunt in Damasco.
verses.english: Rezon gathered men around him and became the leader of a raiding band, at the time when David defeated Hadadezer. They then went to Damascus, settled there, and began to rule in Damascus.

verses.latin: Fuitque adversarius Israël cunctis diebus Salomonis: et hoc est malum Adad, et odio habuit Israël, et regnavit in Syria.
verses.english: Rezon was an adversary to Israel throughout all the days of Solomon's reign. This was in addition to the trouble caused by Hadad, and Rezon hated Israel, reigning in Syria.

verses.latin: Jeroboam quoque filius Nabat Ephrathæus de Sareda, servus Salomonis, cujus mater erat mulier vidua nomine Sarva, levavit manum contra regem.
verses.english: Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite from Zeredah, also lifted his hand in rebellion against the king. He was a servant of Solomon, and his mother was a widow named Zeruah.

verses.latin: Et hæc est causa rebellionis ejus, quia Salomon ædificavit Mello, et obstruxit civitatem David patris sui:
verses.english: And this was the reason for his rebellion: Solomon had built the Millo, and had closed up the breach in the city of his father David.

verses.latin: erat autem Jeroboam vir fortis et potens: vidensque Salomon adolescentem industria præditum, constituit eum super tributa universæ domus Joseph.
verses.english: Now Jeroboam was a strong and capable man. When Solomon saw that the young man was diligent and industrious, he appointed him over all the forced labor of the house of Joseph.

verses.latin: Factum est igitur in tempore illo, ut egressus Jeroboam de Jerusalem, inveniret eum Ahias Silonites propheta in via, opertus pallio novo: erant autem duo tantum in agro.
verses.english: It happened at that time, as Jeroboam was leaving Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite met him on the road. Ahijah was wearing a new cloak, and they were the only two people in the open field.

verses.latin: Apprehenditque Ahias pallium suum novum quo opertus erat, et scidit illud in duodecim partes:
verses.english: Ahijah then took his new cloak that he was wearing and tore it into twelve pieces.

verses.latin: et ait Jeroboam: Accipe tibi decem scissuras: hæc enim dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Ecce ego scindam regnum de manu Salomonis, et dabo tibi decem tribus.
verses.english: And Ahijah said to Jeroboam: 'Take ten pieces for yourself. For this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: "Behold, I am about to tear the kingdom away from the hand of Solomon, and I will give you ten tribes."

verses.latin: Porro una tribus erit ei propter servum meum David, et propter Jerusalem civitatem quam elegi ex omnibus tribubus Israël:
verses.english: 'But one tribe will remain for Solomon's son, for the sake of My servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen from all the tribes of Israel.'

verses.latin: eo quod dereliquerit me, et adoraverit Astaroth deam Sidoniorum, et Chamos deum Moab, et Moloch deum filiorum Ammon: et non ambulaverit in viis meis, ut faceret justitiam coram me, et præcepta mea, et judicia, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: 'This judgment comes because Solomon has abandoned Me. He has worshipped Astaroth, the goddess of the Sidonians; Chemosh, the god of Moab; and Moloch, the god of the Ammonite people. He has not walked in My ways, nor done what is right in My sight, nor kept My commands and My judgments, as his father David did.'

verses.latin: Non auferam universum regnum de manu ejus, sed ducem faciam eum cunctis diebus vitæ suæ, propter David servum meum quem elegi, qui custodivit mandata mea et præcepta mea:
verses.english: 'However, I will not take the entire kingdom from his hand during his lifetime. Instead, I will let him remain ruler for all the days of his life, for the sake of My servant David, whom I chose, and who kept My commands and My precepts.'

verses.latin: sed de manu filii ejus auferam regnum, et dabo tibi decem tribus:
verses.english: 'But I will take the kingdom from the hand of his son, and I will give ten tribes to you.'

verses.latin: et filio ejus dabo tribum unam, ut remaneat lucerna David servo meo cunctis diebus coram me in Jerusalem, civitate quam elegi ut esset nomen meum ibi.
verses.english: 'And to his son, I will give one tribe, so that My servant David may always have a lamp burning before Me—meaning a continuous royal line and presence—in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen for My name to be there forever.'

verses.latin: Tu ergo assumme te, et regnabis super omnia quæ desiderat anima tua: erisque rex super Israël.
verses.english: 'As for you, take power. You will reign over all that your heart desires, and you will be king over Israel.'

verses.latin: Si ergo audieris omnia quæ præcepero tibi, et ambulaveris in viis meis, et feceris quod rectum est coram me, custodiens mandata mea et præcepta mea, sicut fecit David servus meus, ero tecum, et ædificabo tibi domum fidelem, sicut ædificavi David: et dabo tibi Israël.
verses.english: 'If you listen to all that I command you, and walk in My ways, and do what is right in My sight, keeping My commands and My precepts, just as My servant David did, then I will be with you. I will build you a lasting dynasty, just as I built for David, and I will give Israel to you.'

verses.latin: Sed affligam semen David super hoc, verumtamen non cunctis diebus.
verses.english: 'And I will afflict the descendants of David because of this, though not forever.'

verses.latin: Voluit ergo Salomon interficere Jeroboam, qui surrexit, et fugit in Ægyptum ad Sesac regem Ægypti, et fuit in Ægypto usque ad mortem Salomonis.
verses.english: Therefore, Solomon sought to kill Jeroboam. But Jeroboam rose up and fled to Egypt, to King Shishak of Egypt, and remained in Egypt until Solomon's death.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon amavit mulieres alienigenas multas, et filiam Pharaonis, et Moabitidas, et Ammonitidas, Idumæas, et Sidonias, et Hethæas,
verses.english: Now, King Solomon loved many foreign women, even Pharaoh's daughter who he had previously married, along with women from Moab, Ammon, Edom, Sidon, and the Hittites.

verses.latin: de gentibus, super quas dixit Dominus filiis Israel: Non ingrediamini ad illas, neque de illis ingrediantur ad vos: certissime enim avertent cor vestrum, ut sequamini deos earum. His itaque copulatus est Salomon ardentissimo amore.
verses.english: These were from the nations about whom the Lord had strictly warned the children of Israel, saying: 'Do not mix with them, nor let them mix with you, for they will most certainly turn your heart away to follow their false gods.' Yet Solomon joined himself to these women with burning love.

verses.latin: Fueruntque ei uxores quasi septingentæ reginæ, et concubinæ trecentæ: et averterunt mulieres cor ejus.
verses.english: He had seven hundred royal wives and three hundred concubines. And these women did turn his heart away.

verses.latin: Cum jam esset senex, depravatum est cor ejus per mulieres, ut sequeretur deos alienos: nec erat cor ejus perfectum cum Domino Deo suo, sicut cor David patris sui.
verses.english: When he was old, his heart was corrupted by these women, so that he began to follow their foreign, false gods. His heart was not wholly devoted to the Lord his God, as was the heart of his father David.

verses.latin: Sed colebat Salomon Astarthen deam Sidoniorum, et Moloch idolum Ammonitarum.
verses.english: For Solomon began to worship Astarte, the false goddess of the Sidonians, and Molech, the vile idol of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Fecitque Salomon quod malum erat coram Domino, et non implevit ut sequeretur Dominum, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: Solomon did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not fully follow the Lord, as his father David had done.

verses.latin: Tunc ædificavit Salomon fanum Camos idolo Moabitarum, in monte qui est contra Jerusalem, et Moloch idolo filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: Then Solomon built a high place for Chemosh, the idol of the Moabites, on the hill that faces Jerusalem, and also for Molech, the idol of the children of Ammon.

verses.latin: Atque in hunc modum fecit cunctis uxoribus suis alienigenis, quæ adolebant thus, et immolabant diis suis.
verses.english: And in this same manner, he built cultic sites for all his foreign wives who burned incense and offered sacrifices to their own false gods.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus Salomoni, eo quod aversus esset animus ejus a Domino Deo Israel, qui apparuerat ei bis,
verses.english: The Lord became angry with Solomon, because his mind and heart had turned away from the Lord God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice before this time,

verses.latin: et præceperat ei super verbo hoc, ne sequeretur deos alienos: et non custodivit quod præceperat ei Dominus.
verses.english: and had commanded him concerning this very matter: that he should not follow foreign gods. But Solomon did not keep what the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque Dominus Salomoni: Quia obtinuit hoc apud te, et non custodisti pactum meum, et præcepta mea quæ mandavi tibi, disrumpens scindam regnum tuum, et dabo illud servo tuo.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord said to Solomon: 'Because this has happened within you, and you have not kept My covenant and My commandments which I gave to you, I will surely tear your kingdom apart and give it to one of your servants.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen in diebus tuis non faciam propter David patrem tuum: de manu filii tui scindam illud.
verses.english: 'Nevertheless, I will not do this during your days, for the sake of your father David. Instead, I will tear it out of the hand of your son.'

verses.latin: Sed nec universum regnum auferam, sed tribum unam dabo filio tuo propter David servum meum, et Jerusalem quam elegi.
verses.english: 'But I will not take away the entire kingdom. I will give one tribe to your son, for the sake of My servant David, and for the sake of Jerusalem, which I have chosen as My holy city.'

verses.latin: Suscitavit ergo Dominus adversarium Salomoni, Adad Idumæum de semine regio, qui erat in Edom.
verses.english: So the Lord raised up an adversary against Solomon—Hadad the Edomite, who was of the royal lineage in Edom.

verses.latin: Cum enim esset David in Idumæa, et ascendisset Joab princeps militiæ ad sepeliendum occisos, et percussisset omnem masculum in Idumæa
verses.english: For when David was in Edom, and Joab the commander of the army had gone up to bury the slain, he struck down every male in Edom,

verses.latin: (sex enim mensibus moratus est ibi Joab et omnis Israël donec interficeret omne masculinum in Idumæa),
verses.english: for Joab and all of Israel remained there for six months until they had cut off every male in Edom.

verses.latin: fugit Adad ipse et viri Idumæi de servis patris ejus cum eo, ut ingrederentur Ægyptum: erat autem Adad puer parvulus.
verses.english: But Hadad himself fled, along with some Edomite men who were servants of his father. They headed for Egypt, because Hadad was still a small boy at that time.

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissent de Madian, venerunt in Pharan, tuleruntque secum viros de Pharan, et introierunt Ægyptum ad Pharaonem regem Ægypti: qui dedit ei domum, et cibos constituit, et terram assignavit.
verses.english: When they had risen up from Midian, they came to Paran. They took men with them from Paran and then entered Egypt to Pharaoh, the King of Egypt. Pharaoh gave Hadad a house, provided him with food, and assigned him land.

verses.latin: Et invenit Adad gratiam coram Pharaone vehementer: in tantum ut daret ei uxorem sororem uxoris suæ, thepenes reginæ.
verses.english: And Hadad found such great favor with Pharaoh that Pharaoh gave him as wife the sister of his own wife, Queen Tahpenes.

verses.latin: Genuitque ei soror thepenes Genubath filium: quem nutrivit thepenes in domo Pharaonis: et erat Genubath in domo Pharaonis cum filiis Pharaonis.
verses.english: And Queen Tahpenes's sister bore him a son, Genubath. Tahpenes raised Genubath in Pharaoh's house, so Genubath was in Pharaoh's household with Pharaoh's own sons.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset Adad in Ægypto dormisse David cum patribus suis, et Joab principem militiæ mortuum esse: dixit Adad ad Pharaonem: Dimitte me, ut vadam in terram meam.
verses.english: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David had fallen asleep with his fathers—meaning he had died—and that Joab the commander of the army was also dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, 'Let me go, so that I may return to my own land.'

verses.latin: Dixitque illi Pharao: Qua re indiget apud me, ut quæras ire ad terram tuam? Qui respondit: Nihil: sed tantum dimitte me.
verses.english: Pharaoh said to him, 'What do you lack with me that you seek to go to your own land?' He replied, 'Nothing, but only let me go.'

verses.latin: Suscitavit quoque ei Deus adversarium, Razon filium Eliada, qui fugerat a domino suo Adarezer rege Soba.
verses.english: God also raised up another adversary against Solomon: Rezon, the son of Eliada, who had fled from his lord, Hadadezer, the king of Zobah.

verses.latin: Et congregavit contra eum viros, et factus est princeps latronum, quando interfecit David Adarezer: abieruntque Damascum, et habitabant ibi, et imperabant in Damasco.
verses.english: Rezon gathered men around him and became a leader of raiders when David defeated Hadadezer. They went to Damascus and lived there, and Rezon reigned in Damascus.

verses.latin: Fuitque adversarius Israël omnibus diebus Salomonis: et hoc est malum Adad, et odium ejus contra Israël, et regnavit in Syria.
verses.english: Rezon was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon. This was the harm caused by Hadad, and Rezon's hatred against Israel, and he reigned over Syria.

verses.latin: Hieroboam quoque filius Nabat Ephrathæus de Sareda, servus Salomonis, cujus mater erat mulier vidua nomine Sarva, levavit manum contra regem.
verses.english: Jeroboam also, the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite from Zeredah, was a servant of Solomon. His mother was a widow named Zeruah. And he lifted up his hand, meaning he rebelled, against the king.

verses.latin: Et hæc est causa rebellionis: Salomon ædificabat Mello, et junxit civitatem David patris sui.
verses.english: This was the cause of his rebellion: Solomon was building the Millo, and he had joined up the city of his father David—referring to the expansion of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Erat autem Hieroboam vir fortis et potens: vidensque Salomon adolescentem industria præparatum, constituit eum super tributa universæ domus Joseph.
verses.english: Now Jeroboam was a strong and mighty man. And Solomon, seeing that the young man was diligently prepared for work, appointed him over all the labor force of the house of Joseph—meaning the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo in tempore illo, ut Hieroboam exiret de Jerusalem, et reperiret eum Ahias Silonites propheta in via, opertus pallio novo: et erant duo tantum in agro.
verses.english: It happened then, at that time, that Jeroboam went out from Jerusalem, and Ahijah the prophet from Shiloh met him on the way. Ahijah was wearing a new cloak, and they were the only two men in the open field.

verses.latin: Apprehenditque Ahias pallium suum novum quo opertus erat, et scidit illud in duodecim partes.
verses.english: Ahijah took hold of his new cloak which he was wearing and tore it into twelve pieces.

verses.latin: Et ait ad Hieroboam: Accipe tibi decem scissuras: hæc enim dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Ecce scindam regnum de manu Salomonis, et dabo tibi decem tribus.
verses.english: And he said to Jeroboam: 'Take ten pieces for yourself, for thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: 'Behold, I will tear the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon and will give ten tribes to you.'

verses.latin: Porro una tribus remanebit ei propter servum meum David, et propter Jerusalem civitatem quam elegi ex omnibus tribubus Israël:
verses.english: 'But one tribe shall remain for him—meaning for Solomon's lineage—for the sake of My servant David, and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel.'

verses.latin: eo quod dereliquerit me, et adoraverit Astarthen deam Sidoniorum, et Camos deum Moabitarum, et Moloch deum filiorum Ammon: et non ambulaverit in viis meis, ut faceret justitiam coram me, et præcepta mea, et judicia, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: 'This will happen because Solomon has forsaken Me and has worshipped Astarte, the false goddess of the Sidonians, and Chemosh, the false god of the Moabites, and Molech, the vile god of the children of Ammon. And he has not walked in My ways, to do what is just before Me, nor kept My commandments and My judgments, as his father David did.'

verses.latin: Non auferam universum regnum de manu ejus, sed ducem faciam eum cunctis diebus vitæ suæ, propter David servum meum quem elegi, qui custodivit mandata mea et præcepta mea.
verses.english: 'I will not take the entire kingdom out of his hand, but I will make him a ruler for all the days of his life, for the sake of My servant David, whom I chose because he kept My commandments and My precepts.'

verses.latin: Sed de manu filii ejus auferam regnum, et dabo tibi decem tribus.
verses.english: 'But I will take the kingdom out of the hand of his son, and I will give ten tribes to you.'

verses.latin: Filio autem ejus dabo tribum unam, ut remaneat lucerna David servo meo cunctis diebus coram me in Jerusalem civitate, quam elegi ut esset nomen meum ibi.
verses.english: 'And to his son I will give one tribe, so that a lamp—meaning a lineage and kingship—may remain for My servant David for all days before Me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen for My name to be there.'

verses.latin: Te ergo assumam, et regnabis super omnia quæ desiderat anima tua, erisque rex super Israël.
verses.english: 'Therefore, I will take you, and you shall reign over all that your soul desires, and you shall be king over Israel.'

verses.latin: Si ergo audieris omnia quæ præcepero tibi, et ambulaveris in viis meis, et feceris quod rectum est coram me, custodiens mandata mea et præcepta mea, sicut fecit David servus meus: ero tecum, et ædificabo tibi domum fidelem, sicut ædificavi David, et dabo tibi Israël.
verses.english: 'If, therefore, you will listen to all that I command you, and walk in My ways, and do what is right before Me, keeping My commandments and My precepts, just as My servant David did, then I will be with you. I will build for you a lasting house—meaning a dynasty—just as I built for David, and I will give Israel to you.'

verses.latin: Et affligam semen David ob hoc tamen, non per cunctos dies.
verses.english: 'And I will afflict the descendants of David because of this—meaning because of Solomon's sin—but not for all days.'

verses.latin: Voluit ergo Salomon interficere Hieroboam: qui surrexit, et aufugit in Ægyptum ad Sesac regem Ægypti, et fuit in Ægypto usque ad mortem Salomonis.
verses.english: Therefore, Solomon sought to kill Jeroboam. But Jeroboam arose and fled to Egypt, to Shishak, the king of Egypt, and remained in Egypt until Solomon's death.

verses.latin: Et abiit Roboam in Sichem: illuc enim congregatus fuerat omnis Israël ut facerent eum regem.
verses.english: And Rehoboam went to Shechem, because all of Israel had gathered there to make him their king.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset Jeroboam filius Nabat, qui adhuc erat in Aegypto, (fugeram enim eo a facie Salomonis regis, et habitabat in Aegypto:)
verses.english: When Jeroboam, son of Nebat, heard this news, he was still in Egypt, because he had fled there from King Solomon and was living in Egypt at the time.

verses.latin: miserunt et vocaverunt eum. Veneruntque Jeroboam et omnis multitudo Israël, et locuti sunt ad Roboam, dicentes:
verses.english: So the people sent for Jeroboam and called him back. Jeroboam and all the multitude of Israel came, and they spoke to Rehoboam, saying:

verses.latin: Pater tuus durissimo jugo oppressit nos: tu itaque nunc minue aliquantum de imperio patris tui durissimo, et de jugo ejus gravissimo, quod imposuit nobis, et serviemus tibi.
verses.english: Your father oppressed us with a very harsh rule. So now, you should lighten some of your father's harsh control and ease the very heavy burden he placed on us, and we will serve you.

verses.latin: Et ille ait ad eos: Ite usque ad tertium diem, et revertimini ad me. Cumque abisset populus,
verses.english: Rehoboam said to them: "Go away for three days, and then return to me with your answer." And when the people had left,

verses.latin: iniit consilium cum senibus, qui adsistebant coram Salomone patre suo cum adhuc viveret, et ait: Quod mihi datis consilium, ut respondeam populo huic?
verses.english: Rehoboam consulted with the elder advisors who had served before his father Solomon when he was still alive. He said: "What counsel do you give me so that I may answer these people?"

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt ei: Si hodie obtemperaris populo huic, et servieris eis, et locutus fueris ad eos verba levia, servient tibi cunctis diebus.
verses.english: The elder advisors said to him: "If today you show obedience to these people, and serve them, and speak gentle words to them, they will serve you all your days."

verses.latin: Qui dereliquit consilium senum, quod dederant ei, et iniit consilium cum juvenibus, qui cum eo nutriti fuerant, et adsistebant illi.
verses.english: But Rehoboam abandoned the wise counsel of the elders, which they had given him. Instead, he consulted with the young men who had grown up with him and were now his royal attendants.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eos: Quod mihi datis consilium, ut respondeam populo huic, qui locuti sunt mihi, dicentes: Minue jugum quod imposuit pater tuus super nos?
verses.english: He said to them: "What counsel do you give me so that I may answer these people, who spoke to me, saying: 'Lighten the heavy burden that your father imposed on us' ?"

verses.latin: Responderuntque juvenes, qui nutriti fuerant cum eo, dicentes: Sic loqueris populo huic, qui locuti sunt ad te, dicentes: Pater tuus aggravavit jugum nostrum, tu releva nos: sic dices eis: Minimus digitus meus grossior est dorso patris mei.
verses.english: The young men who had grown up with him answered, saying: "You shall speak to these people, who spoke to you, saying: 'Your father made our burden heavy, you relieve us.'
