This is what you shall say to them: 'My little finger is thicker than my father's loins, meaning I am more powerful than him.'"

verses.latin: Et nunc pater meus posuit super vos jugum grave, ego autem addam super jugum vestrum: pater meus cecidit vos flagellis, ego autem caedam vos scorpionibus.
verses.english: "My father placed a heavy burden upon you, but I will make your burden even heavier. My father punished you with whips, but I will punish you with scourges armed with barbs—'scorpions' as they are called."

verses.latin: Venit ergo Jeroboam et omnis populus ad Roboam die tertio, sicut locutus fuerat rex, dicens: Revertimini ad me die tertio.
verses.english: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, just as the king had instructed, saying: "Return to me on the third day."

verses.latin: Duriora igitur respondit rex populo, relicto consilio seniorum, quod ei dederant:
verses.english: So the king answered the people more harshly, having ignored the wise counsel of the elders, which they had given him.

verses.latin: locutusque est juxta consilium juvenum, dicens: Pater meus aggravavit jugum vestrum, ego autem addam jugo vestro: pater meus cecidit vos flagellis, ego autem caedam vos scorpionibus.
verses.english: And he spoke according to the counsel of the young men, saying: "My father made your burden heavy, but I will make your burden even heavier. My father punished you with whips, but I will punish you with scourges armed with barbs."

verses.latin: Et non acquievit rex populo, quoniam aversatus fuerat eum Dominus, ut suscitaret verbum suum, quod locutus fuerat per manum Ahiae Silonitae ad Jeroboam filium Nabat.
verses.english: The king did not listen to the people's pleas, because the Lord had turned his heart away from doing so. This was done to fulfill God's own word, which He had spoken through the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam, son of Nebat.

verses.latin: Videns igitur omnis Israël quod non acquievisset rex eis, respondit populus regi, dicens: Quae nobis pars in David? neque haereditas in filio Isai. In tabernaculis tuis, Israël: vide domum tuam, David. Et abiit Israël in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: Therefore, when all Israel saw that the king had not listened to them, the people answered the king, saying: "What share do we have any longer in David's lineage? We have no inheritance in the son of Jesse's house, meaning we reject the royal line! To your tents, O Israel! Look to your own house, David—we disown your authority!" And so, the tribes of Israel went to their own encampments.

verses.latin: Super filios autem Israël, qui habitabant in civitatibus Juda, regnavit Roboam.
verses.english: However, Rehoboam continued to reign over the children of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah, specifically the tribes of Judah and Benjamin.

verses.latin: Misit itaque rex Roboam Aduram, qui erat super tributa: et lapidavit eum omnis Israël, et mortuus est. Porro rex Roboam festinus ascendit currum suum, et fugit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Therefore King Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was in charge of collecting the forced labor and tribute payments, to the rebellious tribes. But all Israel stoned him to death. Then King Rehoboam quickly mounted his royal chariot and fled to Jerusalem to escape.

verses.latin: Recessitque Israël a domo David usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: And so, the ten northern tribes of Israel permanently separated from the house of David's rule, a separation that continues to this very day.

verses.latin: Audivit autem omnis Israël quod reversus esset Jeroboam: et miserunt et vocaverunt eum, congregato universorum coetu, et constituerunt eum regem super omnis Israël, absque tribu Juda sola.
verses.english: Now all Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned from Egypt. So they sent for him and called him to a gathering of all the people, and they made him king over all the tribes of Israel, except for the tribe of Judah alone, which remained loyal to Rehoboam.

verses.latin: Venit autem Roboam in Jerusalem, et congregavit omnem domum Juda, et tribum Benjamin, centum octoginta millia electorum virorum bellatorum, ut pugnaret contra domum Israël, et reduceret regnum sibi.
verses.english: But Rehoboam came to Jerusalem and gathered all the house of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin, a total of one hundred eighty thousand chosen warriors, intending to fight against the house of Israel—the northern tribes—and bring the kingdom back under his control.

verses.latin: Factus est autem sermo Domini ad Semeiam hominem Dei, dicens:
verses.english: But the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah, a prophet of God, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad Roboam filium Salomonis regem Juda, et ad omnem domum Juda et Benjamin, et reliquos de populo, dicens:
verses.english: Speak to Rehoboam, son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people who are with him, saying:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Non ascendetis, neque pugnabitis contra fratres vestros filios Israël: revertatur unusquisque in domum suam, quia a me factum est verbum hoc. Audierunt sermonem Domini, et reversi sunt de itinere, sicut praeceperat eis Dominus.
verses.english: "Thus says the Lord: 'You shall not go up to fight against your brothers, the children of Israel. Let each one return to his own house, because this division has been done by My will and My word.'" They heard the word of the Lord, and they turned back from their journey, just as the Lord had commanded them.

verses.latin: Aedificavit autem Jeroboam Sichem in monte Ephraim, et habitavit ibi: et egressus inde, aedificavit Phanuel.
verses.english: Now Jeroboam rebuilt the city of Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim and established his residence there. And going out from there, he also rebuilt Penuel.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jeroboam in corde suo: Nunc revertetur regnum ad domum David,
verses.english: And Jeroboam said in his heart: "Now, if things continue as they are, the loyalty of the kingdom will revert to the house of David."

verses.latin: si ascenderit populus hic ut faciat sacrificia in domo Domini in Jerusalem: et convertetur cor populi hujus ad Dominum suum Roboam regem Juda, et interficient me, et revertentur ad Roboam regem Juda.
verses.english: "If these people continue to go up to Jerusalem to offer sacrifices in the house of the Lord, then the hearts of these people will turn back to their lord, Rehoboam, king of Judah. They will kill me, and return their allegiance to Rehoboam, king of Judah."

verses.latin: Et excogitato consilio, fecit duos vitulos aureos, et dixit eis: Nolite ultra ascendere in Jerusalem: ecce dii tui, Israël, qui te eduxerunt de terra Aegypti.
verses.english: So, after careful deliberation, Jeroboam made two golden calves. Then he said to the people: "You have traveled enough to Jerusalem. Look, O Israel, these are your gods who brought you out of the land of Egypt!"

verses.latin: Et posuit unum in Bethel, et alterum posuit in Dan.
verses.english: He placed one golden calf in Bethel, and the other he placed in Dan, two cities at opposite ends of his kingdom.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum hoc in peccatum: ibat enim populus ad adorandum vitulum usque ad Dan.
verses.english: And this action became a great sin for Israel, for the people went to worship the golden calf even as far as Dan, engaging in idolatry.

verses.latin: Et fecit domos excelsorum, et sacerdotes de novissimis populi, qui non erant de filiis Levi.
verses.english: Jeroboam also made temples on the high places, meaning shrines on hills and mountains, and appointed priests from the lowest ranks of the people who were not from the priestly tribe of Levi.

verses.latin: Et constituit Jeroboam diem festum in octavo mense, quintadecima die mensis, juxta solemnitatem quae celebrabatur in Juda: et ascendens altare, similiter fecit in Bethel, ut immolaret vitulis, quos fecerat: constituitque in Bethel sacerdotes excelsorum, quae fecerat.
verses.english: And Jeroboam appointed a feast day in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, mimicking the solemn feast that was celebrated in Judah, the Feast of Tabernacles. And going up to the altar, he did likewise in Bethel, to sacrifice to the golden calves which he had made, and he appointed priests of the high places which he had established in Bethel.

verses.latin: Et ascendit super altare, quod fecerat in Bethel, quintadecima die octavi mensis, quam excogitaverat de corde suo: fecitque solemnitatem filiis Israël, et ascendit in altare, ut adoleret incensum.
verses.english: And he went up to the altar which he had made in Bethel on the fifteenth day of the eighth month—a feast day which he had devised from his own heart, not according to God's law. He made a solemn feast for the children of Israel, and he went up to the altar to burn incense.

verses.latin: Hoc verbum quod dixerat Dominus ad Jeroboam, adimplevit.
verses.english: The Lord fulfilled this word which He had spoken to Jeroboam concerning the division of the kingdom.

verses.latin: Et propter hoc peccatum Jeroboam, et peccatum domus ejus, per quod peccaverunt, et peccare fecerunt Israël, avertit Dominus Israël, et tradidit eos in manus diripientium.
verses.english: And because of this sin of Jeroboam, and the sin of his entire household, through which they sinned and caused all Israel to sin with idolatry, the Lord turned away Israel from Himself and delivered them into the hands of those who would plunder them.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jeroboam, et omnia quae fecit, et fortitudo ejus, quomodo pugnaverit, et quomodo regnavit, ecce scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël.
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his mighty deeds, how he fought wars, and how he reigned as king, behold, these things are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Abiit autem Roboam in Sichem: illuc enim congregatus erat omnis Israel ut constituerent eum regem.
verses.english: Rehoboam, the son of King Solomon, then went to Shechem. For all of the tribes of Israel had gathered there to declare him their king.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset Jeroboam filius Nabat, qui erat in Aegypto (fugerat quippe illuc a facie Salomonis regis), et habitabat in Aegypto:
verses.english: When Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, heard this news—he was in Egypt at the time because he had fled there from King Solomon and was living in Egypt—

verses.latin: miserunt et vocaverunt eum. Veneruntque Jeroboam et universa multitudo Israel, et locuti sunt ad Roboam, dicentes:
verses.english: they sent word and called him back. So Jeroboam and the entire assembly of Israel came and spoke to Rehoboam, saying:

verses.latin: Pater tuus durissimum jugum imposuit nobis: tu itaque nunc imminue paululum de imperio patris tui durissimo, et de jugo gravi quod imposuit nobis, et serviemus tibi.
verses.english: “Your father, King Solomon, put a very heavy burden of forced labor on us. Now, therefore, lighten the harsh rule of your father and the heavy burden he placed on us, and we will be your loyal subjects.”

verses.latin: Et ille ait ad eos: Ite usque ad tertium diem, et revertimini ad me. Cumque abisset populus,
verses.english: Rehoboam replied to them: “Go away for three days, and then return to me for my decision.” So the people left.

verses.latin: iniit consilium rex Roboam cum senioribus, qui assistebant coram Salomone patre suo cum adhuc viveret, et ait: Quod mihi datis consilium, ut respondeam populo huic?
verses.english: King Rehoboam then consulted with the elders, his oldest advisors, who had served before his father Solomon when he was still alive. He asked: “What counsel do you give me, that I may respond to these people?”

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt ei: Si hodie obedieris populo huic, et servieris eis, et locutus fueris ad eos verba levia, servient tibi cunctis diebus.
verses.english: They replied to him: “If today you are a servant to these people, and serve them well, and speak kind words to them, then they will be loyal subjects to you for all of your days.”

verses.latin: Qui dereliquit consilium seniorum, quod dederant ei: et iniit consilium cum juvenibus, qui cum eo nutriti fuerant, et assidebant illi.
verses.english: But Rehoboam rejected the counsel of the elders, which they had given him. Instead, he consulted with the young men who had grown up with him and were now his closest companions.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eos: Quod vobis videtur, aut quid respondebimus populo huic, qui locuti sunt mihi, dicentes: Leva a nobis jugum quod imposuit pater tuus super nos?
verses.english: He said to them: “What counsel do you give, or what should we answer to these people who have spoken to me, saying: ‘Take away from us the heavy burden that your father imposed on us’?”

verses.latin: Responderuntque ei adolescentes, qui nutriti fuerant cum eo, dicentes: Sic loquere populo huic, qui locuti sunt ad te, dicentes: Pater tuus aggravavit jugum nostrum, tu leva a nobis: sic inquam loquere ad eos: Minimus digitus meus grossior est dorso patris mei.
verses.english: The young men who had grown up with him replied to him, saying: “This is how you should speak to these people who have said to you: ‘Your father made our burden heavy, but you should lighten it for us.’ This is what you should say to them: ‘My little finger is thicker than my father’s loins.’ This means that I am even stronger and more demanding than he was.”

verses.latin: Et nunc pater meus posuit super vos jugum grave, et ego addam super jugum vestrum: pater meus cecidit vos flagellis, ego caedam vos scorpionibus.
verses.english: “Now, my father placed a heavy burden on you, but I will add to your burden. My father beat you with whips, but I will beat you with scorpions—a much harsher instrument.”

verses.latin: Venit ergo Jeroboam et omnis populus ad Roboam die tertio, sicut locutus fuerat rex, dicens: Revertimini ad me die tertio.
verses.english: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, just as the king had instructed, saying: “Return to me on the third day.”

verses.latin: Durumque responsum dedit rex populo, relicto consilio seniorum, quod ei dederant:
verses.english: And the king gave the people a harsh answer, ignoring the wise counsel that the elders had given him.

verses.latin: locutusque est juxta consilium juvenum, dicens: Gravavit pater meus jugum vestrum, et ego superaddam jugo vestro: pater meus cecidit vos flagellis, ego vero caedam vos scorpionibus.
verses.english: He spoke according to the counsel of the young men, saying: “My father made your burden heavy, but I will add even more to your burden. My father beat you with whips, but I will truly beat you with scorpions.”

verses.latin: Et non adquievit rex populo: quia aversatus fuerat eum Dominus, ut suscitaret verbum suum, quod locutus fuerat in manu Ahiae Silonitis ad Jeroboam filium Nabat.
verses.english: The king did not listen to the people because the Lord had turned him away from doing so. This was to fulfill His word, which He had spoken through His prophet Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam, the son of Nebat.

verses.latin: Videns itaque omnis Israel, quod non audisset rex eos, respondit populus regi, dicens: Quae nobis pars in David? neque haereditas in filio Isai. In tabernacula tua, Israel: vide domum tuam, David. Et abiit Israel in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: So when all of Israel saw that the king would not listen to them, the people answered the king, saying: “What share do we have in David's lineage? We have no inheritance in the son of Jesse! To your tents, O Israel! Now, let David—that is, Rehoboam, and the house of Judah—look to his own household!” So Israel departed to their tents, that is, to their homes.

verses.latin: Super filios autem Israel, qui habitabant in civitatibus Juda, regnavit Roboam.
verses.english: But Rehoboam continued to reign over the sons of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah.

verses.latin: Misit autem rex Roboam Aduram, qui erat super tributa: et lapidavit omnis Israel eum, et mortuus est. Porro rex Roboam festinus ascendit currum suum, et fugit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: King Rehoboam then sent Adoram, who was in charge of collecting the forced labor tribute. But all the people of Israel stoned him with rocks, and he died. King Rehoboam, for his part, quickly mounted his chariot and fled to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Recessitque Israel a domo David usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: Thus, Israel—meaning the ten northern tribes—separated from the house of David's dynasty and the tribe of Judah, a division that remains to this very day.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, audiente omni Israel, quod reversus esset Jeroboam: et miserunt ac vocaverunt eum, congregato coetu, et constituerunt eum regem super omnem Israel, absque tribu Juda sola, et Beniamin.
verses.english: Now, when all of Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned from Egypt, they sent for him and called him to a general assembly. They then made him king over all of Israel, with only the tribe of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin remaining loyal to Rehoboam.

verses.latin: Venit autem Roboam in Jerusalem, et congregavit omnem domum Juda, et tribum Beniamin centum octoginta millia electorum et pugnatorum, ut inirent proelium contra domum Israel, et reducerent regnum sibi.
verses.english: When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he gathered all the house of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin—a force of one hundred eighty thousand chosen warriors—intending to wage war against the house of Israel to restore the kingdom to himself.

verses.latin: Factus est autem sermo Domini ad Semeiam hominem Dei, dicens:
verses.english: But the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah, a man of God, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad Roboam filium Salomonis regem Juda, et ad omnem domum Juda et Beniamin, et reliquos de populo, dicens:
verses.english: “Speak to Rehoboam, the son of Solomon, the king of Judah, and to all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people, saying:”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Non ascendetis, neque pugnabitis contra fratres vestros filios Israel: revertatur unusquisque in domum suam, quia a me factum est verbum istud. Audientes sermonem Domini, qui reversi sunt de itinere, et abierunt juxta praeceptum Domini.
verses.english: “Thus says the Lord: You shall not go up, nor shall you fight against your brothers, the sons of Israel. Let each one return to his own house, for this word, this division, has been brought about by My will.” Hearing the word of the Lord, they turned back from their journey and went away according to the Lord’s command.

verses.latin: AEdificavit autem Jeroboam Sichem in monte Ephraim, et habitavit ibi: et egressus inde, aedificavit Phanuel.
verses.english: Jeroboam then built up the city of Shechem in the mountains of Ephraim and lived there. After leaving there, he also built up the city of Penuel.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jeroboam in corde suo: Nunc revertetur regnum ad domum David,
verses.english: Jeroboam said in his heart, that is, to himself: “Now the kingdom will certainly return its loyalty to the house of David, the family of Rehoboam.”

verses.latin: si ascenderit populus iste ut faciat sacrificia in domo Domini in Jerusalem: et convertetur cor populi hujus ad Dominum suum Roboam regem Juda, et interficient me, et revertentur ad Roboam regem Juda.
verses.english: “If these people continue to go up to Jerusalem to offer sacrifices in the house of the Lord, then the hearts of these people will turn back to their Lord, Rehoboam, the king of Judah. They will kill me and return to Rehoboam, the king of Judah.”

verses.latin: Et excogitato consilio, fecit duos vitulos aureos, et dixit eis: Nolite ultra ascendere in Jerusalem: ecce dii tui, Israel, qui te eduxerunt de terra Aegypti.
verses.english: So, after careful consideration, Jeroboam made two golden calves and said to the people: “You have been going up to Jerusalem for too long. Behold your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!” This was an idolatrous reference to the golden calf made at Sinai.

verses.latin: Et posuit unum in Bethel, et alterum in Dan.
verses.english: He placed one golden calf in Bethel, and the other in Dan, establishing new worship centers at the northern and southern extremes of his kingdom.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum istud in peccatum: ibat enim populus ad adorandum vitulum usque in Dan.
verses.english: And this action became a great sin, for the people went to worship the golden calf even as far as Dan.

verses.latin: Et fecit domos excelsas, et sacerdotes de novissimis populi, qui non erant de filiis Levi.
verses.english: He also built temples on high places, and appointed priests from among all the people, even those who were not from the tribe of Levi, which was against God’s law.

verses.latin: Et statuit diem festum in octavo mense, quintadecima die mensis, juxta solemnitatem diei festi qui celebrabatur in Juda: et ascendens altare, similiter fecit in Bethel, ut immolaret vitulis, quos fecerat: constituitque in Bethel sacerdotes excelsorum quos fecerat.
verses.english: Jeroboam instituted a feast day in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, corresponding to the feast day that was celebrated in Judah. He went up to the altar himself, just as he did in Bethel, to offer sacrifice to the calves he had made. He also appointed priests for the high places he had made in Bethel.

verses.latin: Et ascendit in altare quod fecerat in Bethel, quintadecima die octavi mensis, in mense quem de suo corde protulerat: et fecit solemnitatem filiis Israel, et ascendit in altare ut adoleret incensum.
verses.english: He went up to the altar which he had made in Bethel on the fifteenth day of the eighth month—a month he had arbitrarily chosen for himself, not one appointed by God. He instituted this feast for the sons of Israel and went up to the altar to burn incense.

verses.latin: propterea juxta hoc verbum, hoc factum est, et in die illa ascendens in altare, ut adoleret incensum.
verses.english: Therefore, according to this word, this was done, and on that day, he went up to the altar to burn incense.

verses.latin: Ecce vir Dei ex Juda venit in Bethel in sermone Domini, Jeroboam stante super altare, et immolante.
verses.english: A man of God came from Judah to Bethel, commissioned by the Lord to deliver a message. He arrived just as King Jeroboam was standing before his altar, offering sacrifices to his false gods.

verses.latin: Et exclamavit contra altare in sermone Domini, et ait: Altare, altare, haec dicit Dominus: Ecce filius nascetur domui David, Josias nomine: et immolabit super te sacerdotes excelsorum, qui nunc in te cremant incensum, et ossa hominum super te commassabit.
verses.english: The man of God then cried out against the altar, speaking a message directly from the Lord. He declared: 'Altar, altar! This is what the Lord says: Listen! A son will be born to the house of David, named Josiah, who will slaughter the priests of the high places—the very priests who are now burning incense on you—and he will burn human bones upon you in desecration.'

verses.latin: Et dedit in illa die signum, dicens: Hoc erit signum quod locutus est Dominus: Ecce altare scindetur, et effundetur cinis qui in eo est.
verses.english: And on that very day, the man of God gave a sign to prove the prophecy, saying: 'This is the sign that the Lord has truly spoken this: Watch! The altar will be split apart, and all the ashes on it will be scattered and spilled.'

verses.latin: Audito ergo sermone viri Dei, quem exclamavit contra altare in Bethel, extendit rex Jeroboam manum suam de altari, dicens: Apprehendite eum. Et arefacta est manus ejus, quam extenderat, nec valebat retrahere eam ad se.
verses.english: When King Jeroboam heard the man of God's message, which was cried out against the altar in Bethel, the king stretched out his hand from the altar and commanded: 'Seize him!' But at that instant, the hand he had stretched out withered, and he could not pull it back to himself.

verses.latin: Altare quoque scissum est, et effusus est cinis de altari, juxta signum quod dederat vir Dei in sermone Domini.
verses.english: Also, at that very moment, the altar itself was split apart, and the ashes were spilled from it, just as the man of God had declared as a sign by the word of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ait rex ad virum Dei: Deprecare faciem Domini Dei tui, et ora pro me, ut restituatur manus mea mihi. Deprecatus est vir Dei faciem Domini, et restituta est manus regis illi, et facta est sicut prius.
verses.english: Then the king said to the man of God: 'Please, pray to the Lord your God for mercy, and intercede for me, so that my hand may be restored to me.' The man of God earnestly prayed to the Lord, and the king’s hand was restored to him, becoming as it was before.

verses.latin: Locutus est autem rex ad virum Dei: Veni mecum domum, ut prandeas, et dabo tibi munera.
verses.english: The king then spoke to the man of God: 'Come home with me so you can eat and refresh yourself, and I will give you gifts as a reward.'

verses.latin: Et ait vir Dei ad regem: Si dederis mihi mediam partem domus tuae, non veniam tecum, nec comedam panem, neque bibam aquam in loco isto:
verses.english: But the man of God answered the king: 'Even if you were to give me half of your royal house, I would not go with you, nor would I eat bread or drink water in this specific place of idolatry.'

verses.latin: sic enim præcepit mihi Dominus in sermone suo, dicens: Non comedes panem, neque bibes aquam, nec revertaris per viam qua venisti.
verses.english: 'For the Lord specifically commanded me in His word, saying: “You shall not eat bread, nor drink water, nor shall you return by the same way you came.”'

verses.latin: Et abiit per aliam viam, nec reversus est per viam qua venerat in Bethel.
verses.english: So he departed by another road, and did not return by the same way he had come to Bethel.

verses.latin: Erat autem propheta quidam senex habitans in Bethel: et venit filius ejus, et narravit patri suo omnia opera quæ fecerat vir Dei illa die in Bethel: et verba quæ locutus fuerat regi, narraverunt patri suo.
verses.english: Now there was a certain old prophet living in Bethel. His son came and told his father all the works the man of God had performed that day in Bethel, and they recounted to their father the words he had spoken to the king.

verses.latin: Et respondit eis pater eorum, dicens: Qua via abiit? Et ostenderunt ei filii ejus viam per quam abierat vir Dei qui venerat de Juda.
verses.english: And their father asked them, saying: 'Which way did he go?' His sons showed him the road by which the man of God, who had come from Judah, had departed.

verses.latin: Et ait filiis suis: Sternite mihi asinam. Qui cum strassent, ascendit,
verses.english: Then he told his sons: 'Saddle the donkey for me.' When they had saddled it, the old prophet mounted it.

verses.latin: et abiit post virum Dei, et invenit eum sedentem sub terebintho: et ait illi: Tune es vir Dei qui venisti de Juda? Respondit ille: Ego sum.
verses.english: He went after the man of God and found him sitting under a terebinth tree. He said to him: 'Are you the man of God who came from Judah?' The man of God replied: 'I am he.'

verses.latin: Et ait illi: Veni mecum domum, ut comedas panem.
verses.english: Then the old prophet said to him: 'Come home with me, so you can eat bread.'

verses.latin: Qui ait: Non possum reverti, neque venire tecum, nec comedam panem, neque bibam aquam in loco isto:
verses.english: But the man of God replied: 'I cannot return with you, nor can I come with you; neither will I eat bread nor drink water in this particular place, as it is forbidden by the Lord.'

verses.latin: quia locutus est Dominus ad me in sermone, dicens: Non comedes panem, et non bibes aquam ibi, nec revertaris per viam qua venisti.
verses.english: 'For the Lord spoke to me by His word, commanding: “You shall not eat bread nor drink water there, nor shall you return by the way you came.”'

verses.latin: Ait ad eum: Et ego propheta sum sicut et tu, et Angelus locutus est mihi in sermone Domini, dicens: Reduc eum tecum in domum tuam, ut comedat panem, et bibat aquam. Mentitus est ei.
verses.english: Then the old prophet said to him: 'I too am a prophet like you, and an Angel spoke to me by the word of the Lord, saying: “Bring him back with you to your house, that he may eat bread and drink water.”' However, the old prophet was lying to him.

verses.latin: Duxit ergo reversum secum, et comedit panem in domo illius, et bibit aquam.
verses.english: So the man of God turned back with the old prophet, and he ate bread in the old prophet's house and drank water.

verses.latin: Cumque sederent ad mensam, factus est sermo Domini ad prophetam qui reduxerat eum:
verses.english: While they were sitting at the table, the word of the Lord came to the prophet who had brought him back.

verses.latin: et exclamavit ad virum Dei qui venerat de Juda, dicens: Haec dicit Dominus: Quia non obedisti ori Domini, et non custodisti mandatum quod præcepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus,
verses.english: And the old prophet cried out to the man of God who had come from Judah, saying: 'This is what the Lord says: Because you did not obey the command of the Lord, and did not keep the instruction that the Lord your God commanded you,'

verses.latin: et reversus es, et comedisti panem, et bibisti aquam in loco in quo præcepi tibi ne comederes panem, et biberes aquam: non inferetur cadaver tuum in sepulchrum patrum tuorum.
verses.english: 'and instead you returned to eat bread and drink water in the very place where I commanded you not to eat bread or drink water, therefore your dead body shall not be brought to the tomb of your fathers for burial.'

verses.latin: Cumque comedisset et bibisset, stravit asinam suam prophetæ quem reduxerat.
verses.english: After the man of God had finished eating and drinking, the old prophet saddled his own donkey for the man of God whom he had brought back.

verses.latin: Qui cum abiisset, invenit eum leo in via, et interfecit: et erat cadaver ejus projectum in via, et asina stabat juxta illud, et leo stabat juxta cadaver.
verses.english: As the man of God went on his way, a lion met him on the road and killed him. His body lay cast out on the road, with his donkey standing beside it, and the lion also stood by the dead body, not harming the donkey.

verses.latin: Et ecce viri transgredientes viderunt cadaver projectum in via, et leonem stantem juxta cadaver. Et venientes narraverunt in civitate in qua senex propheta habitabat.
verses.english: Then, behold, men passing by saw the body lying on the road and the lion standing beside it. They went and reported what they saw in the city where the old prophet lived.

verses.latin: Audivit autem propheta ille qui reduxerat eum de via, et ait: Vir Dei est qui non credidit ori Domini, et conclusit eum Dominus leoni, et contrivit eum, et occidit juxta verbum Domini quod locutus est ei.
verses.english: When the old prophet, who had brought the man of God back from the road, heard this, he said: 'It is the man of God who did not believe the word of the Lord! So the Lord delivered him to a lion, and it crushed him and killed him, just as the Lord had spoken through His own word to him.'

verses.latin: Et ait filiis suis: Sternite mihi asinam. Qui cum strassent, ascendit:
verses.english: Then he said to his sons: 'Saddle the donkey for me.' When they had saddled it, he mounted it.

verses.latin: et abiit, et invenit cadaver ejus projectum in via, et asinam et leonem stantes juxta cadaver: nec comederat leo de cadavere, nec læserat asinam.
verses.english: He went and found the man of God's body lying on the road, with the donkey and the lion still standing by the body. The lion had not eaten from the body, nor had it harmed the donkey, which was a miraculous sign of God's direct involvement.

verses.latin: Sustulit ergo propheta cadaver viri Dei, et imposuit super asinam, et reducens reportavit in civitatem suam, propheta senex: et planxit eum.
verses.english: So the old prophet picked up the body of the man of God, placed it upon his donkey, and brought him back to his own city. The old prophet then mourned for him.

verses.latin: Et posuit cadaver ejus in sepulchro suo: et planxerunt eum: Heu mi frater!
verses.english: He laid the man of God’s body in his own tomb, and they mourned over him, crying: 'Alas, my brother!'

verses.latin: Cumque planxissent eum, ait filiis suis, dicens: Cum mortuus fuero, sepelite me in sepulchro isto, quo sepultus est vir Dei: juxta ossa ejus ponite ossa mea.
verses.english: After they had mourned him, the old prophet said to his sons, telling them: 'When I die, bury me in this same tomb where the man of God is buried. Place my bones beside his bones.'

verses.latin: Verum est enim verbum Domini quod locutus est in sermone Domini contra altare in Bethel, et contra omnia fana excelsorum quæ sunt in civitatibus Samariæ.
verses.english: 'For the word of the Lord that he spoke by the Lord's command against the altar in Bethel, and against all the shrines of the high places which are in the cities of Samaria, will surely come true.'

verses.latin: Post hæc non reversus est Jeroboam de via sua pessima: sed e contrario fecit de novissimis populi sacerdotes excelsorum: quicumque volebat, implebat manum ejus, et fiebat sacerdos excelsorum.
verses.english: Even after these events, Jeroboam did not turn from his evil way. Instead, he continued to appoint priests for the high places from the lowest ranks of the people. Whoever desired it, he consecrated them to serve, and they became priests of the high places, which was a grave sin against God.

verses.latin: Et propter hanc causam peccati facta est domus Jeroboam, et succisa et deleta de superficie terræ.
verses.english: Because of this sin, this became the cause of the downfall of Jeroboam’s house, leading to its complete destruction and utter removal from the face of the earth.

verses.latin: In secundo anno Phekahiæ filii Romeliæ regis Israël, regnavit Joatham filius Oziæ regis Juda.
verses.english: This verse is a chapter break and does not belong to the current context of 1 Kings 13. Please verify the chapter and verse range.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jerusa filia Sadoc.
verses.english: This verse is a chapter break and does not belong to the current context of 1 Kings 13. Please verify the chapter and verse range.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod rectum erat coram Domino juxta omnia quæ fecerat Ozias pater ejus.
verses.english: This verse is a chapter break and does not belong to the current context of 1 Kings 13. Please verify the chapter and verse range.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit, adhuc enim populus sacrificabat et adolebat incensum in excelsis.
verses.english: This verse is a chapter break and does not belong to the current context of 1 Kings 13. Please verify the chapter and verse range.

verses.latin: Ipse ædificavit portam domus Domini excelsam.
verses.english: This verse is a chapter break and does not belong to the current context of 1 Kings 13. Please verify the chapter and verse range.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joatham, et omnia quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: This verse is a chapter break and does not belong to the current context of 1 Kings 13. Please verify the chapter and verse range.

verses.latin: Et ecce vir Dei de Juda, in sermone Domini venit in Bethel, cum Jeroboam staret super altare ad sacrificandum.
verses.english: And behold, a man of God from Judah arrived in Bethel with a message from the Lord. This happened while King Jeroboam was standing at the altar to offer sacrifice.

verses.latin: Et exclamavit contra altare in sermone Domini, et ait: Altare, altare, haec dicit Dominus: Ecce filius nascetur domui David, Josias nomine: et immolabit super te sacerdotes excelsorum, qui nunc in te sacrificant, et ossa hominum super te incendet.
verses.english: And the man of God cried out against the altar with a message from the Lord, saying: "O Altar, O Altar, this is what the Lord says: 'Behold, a son will be born to the house of David, named Josiah. He will sacrifice upon you the priests of the high places who are now offering sacrifices on you, and he will burn the bones of men upon you.'"

verses.latin: Deditque in die illo signum, dicens: Hoc erit signum quod locutus est Dominus: Ecce altare scindetur, et effundetur cinis, qui in eo est.
verses.english: And on that same day, the man of God gave a sign, saying: "This will be the proof that the Lord has spoken: 'Behold, this very altar will be torn apart, and the ashes that are on it will be poured out.'"

verses.latin: Cumque audisset rex sermonem hominis Dei, quem clamavit contra altare in Bethel, extendit manum suam de altare, dicens: Apprehendite eum. Et exaruit manus ejus quam extenderat contra eum, nec valuit retrahere eam ad se.
verses.english: Now, when the king heard the message of the man of God, which he had cried out against the altar in Bethel, King Jeroboam stretched out his hand from the altar, ordering: "Seize him!" But his hand, which he had stretched out against the man of God, immediately withered, and he was unable to pull it back to himself.

verses.latin: Altare quoque scissum est, et effusus est cinis de altare, juxta signum quod dederat vir Dei in sermone Domini.
verses.english: Furthermore, the altar itself was torn apart, and the ashes were poured out from it, exactly as the man of God had prophesied with a message from the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ait rex ad virum Dei: Deprecare faciem Domini Dei tui, et ora pro me, ut restituatur manus mea mihi. Et deprecatus est vir Dei faciem Domini: et restituta est manus regis ad eum, factaque est sicut prius fuerat.
verses.english: Then the king said to the man of God: "Please intercede with the Lord your God and pray for me, so that my hand may be restored to me." So the man of God interceded with the Lord, and the king's hand was restored to him, becoming as it had been before.

verses.latin: Locutus est autem rex ad virum Dei: Veni mecum domum, ut prandeas, et dabo tibi munera.
verses.english: The king then spoke to the man of God, inviting him: "Come home with me to eat a meal, and I will give you gifts."

verses.latin: Et respondit vir Dei regi: Si dederis mihi mediam partem domus tuae, non veniam tecum, nec comedam panem, neque bibam aquam in loco isto:
verses.english: But the man of God replied to the king: "Even if you were to give me half of your royal house, I would not go with you, nor will I eat bread or drink water in this place."

verses.latin: sic enim mandatum est mihi in sermone Domini, dicentis: Non comedes panem, neque bibes aquam, nec revertaris per viam qua venisti.
verses.english: For this is the commandment I received in a message from the Lord, who said: 'You shall not eat bread, nor drink water, nor return by the same road you came.'"

verses.latin: Et abiit per aliam viam, et non est reversus per viam qua venerat in Bethel.
verses.english: So the man of God departed by a different road and did not return by the way he had come to Bethel.

verses.latin: Habitabat autem quidam senex propheta in Bethel: ad quem venerunt filii ejus, et narraverunt ei omnia opera quae fecerat vir Dei illa die in Bethel: et verba quae locutus fuerat regi, narraverunt patri suo.
verses.english: Now there was an old prophet living in Bethel. His sons came to him and told him all the deeds that the man of God had performed that day in Bethel, and they recounted to their father the words he had spoken to the king.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis pater eorum: Qua via abiit? Et ostenderunt ei filii ejus viam per quam abierat vir Dei qui venerat de Juda.
verses.english: Their father then asked them: "Which road did he take?" And his sons showed him the road by which the man of God, who had come from Judah, had departed.

verses.latin: Et ait filiis suis: Sternite mihi asinum. Quibus cum strassent, et ille ascendisset,
verses.english: And he said to his sons: "Saddle a donkey for me." When they had saddled it, the old prophet mounted the donkey.

verses.latin: abiit post virum Dei, et invenit eum sedentem subter terebinthum: et ait illi: Numquid tu es vir Dei qui venisti de Juda? Et ille respondit: Ego sum.
verses.english: He rode after the man of God and found him sitting under an oak tree. The old prophet asked him: "Are you the man of God who came from Judah?" And the man of God replied: "I am."

verses.latin: Et ait illi: Veni mecum domum, ut comedas panem.
verses.english: Then the old prophet said to him: "Come home with me to eat bread."

verses.latin: Qui ait: Non possum reverti, neque venire tecum, neque comedam panem, neque bibam aquam in loco isto:
verses.english: But the man of God replied: "I cannot return or go with you. I will not eat bread or drink water in this place."

verses.latin: quia locutus est Dominus ad me in sermone Domini, dicens: Non comedes panem, et non bibes aquam ibi, nec ultra reverts per viam qua venisti.
verses.english: Because the Lord spoke to me in a message, saying: 'You shall not eat bread or drink water there, nor shall you return by the way you came.'"

verses.latin: Et ait illi: Et ego propheta sum sicut et tu, et Angelus locutus est mihi in sermone Domini, dicens: Reduc eum tecum in domum tuam, ut comedat panem, et bibat aquam. Mentitus est illi.
verses.english: And the old prophet said to him: "I too am a prophet like you, and an Angel spoke to me with a message from the Lord, saying: 'Bring him back with you to your house, so he may eat bread and drink water.'" The old prophet was lying to him.

verses.latin: Reduxit ergo eum secum: et comedit panem in domo ejus, et bibit aquam.
verses.english: So the man of God returned with him, and ate bread in his house, and drank water.

verses.latin: Cumque sederent ad mensam, factus est sermo Domini ad prophetam qui reduxerat eum.
verses.english: While they were sitting at the table, a message from the Lord came to the prophet who had brought him back.

verses.latin: Et exclamavit ad virum Dei qui venerat de Juda, dicens: Haec dicit Dominus: Quia non obedisti ori Domini, et non custodisti mandatum quod praecepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus,
verses.english: And the old prophet cried out to the man of God who had come from Judah, saying: "This is what the Lord says: 'Because you did not obey the word of the Lord, and did not keep the commandment that the Lord your God commanded you,"

verses.latin: et reversus es, et comedisti panem, et bibisti aquam in loco quo praecepi tibi ne comederes panem, et ne biberes aquam: non inferetur cadaver tuum in sepulchrum patrum tuorum.
verses.english: —but instead you returned and ate bread and drank water in the very place where I commanded you not to eat bread or drink water—therefore your corpse shall not be brought into the tomb of your fathers.'"

verses.latin: Factum est autem, postquam comedit panem, et bibit aquam, stravit asinum suum prophetae quem reduxerat.
verses.english: Now it happened that after the man of God had eaten bread and drunk water, the old prophet saddled his own donkey for the man of God whom he had brought back.

verses.latin: Qui cum abisset, invenit eum leo in via, et occidit: et erat cadaver ejus projectum in via, et asinus stabat juxta illud, et leo stabat juxta cadaver.
verses.english: When the man of God departed, a lion found him on the road and killed him. His corpse lay cast out on the road, with his donkey standing beside it, and the lion also stood beside the corpse.

verses.latin: Et ecce viri transgredientes viderunt cadaver projectum in via, et leonem stantem juxta cadaver, et venientes narraverunt in civitate in qua senex propheta habitabat.
verses.english: And behold, some men passing by saw the corpse lying on the road and the lion standing next to it. They came and reported what they saw in the city where the old prophet lived.

verses.latin: Audiens autem propheta ille qui reduxerat eum de via, ait: Vir Dei est, qui non obedivit ori Domini: et tradidit eum Dominus leoni, et contrivit eum, et occidit juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est ei.
verses.english: When the old prophet who had brought him back from the road heard this, he said: "It is the man of God who did not obey the Lord's command! And the Lord delivered him to the lion, and it tore him and killed him, just as the Lord had spoken to him in His message."

verses.latin: Et dixit filiis suis, dicens: Sternite mihi asinum. Qui cum strassent,
verses.english: And he said to his sons: "Saddle a donkey for me." When they had saddled it,

verses.latin: et ille abisset, invenit cadaver ejus projectum in via, et asinum et leonem stantes juxta cadaver: non comederat leo de cadavere, nec asinum contriverat.
verses.english: The old prophet went and found the corpse of the man of God lying on the road, with the donkey and the lion still standing beside the corpse. The lion had not eaten from the corpse, nor had it harmed the donkey.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo propheta cadaver viri Dei, et posuit illud super asinum, et reduxit: et venit in civitatem prophetae senis ad plangendum, et sepeliendum eum.
verses.english: So the old prophet picked up the corpse of the man of God and placed it upon the donkey and brought it back. He came to the city where the old prophet lived to mourn for him and to bury him.

verses.latin: Et posuit cadaver ejus in sepulchro suo: et planxerunt eum: Heu mi frater!
verses.english: And he laid the man of God's corpse in his own tomb, and they mourned over him, crying: "Alas, my brother!"

verses.latin: Et factum est postquam sepelisset eum, dixit ad filios suos, dicens: Cum mortuus fuero, sepelite me in sepulchro isto, quo sepultus est vir Dei: juxta ossa ejus ponite ossa mea.
verses.english: And it came to pass after he had buried him, the old prophet said to his sons, instructing them: "When I die, bury me in this very tomb where the man of God is buried. Lay my bones beside his bones."

verses.latin: Vere enim veniet sermo quem locutus est in sermone Domini contra altare quod est in Bethel, et contra omnia fana excelsorum quae sunt in urbibus Samariae.
verses.english: For truly the message will come to pass which he spoke with a message from the Lord, against the altar that is in Bethel, and against all the shrines of the high places that are in the cities of Samaria."

verses.latin: Post haec non reversus est Jeroboam de via sua pessima: sed e contrario fecit de novissimis populi sacerdotes excelsorum: quicumque volebat, implebat manum ejus, et fiebat sacerdos excelsorum.
verses.english: After these events, King Jeroboam did not turn back from his evil way. Instead, he continued to appoint priests for the high places from the lowest of the people; anyone who desired it could consecrate himself and become a priest of the high places.

verses.latin: Et propter hanc causam peccavit domus Jeroboam, et exterminata est, et delevit de superficie terrae.
verses.english: And because of this cause, the house of Jeroboam sinned, and it was utterly destroyed and wiped from the face of the earth.

verses.latin: In tempore illo ægrotavit Abiam filius Jeroboam.
verses.english: At that particular time, Abijah, the son of Jeroboam, became sick.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jeroboam uxori suæ: Surge, et commuta vestimenta tua, ne cognoscaris quod sis uxor Jeroboam: et vade in Silo, ubi est Ahias propheta, qui locutus est mihi quòd regnare deberem super populum istum.
verses.english: Jeroboam then told his wife, "Get up and change your clothes, so no one will recognize that you are Jeroboam's wife. Then go to Shiloh, where Ahijah the prophet lives—the same man who told me that I would rule over these people of Israel."

verses.latin: Tolle tecum panes quinque, et crustulam, et lagenam mellis, et vade ad illum: ipse dicet tibi quid futurum sit puero.
verses.english: "Take with you five loaves of bread, a cake, and a jar of honey, and go to him. He will tell you what will happen to the boy—your son."

verses.latin: Fecitque ita uxor Jeroboam: et consurgens abiit in Silo, et venit in domum Ahiæ. At ille non poterat videre, quia caligaverant oculi ejus præ senectute.
verses.english: So Jeroboam's wife did as she was told. She arose, went to Shiloh, and arrived at Ahijah's house. But Ahijah could not see, because his eyes were dim with old age.

verses.latin: Dominus autem locutus est ad Ahian, dicens: Ecce uxor Jeroboam ingreditur, ut consulat te super filio suo, quia ægrotat: hæc et hæc loqueris ei. Cum ergo illa intraret, et dissimularet se esse,
verses.english: But the Lord had spoken to Ahijah, saying, "Look, Jeroboam's wife is coming to consult you about her son, because he is sick. You are to tell her exactly these things." So when she entered and pretended to be someone else,

verses.latin: audivit Ahias sonitum pedum ejus introëuntis per ostium, et ait: Ingredere, uxor Jeroboam: quare dissimulas te esse alteram? Ego autem missus sum ad te durus nuntius.
verses.english: Ahijah heard the sound of her feet as she came through the door, and he said, "Come in, wife of Jeroboam. Why do you pretend to be another woman? I, however, am sent on a mission to you with a harsh message from God."

verses.latin: Vade, et dic Jeroboam: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Pro eo quòd exaltavi te de medio populi, et dedi te ducem super populum meum Israël:
verses.english: "Go and tell Jeroboam: 'Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: For as much as I exalted you from among the people, and made you a leader over My people Israel—"

verses.latin: et scidi regnum de domo David, et dedi tibi illud: et non fuisti sicut servus meus David, qui custodivit mandata mea, et secutus est me in toto corde suo, faciens quod placitum esset in oculis meis:
verses.english: "—and I tore the kingdom away from the house of David and gave it to you. Yet you have not been like My servant David, who kept My commandments and followed Me with his whole heart, doing only what was pleasing in My eyes."

verses.latin: sed operatus es malè super omnes qui fuerunt ante te, et fecisti tibi deos alienos, et conflatiles, ut me ad iracundiam provocares, me autem projecisti post tergum tuum:
verses.english: "But you have done worse evil than all who were before you. You have made for yourself foreign gods, and molten images, to provoke Me to anger, and you have cast Me aside, behind your back."

verses.latin: idcirco ecce ego inducam mala super domum Jeroboam, et percutiam de Jeroboam mingentem ad parietem, et clausum, et novissimum in Israël: et mundabo reliquias domus Jeroboam, sicut mundari solet fimus usque ad purum.
verses.english: "Therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam. I will cut off from Jeroboam every male—every male, whether confined or completely free in Israel. I will utterly cleanse the remnant of Jeroboam's house, just as one cleanses dung until it is completely gone."

verses.latin: Qui mortuus fuerit de Jeroboam in civitate, comedent eum canes: qui autem mortuus fuerit in agro, vorabunt eum volucres cæli: quia Dominus locutus est.
verses.english: "Anyone belonging to Jeroboam who dies in the city, dogs will devour him. And anyone who dies in the open country, the birds of the sky will eat him. For the Lord Himself has spoken it."

verses.latin: Tu igitur surge, et vade in domum tuam: et in ipso introitu pedum tuorum in urbem, morietur puer.
verses.english: "You, therefore, rise up and go to your house. And the very moment your feet enter the city, the boy will die."

verses.latin: Et planget eum omnis Israël, et sepelient eum: iste enim solus infertur de Jeroboam in sepulchrum, quia inventus est super eo sermo bonus ad Dominum Deum Israël in domo Jeroboam.
verses.english: "And all Israel will mourn for him, and they will bury him. For he alone among all of Jeroboam's family will be brought to a burial place, because some good was found in him towards the Lord, the God of Israel, in the house of Jeroboam."

verses.latin: Constituet autem sibi Dominus regem super Israël, qui excindat domum Jeroboam in hac die, et in hoc tempore.
verses.english: "Furthermore, the Lord will raise up for Himself a king over Israel who will utterly cut off the house of Jeroboam, and that will happen on this very day and at this very time."

verses.latin: Et percutiet Dominus Israël sicut movetur arundo in aqua: et evellit Israël de terra bona hac, quam dedit patribus eorum, et ventilabit eos trans fluvium, quia fecerunt sibi lucos, ut in iracundiam provocarent Dominum.
verses.english: "And the Lord will strike Israel, causing them to sway like a reed that is moved by water. He will uproot Israel from this good land that He gave to their fathers, and He will scatter them beyond the River Euphrates, because they made for themselves Asherah poles to provoke the Lord to anger."

verses.latin: Et tradet Dominus Israël propter peccata Jeroboam, qui peccavit, et peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: "And the Lord will abandon Israel because of the sins of Jeroboam, who sinned and caused Israel to sin."

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque uxor Jeroboam, et abiit, et venit in Thersa: et cùm ingrediretur limen domus, puer mortuus est.
verses.english: So Jeroboam's wife arose and departed. She came to Tirzah, and as she was crossing the threshold of the house, the boy died.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt eum, et planxit omnis Israël juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est in manu servi sui Ahiæ prophetæ.
verses.english: They buried him, and all Israel mourned for him, just as the Lord had spoken through His servant Ahijah the prophet.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jeroboam, quomodo præliatus sit, et quomodo regnaverit, ecce scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël.
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he fought, and how he reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Dies autem quibus regnavit Jeroboam, viginti duo anni sunt: et dormivit cum patribus suis: regnavitque Nadab filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: The days that Jeroboam reigned were twenty-two years. Then he slept with his fathers—a euphemism for dying. And Nadab, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Roboam verò filius Salomonis regnavit in Juda: quadraginta et unius anni erat Roboam cùm regnare cœpisset: decem et septem annis regnavit in Jerusalem civitate, quam elegit Dominus, ut poneret nomen suum ibi, ex omnibus tribubus Israël. Nomen autem matris ejus Naama Ammanitis.
verses.english: Rehoboam, the son of Solomon, reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Lord had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel to put His name there. Now his mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonitess.

verses.latin: Et fecit Judas malum coram Domino: et irritaverunt eum super omnibus quæ fecerant patres eorum in peccatis suis.
verses.english: And Judah did evil before the Lord. They provoked Him to jealousy with all the sins that their fathers had committed.

verses.latin: Ædificaverunt enim et ipsi sibi aras, et statuas, et lucos super omnem collem excelsum, et subter omnem arborem frondosam.
verses.english: For they also built for themselves high places, and sacred pillars, and Asherah poles on every high hill and under every leafy tree.

verses.latin: Sed et effeminati fuerunt in terra, et fecerunt omnes abominationes gentium, quas abstulit Dominus ante faciem filiorum Israël.
verses.english: Furthermore, there were male cult prostitutes in the land, and they committed all the abominable practices of the nations that the Lord had driven out before the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Anno autem quinto regni Roboam, ascendit Sesac rex Ægypti in Jerusalem,
verses.english: Now in the fifth year of King Rehoboam's reign, Shishak, the king of Egypt, marched against Jerusalem.

verses.latin: et abstulit thesauros domus Domini, et thesauros regios, et omnia diripuit, clipeos quoque aureos, quos fecerat Salomon.
verses.english: And he took away the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the king's house. He plundered everything, including the golden shields that Solomon had made.

verses.latin: Pro quibus fecit rex Roboam clipeos æreos, et tradidit in manum ducum scutariorum, et eorum qui excubabant ante fores domus regis.
verses.english: In place of these, King Rehoboam made bronze shields and committed them to the care of the captains of the guard, who stood watch at the entrance of the king's house.

verses.latin: Cumque ingrederetur rex in domum Domini, portabant eos qui excubabant, et reportabant ad armarium scutariorum.
verses.english: And whenever the king entered the house of the Lord, the guards carried them, and then they returned them to the guardroom of the shield-bearers.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Roboam, et omnium quæ fecit, ecce scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda.
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah.

verses.latin: Fuit quoque bellum inter Roboam et Jeroboam cunctis diebus.
verses.english: There was also continuous warfare between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout all their days.

verses.latin: Dormivit autem Roboam cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David: nomen autem matris ejus Naama Ammanitis. Regnavitque Abiam filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Then Rehoboam slept with his fathers—he died—and was buried with them in the city of David. His mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonitess. And Abijah, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: In tempore illo ægrotavit Abias filius Jeroboam.
verses.english: At that time, Abijah, who was the son of King Jeroboam, fell ill.

verses.latin: Et dixit Jeroboam uxori suæ : Surge, et commuta vestem tuam, ne cognoscaris quod sis uxor Jeroboam, et vade in Silo, ubi est Ahias propheta, qui locutus est mihi quoniam rex futurus es super populum istum.
verses.english: And King Jeroboam said to his wife: "Go now, and disguise yourself by changing your clothes, so no one will recognize that you are the wife of King Jeroboam. Then go to Shiloh, where Ahijah the prophet lives—the same prophet who told me I would be king over this people."

verses.latin: Tolle quoque in manu tua decem panes, et crustulam, et lagenam mellis, et vade ad eum : ipse dicet tibi quid futurum sit puero.
verses.english: "Also, take with you ten loaves of bread, some cakes, and a jar of honey. Go to him, and he will tell you what will happen to the boy."

verses.latin: Fecitque uxor Jeroboam ut dixerat : et consurgens abiit in Silo, et venit in domum Ahiæ : at ille non poterat videre, quia caligaverant oculi ejus præ senectute.
verses.english: So King Jeroboam's wife did as he had told her. She got up and went to Shiloh, and came to Ahijah's house. But the prophet could not see, because his eyes had become dim from old age.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Ahiam : Ecce uxor Jeroboam ingreditur ut consulat te super filio suo, qui ægrotat : hæc et hæc loqueris ei. Cum ergo illa intraret, et dissimularet se esse quæ erat,
verses.english: But the Lord had said to Ahijah: "Look, King Jeroboam's wife is coming to consult you about her son, who is sick. Tell her exactly these things." So when she came in, pretending to be someone else,

verses.latin: audivit Ahias sonitum pedum ejus introëuntis per ostium, et ait : Ingredere, uxor Jeroboam : quare dissimulas te esse ? ego autem missus sum ad te dura.
verses.english: Ahijah heard the sound of her feet as she entered through the door, and he said: "Come in, wife of King Jeroboam! Why are you pretending to be someone you are not? I have been sent to you with a harsh message."

verses.latin: Vade, et dic Jeroboam : Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël : Quia exaltavi te de medio populi, et dedi te ducem super populum meum Israël :
verses.english: "Go and tell King Jeroboam: 'This is what the Lord God of Israel says: I elevated you from among the common people and made you a leader over My people, Israel."

verses.latin: et scidi regnum de domo David, et dedi tibi illud : et non fuisti sicut servus meus David, qui custodivit mandata mea, et secutus est me in toto corde suo, faciens quod placitum esset in conspectu meo :
verses.english: 'I tore the kingdom away from the house of David and gave it to you. Yet you have not been like My servant David, who kept My commandments and followed Me with his whole heart, doing only what was pleasing in My sight.

verses.latin: sed operatus es mala super omnes, qui fuerunt ante te, et fecisti tibi deos alienos et conflatiles, ut me ad iracundiam provocares, me autem projecisti post tergum tuum.
verses.english: 'Instead, you have done more evil than all who were before you. You have made for yourself foreign gods, idols cast from metal, to provoke My wrath, and you have cast Me aside, forgetting about Me completely.

verses.latin: Propterea ecce ego inducam mala super domum Jeroboam, et percutiam de Jeroboam mingentem ad parietem, et clausum, et ultimum in Israël : et mundabo reliquias domus Jeroboam, sicut mundari solet fimus usque ad purum.
verses.english: 'Therefore, behold, I will bring disaster upon the house of Jeroboam. I will cut off from Jeroboam every male descendant, whether slave or free, the lowest and the last in Israel. I will utterly sweep away the remnant of Jeroboam's house, just as one sweeps away dung until it is completely gone.'

verses.latin: Qui mortui fuerint de Jeroboam in civitate, comedent eos canes : qui autem mortui fuerint in agro, vorabunt eos aves cæli : quia Dominus locutus est.
verses.english: 'Those of Jeroboam's family who die in the city will be eaten by dogs, and those who die in the open country will be devoured by the birds of the sky. This is because the Lord Himself has spoken it.'"

verses.latin: Tu igitur surge, et vade in domum tuam : et in ipso introitu pedum tuorum in urbem, morietur puer.
verses.english: Ahijah continued, "As for you, get up and go back to your house. The very moment your feet enter the city, the boy will die."

verses.latin: Et planget eum omnis Israël, et sepeliet : iste enim solus infertur de Jeroboam in sepulchrum, quia inventum est super eum verbum bonum de Domino Deo Israël in domo Jeroboam.
verses.english: "All of Israel will mourn him and bury him. For he alone among Jeroboam's family will be laid in a proper grave, because in him alone, in the house of Jeroboam, a good word concerning the Lord God of Israel was found."

verses.latin: Constituet autem Dominus sibi regem super Israël, qui excindet domum Jeroboam in die illa et hoc in tempore.
verses.english: "Moreover, the Lord will raise up a king over Israel for Himself, who will cut off the house of Jeroboam—and this will happen quickly, at the appointed time."

verses.latin: Et percutiet Dominus Israël sicut movetur arundo in aqua : et evulset Israël de terra hac optima, quam dedit patribus eorum, et ventilabit eos trans fluvium : eo quod fecerint sibi lucos, irritantes Dominum.
verses.english: "And the Lord will strike Israel, shaking them like a reed is shaken in water. He will uproot Israel from this good land that He gave to their ancestors, and scatter them beyond the great river, because they made for themselves sacred poles, provoking the Lord to anger."

verses.latin: Et tradet Dominus Israël propter peccata Jeroboam, qui peccavit, et peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: "And the Lord will abandon Israel because of the sins of Jeroboam, who sinned and led Israel into sin."

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque uxor Jeroboam, et abiit, et venit in Thersa : cumque illa ingrederetur limen domus, puer mortuus est.
verses.english: So Jeroboam's wife got up and left, and came to Tirzah. And as she stepped across the threshold of the house, the boy died.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt eum, et planxit illum omnis Israël juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est per manum servi sui Ahiæ prophetæ.
verses.english: They buried him, and all Israel mourned for him, just as the Lord had declared through His servant, Ahijah the prophet.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jeroboam, quomodo præliaverit, et quomodo regnaverit, ecce scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël.
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Jeroboam—how he fought wars and how he reigned—behold, these are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Dies autem quibus regnavit Jeroboam, viginti duo anni sunt : et dormivit cum patribus suis : et regnavit Nadab filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: The length of King Jeroboam's reign was twenty-two years. He then died and was laid to rest with his ancestors, and his son Nadab reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Roboam vero filius Salomonis regnavit in Juda : quadraginta et unius anni erat Roboam cum regnare cœpisset, et decem et septem annis regnavit in Jerusalem civitate, quam elegit Dominus ut poneret nomen suum ibi, ex omnibus tribubus Israël : et nomen matris ejus Naama Ammanitis.
verses.english: Rehoboam, Solomon's son, was ruling in Judah at this time. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city that the Lord had chosen from all the tribes of Israel to establish His presence there. His mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonite woman.

verses.latin: Et fecit Judas malum coram Domino : et concitaverunt eum super omnia quæ fecerant patres eorum in peccatis suis quæ peccaverunt.
verses.english: And Judah did evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking Him more than all that their ancestors had done through the sins they committed.

verses.latin: Ædificaverunt enim et ipsi sibi aras, et statuas, et lucos super omnem collem excelsum, et subter omnem arborem frondosam.
verses.english: For they also built for themselves high places, pillars, and sacred groves upon every high hill and under every lush tree, engaging in idolatry.

verses.latin: Sed et effeminati fuerunt in terra : feceruntque omnes abominationes gentium, quas abstulit Dominus a facie filiorum Israël.
verses.english: Moreover, there were also male prostitutes for cultic purposes in the land, and they committed all the detestable practices of the pagan nations whom the Lord had driven out before the people of Israel.

verses.latin: In quinto autem anno regni Roboam, ascendit Sesac rex Ægypti in Jerusalem,
verses.english: Now, in the fifth year of King Rehoboam's reign, Shishak king of Egypt marched up against Jerusalem.

verses.latin: et tulit thesauros domus Domini, et thesauros domus regiæ, et omnia diripuit : scuta quoque aurea, quæ fecerat Salomon, abstulit.
verses.english: He carried off the treasures of the Lord's house and the treasures of the royal palace. He plundered everything, including the golden shields that King Solomon had made.

verses.latin: Pro quibus fecit rex Roboam scuta ærea, et tradidit ea in manu ducum scutariorum, et eorum qui excubabant ad ostium domus regiæ.
verses.english: In place of these, King Rehoboam made bronze shields and entrusted them to the care of the commanders of the guards, who protected the entrance of the royal palace.

verses.latin: Cumque ingrederetur rex in domum Domini, portabant ea qui præcedebant, et reportabant ad armarium scutariorum.
verses.english: And whenever the king went into the house of the Lord, the guards who walked before him would carry these shields, and then return them to the guardroom.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Roboam, et omnium quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda ?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Et bellum fuit inter Roboam et Jeroboam cunctis diebus.
verses.english: There was continuous warfare between King Rehoboam and King Jeroboam throughout all their days.

verses.latin: Dormivit autem Roboam cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David : et nomen matris ejus Naama Ammanitis : et regnavit Abiam filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: And Rehoboam died and was laid to rest with his ancestors in the City of David. His mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonite woman. And his son Abijam reigned in his place.

verses.latin: In tempore illo ægrotavit Abia filius Jeroboam.
verses.english: At that time—while Jeroboam was reigning as king—his son, Abijah, became very ill.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jeroboam ad uxorem suam: Surge, et commuta vestem tuam, ne cognoscaris quod sis uxor Jeroboam: et vade in Silo, ubi est Ahias propheta, qui locutus est mihi quoniam rex futurus es super populum istum.
verses.english: And King Jeroboam said to his wife, "Get up, change your clothing so that no one will recognize that you are the queen, King Jeroboam's wife. Then go to Shiloh. Ahijah the prophet lives there—he's the one who told me that I would be king over this people, Israel."

verses.latin: Tolle tecum panes decem, et crustulam, et lagenam mellis, et ingredere ad illum: ipse dicet tibi quid futurum sit puero.
verses.english: "Take ten loaves of bread with you, along with some cakes and a jar of honey, and go to him. He will tell you what will happen to the child."

verses.latin: Fecitque uxor Jeroboam sicut locutus est ei: et consurgens abiit in Silo, et pervenit ad domum Ahiæ. Ahias autem non poterat videre, quia caligaverant oculi ejus præ senectute.
verses.english: So Jeroboam's wife did as her husband instructed. She got up, went to Shiloh, and arrived at Ahijah's house. Ahijah, however, could not see anything, because his eyes were dim and clouded due to his old age.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Ahiam: Ecce uxor Jeroboam ingreditur ut consulat te super filio suo, qui ægrotat: hæc et hæc loqueris ei. Cum ergo illa intraret, et dissimularet se esse,
verses.english: But the Lord God had already spoken to Ahijah, saying, "Look, Jeroboam's wife is coming to consult you about her son, who is sick. You are to tell her exactly this and this—all that I am about to reveal to you." So when she came in, she pretended to be someone else, to hide her identity.

verses.latin: audivit Ahias sonitum pedum ejus introëuntis per januam, et ait: Ingredere, uxor Jeroboam: quare dissimulas te esse? Ego autem missus sum ad te durus nuntius.
verses.english: As Ahijah heard the sound of her footsteps entering through the door, he said, "Come in, wife of Jeroboam! Why are you pretending to be someone else? I have been sent by God to you with a harsh message for your husband."

verses.latin: Vade, et dic Jeroboam: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Pro eo quod exaltavi te de medio populi, et dedi te ducem super populum meum Israël:
verses.english: "Go, and tell Jeroboam this: 'This is what the Lord God of Israel says: Because I lifted you up from among the common people and made you a leader over My people Israel—"

verses.latin: et scidi regnum de domo David, et dedi tibi illud: et non fuisti sicut servus meus David, qui custodivit mandata mea, et secutus est me in toto corde suo, faciens quod placitum esset in oculis meis:
verses.english: "—and I tore the kingdom away from the house of David and gave it to you, yet you have not been like My servant David, who kept My commandments and followed Me with all his heart, doing only what was pleasing in My sight—"

verses.latin: sed operatus es mala super omnes qui fuerunt ante te, et fecisti tibi deos alienos et conflatiles, ut me ad iracundiam provocares, me autem projecisti post tergum tuum:
verses.english: "—instead, you have done more evil than all who were before you. You have made other, false gods for yourself, and molten images, simply to provoke Me to anger. You have completely cast Me behind your back, disregarding My authority and My Law."

verses.latin: idcirco ecce ego inducam mala super domum Jeroboam, et percutiam de Jeroboam mingentem ad parietem, et clausum, et novissimum in Israël: et mundabo reliquias domus Jeroboam, sicut mundari solet fimus usque ad purum.
verses.english: "Therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam. I will cut off from Jeroboam every male, whether slave or free, even the last remaining one in Israel. I will thoroughly cleanse the remnants of Jeroboam's house, just as one cleans away dung until nothing is left."

verses.latin: Qui mortuus fuerit de Jeroboam in civitate, comedent eum canes: qui autem mortuus fuerit in agro, vorabunt eum aves cæli: quia Dominus locutus est.
verses.english: "Anyone belonging to Jeroboam who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs. And anyone of his family who dies in the open country will be devoured by the birds of the sky. This will happen because the Lord God Himself has spoken it."

verses.latin: Tu ergo surge, et vade in domum tuam: et in ipso introitu pedum tuorum in urbem, morietur puer.
verses.english: "So you, get up and go to your house. The very moment your feet enter the city, the boy, your son, will die."

verses.latin: Et planctus erit super eum ab universo Israël, et sepelient eum: iste enim solus infertur de Jeroboam in sepulchrum, eo quod inventum sit super eo verbum bonum ad Dominum Deum Israël in domo Jeroboam.
verses.english: "All of Israel will mourn for him, and they will bury him with honor. For of all Jeroboam's family, only this child will be brought to a proper burial, because in him alone was found some good intention toward the Lord God of Israel, even within the wicked house of Jeroboam."

verses.latin: Constituet autem sibi Dominus regem super Israël, qui excindat domum Jeroboam in hac die, et in hoc tempore.
verses.english: "Moreover, the Lord God will raise up for Himself a new king over Israel, who will completely cut off the house of Jeroboam—this will happen on that very day, at that very moment."

verses.latin: Et percutiet Dominus Israël sicut movetur arundo in aqua: et evulserit Israël de terra bona hac, quam dedit patribus eorum: et ventilabit eos trans fluvium, eo quod fecerint sibi lucos, ut inritarent Dominum.
verses.english: "And the Lord God will strike Israel, causing them to tremble and shake like a reed swaying in the water. He will uproot Israel from this good land that He gave to their fathers, and scatter them beyond the Euphrates River, because they have made sacred groves and Asherah poles—symbols of idolatry—to provoke the Lord God to anger."

verses.latin: Et tradet Dominus Israël propter peccata Jeroboam, qui peccavit, et peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: "The Lord God will abandon Israel because of the sins of Jeroboam, who himself sinned, and who also caused all of Israel to sin."

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque uxor Jeroboam, et abiit, et venit in Thersa: cumque illa ingrederetur limen domus, puer mortuus est.
verses.english: So Jeroboam's wife got up and left, and she came to Tirzah. And as she stepped over the threshold of her house, the boy died—just as the prophet had foretold.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt eum: et planxit illum omnis Israël juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est in manu servi sui Ahiæ prophetæ.
verses.english: They buried him, and all of Israel mourned for him, exactly as the Lord God had spoken through His servant, Ahijah the prophet.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jeroboam, quomodo pugnavit, et quomodo regnavit, ecce scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël.
verses.english: The rest of the acts of Jeroboam—how he fought wars and how he reigned as king—behold, they are written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Dies autem quibus regnavit Jeroboam, viginti duo anni sunt: et dormivit cum patribus suis: et regnavit Nadab filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: The days during which Jeroboam reigned were twenty-two years. Then he rested with his fathers—that is, he died and was buried. And his son, Nadab, began to reign in his place.

verses.latin: Roboam vero filius Salomonis regnavit in Juda. Quadraginta et unius anni erat Roboam cum regnare cœpisset: decem et septem annis regnavit in Jerusalem civitate, quam elegit Dominus ut poneret nomen suum ibi, ex omnibus tribubus Israël. Nomen autem matris ejus Naama Ammanitis.
verses.english: Now Rehoboam, Solomon's son, reigned over Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Lord God had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel to establish His Name there, as a place of true worship. His mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonitess.

verses.latin: Et fecit Judas malum coram Domino: et concitaverunt eum super omnibus quæ fecerant patres eorum in peccatis suis, et in æmulatione sua.
verses.english: And Judah did evil in the sight of the Lord God. They provoked Him to anger even more than all the sins their fathers had committed, through their own sins and their fervent idolatry.

verses.latin: Edificaverunt enim et ipsi sibi aras, et statuas, et lucos super omnem collem excelsum, et subter omne lignum frondosum.
verses.english: For they also built for themselves high places, sacred pillars, and Asherah poles for false worship upon every high hill and under every lush, green tree.

verses.latin: Sed et effeminati fuerunt in terra: feceruntque omnes abominationes gentium, quas abstulit Dominus a facie filiorum Israël.
verses.english: There were also male cult prostitutes, referred to as 'sodomites' by their pagan practices, in the land. They committed all the abominations of the pagan nations whom the Lord God had driven out from before the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Anno autem quinto regni Roboam, ascendit Sesac rex Ægypti in Jerusalem:
verses.english: Now, in the fifth year of King Rehoboam's reign, Shishak, the king of Egypt, marched against Jerusalem.

verses.latin: et tulit thesauros domus Domini, et thesauros regios, et universa diripuit: scuta quoque aurea, quæ fecerat Salomon, abstulit.
verses.english: He plundered the treasures of the house of the Lord God, and the royal palace treasures, and he carried off everything. He even took away the golden shields that King Solomon had made.

verses.latin: Pro quibus fecit rex Roboam scuta ærea, et tradidit ea in manu ducum scutariorum, et eorum qui excubabant ante fores domus regis.
verses.english: In place of the golden shields, King Rehoboam made bronze shields and entrusted them to the care of the captains of the guard, who protected the entrance of the royal palace.

verses.latin: Cumque ingrederetur rex in domum Domini, portabant ea qui præcedebant, et reportabant ad armarium scutariorum.
verses.english: Whenever the king would go into the house of the Lord God, the guards would carry the bronze shields before him, and then they would return them to the guardroom.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Roboam, et omnium quæ fecit, ecce scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda.
verses.english: The rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Judah.

verses.latin: Fuitque bellum inter Roboam et Jeroboam cunctis diebus.
verses.english: And there was continuous warfare between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout all their days.

verses.latin: Dormivit autem Roboam cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David: nomen autem matris ejus Naama Ammanitis. Et regnavit Abiam filius ejus pro eo.
