verses.english: Then Rehoboam rested with his fathers—meaning, he died and was buried with them in the City of David. His mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonitess. And his son, Abijam, began to reign in his place.

verses.latin: Anno octavodecimo regni Jeroboam filii Nabat, regnavit Abiam super Judam.
verses.english: In the eighteenth year of the reign of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, Abiam began his reign over the kingdom of Judah.

verses.latin: Tribus annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Maacha filia Absalom.
verses.english: He reigned in Jerusalem for three years. His mother's name was Maacha, and she was the daughter of Absalom.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in omnibus peccatis patris sui, quae fecerat ante eum: nec erat cor ejus perfectum cum Domino Deo suo, sicut cor David patris ejus.
verses.english: Abiam persisted in all the sins that his father had committed before him. His heart was not entirely dedicated to the Lord his God, unlike the heart of his ancestor, King David.

verses.latin: Sed propter David servum suum, dedit ei Dominus Deus suus lucernam in Jerusalem, ut suscitaret filium ejus post eum, et statueret Jerusalem.
verses.english: Nevertheless, because of His servant David, the Lord his God granted Abiam a lasting dynasty in Jerusalem, so that He would raise up a son to succeed him and ensure that Jerusalem remained steadfast.

verses.latin: Eo quod fecisset David rectum in oculis Domini, et non declinasset ab omnibus quae praeceperat ei cunctis diebus vitae suae, excepto sermone Uriae Hethaei.
verses.english: This was because David had done what was right in the sight of the Lord God and had not turned aside from anything the Lord had commanded him all the days of his life, with the single exception of the matter involving Urias the Hethite.

verses.latin: Bellum autem erat inter Roboam et Jeroboam cunctis diebus vitae eorum.
verses.english: There was continuous warfare between Roboam, Abiam's father, and Jeroboam throughout all their days.

verses.latin: Reliqa autem sermonum Abiam, et omnia quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda? Fuit quoque bellum inter Abiam et Jeroboam.
verses.english: As for the rest of Abiam's acts and all that he did, are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? There was also ongoing war between Abiam and Jeroboam.

verses.latin: Et dormivit Abiam cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in civitate David: et regnavit Asa filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Abiam died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David. Then his son Asa became king in his place.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo Jeroboam regis Israel, regnavit Asa rex Juda.
verses.english: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam's reign over Israel, Asa began to reign as king over Judah.

verses.latin: Quadraginta et uno anno regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Maacha filia Absalom.
verses.english: He reigned for forty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Maacha, the daughter of Absalom.

verses.latin: Fecitque Asa rectum in oculis Domini, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: Asa did what was right in the sight of the Lord God, just as his ancestor David had done.

verses.latin: Et abstulit effeminatos de terra, purgavitque omnes sordes idolorum, quae fecerant patres ejus.
verses.english: He expelled the male cult prostitutes from the land and purified Judah of all the abominable idols that his ancestors had made.

verses.latin: Insuper et Maacham matrem suam amovit ne esset princeps in sacris prius, eo quod in luco ejus simulacrum fecerat turpissimum: et succidit Asa simulacrum illud, et combussit in torrente Cedron.
verses.english: Furthermore, he even removed his queen mother Maacha from her position of authority because she had made a most abominable idol in a sacred grove. Asa cut down this idol and burned it in the Kidron Valley.

verses.latin: Excelsa autem non abstulit. Verumtamen cor Asa perfectum erat cum Domino cunctis diebus suis.
verses.english: However, he did not remove the high places, the unauthorized altars for worship. Nevertheless, Asa's heart was entirely devoted to the Lord God throughout his entire life.

verses.latin: Et intulit quae pater suus voverat, et quae ipse voverat, in domum Domini, argentum, et aurum, et vasa.
verses.english: Asa also brought into the house of the Lord the silver, gold, and vessels that his father had consecrated through vows, as well as those he himself had consecrated.

verses.latin: Bellum autem erat inter Asa et Baasa regem Israel cunctis diebus eorum.
verses.english: There was continuous warfare between Asa and Baasa, the king of Israel, throughout their reigns.

verses.latin: Et ascendit Baasa rex Israel in Judam, et aedificavit Rama, ut non egrederetur, quisquam, aut ingrederetur de regno Asa.
verses.english: Baasa, the king of Israel, went up against Judah and fortified the city of Rama. His intention was to prevent anyone from going out or coming in from Asa's kingdom.

verses.latin: Tollens itaque Asa omne argentum et aurum quod remanserat in thesauris domus Domini, et in thesauris regis, dedit illud in manus servorum suorum, et misit ad Benadad filium Tabremon filii Hezion regem Syriae, qui habitabat in Damasco, dicens:
verses.english: So Asa took all the remaining silver and gold from the treasuries of the house of the Lord and from the royal palace's treasuries. He entrusted it to his servants and sent them with a message to Benadad, the son of Tabremon, son of Hezion, who was king of Syria and resided in Damascus. Asa's message was:

verses.latin: Foedus est inter me et te, et inter patrem meum et patrem tuum: idcirco misi tibi munera, et aurum, et argentum, ut venias, et irritum facias foedus quod habes cum Baasa rege Israel, et recedat a me.
verses.english: Let there be an alliance between you and me, just as there was between my father and your father. I have sent you a gift of silver and gold for this reason: come and break your alliance with Baasa, king of Israel, so that he will withdraw his forces from me.

verses.latin: Acquiescens itaque Benadad regi Asa, misit principes exercitus sui in civitates Israel, et percussit Aion, et Dan, et Abeldomum Maacha, et universam Cineorth, totamque terram Nephthali.
verses.english: Benadad agreed to King Asa's proposal. He sent the commanders of his army to attack the cities of Israel, striking Aion, Dan, Abeldomum Maacha, the entire region of Cineorth, and all the land of Nephthali.

verses.latin: Quo audito, Baasa desiit aedificare Rama, et reversus est in Thersa.
verses.english: When Baasa heard this news, he ceased fortifying Rama and returned to Thersa.

verses.latin: Rex autem Asa nuntium misit in omnem Judam, dicens: Nemo excusetur: et tulerunt lapides, et ligna de Rama, quibus aedificaverat Baasa, et aedificavit ex eis rex Asa Gabaa Benjamin, et Maspha.
verses.english: Then King Asa issued a proclamation throughout all Judah, commanding that no one was to be excused from participating. They dismantled the stones and timbers from Rama, which Baasa had used for construction, and King Asa used those materials to fortify Geba of Benjamin and Mizpah.

verses.latin: Reliqa autem universorum sermonum Asa, et omnis fortitudo ejus, et cuncta quae fecit, et urbes quas extruxit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda? Verumtamen in tempore senectutis suae, doluit pedibus.
verses.english: As for the rest of Asa's acts, his full strength, all that he accomplished, and the cities he built, are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? However, in his old age, he suffered from a severe disease in his feet.

verses.latin: Et dormivit Asa cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David patris sui: et regnavit Josaphat filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Asa died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David, his forefather. Then his son Josaphat became king in his place.

verses.latin: Nadab vero filius Jeroboam regnavit super Israel anno secundo Asa regis Juda: regnavitque super Israel duobus annis.
verses.english: Nadab, the son of Jeroboam, began to reign over Israel in the second year of King Asa's reign over Judah. He reigned over Israel for two years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat in conspectu Domini: et ambulavit in viis patris sui, et in peccatis ejus quibus peccare fecerat Israel.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord God. He walked in the sinful ways of his father Jeroboam and perpetuated the sins by which his father had caused Israel to fall into idolatry.

verses.latin: Conjuravit autem contra eum Baasa filius Ahia de domo Issachar, et percussit eum in Gebbethon, quae est urbs Philisthinorum: siquidem Nadab et omnis Israel obsidebant Gebbethon.
verses.english: Baasa, the son of Ahia, from the tribe of Issachar, conspired against Nadab and struck him down in Gebbethon, a city belonging to the Philistines. At that time, Nadab and all of Israel were besieging Gebbethon.

verses.latin: Interfecit ergo illum Baasa anno tertio Asa regis Juda, et regnavit pro eo.
verses.english: So Baasa killed Nadab in the third year of King Asa's reign over Judah and became king in his place.

verses.latin: Cumque regnasset, percussit omnem domum Jeroboam: non dimisit cadaver de stirpe Jeroboam, donec deleret eum juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus fuerat in manu servi sui Ahia Silonitis.
verses.english: Once Baasa became king, he struck down the entire household of Jeroboam. He did not leave alive a single member of Jeroboam's lineage until he had utterly destroyed them all. This was in fulfillment of the word of the Lord God, which He had spoken through His servant Ahia the Shilonite.

verses.latin: Propter peccata Jeroboam, quae peccaverat, et quae peccare fecerat Israel, et propter iracundiam qua provocaverat Dominum Deum Israel.
verses.english: This destruction came about because of the sins Jeroboam had committed, and by which he had caused Israel to sin, and because of the great anger with which he had provoked the Lord God of Israel.

verses.latin: Reliqa autem sermonum Nadab, et omnia quae operatus est, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: As for the rest of Nadab's acts and all that he accomplished, are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Fuit quoque bellum inter Asa et Baasa regem Israel cunctis diebus eorum.
verses.english: There was continuous warfare between Asa and Baasa, the king of Israel, throughout their reigns.

verses.latin: Anno tertio Asa regis Juda, regnavit Baasa filius Ahia super omnem Israel in Thersa, viginti quatuor annis.
verses.english: In the third year of King Asa's reign over Judah, Baasa, the son of Ahia, began to reign over all Israel from Thersa. He reigned for twenty-four years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat in conspectu Domini: ambulavitque in viis Jeroboam, et in peccatis ejus, quibus peccare fecerat Israel.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord God, walking in the sinful ways of Jeroboam and perpetuating the sins by which Jeroboam had caused Israel to fall into idolatry.

verses.latin: Anno decimo octavo Jeroboam filii Nabat, regnavit Abiam super Juda.
verses.english: In the eighteenth year that Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, was king, Abiam began his reign over Judah.

verses.latin: Tribus annis regnavit in Jerusalem: et nomen matris ejus Maacha filia Abessalom.
verses.english: He reigned for three years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Maacha, daughter of Abessalom.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in omnibus peccatis patris sui, quae fecerat ante eum: nec erat cor ejus perfectum cum Domino Deo suo, sicut cor David patris ejus.
verses.english: He followed all the sinful ways that his father had established before him. His heart was not completely faithful to the Lord his God, unlike the heart of his ancestor David.

verses.latin: Sed propter David servum suum dedit ei Dominus Deus suus lucernam in Jerusalem, ut suscitaret semen ejus post eum, et statueret Jerusalem.
verses.english: But because of David, His servant, the Lord his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem—meaning He allowed his lineage to continue after him, ensuring Jerusalem's stability.

verses.latin: Eo quod fecisset David rectum in oculis Domini, et non declinasset ab omnibus quae praeceperat ei cunctis diebus vitae suae, excepto sermone Uriae Hethaei.
verses.english: For David had done what was right in the eyes of the Lord and had not turned aside from anything the Lord had commanded him all the days of his life, except in the matter concerning Uriah the Hittite.

verses.latin: Belli quoque fuit inter Roboam et Jeroboam cunctis diebus vitae eorum.
verses.english: There was also continuous war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout their lives.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Abiam, et omnia quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda? Fuitque bellum inter Abiam et Jeroboam.
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Abiam, and all that he did—are these not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Judah? There was also war between Abiam and Jeroboam.

verses.latin: Et dormivit Abiam cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in civitate David: regnavitque Asa filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Abiam then rested with his ancestors—meaning he died—and they buried him in the City of David. His son Asa became king in his place.

verses.latin: Anno vicesimo Jeroboam regis Israel, regnavit Asa rex Juda.
verses.english: In the twentieth year that Jeroboam was king of Israel, Asa began his reign as king of Judah.

verses.latin: Quadraginta et uno anno regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Maacha filia Abessalom.
verses.english: He reigned for forty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Maacha, daughter of Abessalom —this refers to his queen mother, who was his grandmother.

verses.latin: Fecitque Asa rectum ante conspectum Domini, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: Asa did what was right in the sight of the Lord, just as his ancestor David had done.

verses.latin: Et abstulit effeminatos de terra, purgavitque omnes sordes idolorum, quae fecerant patres ejus.
verses.english: He expelled the male cult prostitutes from the land and purified it from all the filthy idols that his ancestors had made.

verses.latin: Insuper et Maacham matrem suam amovit ne esset princeps in sacris prius, eo quod fecisset simulacrum in luco: et succidit Asa simulacrum illius, et combussit in torrente Cedron.
verses.english: Moreover, he removed Maacha, his own queen mother, from her position of power concerning the sacred rites, because she had made an abominable idol for the Asherah grove. Asa then cut down her idol and burned it in the Kidron Valley.

verses.latin: Excelsa autem non abstulit. Verumtamen cor Asa perfectum erat cum Domino cunctis diebus ejus.
verses.english: However, he did not remove the high places of worship. Nevertheless, Asa's heart was completely faithful to the Lord throughout all his days.

verses.latin: Intulitque ea quae voverat pater suus, et vota sua, domum Domini, argentum, et aurum, et vasa.
verses.english: He brought into the House of the Lord the silver, gold, and sacred vessels that his father had consecrated, along with his own consecrated gifts.

verses.latin: Bellum autem erat inter Asa et Baasa regem Israel cunctis diebus eorum.
verses.english: But there was constant warfare between Asa and Baasha, the king of Israel, throughout their lives.

verses.latin: Ascenditque Baasa rex Israel in Judam, et aedificavit Rama, ut non egrederetur, vel introiret quisquam de regno Asa.
verses.english: Baasha, the king of Israel, marched against Judah and began to fortify Ramah, intending to prevent anyone from leaving or entering Asa's kingdom.

verses.latin: Tollens itaque Asa omne argentum et aurum, quod reliquerat in thesauris domus Domini, et in thesauris regis, misit in manu servorum suorum ad Benadad filium Tabremon filii Hezion regem Syriae, qui habitabat in Damasco, dicens:
verses.english: So Asa took all the silver and gold that remained in the treasuries of the House of the Lord and in the king's treasuries. He sent it by the hand of his servants to Ben-Hadad, son of Tabremon, son of Hezion, the king of Syria, who lived in Damascus, saying:

verses.latin: Foedus est inter me et te, et inter patrem meum et patrem tuum: idcirco misi tibi munera, et aurum, et argentum: veni, et discede a Baasa rege Israel, ut auferatur a me.
verses.english: There is a treaty between me and you, just as there was between my ancestor and your ancestor. Therefore, I have sent you a gift of silver and gold. Come, break your alliance with Baasha, the king of Israel, so that he will withdraw from me.

verses.latin: Assentiensque Benadad regi Asa, misit principes exercitus sui in civitates Israel, et percussit Aion, et Dan, et Abeldomum Maacha, et universam Ceneroth, totamque terram Nephthali.
verses.english: Ben-Hadad agreed to King Asa's request and sent the commanders of his army against the cities of Israel. He attacked Ijon, Dan, Abel-Beth-Maachah, and all of Chinneroth, along with the entire land of Naphtali.

verses.latin: Auditoque hoc, Baasa desiit aedificare Rama, et reversus est in Thersa.
verses.english: When Baasha heard of this, he stopped fortifying Ramah and returned to Tirzah.

verses.latin: Rex autem Asa convocato omni Juda, nullo demisso, tulerunt lapides et ligna de Rama, quibus aedificabat Baasa: et aedificavit de eis rex Asa Gabaa Benjamin, et Maspha.
verses.english: King Asa then summoned all of Judah, leaving no one behind. They carried away the stones and timber from Ramah that Baasha had been using for construction. King Asa then used these materials to fortify Geba of Benjamin and Mizpah.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem universorum sermonum Asa, et omnis fortitudo ejus, et cuncta quae fecit, et civitates quas aedificavit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda? Verumtamen in tempore senectutis suae, passus est pedes.
verses.english: Now, the rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities that he built—are these not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Judah? However, in the time of his old age, he suffered from a severe foot disease.

verses.latin: Et dormivit Asa cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David patris sui: et regnavit Josaphat filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Asa then rested with his ancestors—meaning he died—and was buried with them in the City of David, his ancestor. His son Jehoshaphat became king in his place.

verses.latin: Nadab vero filius Jeroboam regnavit super Israel anno secundo Asa regis Juda: regnavitque super Israel duobus annis.
verses.english: Nadab, the son of Jeroboam, became king over Israel in the second year of King Asa of Judah. He reigned over Israel for two years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat in conspectu Domini, et ambulavit in viis patris sui, et in peccatis ejus quibus peccare fecerat Israel.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and walked in the ways of his father, and in the sins by which he had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: Conjuravit autem contra eum Baasa filius Ahia de domo Issachar, et percussit eum in Gebbethon, quae est urbs Philisthinorum: siquidem Nadab et omnis Israel obsidebant Gebbethon.
verses.english: Baasha, the son of Ahijah, from the house of Issachar, conspired against him. Baasha struck him down in Gibbethon, a city belonging to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel were at that time besieging Gibbethon.

verses.latin: Interfecit igitur illum Baasa anno tertio Asa regis Juda, et regnavit pro eo.
verses.english: So Baasha killed Nadab in the third year of King Asa of Judah and became king in his place.

verses.latin: Cumque regnasset, percussit omnem domum Jeroboam: non dimisit ex eo nec unam animam donec deleret eam, juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus fuerat in manu servi sui Ahiae Silonitis:
verses.english: When Baasha began his reign, he struck down everyone in the house of Jeroboam. He did not leave a single living soul until he had utterly destroyed them all, according to the word of the Lord which He had spoken through His servant Ahijah the Shilonite.

verses.latin: Propter peccata Jeroboam, quae peccaverat, et quibus peccare fecerat Israel: et propter offensionem qua concitaverat Dominum Deum Israel ad iracundiam.
verses.english: This was because of Jeroboam's sins, which he had committed and by which he had led Israel into sin. It was also because of the offense by which he had provoked the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Nadab, et omnia quae operatus est, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did—are these not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Fuitque bellum inter Asa et Baasa regem Israel cunctis diebus eorum.
verses.english: There was also continuous warfare between Asa and Baasha, the king of Israel, throughout their lives.

verses.latin: Anno tertio Asa regis Juda, regnavit Baasa filius Ahia super omnem Israel in Thersa viginti et quatuor annis.
verses.english: In the third year of King Asa of Judah, Baasha, the son of Ahijah, began his reign over all Israel in Tirzah. He reigned for twenty-four years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat in conspectu Domini, et ambulavit in viis Jeroboam, et in peccatis ejus quibus peccare fecerat Israel.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and walked in the ways of Jeroboam, and in the sins by which he had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: Et advenit sermo Domini ad Jehu filium Hanani contra Baasa dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Jehu, the son of Hanani, concerning Baasha, saying:

verses.latin: Pro eo quod exaltavi te de pulvere, et posui te ducem super populum meum Israel, et tu ambulasti in via Jeroboam, et peccare fecisti populum meum Israel, irritans me in peccatis eorum:
verses.english: Because I elevated you from the dust and appointed you as leader over My people Israel, yet you walked in the ways of Jeroboam and caused My people Israel to sin, provoking Me to anger with their sins:

verses.latin: Ecce ego auferam posteritatem Baasa, et posteritatem domus ejus, et faciam domum tuam sicut domum Jeroboam filii Nabat.
verses.english: Behold, I will utterly sweep away the descendants of Baasha and the descendants of his house. I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat.

verses.latin: Qui mortuus fuerit de Baasa in civitate, comedent eum canes: qui autem mortuus fuerit ex eo in agro, vorabunt eum volucres caeli.
verses.english: Whoever belonging to Baasha dies in the city, dogs will devour him; and whoever belonging to him dies in the open country, the birds of the sky will consume him.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Baasa, et universa quae fecit, et proelia ejus, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Baasha, and all that he did, and his mighty deeds—are these not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Et dormivit Baasa cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Thersa: et regnavit Ela filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Baasha then rested with his ancestors—meaning he died—and was buried in Tirzah. His son Elah became king in his place.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo verbum Domini ad Iehu filium Hanani prophetam contra Baasa, dicens:
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord God gave His message to Jehu, the son of Hanani, a prophet, directly against King Baasha, saying:

verses.latin: Pro eo quod exaltavi te de pulvere, et posui te ducem super populum meum Israel, tu autem ambulasti in via Ieroboam, et peccare fecisti populum meum Israel, provocans me in offensis eorum:
verses.english: “I raised you up from nothing, and I made you the ruler over My people, Israel. But you have behaved exactly like King Jeroboam.

verses.latin: ecce ego auferam posteriora Baasa, et posteriora domus eius, et faciam domum tuam sicut domum Ieroboam filii Nabat.
verses.english: You have caused My people, Israel, to sin, and you have provoked My anger with their sins. Because of this, I will utterly wipe out Baasha and his entire family line.

verses.latin: Qui mortui fuerint de Baasa in civitate, comedent eos canes: qui autem mortui fuerint ex eo in agro, comedent eos volucres caeli.”
verses.english: I will make your family like the family of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat. Those who die from Baasha’s family in the city will be eaten by dogs, and those who die in the field will be eaten by the birds of the sky.”

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Baasa, et universa quae fecit, et proelia eius, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: All the other events concerning King Baasha, everything he did, and all his battles — these are recorded in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel, are they not?

verses.latin: Dormivit ergo Baasa cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Thersa: regnavitque Ela filius eius pro eo.
verses.english: So Baasha died and was buried in Tirzah. Then his son, Ela, became king after him.

verses.latin: Cum autem in manu Iehu filii Hanani prophetae, verbum Domini factum esset contra Baasa, et contra domum eius, et contra omne malum quod fecerat coram Domino, ad irritandum eum in operibus manuum suarum, ut fieret sicut domus Ieroboam: ob hanc causam occidit eum, id est, Iehu filium Hanani prophetae.
verses.english: Indeed, the Lord’s message had come through the prophet Jehu, son of Hanani, against Baasha and his household. This was because of all the evil he had done in the sight of the Lord, provoking Him to anger with the work of his hands, making his house become like the house of Jeroboam. For this very reason, Jehu, the son of Hanani the prophet, had struck him down.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo sexto Asa regis Iuda, regnavit Ela filius Baasa super Israel in Thersa duobus annis.
verses.english: In the twenty-sixth year of King Asa’s reign in Judah, Ela, the son of Baasha, began to reign over Israel in Tirzah. He reigned for two years.

verses.latin: Et insurrexit adversus eum famulus suus Zambri, dux medietatis equitum: cumque esset in Thersa bibens luxuriose in domo Arsa praefecti Thersa:
verses.english: Then Zambri, one of his officials who commanded half his chariots, conspired against him. One day, Ela was in Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arsa, who was in charge of the palace there.

verses.latin: ingressus Zambri percussit, et interfecit eum, anno vigesimo septimo Asa regis Iuda: regnavitque pro eo.
verses.english: Zambri entered and struck him down, killing him. This happened in the twenty-seventh year of King Asa’s reign in Judah. Then Zambri became king in Ela’s place.

verses.latin: Cumque regnasset, et sedisset super solium eius, percussit omnem domum Baasa, et non reliquit ex eo mingentem ad parietem, et propinquos, et amicos eius.
verses.english: As soon as Zambri began to reign and was seated on Ela’s throne, he wiped out Baasha’s entire family line. He left no male alive, nor any of his relatives or friends.

verses.latin: Delevit ergo Zambri omnem domum Baasa juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus est ad Baasa in manu Iehu prophetae,
verses.english: So Zambri destroyed Baasha’s entire family, exactly as the Lord God had spoken to Baasha through the prophet Jehu.

verses.latin: propter universa peccata Baasa, et peccata Ela filii eius, qui peccaverunt, et peccare fecerunt Israel, provocantes Dominum Deum Israel in vanitatibus suis.
verses.english: This was for all the sins of Baasha and the sins of his son Ela. They had sinned and had led Israel into sin, provoking the Lord God of Israel with their empty idols.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Ela, et universa quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: All the other events concerning King Ela and everything he did — these are recorded in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel, are they not?

verses.latin: Mense septimo, anno vigesimo septimo Asa regis Iuda, regnavit Zambri septem diebus in Thersa: exercitus autem obsidebat Gebbethon urbem Philisthinorum.
verses.english: In the twenty-seventh year of King Asa’s reign in Judah, Zambri reigned for seven days in Tirzah. At this time, the Israelite army was besieging Gibbethon, a city belonging to the Philistines.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset populus, et omnis Israel, quod regnasset Zambri, et quod occidisset rex, omnis Israel constituit Amri principem militiae super se regem in die illa in castris.
verses.english: When the army and all Israel heard that Zambri had rebelled and had killed the king, all Israel proclaimed Amri, the commander of the army, as their king right there in the camp on that very day.

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo Amri, et omnis Israel cum eo de Gebbethon, et obsederunt Thersa.
verses.english: So Amri and all Israel with him marched up from Gibbethon and besieged Tirzah.

verses.latin: Vidit autem Zambri quod expugnaretur civitas: et ingressus domum regiam, atque succendens se cum regia, obiit
verses.english: When Zambri saw that the city was about to be captured, he went into the royal palace. He then set fire to the palace and burned himself to death inside it.

verses.latin: in peccatis suis, quae peccaverat, ut faceret malum coram Domino, et ambularet in via Ieroboam, et in peccatis eius, quibus peccare fecerat Israel.
verses.english: He died because of the sins he had committed. He had done evil in the sight of the Lord, following the path of Jeroboam and the sins by which Jeroboam had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Zambri, et seditio eius, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: All the other events concerning King Zambri and his conspiracy — these are recorded in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel, are they not?

verses.latin: Tunc divisus est populus Israel in duas partes: media pars populi sequebatur Thebni filium Gyneth, ut regnaret: et media pars Amri.
verses.english: At that time, the people of Israel were divided into two factions. One half of the people followed Thebni, the son of Gyneth, wanting him to be king, while the other half followed Amri.

verses.latin: Praevaluit autem populus Amri super populum Thebni filii Gyneth: mortuusque est Thebni, et regnavit Amri.
verses.english: However, the people supporting Amri eventually became stronger than the people supporting Thebni, son of Gyneth. So Thebni died, and Amri became the sole king.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo primo Asa regis Iuda, regnavit Amri super Israel duodecim annis: in Thersa regnavit sex annis.
verses.english: In the thirty-first year of King Asa’s reign in Judah, Amri began to reign over Israel for a total of twelve years. He reigned in Tirzah for six of those years.

verses.latin: Et emit montem Samariae a Semer quadringentis talentis argenti: et aedificavit in monte, et vocavit nomen civitatis quam exstruxit, Samaria, nomine Semer domini montis.
verses.english: Amri bought the hill of Samaria from Semer for two talents of silver. He built a city on this hill and named the city he built Samaria, after Semer, the original owner of the hill.

verses.latin: Fecit autem Amri malum in conspectu Domini: et operatus est nequiter super omnes qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: Amri did evil in the sight of the Lord God. He acted with greater wickedness than all the kings who had been before him.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in omni via Ieroboam filii Nabat, et in peccatis eius quibus peccare fecerat Israel, ut concitaret Dominum Deum Israel in vanitatibus suis.
verses.english: He walked in every way of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and in his sins by which Jeroboam had caused Israel to sin. This was so he would provoke the Lord God of Israel to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Amri, et proelia eius, quae gessit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: All the other events concerning King Amri, and the battles he fought — these are recorded in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel, are they not?

verses.latin: Dormivit Amri cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Samaria: regnavitque Achab filius eius pro eo.
verses.english: So Amri died and was buried in Samaria. Then his son, Achab, became king after him.

verses.latin: Achab vero filius Amri regnavit super Israel anno trigesimo octavo Asa regis Iuda: et regnavit Achab filius Amri super Israel in Samaria viginti et duobus annis.
verses.english: Achab, the son of Amri, began to reign over Israel in the thirty-eighth year of King Asa’s reign in Judah. Achab, the son of Amri, reigned over Israel in Samaria for twenty-two years.

verses.latin: Et fecit Achab filius Amri malum in conspectu Domini super omnes qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: Achab, the son of Amri, did even more evil in the sight of the Lord God than all the kings who had been before him.

verses.latin: Nec suffecerat ei ut ambularet in peccatis Ieroboam filii Nabat: insuper duxit uxorem Iezabel filiam Ethbaal regis Sidoniorum, et abiit, et servivit Baal, et adoravit eum.
verses.english: It was not enough for him merely to follow in the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat. Additionally, he married Jezabel, the daughter of Ethbaal, king of the Sidonians. Then he went and served Baal, even worshipping him.

verses.latin: Et erexit aram Baal in templo Baal, quod aedificaverat in Samaria:
verses.english: He even erected an altar for Baal in the temple of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.

verses.latin: et lucum plantavit: et addidit Achab faciens opera quae irritarent Dominum Deum Israel, super omnes reges Israel qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: He also set up a sacred pole for Asherah. Achab did more to provoke the Lord God of Israel to anger than all the kings of Israel who had been before him.

verses.latin: In diebus eius Hiel de Bethel aedificavit Iericho in primogenito suo Abiram fundavit eam: et in novissimo suo Segub posuit portas eius, juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus fuerat in manu Iosue filii Nun.
verses.english: In Achab’s days, Hiel of Bethel rebuilt Jericho. He laid its foundation at the cost of his firstborn son Abiram, and he set up its gates at the cost of his youngest son Segub. This happened exactly as the Lord God had spoken through Joshua, the son of Nun, many years before.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo verbum Domini ad Jehu filium Hanani prophetam, contra Baasa, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord’s message then came to Jehu, who was a prophet and the son of Hanani. This message was against Baasa, and it said:

verses.latin: Pro eo quod exaltavi te de pulvere, et posui te ducem super populum meum Israël, et tu ambulasti in via Jeroboam, et peccare fecisti populum meum Israël, irritans me in peccatis tuis,
verses.english: “I raised you from obscurity and appointed you as leader over my people, Israel. But you followed the ways of Jeroboam, and you caused my people Israel to sin, thereby provoking My anger with your sins.

verses.latin: ecce ego auferam posteriora Baasa et posteriora domus ejus, et faciam domum tuam sicut domum Jeroboam filii Nabat.
verses.english: Behold, I will wipe out all of Baasa’s descendants and his entire household. I will make your household like that of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat.

verses.latin: Qui mortuus fuerit de Baasa in civitate, comedent eum canes: et qui mortuus fuerit ex eo in agro, comedent eum volucres caeli.
verses.english: Anyone from Baasa’s household who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs. And anyone from his household who dies in the open country will be eaten by the birds of the sky.”

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Baasa, et cuncta quæ fecit, et prælia ejus, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: The rest of Baasa’s deeds, all that he accomplished, and his battles—are these not all written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivit ergo Baasa cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Thersa: et regnavit Ela filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Baasa then rested with his ancestors and was buried in Thirsa. Then his son Ela reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Sed et per manum Jehu filii Hanani prophetæ, verbum Domini factum est contra Baasa et contra domum ejus, et contra omne malum quod fecerat coram Domino, ut irritaret eum in operibus manuum suarum, ut fieret sicut domus Jeroboam, ob hanc causam occidit eum, id est, Jehu filium Hanani prophetam.
verses.english: Indeed, through the prophet Jehu, son of Hanani, the Lord’s message also came against Baasa and against his household. This was because of all the evil he had done before the Lord, provoking Him to anger with the works of his own hands, so that his household would become like the household of Jeroboam. For this reason, the Lord struck him down, as declared by Jehu, the prophet and son of Hanani.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo sexto Asa regis Juda, regnavit Ela filius Baasa super Israël in Thersa, duobus annis.
verses.english: In the twenty-sixth year of King Asa of Judah’s reign, Ela, Baasa’s son, began to reign over Israel in Thirsa. He reigned for two years.

verses.latin: Et facta est contra eum conjuratio a servo suo Zamri, qui erat dux medietatis equitum: porro Ela erat in Thersa bibens et inebrians se in domo Arsa præfecti Thersa.
verses.english: Then his servant Zamri conspired against him. Zamri was the commander of half of Ela’s chariots. Ela, meanwhile, was in Thirsa, drinking and getting drunk in the house of Arsa, who was in charge of Thirsa’s palace.

verses.latin: Irruens itaque Zamri percussit et interfecit eum, anno vigesimo septimo Asa regis Juda, et regnavit pro eo.
verses.english: So Zamri rushed in, attacked, and killed Ela in the twenty-seventh year of King Asa of Judah’s reign. Then Zamri reigned in Ela’s place.

verses.latin: Cumque regnasset, et sedisset super solium ejus, percussit omnem domum Baasa, et non dimisit ex eo mingentem ad parietem, et propinquos et amicos ejus.
verses.english: As soon as Zamri began to reign and was seated on Ela’s throne, he struck down Baasa’s entire household. He did not leave alive a single male from Baasa’s family, nor any of his relatives or friends.

verses.latin: Delevit ergo Zamri omnem domum Baasa juxta verbum Domini quod locutus est ad Baasa in manu Jehu prophetæ,
verses.english: So Zamri completely destroyed Baasa’s entire household, just as the Lord had declared against Baasa through the prophet Jehu.

verses.latin: propter universa peccata Baasa, et peccata Ela filii ejus, qui peccaverunt, et peccare fecerunt Israël, provocantes Dominum Deum Israël in vanitatibus suis.
verses.english: This destruction was for all the sins of Baasa and the sins of his son Ela, which they committed and which they caused Israel to commit, thereby provoking the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Ela, et omnia quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: The rest of Ela’s deeds, and all that he accomplished—are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Mense Theboth, anno vigesimo septimo Asa regis Juda, regnavit Zamri septem diebus in Thersa. Porro exercitus obsidebat Gabathone Philisthinorum.
verses.english: In the month of Theboth, in the twenty-seventh year of King Asa of Judah’s reign, Zamri reigned for seven days in Thirsa. Meanwhile, the army of Israel was besieging Gabathon, a city of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset populus qui obsidebat, et dictum esset: Regnavit Zamri, et occidit regem: constituit sibi populus omne Israël Amri ducem exercitus super Israël in die illa.
verses.english: When the people who were besieging Gabathon heard that Zamri had conspired and killed the king, all the people of Israel appointed their army commander, Amri, as king over Israel that very day.

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo Amri, et omnis Israël cum eo de Gabathone, et obsederunt Thersa.
verses.english: So Amri and all Israel with him marched up from Gabathon and besieged Thirsa.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Zamri quod oppidum caperetur, ingressus est domum regiam, et succendit se cum domo regia: et mortuus est
verses.english: When Zamri saw that the city was about to be captured, he went into the king’s palace and set fire to himself along with the palace. Thus he died.

verses.latin: in peccatis suis, quæ peccaverat, ut faceret malum coram Domino, et ambularet in via Jeroboam, et in peccatis ejus, quibus peccare fecerat Israël.
verses.english: He died because of his sins, which he had committed by doing evil in the Lord’s sight, by following the way of Jeroboam, and by the sins with which he had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Zamri, et conjuratio ejus atque tyrannidas, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: The rest of Zamri’s deeds, his conspiracy, and his acts of tyranny—are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Tunc divisus est populus Israël in duas partes: medietas populi sequebatur Thebni filium Gineth, ut regnaret: et medietas altera Amri.
verses.english: Then the people of Israel were divided into two factions. Half of the people followed Thebni, son of Gineth, wanting him to be king, while the other half followed Amri.

verses.latin: Præevaluit autem populus Amri, populo Thebni filii Gineth: et mortuus est Thebni, et regnavit Amri.
verses.english: However, Amri’s supporters proved stronger than the supporters of Thebni, son of Gineth. So Thebni died, and Amri began to reign.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo primo Asa regis Juda, regnavit Amri super Israël duodecim annis: in Thersa regnavit sex annis.
verses.english: In the thirty-first year of King Asa of Judah’s reign, Amri began to reign over Israel for twelve years. He reigned in Thirsa for six of those years.

verses.latin: Et emit montem Samariæ a Semer centum talentis argenti: et ædificavit in monte, et vocavit nomen civitatis quam extruxerat, Samaria, nomine Semer dominatoris montis.
verses.english: He bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for one hundred talents of silver. He built a city on this hill and named the city he founded Samaria, after Shemer, the original owner of the hill.

verses.latin: Fecit autem Amri malum in conspectu Domini: et operatus est nequiter super omnes qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: Amri did evil in the Lord’s sight, acting more wickedly than all who had come before him.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in omni via Jeroboam filii Nabat, et in peccatis ejus quibus peccare fecerat Israël: ut irritaret Dominum Deum Israël in vanitatibus suis.
verses.english: He followed the path of Jeroboam, son of Nebat, and continued in his sins, which caused Israel to sin. This provoked the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Amri, et prælia ejus quæ gessit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: The rest of Amri’s deeds, and the battles he fought—are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivit Amri cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Samaria: et regnavit Achab filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Amri then rested with his ancestors and was buried in Samaria. His son Achab reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Achab vero filius Amri regnavit super Israël anno trigesimo octavo Asa regis Juda. Et regnavit Achab filius Amri super Israël in Samaria viginti duobus annis.
verses.english: Achab, Amri’s son, began to reign over Israel in the thirty-eighth year of King Asa of Judah’s reign. Achab, Amri’s son, reigned over Israel in Samaria for twenty-two years.

verses.latin: Et fecit Achab filius Amri malum in conspectu Domini super omnes qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: Achab, Amri’s son, did more evil in the Lord’s sight than all who had come before him.

verses.latin: Nec suffecerat ei ut ambularet in peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat: insuper duxit uxorem Jezabel filiam Ethbaal regis Sidoniorum, et abiit, et servivit Baal, et adoravit eum.
verses.english: It was not enough for him to follow the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nebat. Additionally, he took Jezabel, the daughter of Ethbaal, king of the Sidonians, as his wife. Then he went and served Baal and worshipped him.

verses.latin: Et erexit aram Baal in templo Baal, quod ædificaverat in Samaria:
verses.english: He even built an altar for Baal in the temple of Baal, which he had constructed in Samaria.

verses.latin: et fecit lucum, et addidit Achab faciens opera quæ irritarent Dominum Deum Israël super omnes reges Israël qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: Achab also made an idolatrous pole and continued to do more to provoke the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel who had come before him.

verses.latin: In diebus ejus ædificavit Hiel de Bethel Jericho in primogenito suo Abiram fundavit eam, et in novissimo suo Segub posuit portas ejus, juxta verbum Domini quod locutus est in manu Josue filii Nun.
verses.english: In Achab’s days, Hiel of Bethel rebuilt Jericho. He laid its foundation at the cost of his firstborn son, Abiram, and he set up its gates at the cost of his youngest son, Segub. This happened exactly as the Lord had declared through Josue, son of Nun, many years before.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo verbum Domini ad Jehu filium Hanani prophetam, contra Baasa, dicens:
verses.english: Now, the word of the Lord came to Jehu, the son of Hanani, who was a prophet. It was a word against Baasa, saying:

verses.latin: Pro eo quod exaltavi te de pulvere, et posui te ducem super populum meum Israel, et tu ambulasti in via Jeroboam, et peccare fecisti populum meum Israel, irritans me in peccatis eorum:
verses.english: Because I raised you up from the dust, and I appointed you as a leader over my people, Israel, yet you walked in the ways of Jeroboam. You made my people, Israel, commit sin, thus provoking me to anger with their sins.

verses.latin: ecce ego auferam posteriora Baasa, et posteriora domus ejus, et faciam domum tuam sicut domum Jeroboam filii Nabat.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, I will completely sweep away Baasa's descendants, and the descendants of his household. I will make your household like the household of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat.

verses.latin: Qui mortui fuerint de Baasa in civitate, comedent eos canes: qui autem mortui fuerint ex eo in regione, comedent eos volucres caeli.
verses.english: Those of Baasa's family who die within the city will be devoured by dogs. And those of his family who die out in the countryside will be consumed by the birds of the sky.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Baasa, et universa quae fecit, et proelia ejus, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Baasa, and all that he accomplished, and his battles—are these not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivit ergo Baasa cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Thersa: et regnavit Ela filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Baasa passed away and was buried in Thersa. Then his son Ela became king in his place.

verses.latin: Cum autem in manu Jehu filii Hanani prophetæ, sermo Domini factus esset contra Baasa et contra domum ejus, et contra omne malum quod fecerat coram Domino ad iracundiam provocans eum in operibus manuum suarum, ut fieret sicut domus Jeroboam, ob hanc causam occidit eum, id est, Jehu filius Hanani prophetæ.
verses.english: Indeed, it was through the hand of Jehu, the son of Hanani, the prophet, that the word of the Lord came against Baasa and against his household. It was against all the wickedness he had done before the Lord, provoking Him to anger with the works of his own hands—so that his house would become like the house of Jeroboam. It was for this very reason that the Lord's judgment brought about his end, as pronounced by Jehu, the son of Hanani, the prophet.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo sexto Asa regis Juda, regnavit Ela filius Baasa super Israel in Thersa duobus annis.
verses.english: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa, king of Judah, Ela, the son of Baasa, began to reign over Israel in Thersa. He reigned for two years.

verses.latin: Et rebellavit adversus eum famulus suus Zambri, dux medietatis equitum: cumque esset in Thersa bibens luxuriose in domo Arsa praefecti Thersa:
verses.english: And Zambri, his servant and the captain of half his chariots, rebelled against him. Now, Ela was in Thersa, drinking excessively and indulging himself in the house of Arsa, who was the governor of Thersa.

verses.latin: ingressus Zambri percussit et interfecit eum, anno vigesimo septimo Asa regis Juda, et regnavit pro eo.
verses.english: Zambri went in, struck him down, and killed him. This happened in the twenty-seventh year of Asa, king of Judah, and then Zambri became king in Ela's place.

verses.latin: Cumque regnasset, et sedisset super solium ejus, percussit omnem domum Baasa, et non dimisit ex eo mingentem ad parietem, et proximos et amicos ejus.
verses.english: As soon as Zambri began his reign and took his seat on the throne, he struck down the entire household of Baasa. He did not leave alive a single male descendant, nor any of his relatives or friends.

verses.latin: Delevit ergo Zambri omnem domum Baasa juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus fuerat ad Jehu prophetam contra Baasa,
verses.english: So Zambri completely destroyed the entire household of Baasa. This was exactly according to the word of the Lord, which He had spoken through Jehu the prophet, against Baasa.

verses.latin: in omnibus peccatis Baasa, et peccatis Ela filii ejus, qui peccaverunt et peccare fecerunt Israel, irritantes Dominum Deum Israel in vanitatibus suis.
verses.english: This destruction was on account of all the sins of Baasa, and the sins of his son Ela. They sinned themselves and also caused Israel to sin, provoking the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Ela, et universa quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Ela, and all that he accomplished—are these not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Mense vigesimo septimo Asa regis Juda, regnavit Zambri septem diebus in Thersa: populus autem obsidebat Gebbethon urbem Philisthinorum.
verses.english: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa, king of Judah, Zambri reigned for only seven days in Thersa. At that time, the Israelite army was besieging Gebbethon, a city of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset populus obsidionis, et omnes Israel quod transtulisset Zambri regnum, et quod percussisset regem, constituit sibi omne Israel Amri ducem exercitus regem super Israel in die illa in castris.
verses.english: When the army besieging the city, and all of Israel, heard that Zambri had taken the kingdom by force and had murdered the king, all of Israel, on that very day, in the military camp, appointed Omri, the commander of the army, as king over Israel.

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo Amri, et omnis Israel cum eo de Gebbethon, et obsederunt Thersa.
verses.english: So Omri, with all of Israel who were with him, marched up from Gebbethon and laid siege to Thersa.

verses.latin: Viditque Zambri quod expugnaretur civitas, et se opprimi, ingressus curiam regiam domus regiae, succendit super se domum regiam igni, et mortuus est.
verses.english: When Zambri saw that the city was being captured and that he himself was about to be overcome, he went into the royal palace, to the inner citadel of the king's house. He then set the king's house on fire around himself, and he died in the flames.

verses.latin: In peccatis suis, quae peccavit faciens malum coram Domino, et ambulans in via Jeroboam, et in peccato ejus quo peccare fecit Israel.
verses.english: This was due to his sins, which he committed by doing evil in the sight of the Lord. He walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin, he led Israel to sin.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Zambri, et de conspiratione et tyrannide ejus, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Zambri, and his conspiracy and his tyrannical rule—are these not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Tunc divisi sunt populi Israel in duas partes: media pars populi sequebatur Thebni filium Gineth, ut regnaret, et media pars Amri.
verses.english: At that time, the people of Israel were divided into two factions. Half of the people followed Thebni, the son of Gineth, wanting him to be king, while the other half followed Omri.

verses.latin: Prevaluit autem populus qui erat cum Amri, populo qui sequebatur Thebni filium Gineth: et mortuus est Thebni, et regnavit Amri.
verses.english: However, the people who were with Omri proved stronger than the people who followed Thebni, the son of Gineth. So Thebni died, and Omri began to reign.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo primo Asa regis Juda, regnavit Amri super Israel duodecim annis: in Thersa regnavit sex annis.
verses.english: In the thirty-first year of Asa, king of Judah, Omri became king over Israel. He reigned for twelve years in total, and for six of those years, he reigned in Thersa.

verses.latin: Et emit montem Samariae a Semer quadringentis talentis argenti: et aedificavit in monte, et vocavit nomen civitatis quam exstruxerat, nomine Semer domini montis, Samariam.
verses.english: He then purchased the hill of Samaria from Semer for four hundred talents of silver. He built a city on that hill, and he named the city he had constructed Samaria, after Semer, the original owner of the hill.

verses.latin: Fecit autem Amri malum in conspectu Domini, et operatus est nequiter super omnes qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: Omri did evil in the sight of the Lord, and he acted more wickedly than all those who had been kings before him.

verses.latin: Et ambulavit in omni via Jeroboam filii Nabat, et in peccatis ejus quibus peccare fecerat Israel, ut irritaret Dominum Deum Israel in vanitatibus suis.
verses.english: He walked in every way of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, and in the sins by which Jeroboam had caused Israel to sin. Omri did all of this to provoke the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Amri, et universa opera ejus quae operatus est, et proelia ejus, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Omri, and all the works he accomplished, and his battles—are these not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Et dormivit Amri cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Samaria: et regnavit Achab filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Omri passed away and was buried in Samaria. Then his son Achab became king in his place.

verses.latin: Achab vero filius Amri regnavit super Israel anno trigesimo octavo Asa regis Juda: et regnavit Achab filius Amri super Israel in Samaria viginti et duobus annis.
verses.english: Achab, the son of Omri, became king over Israel in the thirty-eighth year of Asa, king of Judah. Achab, the son of Omri, reigned over Israel in Samaria for twenty-two years.

verses.latin: Et fecit Achab filius Amri malum in conspectu Domini super omnes qui fuerunt ante eum.
verses.english: Achab, the son of Omri, did more evil in the sight of the Lord than all the kings who had been before him.

verses.latin: Nec suffecerat ei ut ambularet in peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat: insuper duxit uxorem Jezabel filiam Ethbaal regis Sidoniorum, et abiit, et servivit Baal, et adoravit eum.
verses.english: It was not enough for him merely to walk in the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat. In addition, he took Jezabel, the daughter of Ethbaal, king of the Sidonians, as his wife. Then he went and served Baal, and he worshipped that false god.

verses.latin: Et erexit aram Baal in templo Baal, quod ædificaverat in Samaria.
verses.english: He even erected an altar for Baal inside the temple of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et fecit lucum, et addidit Achab faciens opera mala super omnes reges Israel, qui fuerunt ante eum, ad irritandum Dominum Deum Israel.
verses.english: He also made an Asherah pole—a pagan idol dedicated to a goddess. Achab added even more wicked deeds, surpassing all the kings of Israel who had been before him, all in order to provoke the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger.

verses.latin: In diebus ejus Hiel de Bethel ædificavit Jericho: in primogenito suo Abiram fundavit eam, et in novissimo suo Segub posuit portas ejus, juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus fuerat in manu Josue filii Nun.
verses.english: In Achab's days, Hiel of Bethel rebuilt Jericho. He laid its foundation at the cost of his firstborn son, Abiram, and he set up its gates at the cost of his youngest son, Segub. This happened according to the word of the Lord, which He had spoken through Joshua, the son of Nun, many centuries earlier.

verses.latin: Et dixit Elias Thesbites de habitatoribus Galaad ad Achab: Vivit Dominus Deus Israel, in cujus conspectu sto, si erit annis his ros et pluvia, nisi per sermonem oris mei.
verses.english: And Elijah the Tishbite, one of the settlers from Gilead, said to King Ahab: "As the Lord God of Israel lives, in whose presence I serve, there will be no dew or rain for the coming years, unless I command it by my word."

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad illum dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to Elijah, saying:

verses.latin: Recede hinc, et vade contra orientem, et abscondere in torrente Carith, qui est contra Jordanem,
verses.english: "Leave this place, and go east. Hide yourself in the Cherith Ravine, which is on the eastern side of the Jordan River."

verses.latin: et ibi de torrente bibes: et corvis praecepi ut pascant te ibi.
verses.english: "And there you will drink from the ravine. I have commanded ravens to feed you there."

verses.latin: Et abiit, et fecit juxta sermonem Domini: cumque abiisset, sedit in torrente Carith, qui est contra Jordanem.
verses.english: So Elijah went and did as the Lord had commanded him. He went and stayed by the Cherith Ravine, which faces the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Corvi quoque deferebant ei panem et carnes mane, et similiter panem et carnes vespere, et de torrente bibebat.
verses.english: Ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning, and bread and meat in the evening. And he drank from the ravine.

verses.latin: Et factum est post dies, consumptus est torrens, quia non pluerat super terram.
verses.english: And it happened after a number of days that the ravine dried up, because no rain had fallen on the land.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad illum, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to him, saying:

verses.latin: Surge, et vade in Sareptha Sidoniorum, et manebis ibi: praecepi enim ibi mulieri viduae ut pascat te.
verses.english: "Arise and go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and stay there. For I have commanded a widow woman there to provide for you."

verses.latin: Surrexit, et abiit in Sareptha. Cumque venisset ad portam civitatis, apparuit ei mulier vidua colligens ligna, et vocavit eam, dixitque ad illam: Da mihi paululum aquae in vase ut bibam.
verses.english: So Elijah arose and went to Zarephath. When he came to the city gate, he saw a widow woman there gathering sticks. He called out to her and said, "Please bring me a little water in a cup, so I can drink."

verses.latin: Cumque illa pergeret ut afferret, clamavit post tergum ejus, dicens: Affer mihi, obsecro, et buccellam panis in manu tua.
verses.english: As she was going to get it, Elijah called after her, saying, "Please, also bring me a small piece of bread with you."

verses.latin: Quae respondit: Vivit Dominus Deus tuus, quia non habeo panem, nisi quantum pugillus farinae in hydria, et paululum olei in lecytho: en colligo duo ligna ut ingrediar, et faciam illum mihi et filio meo, ut comedamus, et moriamur.
verses.english: She answered, "As the Lord your God lives, I have no bread, only a handful of flour in a jar and a little oil in a jug. Look, I am gathering two sticks so I can go home and prepare it for myself and my son, so we can eat it and then die."

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eam Elias: Noli timere, sed vade, et fac sicut dixisti: verumtamen mihi primum fac de ipsa farina subcinericium panem parvulum, et affer ad me: tibi autem et filio tuo facies postea.
verses.english: Elijah said to her, "Do not be afraid. Go and do as you have said, but first make a small flat cake for me from your flour and bring it to me. Afterwards, you can prepare some for yourself and your son."

verses.latin: Haec autem dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Hydria farinae non deficiet, et lecythus olei non minuetur, donec in die quo daturus est Dominus pluviam super faciem terrae.
verses.english: "For this is what the Lord God of Israel declares: 'The jar of flour will not be emptied, and the jug of oil will not run dry, until the day the Lord sends rain upon the face of the earth.'"

verses.latin: Et abiit, et fecit juxta verbum Eliae: et comedit ipse, et domus ejus, et Elias plurimos dies.
verses.english: So she went and did as Elijah told her. And she, and her household, and Elijah, had enough to eat for many days.

verses.latin: Et hydria farinae non defecit, et lecythus olei non est imminutus, juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus fuerat in manu Eliae.
verses.english: And the jar of flour did not run out, nor did the jug of oil diminish, just as the Lord had promised through Elijah.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post haec, aegrotavit filius mulieris materfamilias, et facta est languor ejus vehementissimus, ita ut non remanerit in eo spiritus.
verses.english: Now it happened after these events that the son of the woman, who owned the house, became ill. His sickness was so severe that he stopped breathing and no life remained in him.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo ad Eliam: Quid mihi et tibi, vir Dei? ingressus es ad me ut commemorares iniquitates meas, et interficeres filium meum?
verses.english: So she said to Elijah, "What have you done to me, O man of God? Have you come to remind me of my sins and to cause the death of my son?"

verses.latin: Et ait ad eam Elias: Da mihi filium tuum. Et tollens eum de sinu ejus, portavit in coenaculum ubi ipse manebat, et posuit super lectulum suum.
verses.english: And Elijah said to her, "Give me your son." He took the boy from her arms, carried him up to the upper room where he was staying, and laid him on his own bed.

verses.latin: Et clamavit ad Dominum, et dixit: Domine Deus meus, etiam viduam, apud quam hospitor, afflixisti, ut interficeres filium ejus?
verses.english: Then he cried out to the Lord, "O Lord my God, have You brought this tragedy upon the widow with whom I am staying, by causing her son to die?"

verses.latin: Et expandit se, et incubuit super puerum tribus vicibus: et clamavit ad Dominum, et ait: Domine Deus meus, revertatur, obsecro, anima pueri hujus in viscera ejus.
verses.english: Then Elijah stretched himself out on the boy three times. And he cried out to the Lord, "O Lord my God, please let the life breath of this boy return to his body!"

verses.latin: Et exaudivit Dominus vocem Eliae: et reversa est anima pueri in viscera ejus, et revixit.
verses.english: And the Lord listened to Elijah's prayer. The life breath of the boy returned to him, and he revived.

verses.latin: Et tulit Elias puerum, et deposuit eum de coenaculo in inferiorem domum, et tradidit matri ejus, et dixit illi Elias: Ecce filius tuus vivit.
verses.english: Then Elijah took the boy and brought him down from the upper room into the house below. He gave him to his mother and said, "See, your son is alive!"

verses.latin: Et ait mulier ad Eliam: Nunc in hoc cognovi quoniam vir Dei es tu, et verbum Domini in ore tuo verum est.
verses.english: And the woman said to Elijah, "Now I know by this that you truly are a man of God, and that the word of the Lord spoken through you is true."

verses.latin: Post multos dies factum est verbum Domini ad Eliam in anno tertio, dicens: Vade, et ostende te Achab, ut dem pluviam super faciem terrae.
verses.english: After many days—specifically, in the third year of the drought—a message from the Lord came to Elijah, saying: "Go and present yourself to King Ahab, so that I may send rain upon the earth."

verses.latin: Abiit ergo Elias ut ostenderet se Achab. Erat autem fames dura in Samaria.
verses.english: So Elijah went to present himself to Ahab. There was a severe famine throughout Samaria, the capital city of Israel and its surrounding region.

verses.latin: Vocavitque Achab Abdiam dispensatorem domus suae. Abdias autem timebat Dominum valde.
verses.english: King Ahab had called Obadiah, who was the chief steward of his royal household. Obadiah, for his part, greatly feared and reverenced the Lord.

verses.latin: Nam cum interficeret Jezabel prophetas Domini, tulit Abdias centum prophetas, et abscondit eos quinquagenos et quinquagenos in speluncis, et pavit eos pane et aqua.
verses.english: For when Jezebel, the queen, was slaughtering the prophets of the Lord—who spoke truly for God—Obadiah had taken one hundred of these prophets and hidden them, fifty in one cave and fifty in another, and he had secretly provided them with food and water.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Achab ad Abdiam: Vade in terram ad universos fontes aquarum, et ad cunctas valles, si forte inveniamus herbam, et salvemus equos et mulos, et non pereant universa jumenta.
verses.english: So King Ahab said to Obadiah: "Go throughout the land to all the springs of water and to all the valleys. Perhaps we will find enough grass to save the horses and mules, so that all the animals do not perish entirely."

verses.latin: Et diviserunt sibi regiones ut circuirent: Achab ibat per viam unam, et Abdias per viam alteram seorsum.
verses.english: Then they divided the land between themselves to search for water: Ahab went one way alone, and Obadiah went another way alone.

verses.latin: Cumque esset Abdias in via, Elias occurrit ei: qui cum cognovisset eum, cecidit super faciem suam, et ait: Num tu es, domine mi Elia?
verses.english: While Obadiah was on his way, Elijah suddenly met him. When Obadiah recognized Elijah, he fell on his face and said, "Is it really you, my master Elijah?"

verses.latin: Et ille respondit: Ego sum: vade, et dic domino tuo: Ecce Elias est.
verses.english: And Elijah responded: "It is I. Go and tell your master, 'Behold, Elijah is here!'

verses.latin: Qui ait: Quid peccavi, ut traderes me servo tuo in manum Achab, ut interficiat me?
verses.english: Obadiah then said: "What sin have I committed, that you would hand over your servant into the hand of Ahab, so that he may kill me?"

verses.latin: Vivit Dominus Deus tuus, quia non est gens et regnum quo non miserit dominus meus te requirens: et respondentibus: Non est hic: adjuravit regna et gentes, eo quod non invenireris.
verses.english: "As the Lord your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my master, King Ahab, has not sent messengers to search for you. And when they replied, 'He is not here,' he made those kingdoms and nations swear an oath that you could not be found, so determined was he to find you or confirmation of your absence."

verses.latin: Et nunc dicis: Vade, et dic domino tuo: Ecce Elias est.
verses.english: "And now you tell me: 'Go and tell your master: Behold, Elijah is here!'"

verses.latin: Cumque recessero a te, spiritus Domini asportabit te in locum quem ignoro: et ego ingressus nuntiabo Achab, et non te inveniente interficiet me: servus autem tuus timet Dominum ab infantia mea.
verses.english: "For as soon as I leave you, the Spirit of the Lord will carry you away to a place I do not know. Then, when I go and report to Ahab that you are here, and he doesn't find you, he will kill me. And I, your servant, have feared the Lord since my youth!"

verses.latin: Numquid non nuntiatum est tibi, domine mi, quid fecerim cum interficeret Jezabel prophetas Domini, quomodo absconderim centum viros ex prophetis Domini quinquagenos et quinquagenos in speluncis, et paverim eos pane et aqua?
verses.english: "Has it not been reported to you, my master, what I did when Jezebel was slaughtering the prophets of the Lord? How I hid a hundred men of the Lord's prophets, fifty by fifty in caves, and fed them with bread and water?"

verses.latin: Et nunc dicis: Vade, et dic domino tuo: Ecce Elias est: et interficiet me.
verses.english: "And now you tell me: 'Go and tell your master: Behold, Elijah is here!' This will surely result in him killing me."

verses.latin: Et ait Elias: Vivit Dominus exercituum, in cujus conspectu sto, quia hodie apparebo ei.
verses.english: Then Elijah said: "As the Lord of hosts lives, in whose presence I stand—meaning I am His servant ready to do His will—I tell you for certain that today I will appear before King Ahab."

verses.latin: Abiit ergo Abdias in occursum Achab, et nuntiavit ei. Et venit Achab in occursum Eliae.
verses.english: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab and informed him. And Ahab then went to meet Elijah.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Achab Eliam, ait: Tune es ille, qui conturbas Israel?
verses.english: When Ahab saw Elijah, he said: "Is it really you, the one who troubles Israel by causing this famine and distress?"

verses.latin: Et ille ait: Non ego conturbavi Israel, sed tu, et domus patris tui, qui dereliquistis Dominum, et secuti estis Baalim.
verses.english: And Elijah replied: "I have not troubled Israel, but you and the house of your father have troubled it, because you have forsaken the Lord, the true God, and have followed the false gods known as the Baalim."

verses.latin: Verumtamen nunc mitte, et congrega ad me universum Israel in montem Carmelum, et prophetas Baal quadringentos quinquaginta, et prophetas lucorum quadringentos, qui comedunt de mensa Jezabel.
verses.english: "Nevertheless, now send word and gather all Israel to me on Mount Carmel. Also gather the four hundred and fifty prophets of Baal, and the four hundred prophets of the Asherah poles—idols of a false goddess—who are supported and eat at Jezebel's table."

verses.latin: Misit Achab ad omnes filios Israel, et congregavit prophetas in montem Carmelum.
verses.english: Ahab sent out word to all the children of Israel and gathered the prophets to Mount Carmel.

verses.latin: Accessit itaque Elias ad omnem populum, et ait: Usquequo claudicatis in duas partes? si Dominus est Deus, sequimini eum: si autem Baal, sequimini illum. Et non respondit populus ei verbum.
verses.english: Then Elijah approached all the people and said: "How long will you waver and limp between two opinions, unable to make a choice? If the Lord is truly God, then follow Him! But if Baal is god, then follow him!" And the people did not answer him a single word.

verses.latin: Et dixit Elias ad populum: Ego solus remansi propheta Domini: prophetae autem Baal sunt quadringenti quinquaginta viri.
verses.english: Elijah then said to the people: "I alone remain as a prophet of the Lord, whereas the prophets of Baal are four hundred and fifty men."

verses.latin: Dentur nobis duo boves, et eligant sibi bovem unum, et in frustra caedentes ponant super ligna, ignemque desuper non supponant: et ego faciam bovem alterum, et imponam super ligna, et ignem non supponam.
verses.english: "Let two oxen be given to us. Let them choose one ox for themselves, cut it into pieces, and place it on the wood, but let them not put fire underneath it. Then I will prepare the other ox, and I will place it on the wood, and I will not put fire underneath it."

verses.latin: Invocate nomina deorum vestrorum, et ego invocabo nomen Domini mei: et Deus qui exaudierit per ignem, ipse est Deus. Et respondens omnis populus ait: Optima propositio.
verses.english: "You are to call upon the names of your gods, and I will call upon the name of my Lord. And the God who answers by sending fire—He is truly God." And all the people answered and said, "This is an excellent proposal!"

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Elias prophetis Baal: Eligite vobis bovem unum, et facite primi, quia plures estis: et invocate nomina deorum vestrorum, et ignem non supponatis.
verses.english: So Elijah said to the prophets of Baal: "Choose one ox for yourselves and prepare it first, since there are many of you. And call upon the names of your gods, but do not put fire underneath."

verses.latin: Qui cum tulissent bovem quem sibi dederat, fecerunt: et invocabant nomen Baal de mane usque ad meridiem, dicentes: Baal, exaudi nos. Et non erat vox, nec qui responderet. Transiliebantque altare quod fecerant.
verses.english: When they had taken the ox that had been given to them, they prepared it. And they called upon the name of Baal from morning until noon, saying: "Baal, hear us!" But there was no voice, nor anyone who answered. And they kept leaping around the altar that they had made in a frenzied dance.

verses.latin: Cumque esset jam meridies, illudebat illis Elias, dicens: Clamate voce majore: Deus enim est, et forte loquitur, aut in diversorio est, aut in itinere, aut certe dormit, et excitetur.
verses.english: And when it was already noon, Elijah mocked them, saying: "Cry out with a louder voice! For he is a god, surely, and perhaps he is speaking to someone, or he is in a private place, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he is sleeping and needs to be awakened."

verses.latin: Et clamabant voce magna, et incidebant se juxta ritum suum cultris et lancinabantur donec perfunderentur sanguine.
verses.english: So they cried out with a loud voice, and, according to their custom, they cut themselves with knives and lances until they were drenched with their own blood.

verses.latin: Post meridiem autem, et transacto jam horarum curriculo, prophetabant juxta morem suum usque ad vesperam: et non fuit vox, nec qui responderet, nec qui attenderet.
verses.english: After noon, and when the regular hours for their prophecy had passed, they continued their prophetic frenzy according to their custom until the time of the evening sacrifice. But there was no voice, no one who answered, and no one who paid any attention.

verses.latin: Dixitque Elias ad omnem populum: Venite ad me. Et accessit omnis populus ad eum. Et sarcivit altare Domini quod destructum fuerat.
verses.english: Then Elijah said to all the people: "Come closer to me." And all the people came closer to him. And he repaired the altar of the Lord that had been torn down.

verses.latin: Tulitque Elias duodecim lapides juxta numerum tribuum filiorum Jacob, ad quem factus est sermo Domini, dicens: Israel erit nomen tuum.
verses.english: Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob—to whom the word of the Lord had come, saying, "Israel shall be your name."

verses.latin: Et aedificavit de lapidibus altare in nomine Domini: et fecit aquae ductum circa altare, quasi binarum saratarum modus.
verses.english: And with these stones, he built an altar in the name of the Lord. He then made a trench around the altar, large enough to contain two measures of grain.

verses.latin: Et composuit ligna, et in frustra concidens bovem, posuit super ligna:
verses.english: He arranged the wood, and cutting the ox into pieces, he placed it on the wood.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Implete quatuor hydrias aqua, et fundite super holocaustum, et super ligna. Rursumque dixit: Secundo facite. Et cum fecissent secundo, ait: Etiam tertio facite. Feceruntque tertio.
verses.english: And he said: "Fill four jars with water and pour it over the burnt offering and over the wood." Again he said: "Do it a second time." And when they had done it a second time, he said: "Do it a third time also." And they did it a third time.

verses.latin: Et cucurrit aqua circum altare, fossamque implevit.
verses.english: The water flowed all around the altar and even filled the trench completely.

verses.latin: Cumque jam tempus esset ut offerretur holocaustum, prope accessit Elias propheta, et ait: Domine Deus Abraham, Isaac, et Israel, hodie ostende, quia tu es Deus Israel, et ego servus tuus, et juxta praeceptum tuum feci omnia haec verba.
verses.english: And when it was time to offer the evening burnt offering, Elijah the prophet approached and said: "O Lord, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, today let it be known that You are God in Israel, and that I am Your servant, and that I have done all these things at Your command."

verses.latin: Exaudi me, Domine, exaudi me: ut sciat populus hic, quia tu es Dominus Deus, et tu convertisti cor eorum rursum.
verses.english: "Hear me, O Lord, hear me! Let this people know today that You, O Lord, are the true God, and that You have turned their hearts back to You once more."

verses.latin: Cecidit itaque ignis Domini, et voravit holocaustum, et ligna, et lapides, pulverem quoque, et aquam quae erat in aquae ducto lambit.
verses.english: Then the fire of the Lord fell from heaven and consumed the burnt offering, the wood, the stones, and even the dust, and licked up all the water that was in the trench.

verses.latin: Videns autem omnis populus, ceciderunt in faciem suam, et dixerunt: Dominus ipse est Deus, Dominus ipse est Deus.
verses.english: And when all the people saw this, they fell on their faces and exclaimed: "The Lord—He alone is God! The Lord—He alone is God!"

verses.latin: Dixitque eis Elias: Apprehendite prophetas Baal, et ne evadat ex eis unus quidem. Quos cum apprehendissent, duxit eos Elias ad torrentem Cison, et interfecit eos ibi.
verses.english: Elijah then said to them: "Seize the prophets of Baal! Let not one of them escape!" And when they had seized them, Elijah led them down to the Brook Kishon and killed them there, executing judgment on false prophets according to the Law of Moses.

verses.latin: Narravit autem Achab Jezabel omnia quæ fecerat Elias, et quomodo occidisset universos prophetas gladio.
verses.english: Achab then told Jezabel everything that Elias had done, and how he had killed all the prophets with a sword.

verses.latin: Misit itaque Jezabel nuntium ad Eliam, dicens: Hæc faciant mihi dii, et hæc addant, nisi hoc tempore cras animam tuam fecero sicut animam unius ex illis.
verses.english: So Jezabel sent a messenger to Elias, saying: "May the gods strike me down and do more if, by this time tomorrow, I do not make your life like the life of one of those prophets you killed."

verses.latin: Timuit ergo Elias, et surgens abiit, quocumque eum ferebat voluntas: venitque Bersabee Juda, et dimisit ibi puerum suum.
verses.english: Therefore Elias was afraid, and he arose and went wherever his will led him. He came to Bersabee, which belongs to Juda, and left his servant there.

verses.latin: Et ipse perrexit in desertum, via unius diei: cumque venisset, et sederet subter unam juniperum, petivit animæ suæ ut moreretur, et ait: Sufficit mihi, Domine, tolle animam meam: neque enim melior sum quam patres mei.
